description:
Excellent Italian food!!! Clean environment and friendly staff. Calzone's get pretty busy so plan accordingly. Excellent home style dishes!!!
We decided to sit inside-and got the table right away. Bathrooms are really clean and staff is keeping up with guests in keeping them clean!

Ordered meatballs as appetizers. They were delicious. Calzone and pizza came afterwards. They were both individual servings and just the right amount of food!
Tiramisu and cheesecake with extra whip cream finished off the meal. 
I was a bit surprised that I could not get cannoli or gelato but oh well!
author: Risto K.

description:
Came here for my birthday with my family and loved the food and service. 

Their plates are large enough to share so you can try out different options if you see more one thing you must try... like their gnocchi.
author: Antonia Z.

description:
We went to Calzone's after a concert late night with my sister and a girlfriend. We sat outside and ordered our food and it wasnt bad.However... as we were eating and quietly enjoying our dinner,a group of 6 young men looking to start a fight surrounded our table and began threatening us with violence because they said white people like us are the racist problem with America...what???
We are San Francisco people and were dumfounded with what they were saying however they were just looking to fight with someone and they were drunk or high....
Both waiters who were helping us quickly ran inside scared leaving us in this horrible situation without so much as asking them to leave or call the police....
They eventually left as we defused the situation but it ruined our otherwise pleasant night....
Northbeach has changed a lot and I would advise you at least to sit inside as it has become downright dangerous to sit outside.
author: gian c.

description:
Solid for an Italian dinner and drinks in an old school Italian neighborhood

I'll admit, I was a bit skeptical, as this spot was all over the hotel TV and folks were talking about it on the street. I'm always worried about being the fly in the 'tourist trap' but even the bartender at my hotel said that he eats here...so I tried it out. 

Started with some cheese bread and meatballs...meatballs were served piping hot with cheese, oil, and some spicy jalapeños. Very nice!  Good bread with lots of choices for toppings. 

The people next to me had garlic fries which smelled like they came from heaven (or from the devil himself to tempt me :). Wow. The whole place smelled of garlic. Yum. I was trying to be good so I didn't try them but I saw them disappear quickly!

Moved into the pizza and it did not disappoint. Hot, fresh, and gooey with cheese. Had some nice Chianti with the meal and boom! I was complete. 

I saw some wonderful looking desserts coming by but honestly I had to get out of here before I became a total pig. 

Good food. Good service. Try the garlic fries and tell me how they were!
author: Christopher S.

description:
So you're in San Francisco walking around Little Italy and you're hungry. All the other small restaurants have a wait, but this imposing building says they have tables. So you fall into the Calzone's trap.

Everything here is meh. Our server was hard to locate. The top deck was so hot it was uncomfortable. The wine was flat. The meatballs oddly had jalapeno but no marinara. The cheese trio pizza was like a microwavable totinos pizza. Very disappointed with this food and service. 

Make yourself a reservation at any other place in the area, you won't regret it!
author: Anoosha A.

description:
My husband took us here last night, and we were thoroughly happy with our visit. The wait was minimal (maybe 3 minutes) for the patio, which was such a lovely spot to sit! I ordered a delightful mojito and my husband ordered root beer. The mojito was awesome! We started off with the garlic bread, but I wish i could have had 5 more pieces, it was incredible! The bread was toasted perfectly so it was crisp but still soft. The garlic flavor along with the herbs was spectacular, and there was also some red chili on it, which added a nice little kick. My husband ordered the lasagna calzone and thought it was delicious. I ordered the bbq chicken calzone and loved it!! The roasted peppers added a nice sweetness. 

The staff was very kind and professional, and our water glasses were never empty. I highly recommend Calzone's, and we really hope to come back again soon!!
author: Annalisa L.

description: First time here, although this restaurant only had 3 1/2 stars we went in anyways, looking for some good pizza. The pizza was pretty good don't get me wrong, but in my opinion everything was too pricey.
author: D L.

description: Stayed at Hotel Boheme. Stopped by for a takeout pizza. When I got back to my room, it was the wrong item. Called back to correct. Was put on hold twice, and hung up in once. Just wanted to correct the issue. Not much concern. And, the cheese pizza I got that I don't order was basically horseshit.
author: Derek M.

description:
I really like the decor. Italian themed, with black and white checkered floors and red everywhere else you look. They've designed it so that it feels like you are sitting near a red pantry, with the boxes of food on the shelves and garlic hanging from the ceiling.  The added touch of class from the chandeliers. 

I had the wild arugula salad which has artichoke hearts, dried tomatoes, goat cheese, and sliced almonds. Simple, yet healthy and tasty. Had to order the sangria, which is fruity. The way I like it. 

They have a full bar on one side of the restaurant. There is indoor seating on the ground floor and upstairs. The seating is a little crowded. The outdoor seating is basically on the sidewalk, with outdoor heaters.  

The staff are friendly and accommodating.
author: Max S.

description:
Let me caveat straight out the gate by saying I had extremely low expectations for this place.

It's located right in the heart of North Beach. I pass by this restaurant daily on my walk to and from work and the flashy neon signs just screams tourist trap. I try to avoid places like these but it was late and we were getting hungry and they had availability so we were suckered right on in.

This place is like an amusement park. You get lost in the shuffle almost. It's two stories and decorated with walls and walls of all things italian and packaged, and it gets magnified and expanded through their use of odd mirrors placed in odd locations. It was more fun to be here than I originally expected, felt like a wide-eyed tourist in my own neighborhood!

Can't attest for their pizzas but I can say they have an incredible operation going--the service was speedy! Normally pizzas and calzones take a hefty amount of time to prep and bake, but I felt like my BBQ chicken calzone came to me in less than 10 minutes. Miraculous!

The BBQ chicken calzone was delicious! This is definitely meant to be shared as I don't think I could down that much gluten in one sitting. They might share the same owner as the Stinking Rose because we sat up top and there were neon signs with Stinking Rose references.

I learned my lesson. Don't underestimate an establishment because it caters to primarily out of towners! Give every place a chance to win you over! All about that serendipitous life ya'll.
author: Connie M.

description:
Sometimes you think "Do I really have to feed into this millennial existence by needing to cross-reference 100 yelp reviews to know if I'm making the right decision for my precious dollars?" Sometimes, you throw caution to the wind and pick the place based on the crowds, the smells, the charming traditional Italian ambiance. 
What will end up happening is an average experience that leaves you with a full stomach and a mysteriously unsatisfying dent in your wallet. 
Came here with my husband and two friends, and in an attempt to not spend $60 on pizza dough and marinara sauce, I went with a.... $20 panini...that took 45 minutes to make. Shouldn't have fallen into this literal tourist trap but hey, after traipsing around SF long enough its bound to happen.
author: Daisy K.

description:
Mama Mia! The dough, the dough, that dough, though!

I love having Clalzones as an S.F. staple in my arsenal. Strong, well made drinks, great service, some awesome people watching but some of the best pizza and calzone dough you a an get your mits on! Always fresh and tender. This round we had the margarite calzone, lasagna and bacon wrapped scallops in a wasabi cream sauce. Everything was superb.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Not good. My MIL and myself stopped here today while walking around north beach. We wanted a glass of wine while enjoy a Friday afternoon. We walked up and were told that if we sat outside a server would be with us shortly. 

We waited 15 minutes and no one came sadly so we got up and left. Sad day.
author: Bethany M.

description:
Really good place to visit. I was in San Francisco and decided to eat Italian good. I drove by this place and instantly got my attention the exterior table set up. I parked about two blocks from the restaurant (yes San Francisco parking is a headache) and walked to the restaurant. When I arrived all the exterior tables were occupied and I asked the front desk person how long was the waiting, she said 20-25 min. I decided to wait since I really wanted to eat outside. While waiting I went to use the restroom (all gender) and as soon as I got back to the bar to wait for my table, the sever contacted me to let me know my table was ready, was really fast and I was glad. 

Observing the menu I realized they have a decent options when it comes to pasta, ravioles and pizza. Without mentioned that drinks menu was not bad at all either. After exploring the options I ordered a glass of Chardonnay, raviolis with mushrooms and some bread. Over all bread was really good, ravioles had a very good taste and wine was delicious. I personally find it interesting stay outside the restaurant observing the people walking and the style makes you feel like you're in Europe, although in reality you're in the fog city. 

I recommend this place to people who likes to eat outside the box and feel comfortable eating next to strangers. That's the only reason why I'm giving 4 starts, the tables can be a little more separated from each other.
author: Issac R.

description:
We walked up from Fisherman's Wharf and were in need of some bubbly libations and some good eats!  I had eaten at Calzone's years ago and liked their sidewalk tables, and we were lucky to score one.

Our server was great!  I can't remember her name, but she was friendly and fun!  Santa Con was in full force and it was fun watching all the drunk fools walking by...some wishing us a Merry Christmas...others looking like death warmed over...LOL!

We ordered a bottle of prosecco to start.  We then ordered the bruschetta and I swear, they picked the tomatoes that morning and the basil in the afternoon!  Soooooooo molto bene!!!  We then ordered the calimari fritti.  So for a little over two hours, we just sat there talking and watching all the Santas and their helpers walking by.  

We chatted with the tables next to us as well, which is always fun to do.  We also met this group of revelors who stopped to chat and take pictures.  So much fun!  As I sat there, I noticed some of my favorite places, Panta Rei and Caffe Roma, are now closed.  Thank God Calzone's is still here!  This has to be one of the best places to come to in North Beach to eat and people watch!

Grazie!
author: Mikey H.

description:
Italian restaurant located right across cafe gretto.  Perfect for dinner after long hours of studying.  They even have a heater so you can sit outside - selling point!  Got seated right away & our food came out so fast but was also delicious!! Highly recommend the calzone (name of the restaurant) it is HUGE but it's definitely delicious!! 
Ordered: lasagna calzone ($19.95), slow roasted pork & beef sugo pasta ($18.95)
author: Mikayla M.

description:
Great spot in North Beach. It's a cute restaurant with heated outdoor seating and inside decor with shelves filled with tomato sauce and olive oil. I also like that it's open significantly later than other restaurants in the area. 

The food was delicious. I was really in love with the Dungeness crab pizza. I was skeptical of the flavor combo when I saw it on the menu: crab with avocado and wasabi and cheese?? It turned out to be really amazing. Even their side salad with butter lettuce was really good.
author: Cassie R.

description: Italian Calzone & Caesar salad were ready in minutes. Delicious lunch, waiter was always attentive and the graded parmesan cheese. My wife loved the music and they have nice little indoor & outdoor eating areas. When I'm in SF I will be back
author: Jeff C.

description:
Greeted and seated quickly in a booth inside was greatly appreciated. The waiter was swift in getting our drink order and always keeping them full as we dined.
The pizza was good but crust was a bit soft, could have used a bit more time in the wood oven. 
The environment was clean and everything you would need is on the table.
Overall, I would say it's worth a try to anyone in the area.
author: Christopher S.

description:
This place has gone down hill. I used to love this place when I moved to the city in 2006. It was a fun central location in North Beach that has an outdoor seating that allows you to be a part of the fun hustle and bustle. 

This last time that I went- I thought that this would a be fun location to have my parents and my niece meet me since they were coming in from out of town. We sat inside since a party of 5 might be an awkward number to have to sit outside since the outside tables are best for 2-3ppl. 

To the point: the menu was on the higher price for the quality of food we received. The pasta was not fresh pasta, my mom's baked salmon was actually flash fried with freezer burn, and they now charge for their bread. The service was meh, all the servers  were disheveled, and I would compare their food to Marie Calendars. 

The city is starting to lose its charm and this restaurant is an example of grabbing at straws to salvage the cost of the city.
author: Chrissy C.

description:
A colleague walked by and felt we should return. She was right. 

It was so cute. On a hot day there was no AC. But it was good. Service was spotty for our group of three. The short water glasses didn't help. 

We started with bruschetta and Brussels sprouts and kale salad. They came out promptly and were tasty. The balsamic helped the bruschetta. 

Mains were lasagna calzone, which was recommended. We also had gnocchi with mushroom sauce. Tasty!!!

Even with spotty service, I'll return.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Mmmmm... I love Calzone's. I had the Dungess Crab pasta and it has to be among the best pasta dishes I've ever had in my entire life. I'm salivating just at the thought. Seriously, the pasta and sauce were perfection and the crab was ridiculously plentiful. Bread was served without butter or olive oil, but there was a place setting the with olive oil on the table. It was okay, but the highlight was my entree. 

Outdoor seating, on the sidewalk, is available, but we sat inside. The seating is limited, however we arrived at the perfect time and our party was able to acquire seating in a very short amount of time. We stopped at Calzone's upon recommendation of the world's best Uber driver and I'm so glad that we did. This will be among one of my first stops in San Francisco when we return.
author: Kari C.

description: I love Calzone's! I was able to sit outside on a nice sunny Sunday and the little tables face the street. Excellent for people watching. I enjoyed the BBQ chicken calzone, which was as long as my arm, an Arnold Palmer, and tiramisu for dessert. The calzone was hot, slightly sweet from the bell peppers and completely filling. The Arnold Palmer was more like a pink lemonade which was different! I loved the tiramisu. They give the biggest square cuts and it's very fluffy and deliciously sweet. A little on the pricey side, but you definitely should treat yourself here.
author: Liz B.

description:
Came here for lunch with a friend on our lunch breaks. I've walked by this place and always see people sitting outside so I figured it would be pretty good- it was actually pretty mediocre. 

Ambiance: The one thing I loved about this restaurant is the outside seating. It's very cute and fun since there aren't many restaurants near it that have outside seating. 

Service: The service was pretty good here. Our waitress was quick and helpful. We told her we were in a hurry so she immediately brought the check.

Food: The food here just wasn't as good as it could be. This place has potential because of the location and all- maybe just change up the menu. My friend and I both got a salad. I got the arugula salad and my friend got the COB salad. We both thought they were just alright. Definitely big portions at least. My arugula salad was just a little plain and the toppings on it weren't as I expected. The roasted tomatoes were rough and chewy, the lemon dressing was way to bitter and didn't do well with the salad. 

Overall, for the price- you can for sure find better food in the area. If you just want to get wine and appetizers and sit outside, this may be the place!
author: Hayley D.

description:
Love this place!!!! Always friendly staff, food is to die for!!!! I've been here five times and tried five different dishes and was never disappointed.
Highly recommended!!!
author: Deezy P.

description:
Love the cozy patio to people watch! Food is delicious and authentic. Good wine selection, garlic cheese bread with tomato dipping sauce is a great appetizer.  
Highly recommend the lasagna for great flavor with a light homemade pasta feel.
author: Daniela G.

description: Customer service was fantastic and the food was amazing late at night. The view from outside was night as well. I had the crab salmon avocado bruschetta over sourdough toast and my coworker had an amazing Calzone! We will be back!!!!
author: Chanel B.

description: The quality of food at Calzone's has declined significantly since the years I dined here before. Portions have decreased and cold, stale bread cost $1 now. Also, they charged me a higher price for a dish even though the menu printed a lower price. Apparently they increased the price without changing it on the menu. Never coming back.
author: Mary ..

description: Great food. Rigo the server was great. The atmosphere, very cozy! Had a great experience while I was in a dinner date in Cali.
author: John B.

description: After a terrible experience at Tony's where we waited for an hour to order on a Sunday night at 930 we left hungry and sad thinking our anniversary dinner was ruined. Since it was Sunday everything in the area is closed except for Calzone's. I've eaten here many times and always had a great experience (come here every year with my mom for thanksgiving.)  We walked in deciding to do takeout since it was later in the evening and we just wanted to go home. We got seated at the Bar with Ryan. I have to say he made our night 110% better, he was friendly, funny and made the best Shirley temple I've had in ten years. Thank you so much Ryan and thanks Calzone's.
author: Casey P.

description: My friends first time in San Francisco so we were looking for a good spot to eat and unfortunately we stopped here. I ordered the mussels and out of 18 mussels on the plate, only 9 of them actually had mussels in them. The waitress seemed angry that I would dare say anything and told me to look through my soup as they sometimes come out in the soup. So I combed through my soup looking for my own meal. There were no mussels in the soup so she said she'd go talk to someone about it then didn't come back or acknowledge us for a solid 20 minutes. I'm still hungry, after paying $60 for our meal, so we're going to go get cheese steaks down the street.
author: Lucy R.

description: One of my favorite Italian restaurants when I am in San Francisco I ordered the lasagna calzone it was super delicious. Also ordered bruschetta and a nice bottle of red wine. Normally I sit outside along the street this time I decided to sit inside the atmosphere is always welcoming and warm. The service is always with a smile and I really enjoy the guidance through the menu to select the right meal
author: Nick D.

description:
We were walking in Lil Italy, and the wonderful smells of pizza and baked goodies coming from this restaurant was too much to pass up.

I ordered a calzone off the menu; it was great, delicious, and satisfying at the same time!

I liked the decor inside the restaurant, but the patio seating allows you to people watch and that was cool.

The staff were nice and quick to make sure we were taken care of.

Calzones is worth the stop, when visiting SF.
author: Edwin A.

description: Walked by this restaurant on our way to try golden boy but it was such a nice beautiful sunny day to sit, have a glass of wine and people watch, so we decided to stop here. It definitely looks and feels like a tourist trap but the food was delicious and wine was good! I love that they have these tables set up for 2 facing the street. We found an open seat and ordered some house red wine to start and shared a pizza. Pizza was surprisingly in an oval shape but it was delicious. Crust was thin and crispy around the edges. Service was quick. Only thing that was a bit off-putting was they accidentally brought us a whole bottle of wine instead of a carafe as we had ordered. When I pointed this out to the server, they took it back and brought back out what seemed much less than a carafe. Usually, they'd let you keep the wine that was served much less bring out less than what you ordered. Minor point but customer service could be improved.
author: Yin H.

description:
My first night in SF and we stumbled across this gem. The reviews are great and who says no to pizza?! We got the garlic fries as a starter. They were lightly fried and they had a delicious crunch to them. They topped It off with fresh Parmesan and garlic. We also orders a chicken Alfredo and a artesian pepperoni pizza. So good! The flavors were fresh. The pizza and pasta both came out piping hot and ready to eat. The sauce on the Alfredo was very flavorful and creamy. The cheese on the pizza was stretchy and delicious. I would love to come back. Highly recommend for any Italian food lover. 

Side note: the ambiance is casual and romantic. We got seated on top floor that felt like a maze to get here. There are only 5 tables here and it's so romantic. The lights are dim and ambiance is relaxing.
author: Gabriela P.

description: The aesthetically appealing street tables with heaters are what originally drew me to Calzones. I ended up ordering the Italian Calzone to be consistent with the restaurant name. The Calzone was great. Very flavorful and cooked perfectly. I felt it was a little heavy on the artichokes at certain points and not enough in other areas. My wife ordered a pasta; pictured below. We were hoping for a little more food on her pasta dish. All together, it was a great experience and I would recommend.
author: Trevor J.

description: Dropped by Calzone's for a late night dinner. I had the Italian calzone and my lady had pasta. The pasta was pretty good and the bread on the calzone was very soft and flavorful. Little pricey but it is the location your paying for. It's a block away from broadway right on Columbus street. I know this place has been here a really long time. It has outside seating with heaters so you can eat outside at night. Very old school decor. Cool place to check out. Also has a full bar. Open until 1 which is really cool and why we stopped here.
author: Mark P.

description: What a cool place!   We sat at the bar and had the best bartender.  Drinks were good and the food delicious.   A little on the pricey side but you are in SF.
author: Chris M.

description: The place was very cute. I like the outside eating area. The food was also good but nothing out of the ordinary. Definitely would recommend if you are in little Italy.
author: Sofia H.

description: As far as the food very good my husband had pasta i had chicken meal was very good and portions were good but when i asked for bread they said it would be .95 cents. I would've given them 5 stars other then bread
author: Clara C.

description: AMAZING! Food, service,view - the entire experience was great. The waiters are attentive and responsive. Plus, the heated lamps to sit outside truly do keep you cozy. The tiramisu is to die for!
author: Krista S.

description:
Love the Lasagna Calzone at this place and every chance she gets, my daughter will insist on going there.  I knocked off a star only because recently, I guess they decided to stop serving the complimentary bread which I thought was a bit crazy and if you wanted bread, they would charge you for it.  

However, we sat outside as we had a full day and had our puppy and our waiter provided her with some complimentary doggy treats which I thought was very nice.

I recommend going there, but order an appetizer if you would like something to munch on while you wait for your main course!  :)
author: Bonnie J.

description:
Calzone's is OK. Definitely caters to the tourist and that means it has one major thing going for it - atmosphere! How many times have I walked by those cute outside tables and felt the heat lamps begging me to sit a while? 
Well this weekend we decided to do that and it was indeed a fun spot to sit. I didn't go inside but heard it's very cute as well and has an upstairs. I love the anonymous people watching from the balcony at Vesuvio, maybe Calzone's upstairs tables rival that.
We got a couple of the crostini with different toppings (one was pretty much avocado toast w/crab and we fought over it), an arugula salad and the lasagne calzone, cause how can you not eat the thing they named the place after? I haven't eaten many calzones because they are usually debilitatingly heavy and leave you feeling the same. Despite being enormous and filled with dense ingredients this one felt somehow light. We were able to finish about 75% of it. 
Food was quick. Prices were high. Service was nice but definitely attempted to steer you to the most expensive items and felt higher than average pressure to order the more. Like I'm sure dessert's great but no means no. 
Anyway, we liked everything we ate here. I just know for a fact you can find something you will like more and pay quite a bit less elsewhere in North Beach. Pay for that atmosphere!
author: New2Northbeach N.

description:
Awesome service by frenny...and the staff is warm and extremely courteous.
The food is outstanding ... and even after garlic fries(amazingly crispy) the margarita pizza and the prawns fettuccini pasta ...it wasn't a heavy feeling afterwards .
The food was fresh and full of flavors
author: Abhilasha S.

description: I've been coming here since the early 1990s and the food WAS amazing and consistent. NOW not so much. I would like to know what happened!! Had dinner on Saturday and the food was horrible. I would compare it to Sbarro pizza in the mall but three times more expensive. I ordered pasta was asparagus and chicken. I got dry over cooked pasta with dehydrated chicken. It was obviously so bad that the waiter drowned it in parmesan cheese. I tried to save it with olive oil and it was point of no return. My family ordered calzones that were so salty that they were unbearable to eat. Massive! The cheese bread.... wow! I had better cheese bread at school cafeteria! Pathetic! Do us all locals a favor and bring back the old menu that was amazing and good. What a disappointment now. Thanks for a bad expensive experience. Would not recommend. Zero stars.
author: Alena R.

description: I love the atmosphere of this Italian restaurant in North Beach, and it's open late. We shared the salmon and dungeness crab bruschetta(2 pieces)...and the bacon-wrapped scallops(4 pieces). My friend loved the scallops and ordered a second round. I think I've come here 3 times and have always had a dish with dungeness crab. We also had espresso and decaf coffee at the end. Food is always good here, but a little pricey.
author: Denise C.

description: Went on a Sunday night and it was super busy. Glad we made reservations online. They seated us upstairs and it was very warm up there. The waiters were running up and down the stairs and all over the place. It was very chaotic at times. Didn't have to wait long for our food. My lasagna was cold in the middle but the waiter was so busy I never could get his attention to let him know. My husband and son both liked their food and didn't have any Issues. If you want a nice relaxing dinner I would not recommend this place.
author: Kelli H.

description:
It was lunch time, and we were very famished. After visiting some famous SF landmarks, we were ready to eat a good meal. We consulted Yelp, and found this fine Italian place.
We sat down at one of the small tables outside, and perused the menu. To my delight, they had a filet mignon calzone! No contest! This is what I ordered.
The good took about ten minutes to arrive, in the meantime we enjoyed our drinks while looking at the busy street. Once our food arrived, we ate well. The filet mignon calzone was very delicious, and it filled me up for a good while. 
The staff here was very nice and accommodating. They made sure we were taken care of.
I would definitely return the next time I visit NorCal.
author: William G.

description: The food here is great! They have pizza , salads , pasta basically all Italian food . I highly recommended the margarita pizza it is lite and delicious. Staff is very friendly. I love the option of outdoor dining , this is a great  place to people watch. Everything is clean and it is in a good location, will be coming here again very soon.
author: Zoe A.

description: Get the crab pasta!!! Huge chunks of crab and scallops in a great tomato garlic sauce. We also got the mixed seafood plate which was slightly over cooked, but the spinach and mashed potato sides were stellar. Also half bottles of decanted wines! Brought the dog so we enjoyed the outdoor seating with heating lamps. Total bill was around $100 with tip - what you'd expect in a decently touristy part of town. Would definitely come again.
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place was okay! the food was average I had the pepperoni pizza pie,with bread, and a ginger ale,the service sucks I had to literally run down a server because they didn't even give us any water for the first 45 minutes while being seated.the only thing that was great about this place was the architect and my ginger ale.
author: Amazing P.

description:
The service was nice and environment was fun and a bit touristy. 

Pros: friendly and fast service 
Cons: food was over cooked and lacked flavor
author: Jenna P.

description:
I always admired the outdoor seating at the front of the restaurant when strolling by!  It's very Italy and there are heated lamps when dining in the cold outside!  It makes the ambience quite cozy.

Passerbys to observe and the pleasant Columbus Avenue is glowing with cherry enjoyment. 

Signature Calzone stuffed with filling is quite hearty!

I like the balsamic vinegar they provide, which I used on my Calzone to get it an extra kick and the decor table setting!  

Ordered up the Crab Alfredo and it hit the spot on my noodle and seafood creamy craving!

Service was adequate.  I had to ask for the lemon wedges two times until my dining partner asked for me on the third try, then that it finally arrived.

Lovely dining experience here!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I love this place. I start with a french lemonade. Its vodka , chamboard and strawberry lemonade. So good. Then love the whole menu. Favorite the steak scallopini with mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. The pastas are great and all the sandwiches. Especially the crab melt. I like to sit at the bar. And like the heated sidewalk seating. Serves food till 1am !!! Pizzas and calazones absolutely fantastic. To top it off great staff. !!!
author: Dani S.

description:
This is the definition of a tourist trap. We were desperate to eat a late night snack, and Calzone's was the only restaurant open at midnight on a holiday (Golden Boy Pizza around the corner had an intimidating line). 

Prices are so high, I'm offended. We ordered the Italian potstickers as an appetizer, and C asked the person who brought our water how many came in an order. He confirmed- 5. When the dish arrived, there were only 4. We were confused, but our server explained that we had asked the bus boy, who did not know anything about the dishes. Well then don't pretend you know; just TELL US you don't know! 4 potstickers for $16, so the cost per bite is ~$2. RIDICULOUS. It was pretty much a Chinese potsticker with Italian meat drenched in soy sauce. 

I'd rather starve than eat here again.
author: Karen S.

description: Great place ! Friendly staff ! Great service ! And the food was so good  my husband cup of water was never empty. The soda came in a cute bottle. I was hooked after that
author: Joanna S.

description:
My friend ordered a pasta with a garlic scallop sauce which was next to the fettuccine section on the menu and when it came it was a red sauce. When she told our waiter the issue he said that she ordered it and she should have known even though the menu did not specify. He did not offer to fix it nor get her something different and for $22 for a small bowl of pasta I'd hope they would at least try to fix the issue. 
OTHER THAN THAT... 
my food was good, my boyfriends food was good. But service wise.. 2/10.
author: Lexie M.

description:
I have been delightfully surprised by Calzone's. As someone who lived in the neighborhood, I thought that Calzone's was just another touristy restaurant. However, after trying it at the suggestion of a friend, I changed my opinion!

I've sampled a few of the pastas, salads and pizzas, and I think the pastas are my favorite - all of the sauces are super flavorful.

Additionally, Calzone's is open late every night, unlike many of the other neighborhood restaurants, for when you need a snack after a long happy hour! Overall it's a great place to stop by at.
author: Holly L.

description:
Wonderful food absolute great service with all staff
We had an Italian calzone with marinara side sauce for dipping ..Yummmm
Our sever outside was Fannie what aGem!!Great Fourth of July service They take great care for your comfort, heaters outside with open air windows inside whichever one prefers
Thank you!!
author: Lisa T.

description: It was a chilly night in our beautiful city, San Francisco. Such a romantic outdoor dinner with great food and great service. The waiters were training a potentially new worker and he was doing an amazing job! He had such great customer service just like the rest of the servers there. We witness them clean a table in less than what it seemed to be a blink of an eye. Great restaurant, delicious food and hard working employees. Thank you.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I was told it's like new york pizza. 

It would be, if the person forgot to add sauce. 

New york pizza is all about the sauce and a really good oven.
author: Pavan K.

description: While living in SF a while ago this used to be my favorite pizza place. We got sat upstairs, which I never knew they had. We also got sat next to a super annoying large obnoxious family, which may also be affecting my stars. I had always been sat downstairs. The bread was delicious, although we had to ask for it. The dinner salads were enjoyable as well. My kids ordered a pepperoni pizza and my husband and I ordered a calzone. The pizza was decent and our calzone was ok. They were both missing the wow factor! Service was excellent.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Arugula salad was supposed to have goat cheese and it came out covered in blue cheese. Then, the server tries to convince me that the cheese (which is marbled with blue) is not blue cheese and they don't even have blue cheese in the restaurant. 
Ended up cancelling the order because by the time they finally agreed to change my order and stop arguing with me about the color of my cheese, my bf was done with his meal. Terrible food and terrible service. 
Will not be back.
author: Paola M.

description:
First time here for Dinner and I will definitely be back.
Food and Service were both Great.
Sit outside and enjoy the atmosphere.
Give it a try, you'll love it.
author: Douglas F.

description: It's overpriced. They will sneak in charges. There is house charge then their payment app will almost force you to leave a 15% or higher tip which is calculated not on just the food cost, but also on the house charge and taxes. Basically we ended up paying 25% on tips and services for a so-so service. The food was okish, wine not so great.
author: Jatin M.

description: We had a horrible experience here. We asked for $40 bottle of wine from one server. A second server delivered the bottle. They came out with our bill and charged us $90 for it. We said it was not what we ordered and that we requested the $40 bottle and they said it was our fault because we drank the $90 bottle. I don't know about you, but I don't memorize the prices of the bottles I order and I expect servers to deliver the bottle we order. The shady server switch seems like we completely got screwed over and that this was intentional. I asked if we could please talk to the first person we ordered the wine from and the second server said no because she was on break. For what it's worth, the food is excellent here. We would've returned had this not occurred.
author: Katie H.

description:
We went to the city with a group of friends and ended up here for dinner based on a friend's recommendation. We got here pretty early for dinner but the place was already super packed! We were told the wait was over 45 minutes, and that's when I resorted to Open Table - I was actually able to snatch a reservation for a much earlier time but when we returned for it, we still had to wait...what a bummer!

When they finally seated us, it took forever for the waiter to get to us - I know it's crazy busy but it felt like there was only one waiter for the whole second floor. We ordered a variety of items to share but, of course, food took awhile to be served also. We basically did not get any service during our meal since it was impossible to flag someone down in the awkward corner where no one sees you - I almost had to stand up and wave my arms around at the end when we were trying to get our check because the waiter never looked our way once even though he was serving our neighboring tables!

Overall, food was just mediocre...I honestly don't see the appeal for a place as busy as this one. Since we rarely go to the city, I doubt we will ever return to this place!
author: Cathy W.

description:
Disappointing from the moment we walked in. We have long admired this place from afar; it has a very slick sign out front. But the interior doesn't match - it's more simple-kitschy, with bright red wooden shelves overstacked with old cans, small rickety tables, uncomfortable seating, and a little too much light.

We waited more than five minutes to see any hint of our server and he didn't feel that was significant enough to warrant discussion. We were all interested in pizza and asked if three of us could share one, as they were priced at $19. He replied quite haughtily that all the pizzas were personal pizzas, which turned out to be false. We ordered two and took the equivalent of one back to our hotel. 

By comparison, if we have a coupon we can get a family-size Papa Murphy's pizza for $12, and that feeds six. Calzone's pizza was ok, but not that much better than a take-and-bake, and we resented the absence of grated cheese. We had to ask for it. 

We asked about bread then ordered garlic bread in lieu of a complementary loaf. Our server brought both. 

A Caesar salad was served with very bitter greens that left an acrid aftertaste. We appreciate the restaurant deducting it from our bill, but we won't be back. 

There are some outstanding restaurants in North Beach. This isn't one of them. It's more of a tourist trap.
author: Steve L.

description: Best flatbread (thin, crispy crust) pizza and French bread I've had in a very long time !  Easily shared for two people !
author: Cindy D.

description:
Late dinner?... The ambiance is like a "brasserie" in Paris (smaller)... inside and outside tables on the walkway. My Italian Calzone wasn't "great", but good. Prosciutto was good, but a little more would have been great. The baby artichokes were very well cooked... tender like butter. The sauce was good and not "too much", to still taste the ingredients. The "crust" could have been a little more "smokey" and slightly more "crusty". But, again, this way you can better taste what's inside.
Overall, good service, and I enjoy a late after 10pm dinner, where most restaurants around are closed.
author: Didier P.

description: Excellent Location, Ambiance. Delicious Food . A Little $ Pricey , But Well Worth It . Comfortable Contemporary, A Great Saturday Night Dining Spot !
author: Gregory P.

description: Been walking by this place for so long and not stoping to eat here. The place looks really cool because there's chairs and tables on the sidewalk but it comes with a price. To me this place is way too expensive, I don't want to sound cheap or something but you could look at the receipts and look at the pictures and you tell me ? This place is good to try one time in my books. It's always crowded every time I walk by and when I was in there it was really crowded and there's not much moving space. As for the food it was good my filleted calzone was pretty good, it tasted like cheesesteak wrap with Naan bread and baked it was good. The pizza Was really good to it had the same naan bread taste to it I guess that's their secret ingredients they use in their dough. Another your bookmark gone. I give this place 3 and half stars.
author: Dennis T.

description: The calzone was about as long as my arm, so I highly recommend sharing unless you are wanting leftovers for another day!
author: Keisha K.

description: Once again I have yelp to thank for ordering the perfect item. Another yelper described the Dungeness crab pasta as possibly their favorite pasta dish ever, prompting me to try it. It was a decision I would not regret. The pasta seemed freshly made and I didn't have to fork around trying to find the crab pieces, there were plenty of them. I inhaled the whole thing! We also ordered the bruschetta appetizer which tasted outstanding as well. It was a beautiful day in San Francisco so they had the giant windows completely open, allowing for a nice breeze and people watching.
author: Amanda R.

description: Calzone's is a very busy place! Also it has a warm inviting atmosphere. There is outside seating for that very authentic experience. The menu is Italian cuisine. I decided to go with the meatball sandwich and fries. It was tasty and good. The fries complemented the sandwich, the meatball sandwich could have used a bit more sauce. However the delicious meatballs and the generous amount more than made up for it. The staff is friendly also.
author: Jimmy L.

description: This was the second time back. We ordered the meatball sandwich and lasagna style calzone with a bottle of rosé. Always great food and service and good price. We love sitting on the patio. Our new favorite tradition. Definitely recommend.
author: Erin P.

description:
Literally just walked out. Normally I'm a strict Yelper. But my wife and I are only I town for a few hours and we have a newborn in tow, so we ducked in here. 

Should have listened to the reviews. 

Ordered a carafe of wine and Brussels sprout pizza. 

Wine never came. Brussels were literally uncooked. Waitress checked on us once so we couldn't remind her that we were waiting on wine. 

When we pointed out our wine never came the waitress brought the check and said she had taken the wine off the bill, like she was doing us a favor. 

On a positive note. Best club soda I ever had.
author: Chris R.

description:
Ill write this post everywhere , we were 8 people and 7 of us got foods from here, and one wanted to get from somewhere else and the manager was so rude and not respectful, and was very aggressive for not to have the pizza there.
This kinda manaement, behavior and attotude is for mcdonalds, for god sake know your value know your business know your customer , dont be like this
author: Kamran A.

description:
Hungry late night. All restaurants closing...walked by Calzones. Looked cute. Read the reviews & decided to try it anyway.

LOVED IT!  Had seared scallops appetizer & (large plate) salmon  (cooked well; with tomato/asparagus/olive YUMMY side & GREAT mashed potatoes)

Tiramisu was good, too. Coffee came with an immediate refill in a pot! ;)

Sat outside with our (individual!) heater. Waiter was attentive and on top of his game.

Would TOTALLY return.
author: Donna S.

description: Came here late Friday night with a friend for dinner. This place caught my eye as we were walking down the street. It looks super cute with the street side seating/tables, so we sat down for dinner. My friend had a dairy allergy and the server was SUPER understanding and caring about it, really awesome service! He worked with her to make sure she could eat whatever we ordered. We shared several appetizers and they were all delicious. We had the scallops, mussels, prosciutto bruschetta, and Italian potstickers. They were all delicious. Scallops could've been a little more rare and bigger, but otherwise no complaints! We also had wine and they had a nice selection. Would definitely return. It's also really nice sitting outside and watching the city life.
author: Marie D.

description: An excellent spot to people watch outside under the heat lamps. Good food and diverse menu. Excellent and attentive service. I'm a local and still go here. Any visitor to North Beach should have lunch here.
author: Suzanne T.

description: We've been going to Calzone's for years. We no longer live in the area, but we still head there when we're in town. This was the first time we were very disappointed. The service was great. No complaints! The food, not so much! Our tab came to over $140. There were 4 adults and 2 kids. We had 3 pizzas, which were more like crackers with sauce and cheese, 3 Caesar salads with stale, soggy croutons and hardly any dressing, 3 beers and a coffee. That price was way over the top for what we got. There are a dozen spots in North Beach that have great pizza. Calzone's is no longer one of them. You can do better! I doubt that we'll be back.....
author: Sheri H.

description:
We came here after being told another restaurant that the wait was too long. I guess u can say we "settled" for Calzones. 

I'M GLAD WE DID! 

The ITALIAN CALZONE was DELICIOUS. My hubby had the LASAGNA. The lasagna was also DELICIOUS but was a VERY SMALL portion. My kids had the pizza. They were a little disappointed with the pizza. I definitely believe that PASTA n CALZONES are the things to order here. 

We were TOURIST on our 1ST SAN FRAN experience I'm glad we decided to go come here. 

HOSTESS is kinda rude she's kinda short n I think curly hair don't mind her. We didn't lady u just ain't that important to us. Lol We Still Smiling!  

We said party of 4 she then said I can seat u now. We passed by a booth n she tried to sit us in between three fully seated tables. VERY BUSY area. (Two kids that have to pee, drop things,  n move a lot etc.) It was impossible to scoot back without being an inconvenience. I then politely stated, "Excuse me, is there any chance we can we have the booth " we ruffled her feathers. "Well then u will have to wait" Me in my mind, "no honey I don't have to wait I can take my happy butt to one of the other 100 Italian restaurants." What I really said, "that's fine not a problem" 
We them waited a whole 4 minutes, no one else was in line waiting just her staring at the ceiling then her nails. She then sat us down in the booth.

Rumor is the average life in a SanFran Restaurant is 6 months because competition is fierce. You would think customer service would be better! Smile more Ms. Hostess, Happy Girls are the Prettiest!
author: Veronica M.

description:
Ok so here's why I give it 5 stars:
* yes it's in high tourist traffic zone but the outdoor seating is great (and heated too- good people watching)
* staff is nice- they don't rush you. Some may say that it's  "ignoring/bad" but I like that you can eat and drink in peace and not feel like they just want to flip the table asap.
* they do a great job with dietary concerns/ adjustments to dishes
* yummy pizzas and pastas- fresh ingredients and good take on Italian-American food.
author: Desiree P.

description: Tacky design, non-caring waiting staff (we have met many of them, never the same person though), food is at best average. Their calzone is a new interpretation on the Italian original (think piece of hard bread folded in two); the alfredo pasta was very rich in cream. We did not dare the desserts - they looked very heavy on the other tables...
author: Laszlo K.

description:
Every time I visit the North Beach area I always tell myself how much I want to try out Calzone's. Last week after a concert at Bill Grahm we were looking for a nice spot to eat dinner.  And as always I pulled up the Yelp App and I searched for a place that looked yummy and opened late.  We choose this place because it closed at 1 am and it was only 11:45 pm. I always hate showing up to places 20 minutes before closing so this was the perfect opportunity to check out Calzone's. 

When we arrived we walked inside and stood by the host area and no one acknowledged us. The bartender just stared at us. I was really confused that I even pulled up my phone to double check if the place was about to close. Finally, after about 8 minutes standing around the host sat us down outside and gave us the menu. We looked over the menu and then waited another 20 minutes for someone to come take our order and drinks. It was really strange because the server walked past us about 3 times. At this point, its like 12:30am and they finally take our order. The food came out a lot quicker than I was expecting. 

We ordered the garlic bread and the Lasagna Calzone which were both very delicious. The Calzones are a perfect to share with another person. The only downside was that the food got cold pretty fast since we were sitting outside. I also liked how they provide you with a refill on the side for your soda. This was definitely an interesting experience, I will give it another try in the near future but won't be rushing back.
author: Mavy A.

description:
This has become my husbands and mine go to for dinner while in San Francisco. I love North beach and the vibe you get there and we have gone to many many restaurants in our lives together and separately. But for our 20th Wedding anniversary we felt ourselves being drawn back for a second time to this great place. The food is outstanding and the service the same. It's not expensive dinner for two and 2 cocktails, a diet coke and iced tea the total price $95 for 2 people that's a great price for an unforgettable dinner!!! I had the arugula and artichoke pizza (again)and my husband the salmon and pasta. I also enjoyed 2 French lemonades a quiet but effective cocktail. We sat outside under the heaters and enjoyed our meal. 
note: at no time do you feel pressured to leave. They let you take your time and truly savor your meal and you get to watch the city walk by. 
We will be back forever and as long as they keep those cocktails flowing, I can think of no better place to leave my heart!
author: Amber N.

description: Great calamari & excellent service.  Decent wine list and fun ambience!  We'll be back!
author: Gillian H.

description: Love the outdoor bistro tables and the amazing staff. Specials change often so ask your waiter. True Italian at its best.
author: Mary A.

description: Delicious doesn't being to describe the food at this restaurant! Not only was the service amazing but the food speaks for itself! The ambiance of the restaurant was so fun and lively as well! The restaurant itself is so charming with all of the quaint decorations! I highly recommend the crab Alfredo and the meatball sandwich! But regardless from what you choose on the menu I can guarantee the food will be spectacular! The fish food that they serve here is so fresh you can tell immediately how fresh they are just by smell alone. I went to the  restaurant with my family for Mother's and we were seated immediately and the staff could not have been more curious and kind.
author: Lauren B.

description:
I was looking forward to lunch here when my friend suggested it, but unfortunately I wasn't too impressed. Located on Columbus Ave in North Beach, Calzone's is one of those places that looks like it has been around forever and really embodies the spirit of the Italian neighborhood. Unfortunately, the food just didn't knock it out of the park for me.

Since it was my first time here and the place is named Calzone's, I figured that I should get a calzone. The menu item that the restaurant is named after should definitely be the best, right? I got the roasted melanzana calzone, which contains eggplant, spinach, bell peppers and cheese. When the long and skinny calzone came out, I was excited to dig in. It was fine. Nothing amazing. The crust itself didn't taste that fresh, which I think I think took away from the overall meal. There was also no marinara sauce provided for dipping, which I personally think is a must for calzones.

Maybe Calzone's has something better on their menu than calzones, but I'm in no rush to return. I think this spot is a-ok for tourists, but I'll be looking for something a little more off-the-beaten path next time I'm in North Beach.
author: Dylan C.

description: Disappointed in how an issue was handled.  Group of 6 last night. We ordered drinks, apps and entrees.  One member of our group found a hair inbedded in their lasagna. I discreetly told our waiter about it, and he got completely defensive and said it must've blown in from the outside windows which were opened last night. That's just ridiculous!!  We didn't ask for anything, but I thought the waiter should know.  We didn't even ask for refund, but he was so defensive that he didn't even apologize, offer my guest a new piece of lasagna, anything. It was handled so poorly. When he brought the bill he continued to talk and be defensive about how apparently this was our fault, the wind blew it in and I asked him to just leave us alone and that he obviously wasn't going to handle it the way a professional would. I think he ruined our experience as much as finding the hair.  We put out a credit card, he rang it up, and brought it back for signing. At this point we just want the hell out of there.  We noticed he had taken the cost of the lasagna off of the bill but said nothing to us. I was so disappointed and embarrassed for my out-of-town guests.  So he made it right in the end you could say but I felt as if he was calling us liars.  Never again will we be back.
author: Linda W.

description:
While the pasta here is al dente... I was expecting a more worthy pasta sauce for my crab pasta.

Crab tasted frozen or not fresh.  Not worth the amount I paid for pasta.

Bread rock tho
author: David H.

description: Great service & great food. Seated us quickly. The only reason it's 4 and not 5 is because bread was cold. But I loved my house fettuccine with slow roasted pork.
author: DiAnne G.

description:
Sat outside, watching the rain.
Ordered a bottle of red wine, some appetizers, a sandwich...
Perfect winter night to enjoy the City and people watch.

It wasn't terribly busy, but service was trying (especially in the pouring down rain).  The menu was more limited than I expected, but considering how many Italian restaurants are packed into North Beach, you can always find exactly what you're looking for.  I was searching for late evening ambiance over fare selection, and that's exactly what I got.
author: Jes G.

description:
I love this place.  Been coming here for 20
Years.  Rigobert was our server and he was great.  The bread is awesome.  And make you sit outside 


Back again Rego it was our server excellent job raviolis with the cream and tomato sauce were very good we just wish there was a way to block the homeless people from bothering us while we were eating
author: Brett E.

description:
The crab dungeness fettuccine was delicious. The presentation made it look like the portion size was small, but it's actually really filling (and decently flavorful, although it needed the grated Parmesan on top). 

The service could've been better. You have to flag them down if you need something. However, the food was hearty and the ambiance was charming. The wall displays made you feel like you were in an Italian grandma's pantry, in a good way.
author: Leeyen R.

description: What fun! Lovely afternoon wandering around this area. My friend had eaten there years ago and remembered Calzone's. Yes, parking is a hassle, but worth a little wait. We sat outside and enjoyed the delightful and occasionally unusual 'ambience'. The server was pleasant, and we were able to split a few things so that I could experience some REAL Italian food. The food was Outstanding. So flavorful. Obviously carefully prepared.  Delightful experience all the way around. Would highly recommend this treasure!
author: Carol M.

description:
We had been planning our daughter's 16th birthday event up in The City and decided to go to Calzone's for dinner.  Their manager, Andre, immediately contacted us after we messaged the business through Yelp.  He was very helpful and accommodating when it came to making a reservation (for 12-19 people) and selecting the food items.  

When we arrived, we were promptly seated in the mezzanine which was designed for large groups.  The restaurant have a very cool and eclectic feel to it.  I liked the outside seating area for those small groups that wanted to hang out and people watch.  Sergio and the team quickly took our drink orders.  An interesting touch was that they automatically brought out extra portions of each person's drink.  I guess that way, they wouldn't have to keep coming up to refill them.  

The food came out very quickly to our surprise; the kitchen must be running on steroids or speed for the food to come out that quickly!  We ordered calamari, house salad, margherita pizza, pepperoni pizza, combo pizza, chicken alfredo, and steak scaloppini.  Everything was delicious and prepared as expected.  We also ordered a single piece of tiramisu with a candle on it so that the girls could sing to my daughter.  Dessert was planned at another location.

We will definitely be back to try their mojitos and more of their food!
author: Gene D.

description: This place is great! We randomly stopped in after watching football at a nearby bar. Ordered the combo pizza and Caesar salad. Both were solid. The service was also fast & friendly. We'll definitely be back again.
author: Elle B.

description: The service was good. The food wasn't very tasty and was somewhat overpriced. The portions were also small. Won't try this again.
author: Steph R.

description: The bread is not very good but you can take away for your breakfast tomorrow. I have taken a pizza it was a pizzeta and it was too thin. I've just read on Marina time, a free newspaper in SF, they have take pictures of Calzone but it's Fougasse and not what they called. Calzone eat on Kearny Street, it's my advice.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: Nice spot in North Beach.  Love sitting on the sidewalks and having a nice meal on a sunny day.  Also late night eating is good.  Came with a group of 10 and was seated right away.  Very good food and drinks.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
I came here for the first time in 2008 with a group of friends. I ordered a salad and discovered an 3 inch piece of tree twig in my salad. After letting our waiter know, the waiter and manager both tried to convince me that the twig was actually part of the salad...

so uh no, no thanks. No more future visits for me to Calzone's!

Fast Forward to Summer 2015, I am back here again for a dinner date. Aside from the complimentary bread, we ordered the Caesar salad, house-made ravioli and the shellfish cappellini.

couple notes:
*Caesar salad was a pass for me. Bland taste and I dislike the uncut appearance of the baby romaine. 
*House-made ravioli sauce had great flavor. Sadly the ravioli was not cooked long enough, it could have used another minute to boil. I still enjoyed it though.
*Date loved the shellfish cappellini.
* Bread was not exciting. Lukewarm and kind of tough to chew on.

The service and outdoor seating area is what separates this place from the other Italian joints in North Beach. The food here is adequate for me, but I probably should have tried the calzone or the pizza since those dishes are actually in the restaurant's title. If you want a great people-watching spot with average food, Calzone's will serve your purpose. You want authentic italian food? Move on along down Columbus and keep looking.

I am happy to report there was no sign of tree twig in any of my food this last visit lol.
author: Philip M.

description: They have long row of outdoor dining. Very fancy and authentic food. My girlfriend loves sangria so this place was a plus. The drink came out before the waiter even left our table which i thought was very cool. Im a huge fan of gnocchi and they have many flavors to pick from. I chose the mushroom on the waiters request, but there was an abundance of mushrooms and not enough gnocchi. Nonetheless it was great and i will be back for anther flavor of gnocchi. Great authentic and great scenery. My girlfriend is in love with little italy!!
author: Pu B.

description: Wow i think this was the best pizza I've ever had.  Loved everything about it, light crisp crust, sauce was very tasty and the cheese so fresh and yummy.  There were 5 of us and everyone had great things to say including my daughter who is pretty picky.  Service was good and great atmosphere.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Alicia Z.

description:
Had high hopes for this seemingly charming restaurant.  Instead went away thinking that it was my responsibility to warn others away.

If you decide to visit Calzone's you must do one thing upon arrival.  Step into either the men's or women's bathroom.  The rest of your visit will be reflective of what you see there.

Service (2 out of 5):
Wait staff seemed like they had other things to do.  Never letting the customer know how glad they were to have them in the restaurant.  I was asked how the food was, but waiter was not very concerned when I expressed my displeasure with the food. 

Items ordered:

Italian Pot Stickers
Mussels
Gnocchi with Cremini mushroom sauce
Crab Alfredo
Chicken and Mushroom Pasta

It is hard for me to begin to tell you how little effort is being given in this kitchen.  The mushroom sauce was soupy and flavored only of old mushroom.  The gnocchi was likely from frozen.

The Mussels were sandy and nowhere near fresh.

The crab alfredo was overly heavy and left the body feeling like it needed to purge.

Italian pot stickers were fine, but nothing special.  

Chicken/mushroom pasta was the only thing on the table that seemed eatable.   However, a few bites was enough.

Again, before you sit down visit the bathroom.  Then find another place.
author: Steph P.

description: What a lovely way to start the day in The City.  We stumbled across this place while walking North Beach.  I had eaten here in the past and it was stellar.  On this ocassion we had a tasty  bottle of Prosecco to start our day.  It was a really good Prosecco. We sat outside on cute little tables.  Right next to us was a delightful man celebrating his 82nd birthday and we chatted it up with him and he told us a lot of jokes.  We had such a delightful time there.
author: Kelly M.

description: Lasagna Calzone was AMAZING. We will be going back for sure. We live in Sunnyvale but worth the drive. Recommend sitting outside and enjoy what SF has to offer. People watching at it's best. My wife had the Chicken & Asparagus . She said the chicken was so tender. I have already started sending my pics of the food to friends and family and recommending they go when in The City ! Go A's
author: Raymond H.

description: The pizza crust was paper thin and burned.  The bruschetta was raw tomatoes on garlic bread.  This was terrible.  Don't waste your time or money.
author: Carissa R.

description: The manager Andre replied to my review!  And of course a month has passed and no one from his supposed team has contacted me.  Just a canned response to make it look like he is doing something when he is not!   What a poor example of a manager he is!  Gee and you wonder why people leave bad reviews on this place!
author: Garett I.

description:
After a day filled with concert, walking, a night of theatre,  blues and midnight munchies we ended up in North Beach's Italian corridor. Pizza slices and gentlemen's clubs galore.

Finally landed at Calzones. Ordered tomato soup and salad, hubby had crab crostino.  The soup was expertly seasoned with touch of seafood flavor, intended or not, it was seriously the best tomato soup ever. That's saying something from this soup lover!  Crab crostino was generously heaped and delicious.

The outside is lined with beautifully decorated tables for two, and the sounds of Eros Ramazzotti wafting throughout. Don't miss this gem!
author: Linda V.

description:
We were starving after being in the cold for 3 hrs watching the Chinese Lunar New year parade.lol..we came upon Calzones loved the decor the waiter set us in  a romantic corner booth .. lol..my hubby ordered the garlic cheese bread with marinera sauce.. awesome! Hubby ordered, capppanela with meat sauce.. awesome...
I ordered Meatball sandwich with a ceasers salad, Awesome..
Desert, lomoncello cake with lemon infused mascarpone cream... to die for!!
Totally recommend..tootles
author: Juls U.

description: Obsessed with this place. The outdoor seating w/ the heat lamps is awesome during the colder months. Love the food, highly recommend!!
author: Johnny M.

description: This places has the greatest service. Nice scenery for taking your family out and hey have The best crab Alfredo and Calzone!
author: Alec L.

description: Calzone's - cherry tomatoes and melanzane out of the world. Pizza with crimini mushrooms and gnocchi with crimini mushrooms sauce are to die for
author: KS S.

description: Went to this place last night for the first time and made reservations for 7 people at 9:30 to sit outside and when we got there they told us that it was to hard to do that and that was ok but they should have told us that on the phone that is the only complaint I have the food was really the best I have had in a while we had the jalapeño butter ravioli and a cheese pizza  and scallops with the wasabi aioli and all of dishes was great  the waiters were friendly and had great service
author: Jamie M.

description: Definitely a tourist trap - but surprisingly good food! As a local in the neighborhood, I wouldn't go here on my own, but am very happy to take out of town guests. I've had soup, salad, pastas and pizza here. Always a satisfying meal. And with the outdoor tables, great people watching. After you're finished, walk down the street to the park. Good for an afternoon or evening in north beach.
author: Kelly S.

description: Pleasant environment, a tourist trap, food was ok, service was excellent way over priced.
author: Anthony R.

description:
The redeeming qualities of Calzone's are in the space and staff--certainly not the food.

We were in a rush prior to a show and figured Calzone's would be quick. We weren't wrong. Unfortunately the quick pace also reflected in the food. Both caesar salads were messily tossed with entire pieces of lettuce undressed while other had globs of dressing. 

Service was unexpectedly stellar for us. We were seated immediately upon request, followed a smooth swoop in by out waiter. He had drinks and food to us in minutes and didn't miss a beat  with the pepper grinder. When he saw that manfriend had barely touched his salad, he took it off the bill with prompting.

I'd definitely come back to grab a cup of coffee or dessert simply bc of the great service.
author: Ngan T.

description: Great stop at this place. Nice spot to see people. Had a margarita pizza and a tasty Chianti Wine. We'll definitively be back!
author: Hugo d.

description: Very tasty mushrooms and onions light and crispy. Need come back and try the calzone.
author: Patricia R.

description: We had very high expectations, however, the service was not that great... they brought all our food wrong. The food was very plane. The fries were the best about our visit! The price rage was incredibly high, NOT HAPPY
author: Maura V.

description:
Being a native of San Francisco. I was curious about eating at this Italian restaurant for years. The opportunity present it self during Fleet Week. I wanted to eat good Italian food and enjoy the nice  outside, while watching handsome sailors walk pass my table. My dinner was served fast and hot like the service. 
The food was good and not to heavy with sauces and oils. The Sprite soda could have been better and not taste water down from their filter. 
And the server could have slow down their pace and not make me feel I had to swallow my food for the next customers to be seated at my table. 
Overall, I would recommend this restaurant.
author: Tanika G.

description: This is not a pretentious or particularly  trendy restaurant but I love their heated outdoor seating. It is a great spot for people watching and a place you will feel comfortable dressed up or down. They make an excellent moscow mule but their house made crab fettucine is  my favorite pasta. The service is attentive, quick and their food is pretty reasonably priced especially for San Francisco.
author: Courtney Y.

description: Excellent pizza. Great service. We loved this place. Highly recommend. Get the margarita pizza you won't be disappointed.
author: Kris M.

description: This is a nice place to visit as it's one of Columbus' more visible restaurants. The hustle and bustle of the restaurant give it a cool vibe. The patrons seemed to be having a good time. We were seated quick quickly, within 10 minutes after arriving on a Saturday night. The food is probably ok, my calzone lacked flavor but the few other items I've tasted were relatively good.
author: Dan R.

description: .They offered treats for my dog and also water for him. Their food was decent. It's a good family friendly restaurant.
author: Nioosha T.

description: Good location, very very high quality food , friendly people, middle price, good drink , I loved it
author: Samin S.

description: Loved this place so much we ate there twice in one weekend. Our waiter Rigoberto was amazing!! Very personable & professional. Rigoberto's fellow co-worker Andres also very professional !! Great team those two. 100% etiquette all the way!! We ordered the mushroom pizza.... and a MUST order was the sausage,mushroom pot stickers!!!! Yummmmmo!!
author: Cat C.

description: My husband and I spent the weekend in San Francisco for my birthday and just chose this spot as we were thirsty and wanted to people watch. 3 hours, two chili marys, appetizers, and dinners later, we realized it was serendipity to stumble upon this place. Everything was absurdly delicious, from the brussel sprout salad to the cheesy garlic bread to the veggie calzone. Wonderful spot!!
author: Acorn M.

description: This is a great, authentic Italian restaurant. The food is simply amazing, the ambiance is great and the prices are more than reasonable for the incredible quality. Would highly recommend.
author: Andy B.

description: Absolutely great food, really enjoyed sitting outside and watching the flow of the city outside. Will definitely visit again the next time I'm in SF.
author: Nick L.

description: One of our favorite places in San Francisco. I love their monitors with sugar cane. Their pizzas are amazing surprisingly I haven't tried their calzones yet even though their name is calzones :p we keep going and getting different pizzas.
author: Sahar E.

description: Honestly, I came to this place because it already had a great review. Nonetheless, it far exceeded my expectations! My man literally grinding the Parmesan cheese on my pizza for me! The drink was extra strong and delicious.  My date really enjoyed herself as well. We will definitely recommend this place to anyone in the bay area.
author: Gifted G.

description:
Obvious tourist trap and my entire group regretted coming here so much that we were joking about how awful the food was for a week.

Their signature dish, the Calzone, is basically a $19 ham and cheese empanada with a really gross/leaky artichoke inside.

Walk 30 seconds further in any direction for a better lunch.
author: Jacob F.

description: The garlic fries with chipotle remoulade are unbelievable! Clean, friendly, and fast.
author: Rodney G.

description:
Anniversary date with husband was spent here! Brian below took the words out of my mouth. The atmosphere was lovely! the Service extremely exceptional! The seat by the window absolutely romantic! how can anyone "not give" honor to where it us due? 
satisfied and Happy Thank you Calzones for you outstanding service.!! bravo!
We'll be back soon.
author: Hannah P.

description: Mediocre.  Outdoor seating is nice.  Food is old school and not current.  For the price, I'd rather go some where else.
author: Urban E.

description:
Fake Balsamic????!!!!!

Used to be a good restaurant, but not any more. I am here tonight and their Balsamic vinegar is fake. It has regular vinegar in it and I am still coughing. Too bad

I was not expecting this at all.
author: Elmira M.

description:
Love (Lust?) For Their Crab Fettuccine!

SITREP

Calzone's provided a most excellent backdrop for my sweet friend Diana and myself to spend part of a glorious afternoon in San Francisco.

THE SETUP

For us, Calzone's Pizza Cucina is our "go-to" spot when wanting to capture a late lunch / early dinner in the North Beach hood.

A very stylish establishment, we absolutely love their pasta dishes, but both of us seem to have happily settled on one of their specialties:  the Crab Fettuccini!  ($22.95)

Whereas, Diana loves to capture the unadulterated special itself, for another $6.95, I *pop* for the add-in where they include about 8 large garlicky prawns to the dish.

It's a BIT pricy, I admit - but it's San Francisco, on a beautiful afternoon, with a very special friend, so what are you gonna do, capiche?

THE LOWDOWN

My go-to pasta spot in North Beach, SF!
author: Michelangelo S.

description:
The lights.  
The eclectic decor.
The picture windows.
The outside tables. 

These are the pluses.

What are the minuses?

The tourist overload.  It's a common pitfall in this neighborhood.  And it's on fire at this establishment.  

Then, there's the food.
Food wise, Calzone's lives up to the tourist restaurant image perfectly.  The food is mediocre at best.  Stick w fried appetizers (calamari, fries), pizza, & the namesake calzones, & you should come out ahead.

The European feel of dining al fresco out on the sidewalk, & the priceless people watching it affords, is the edge Calzone's has over other restaurants in the hood.  This is Columbus Avenue, major real estate.  Rose Pistola down the street also has tables outside, but not nearly as many, & that block isn't quite as colorful as this one.  These are definitely prime seats on a nice day or night.  Worth a visit for this experience alone.

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
This was our stop for dinner as part of a quick tour of the North Beach area. We stopped mostly because of the ambiance - the tables outside are lovely and excellent for people watching. On a colder day they'll turn on the much welcomed outdoor heaters!

The food is definitely quite Americanized, but still delicious! Two of us shared the Heirloom Tomato salad, which was really tasty. With the avocado and the basil crostini, there are a lot of different consistencies here, which is great. The tomatoes were fresh and lovely!

For our main course, we shared the Italian calzone. It is huge, and definitely plenty for two people. You may even get three out of it! Again, the food here is good, but Americanized. If you're looking for something more authentic there are definitely other spots in the area to visit. All in all, this is a good quick stop for some tasty well-priced food. Beautiful decor and friendly staff!
author: Chelsie G.

description: Italian beef Calzone, Tiramisu excelente, Ravioles with salsa Gorgonzola, the Italian Margarita & White Russian both drinks were Perfect plus the food was really good, fast service, attention to Customers it was really good
author: Mark C.

description: Calzones are gross! Classic one was extremely salty and un- eatable. The chicken calzone was dry and the lasagna calzone was ok. The pasta was good.
author: Lucinda R.

description: I visited Calzones on New Years eve and it was an okay-ish experience. Can't blame them for the waiting time but they managed all the crowd very efficiently. Average food, garlic bread was too hard to chew and fettuccine was made nicely, could've added extra garlic flavors in the Alfredo especially because I had asked for it. I was made to sit in the farthest corner of the restaurant but not complaining since it was better there away from the loud drunk crowd
author: Yashaswita B.

description: I've frequented Calzone's many times in the past, but haven't visited In some time.  Food is good, but service is not very attentive, specifically the server because they were busy.  The busers were good about refilling the water which was appreciated!  We all had pasta dishes and the portion is a little small for the price, but I appreciated that they let me order a plain pasta with Alfredo sauce for my child and charged $10 instead of the regular pricing.  They should consider a kids menu, but I guess they are catering to tourists, not locals.  All in all, good food still especially that the restaurant has been around, maybe the reason why it's still around!!?!?
author: L N.

description:
Fantastic service and atmosphere. 
The food was delicious and unique. 
It's always pretty busy- but a sidewalk seat is great!
author: Missy J.

description: Nothing that great. The food was better a decade ago but it's just average now. Crowded place with some tables so close to each other. There's a tiny restroom for the entire restaurant & sometimes you have to wait for a long time to just wash your hands.
author: Fred F.

description: Calzone's was very accomodating to changes be on the menu and the atmosphere was perfect with nice ambiance while sitting outside. The food was amazing!!
author: Akriti S.

description: A little bit of a tourist trap - but fine, high energy place.  And reasonably good food.
author: Tim S.
