description: Absolutely amazing.  We had the Italian potstickers and the jalapeño meat balls for starters and they just melt in your mouth.  Everything we tried was wonderful.  Steak sandwich, Dungeness Crab pasta and the lasagna calzone.  We loved each but all agreed that we like the calzone the best.  The crust isn't heavy. It's light and flaky and the filling absolutely amazing.  We will come back every time we are in the area.
author: David P.

description: You have to try the pizza, perfect light crust with great ingredients.  We had the prosciutto...awesome.  Heaters are on sitting outside, highly recommended and the service was awesome!  A must try whether you are a local or tourist.
author: Angela C.

description:
Cute restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.  Great people watching restaurant, every tale has a few of the front sidewalk whether direct or through the mirrors.
We had garlic cheese bread, garlic bread, pizza and sandwiches.  Everything tasted wonderful.  I would have loved to have tried the Gnocchi, I hear it is wonderful but we already had so many items, maybe next time.
author: Marcia M.

description: This is my favorite place to stop by every time I'm in the north beach area.  I love seating outside especially on cold days because they have the heated lamps outside.  I love having the people walk by and observe people at the same time on this busy street.  We've tried all the pizzas here and I haven't disliked any of them so far.  Oh, and the pasts are made from scratch.  Pair all that up with some wine or beer.  It's an awesome experience.  Highly recommend.
author: Seema S.

description: Always a good time! Good food always, staff is friendly and attentive.  We come often for the dungeoness crab pizza, bacon wrapped scallops and bruschetta all the time!
author: Sara Y.

description: I totally agree with the other fellow bad reviewers on this place. If I could give this place zero stars o would. It's definitely a tourist trap that I sadly walked into as a local. The mediocre and over priced food was enough to give this place one star,  but the even worse service solidified my decision. There are so many other great restaurants in North Beach I would avoid this one!
author: Sheil Z.

description: OMG this is the best italian food on the North Beach. Great style, you can get table outside and observe the city. Good service and quality of food. Nice selection of cocktails. I live one block of this place and I love to go there to get some food. Big plus that they open till late night... love it
author: Christina W.

description: Absolutely the best Italian place!!! We bring all of our guests here. Such a fun experience, amazing waiters, and SO GOOD! Gnocchi in tomato cream sauce is to die for
author: Kylee P.

description:
Maybe It's because people don't know how to eat. Maybe It's because they don't know how to order. But anyone that can't give Calzone's 5 stars has sadly been denied the dining experience possible to them. Maybe It's because I've lived in the bay area for 30 years and in San Francisco for 20 of that is why I can squeeze the finest nectar from my town. Yes, that must be it. 
As I sit like a king, reinging over my oblong plates of delicious subjects, some are calamary some are garlic fries some are arugala based indentured servants. 
I judge and sentence all of them to gastronomnomia. I've heard the garlic fries described as "too garlicy". I had to look that up, "having too much of the flavor of garlic". So I had to look that up. I still don't understand... 
So I sit in my royal robes amid the little people that also come to enjoy Calzones offering surrounded by the classic and historic black and white mosaic decor and sentence each morsel within the Cathedrawl of delite which is Calzones. Unless it's one of those days or evenings when the sidewalk seating is more enjoyable. Either because It's warm and lightly breezy or because It's cool out and I seek the warmth of the heat lamps outside. Either way I'm greeted with a smile, seated quickly waited on, served and satisfied each and every time. The only thing I wouldn't recommend would be the decafe coffee, but you're in Northbeach in San Francisco!! and my tastebuds are trained for something freshly ground and laced with freshly made whipping cream. I don't ask or expect Calzones to provide that for me. I go elsewhere, to a place specifically focused on providing the same excellence  in speciality coffees as Calzone's provides in specialty foods.

"Too garlicy." I still chuckle.
author: Brian M.

description: Went on a Friday night and it was super busy. I definitely had to give it a try. We sat outside which was cool assuming you don't mind all the foot traffic going by. My girlfriend ordered a salad with chicken and I ordered a calzone. Just so you know they do give you lots of chicken with your salad. In matter of fact they pile it on so high you can't even see your salad. Keep in mind the chicken is straight out of the refrigerator. My calzone wasn't so bad but it comes dry so make sure you ask for some marinara sauce or something. Calzones do provide you with complimentary bread until your meal comes. Be prepared to get a 1/2 a stick of butter still in the wrapper (again straight out of the refrigerator) if you ask for butter. Ask them to warm it up so you can actually use it. I wasn't impressed overall. Not sure I'd go back. I hope you have a better experience.
author: Brian W.

description: Stumbled across this restaurant as we were on our way to a different place recommended by our hotel receptionist. My word.... the pizza I had was by far one of the best pizzas I've ever tasted (lasagna calzone). Service was extremely on point. Really well priced and got to sit outside on the street with others just chilling out. Amazing
author: Danielle L.

description:
Lunch on a week-day without crowds of tourists. At our table for 5, which included (Italian) friends from Switzerland; the food at the table:  

Garlic fries - : Great. Tasty & crispy w/ a "chipotle rémoulade" which is addictive
Calamari (Frites) - : Great, with peppers and lemon. W/ "chipotle rémoulade" 
Calzone (Italiano) - : Great, proscuitto, mortadella, salami,  mozzarella , artichokes
Lasagna - : Great (as reported by 2 tablemates), thin sheets of pasta and tasty innards
Ravioli - : Great - perfect pillows filled w/ chicken, with crimini mushroom & chianti sauce
Bread - : Great, fresh and Italianesque

Service: Great - attentive but not overbearing. Environment is trattoria-esq, and with ample windows to Columbus Street. A pleasant joint to savor the finely prepared food on the edge between ChinaTown & North Beach. While adhering to Italian traditions, Calzone's Cucina takes some tasty non-Italian liberties such as the "chipotle rémoulade" to spice up their diverse menu.
author: Matsuo U.

description: All of the food was just average.  The service to a very long time for everything.  The only part great about this was the atmosphere.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Stumbled upon this restaurant by accident but happy that I did. Delicious pasta and bread. I just wish they had oil and Parmesan cheese ready to go on the table to dip the bread in. Other than that no complaints, yummy meal.
author: Marissa D.

description: First time here and I loved everything. The bartender and hostess we're both so casual but professional and nice. Asked my name right off the bat and used it thru out the night. The food was delicious; best lamb I've ever had. Highly recommend this establishment.
author: Benjamen H.

description: What is not to love about this place? It's in San Francisco, great patio with heaters for people watching, and phenomenal food! I My favorite is the calamari, try it! The remoulade is fantastic! The service is impeccable and I am very happy I spent my Christmas Eve dinner here. I will be back.
author: Holly G.

description: I say 5 stars because they earned it Wow the food is amazing service is very good kitchen is extremely fast this guys dont mess around I tool Uber so dont know anything about parking for 10 people I spend around $450 but thats with 5 Pizzas  alcohol drivinks 7 main 10 main courses
author: John C.

description:
We were walking around Columbus wanting to try a new place in North Beach. Always seen Calzone's but never really had the urge to walk through the door. Well today was our day. 

Very interesting place. Lots of two seat tables outside so you can watch all the traffic on Columbus but we decided inside. Inside the walls are covered like and Italian kitchen pantry. Very cool. 

I was looking for something different. I've always had pizza, calzone, and pasta. So today I ordered the vegetable sandwich which had artichoke heart, egg plant, mushrooms, and tomato with melted cheese on a toasted baguette. Really good. Just bursting with flavor. On the side were roasted carrots. Never had carrots prepared this was. Sweet and good. Downed them really fast. My wife and daughters shared a roasted chicken with artichoke heart calzone. I tried a little but of it and it was okay, but my wife and daughter really liked it a lot. Both gobbled it up really fast. My son ordered the homemade ravioli and he really enjoyed it. Inhaled it.   

The service was downright outstanding. Water cups filled on a regular basis even before the cups were only half full. Finished dishes were taken away promptly. 

Even though the food was a little pricy, it was really good. So if you looking for a relaxing time and watching the traffic go by on Columbus then this might be just for you. Relax and enjoy. I surely did.
author: Doug T.

description: Always a fun place to eat with lots of classic Italian dishes. We see tourists and locals here every time we go. The thin crust pizza is my favorite and my honey loves to try everything. This time he had chicken Milanese and it was so good I kept stealing it! Service is always friendly and prompt. We did try the Italian potstickers this time and I was surprised at how tasty they were...kind of like a cross between potsticker and pizza roll. We will be back soon
author: Jen W.

description:
Tonight I got to split two meals. 

The calzones were really good. I've had many calzones, ranging from papa johns, to some Italian guy in New York. There were definitely on the loose half. It's also the best deal. 

I also got the prawn Alfredo. It being 6 months since I had Alfredo, it was amazing. It was actually really damn good. I also recommend. 

Atmosphere and all, I've had better, but Check it out!
author: Matt F.

description: Loved this place! Sooo romantic and the food was very delicious, I would recommend to any lovers out there who are celebrating an anniversary or just a simple dinner date! A bit pricey but hey it's San Fra what else can you expect?! Totally worth it!!
author: Karla F.

description:
Great for large parties, but pastas here are lacking in flavor. Pizza was ok. 

Service should get at least 4 stars. But food, I would definitely try more places around north beach before coming here.
author: Marlene T.

description:
Calzone's Pizza Cucina is a very big let down.

Don't be fooled by the colorful ambiance and crowds it's a place you should avoid.

I ordered the chopped steak filet calzone, which on the menu sounded very promising. But I was very disappointed when it arrived; there was little steak, too much onion and jalepeno, and not enough cheese.  Not to mention the fact that it was luke warm and the cheese was hardly melted.

All that cost me $17 but really I feel I could have picked this up from a food truck for $7.

As well, my girlfriend ordered the Chicken Calzone and had to send it back 3 different times:

First wrong order, second because it was cold, third because they burnt it when they tried to reheat it.

In summary:  mediocre and over priced food.
author: Kenny V.

description:
Stopped in while walking up the street.
The lasagna was good. I also like the fact they brought an extra carafe with a refill when they brought my ginger ale.
My companions had Calzone which was about a foot long!  
Service was decent and food was good.
author: Pj D.

description: Pizza is really really good. French lemonade is legit. Salad was only let down but who goes to a pizza joint for salad.
author: Mike S.

description: Stopped here to eat and catch up with an old college/military friend of mine following his deployment with his family. The food was absolutely incredible, the calzones can feed 2 with ease!
author: Devin R.

description:
My roommate has been here so we decided to get some coffee and dessert.  We were seated outside, and our orders were placed promptly.  We started with garlic bread with cheese, and our desserts came in afterwards.  She ordered tiramisu, and I got the orange creamsicle cheesecake.

The garlic bread was good.  The waiter asked if we wanted cheese on it, and I left that decision up to my roommate.  She said she yes.  They do have a garlic cheese bread with pistachio pesto on the menu which is $2 more, so if the waiter asks you the same thing, just remember you're ordering something different (the regular garlic bread doesn't have the pesto).  The cheesecake tasted like orange frosting, which isn't a bad thing.  It was heavy with the white chocolate chips. so I took them off.  I could only eat half.  The minted whip cream on the side was good and actually refreshing.

Service was fast and attentive.  I'll need to come back to try their entrees.
author: Vira P.

description:
Just got back from lunch with my friend.  I normally like to plan things out and have a place in mind before we leave my office, but today I decided to "just go with it."  And it came back to bite me in the gluteus maximus.

We knew that we wanted to stop by St. Francis to talk and pray, so I suggested that we just saunter up Columbus Ave. and explore the North Beach/Telegraph Hill area.  I ended up getting overwhelmed by all of the Asian restaurants that lined the left side of the street, and all of the little cafes and Italian, Greek, Fusion-y restaurants on my right.  By the time we hit Broadway, I Yelped.

We walked down Broadway to E'Tutto Qua... closed til 5.
Looked across the street and walked into Naked Lunch... eh, not really feeling the atmosphere (more of a post-work hangout to us). 
Headed back to Columbus and peeped into Giordano Bros... realized we definitely didn't want sandwiches.
What about that Greek place back across the street (Estia)?  Looked and saw an iron grill over the door even though it said open at 11.  Eek!

My thoughtful friend knew I was getting hangry at myself so he reassured me that it was alright, and that we'd walk just a bit further up and pick a nice place with outdoor seating.  And we did just that, planting ourselves down at a table for two in front of Calzone's.  

HO-LY HEAT LAMPS!!

My goodness.  We both had to take out thick jackets off before sitting down.  It was a chilly, slightly windy 62, but we sat out there like it was almost in the 80s.  My bf asked the waiter if he could maybe turn it down, but apparently it's just ON or OFF, HOT or NOT. 

My friend picked the pizza (margherita - san marzano tomatoes, garlic, fresh basil & mozzarella - 14.95) and I chose the salad (fuji apples - sun dried cranberries, candied walnuts & rocket arugula in raspberry vinaigrette - 9.95).  The waiter took our drink orders (just water) and after bringing out the water, brought us some bread.

About ten minutes later our food came out and it looked so, SO good.  I normally don't like thin crust pizzas, but today I wasn't really in the mood for a heavy, food-coma inducing lunch, so the thin crust worked out very nicely.  I'm also not really much of a veggie person, but the salad was GREAT!  Thin slices of tart fuji apples, sweet cranberries and raspberry vinaigrette, chunky walnuts... mmm.  Balanced out the slightly bitter taste of the arugula.  I'm excited to try to recreate this at home.  That was a lie.  Who am I kidding?  I'll just come back here!

There's not much of a "view," unless you're into, y'know, streets... but it made for great people watching.  

Service was prompt and very attentive (refilling water, checking in to see how the food was, getting our plates cleared, bringing the check).  

All in all, it was a lovely spot for a lunch spot.  Definitely recommended!  I hope to come here again and try their calzones!
author: Iona C.

description:
This place is more of a 3(1/2) kind of place. The seating is the deal breaker... It's very whimsical with the outdoor seating right on the street. You can sit in a row with a max of probably 3 people facing/right on the sidewalk and feel like you are on the streets of Montmartre, Paris.

The food was pretty good though. I highly suggest getting any of their fettucine pastas. Can't go wrong. Definitely more on the touristy side but I think the whole experience of it is a winner.
author: Ann Marie L.

description:
I was actually thoroughly underwhelmed by Calzone's. I stopped in for drinks and some food because there was outdoor seating and it was busy, which is usually a good sign.

The drinks were tasty (a lemon drop and their strawberry lemonade), but the food was incredibly lacking in flavor. The pizza looked delicious but the dough was floury and flavorless and the pepperoni was more like large cooked salami - very meaty in taste, which may be good for some.

The service was good, our waitress was nice. We asked someone other than our waitress for bread though and did not receive any.
author: Taylor S.

description:
Any restaurant with an outdoor seating option like this will automatically get an extra star!

Delicious calzones, though the ham in the Italian calzone tasted like deli meat. 

Lasagna was good, but pretty average. 

Service was rather slow, and they gave us a block of store-bought butter with the wrapper still intact when asked for butter to go with our bread.. 

3 stars for the food, but one extra star for the outdoor option. 

Go here for dinner and go to Cafe Greco across the street for dessert and coffee.
author: Michelle K.

description: The pizza sauce tasted canned, pizza crust was too chewy and the flavors in the calzone didn't go well together.
author: Yousif A.

description: Ok so it's kind of a tourist spot, but I've had dates here, brought out of town family, and now popped in after a long day of work. It's prime people watching. The martinis are top notch and make me feel like a lightweight after just one. To be fair it was on an empty stomach. So in lieu of that I stayed for a chicken Caesar and another martini, and left feeling like a million bucks. If you came in here with a million bucks you'd still leave a millionaire. What I'm saying is that it's reasonably priced.
author: Jon D.

description:
What the hell kind of tourist bs is this...prices for scraps...seek italian elsewhere people...tourist trap!

More details to come after I speak to a manager...hopefully Andre from below...

Over a month and no call or follow up from a "manager"...still waiting...Andre A are you there? I would seriously skip this place folks...they survive on pure location alone...
author: Thomas Y.

description:
I've had the pleasure of dining at Calzone's twice for lunch.  It's definitely a great spot for people watching in North Beach if you can get a table outside lined up along the sidewalk on Columbus Ave.

With a place named Calzone's, how can you not try their Calzones?  I once saw a friend post a pic up of her Calzone and it looked amazing so I had to have one! 

The first time I visited I had the Italian Calzone by recommendation of the waiter.
Italian Calzone -- http://bit.ly/1aGdgQv
prosciutto, fra mani mortadella, salame, baby artichokes, tomatoes & mozzarella
It was just as good as I expected it to be.  I've had Calzones before from pizza parlors, but I've never had one prepared in this manner before.  It's almost like a stomboli in a way.  Regardless, what I had was amazing, the crust was crispy, the cheese was gooey, and the different blend of Italian meats packed amazing flavor into it.

On my second visit I started with Dungeness Crab Crostini and then I had the Eggplant Calzone

Crab Crostini  --  http://bit.ly/Zyn214
smoked salmon, avocado, drizzled with extra virgin olive oil
This is one of their signature items and it was really good!  It was plated very nicely and the crab and smoked salmon were great together!  For an appetizer, this almost filled me up that I didn't really have a need to have my Calzone after.

Marinated Eggplant Calzone -- http://bit.ly/10tCHgU
San Marzano tomatoes, roasted garlic, fresh herb ricotta & mozzarella 
Pretty much the same deal as the Italian but with Eggplant in place of the Italian meats.  It was just as good!!

You really can't go wrong with dining at Calzone's whether it's for lunch or dinner.  It may seem like a touristy spot, which it is more or less, but the service is good, the atmosphere is pleasant especially when dining outside, and the food is solid!
author: Rodney H.

description: good Italian food, the thing is there's a lot of competition in San Francisco so you could probably find a better around the corner. The reason I'm not giving it a better rating is because it's a restaurant in SF, they should know better that "good food" doesn't cut it
author: Omar Z.

description: This place makes great chicken Alfredo. It was a busy Saturday night and they sat us within five minutes! We were in a rush and the food also came within around five minutes! Service was awesome, people were friendly, and it's a really cute atmosphere!
author: Bridget B.

description:
Had a good time here celebrating my birthday. Food was great! I will be back.
Service was amazing. Drinks were very good!
author: Justin G.

description:
Run into this interesting place while rambling hungrily through this area. It looks like a good place from the outside that transforms to great, when you step in. Red is a bold color to paint the interiors. They've run with it and gotten away with flying colors. A tall ceiling, one side of open glass windows, and another side of mirrors, is a smart way to: (a) pull off the red, and (b) transform a narrow rectangular-for-the-most-part area into seemingly larger space. The shelves are stacked TIGHT with plastic Italian groceries. 
Anyway, this review is beginning to sound like I went to a museum. Let's get on with the food. I'll keep it brief. Because, it was NOM NOM NOM!! Delicious and unique. With Italian being as widespread a cuisine as it is, to find new options and sensitive flavor profiles was refreshingly enjoyable. Like everyone else says, definitely get the spinach cappellini. The calzones - nothing new, I know - but among the softest, the tastiest, and fluffiest!
Service & pricing is alright - nothing to sing paeans about, nothing to complain about either.
author: Surabhi V.

description:
Terrible service 
Asked for a heirloom salad with avocado on the side. They made it with avocado, I informed them it was with avocado.
They bought back the salad 5 mins later with avocado on the side.  However instead of making a new salad, they removed the avocado that was mixed in and put it in a small container.  Thanks for not caring about people with allergies!
author: Faurum D.

description: If you're a vegetarian, stay a mile away from this place. The place has only 5 options in veggie. I ordered the Fresh Tomato Pasta which is some green vermicelli topped with tomato cubes and no salt. My friends ordered Dinosaur Kale Pasta which is very similar, vermicelli topped with Kale. We could barely eat it. And it costed a bomb (20$). Very disappointed. I'm starving. Going back to eat some home cooked food :(
author: Mad J.

description: Food was good. Service was alright. Location is great. Got right in on a Friday night. Would definitely go back!
author: Brittany E.

description: The wait was short as long as you sit inside. The tables are small and you are crammed in. The bathroom has 1 stall and 1 sink, and is extremely cramped. The food was delicious. My husband had a calzone. It was a large portion, and the sauce is amazing. I had the soup and salad. The soup had great flavor, but the salad was lacking. The portion size was small. It was overpriced for what we received. The staff was not friendly. From the hostess to the wait staff.
author: Gina L.

description: Service is really bad, lots of harassment, and stuff the server was flirting and when i spilled the wine, he said we were drund and didnt bring us napkings when he was asked to. His name is Jose. At least thats what he said his name is.
author: Angelica k.

description: Just a stop in due to location and it was pretty good.  The lasagna was selfish, the meat very flavorful. Spaghetti with meatballs was amazing. The meatballs were so good.  I mean so good.  Prices are about right for North BeAch.  Expensive but it's San Francisco so what the eff???  Exactly. Highly recommend
author: Jack H.

description: We had a delicious lunch! Great lasagna and calzone! We sat outside and enjoyed the sunshine!
author: Kim D.

description:
I have eaten here a bunch of times and never could remember if it was good / not good. I always left happy and had no complaints. So yesterday I decided to pay attention!

Dinner w 3 adults & 1 toddler. We arrived close to 6 and were seated promptly. I immediately ordered a cheese pizza for kiddo (so it would cool by the time our dinner came) and a glass of wine for me. The wine arrived and it was great, house Sangiovese.

Ordered:
Cheese pizza- had a slice and it was good
Pepperoni pizza- good
Combo pizza- good
Gnocchi w Gorgonzola sauce- it was a bit saucy and heavy and the gnocchi got buried, but all in all it was solid. I would not order that sauce again, but would order the gnocchi w a different sauce.

Service was nice and prompt we were in and out in 1 hr.
author: Kate F.

description:
Um, we ended up here because my hubby liked the atmosphere. And it should get 5* for the sidewalk cafe and people-watching attributes. And the service.

But, the food was blah. At best. I cannot and will not recommend. If you want to have a quick drink and snack or a coffee, it's a great place to watch the world go by. Otherwise, PASS.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Calzone restaurant was a disappointment! First, the environment. If you are coming for a Mediterranean atmosphere while you eat, don't come here. Come here if you would like 1980s music to accompany your "Italian" food. 
Second, the food is lacking flavor and authenticity. If you would like Jalapeños in your "Italian" food, you have come to the right place. The food is bland and tasteless, but comes at the price of gourmet entrees. Our group tasted the Eggplant Calzone and Mushroom Pizza. Both suffered from a unfortunate choice of flavorless cheese and could not be rescued by the toppings. To add interest, there was a change in texture with the doughy pizza crust that seemed uncooked. The complimentary bread was stale and cold. 
Third and last, we experienced subpar customer service. First, our waiter did not introduce herself. In fact, we did not have a single consistent waiter during the entire meal. The waiters spilled water on the table and splattered us each time they served our drinks. Perhaps this was due to an imperfect choice of pitchers or too much distance between the pitcher and cup, but the results were the same. When it was time to go, our requests to split the check were met with disgusted waves and wordless glares. This, we will not be returning to Calzone's and hope you won't either!
author: Laurenz R.

description: Excellent wood fired brick oven pizza! so many choices, we went with the combo, three types of meats and onions. Great atmosphere, with outside seating.
author: Linda V.

description:
I really like this place! My boyfriend and I were wondering around the North Beach area of San Francisco and stumbled upon Calzone's and decided to give it a try. We walked in around 8pm on a Friday night and we were seated right away. 

Ambiance of the restaurant was so amazing. Typical city restaurant with a cool vibe and decor. I could sit in this restaurant for hours just admiring their decor....I loved it that much!

I ordered an Italian Calzone and my boyfriend ordered a Pizza. We both loved our meals....so fresh and tasty. I also ordered a glass of wine, which was pretty good too. Prices were about on par with the city, the bill coming to about $40 before tip. Service was pretty good as well and our server was very friendly!

I'd eat here again the next time I'm in the city!

Cheers!
author: Michelle M.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! 

Came to the city on a random weekend. Outdoor seating made the night quite romantic 

Employees were on point! They made sure our drinks were always full and checked in on us every so often to make sure we were okay.

I had the lasagna which was very delicious!

I will be coming back for sure!!
author: Jay B.

description: I came here a couple of years ago and had one of the best calzones of my life.  The ingredients were delightfully combined and I recall savoring every bite.  Well, it looks like the menu has changed from then and the one I had is no longer on it.  I tried the thing that was the closest, which I believe was the Italian.  It was just okay.  I have had better.  Nothing bad, just not good enough for me to want to come back.
author: Bob F.

description: The chicken calzone was perfection, the girls shared a margerita pizza and said it was the best ever. The calamari was so fresh and melted in my mouth. Service was quick and all of the ingredients tasted so fresh!
author: Kobi A.

description: This place was referred by the cashier at a local and Gelato Cafe. It did not live up to the referral. The food  did not have flavor. They also did not make any modifications to the food on their menu. I know a lot of restaurants do that however, when you make that type of decision you better be sure that your food is going to be spectacular. I would recommend finding another Italian place when visiting Little Italy.
author: Shanta M.

description:
Came here with the family on a sunny Sunday for the Columbus Day Parade.  waited in line for about 30 minutes as we didn't have a reservation and got an amazing table on the street and appetizers were delicious.  I recommend the calamari and the Cesar salad was also very tasty. For the main course their lasagna was tender, rich in the right spots, yet light where it needed to be. You could tell that they made it with love and care. Service was attentive, timely, and enjoyable. 

Written by: Charlize Curtis
author: Brian C.

description: Just hit up this place for the first time and loved it. It's in the heart of North Beach, beautiful inside and outside so there's no bad seat. I had the Italian calzone which was delicious and also gigantic, I could barely eat half of it. The north beach martini was perfect- brandy, sweet vermouth, and a touch of fernet branca. Kinda expensive, but the service was great and I felt like I got what I paid for. I will definitely come back. Thank you!
author: Nicole S.

description: Delicious homemade pasta, lovely atmosphere, and wonderful service! Cant say enough good things about this place - each time I go is better than the last. Love sitting outside, even in cooler weather as they have heat lamps. They also do half bottles of wine which is not super common and really nice for couples. Got the artichoke ravioli with mushrooms this past time and it was some of the best ravioli I've ever had (stacks up to my Italian grandma's homemade ravioli no question!). Good place both for a casual outing and for special events like birthday parties. They are very kind and accommodating and with all the great Italian food in north beach, the service is really what sets this place apart.
author: Noel B.

description: If you're looking for a nice SF outdoor ambiance, this is the place. The black and white floor tile and handcraft painted tables adds to the Little Italy vibe experience. The location is in the heart of Northbeach in San Francisco. Great food, good service, and I never stood in line to wait to get seated. I always order their Mojito because it comes with a real sugar cane stick. I dine here on Halloween nights, not because they have a night life party, but because I get to sit down outdoor, eat and watch people pass by in costumes; while I have my wine and crab pizza. Calzone is also one of the restaurants that closes late, @1AM. You cant go wrong with this place, unless you're really just a complainer. enjoy
author: Charmagne C.

description:
I was a bit hesitant at first, given all the horror-story reviews with the reservation system, but after enjoying a reunion meal with friends, it proved to be a decent experience. The ambiance was lively, and pretty good for some good conversation with old friends.

The waiter was very prompt with our initial drink order, but was a bit slow with our food and refilling drinks afterwards. However, once the food actually did come out, we were not disappointed. We ordered a few orders of garlic fries (slightly odd dish at an Italian restaurant), and they were awesome. Pretty strong garlic taste (you'll need mints after) and super crispy texture. However, I would stay away from the garlic bread, since it's the same thing as the free bread they give you, just with a little more garlic and olive oil, and you only get 4 small pieces. Don't know why they're such misers about the bread.

I ordered the combo pizza, which had a variety of meats on top. It was a bit on the soggy side, but still tasted pretty good and was a decent sized pie. I was also able to try the original calzone, which didn't impress me as much since it was too dry, which was disappointing, given the name of the restaurant. C'mon, son.

Regardless, I had a good time here, but given the number of Italian restaurants in the area, I probably won't be back.
author: Eric J.

description: Stopped here for a bite to eat while in the area. Tables to eat inside, or grab a table outside and people watch. The place is decorated kinda cool inside with lots of food related stuff on the walls. Food was just o.k.  My son and I both got a pizza of our choice, and my wife and daughter both got a pasta dish.  We were all kinda blah about our food. Nothing spectacular food wise. Pizzas were almost $20 each, and so was each of the pasta dishes. Way overpriced for what you get. I guess they cater to the tourists crowd that they figure will never be back again anyways. Service was also average. Will plan ahead more and choose a better option next time.
author: G. R.

description: They have heaters outside that gets pretty warm so that you can sit outside while you enjoy your food. We had bruschetta kale dinosaur and lasagna. We absolutely loved it! Will definitely come back! Excellent service! Waiter actually has suggestions on the menu that will make this an unforgettable experience
author: Aylin M.

description: Absolutely loved the food. I had the BBQ Calzone. Large servings. Service was very good n the ambiance was great. Would diffenity go back if i was in the area again. A most charming and delicious place to eat.
author: Mary P.

description: Holy crap! Best pizza I've ever had! Seriously awesome! Good customer service and we're sat down quickly. Good environment. Definitely recommend.
author: Cameron P.

description: Had a great time here, walked in to led zeppelin, sat down quickly. Great ambience, amazing food and happy polite wait staff.
author: Jacob M.

description: Went on a business trip with a couple coworkers and we decided to dine here on a night out. Our waiter, Pablo, gave exceptional service. Our drinks and food were served in very little time, and everything tasted amazing/fresh. The ambiance was warm and cozy. Definitely recommend this restaurant for a nice Italian meal and great service.
author: Jessica O.

description: This place looks amazing from outside, cool vibe with diner style chairs and authentic. It definitely catches the eye.The outside seating and bar area are great to people watch and order a drink, but that's as far as I'd go. The pasta was bland and underwhelming. I was really disappointed as this place looks like the real deal. As I say good for drink, just for the street view but anything more than that for anyone with discerning taste, it's a no. Also had to ask numerous times for bill.
author: Paula M.

description:
Either I've been here too many times or this place is loosing it. That way or the other I was extremely disappointed with my last visit here which is probably the last one.
Next time I will stand as much as needed in the line for Tonny pizza, or chose one of the many other excellent restaurants around. The sidewalk seating does not worth it that much.
We waited for someone to take our drinks order way too long while sitting in the sun, we were not served the bread they usually serve as you sit down and when we finally got it, it was after we were served our entries. The bread was served without butter (they used to serve butter with it). 
I looked at the table next to us and saw they were served a half stick of butter in its original paper cover as you buy it from the grocery store - very bizarre, so I gave up asking for butter. 
The man server insisted to speak fluent Spanish with us although we kept staring at him, telling him we have no idea what he says. I don't care he thought we're Spanish, but it should have been enough when we told him once, yet he kept speaking Spanish and only at the third time we told him angrily we have no idea what he says he switched to English.
My daughter ordered fettuccini Alfredo with chicken and her dish tasted nothing but disgusting! It tasted as if the chicken was spoiled!I did not finish my salad after finding a piece of plastic in it. They took it off the bill but still -yucky! I believe it came from the cover of the bacon they cut into the salad.
The woman server who took my salad order saw it necessary to tell me TWICE: you know Panchetta  (one of the salad ingredients) is bacon! I told her yes I know, but she repeated it slowly as if she's talking to a difficult child: panchetta is bacon you know?
(Did I look to her like I'm in a need of a diet? Did I ask what panchetta is? Do you call me fat?!?) I ate panchetta when this server was yet in her diapers. A real panchetta. In Italy.
I said again very slow: yes I know... But it's a good idea to leave it out of the plate since I'm trying to save calories. (Do you call me fat?!?)
Not only the panchetta...ahm... Excuse me, bacon ended up in my dish but also a piece of its plastic cover ended up in there.
We were extremely upset and left without finishing our food. Never coming back here. Ever again.
author: Stephanie A.

description: I have to say I come here often but tonight was a little much. I came in after work in sweats with my niece n nephew sat outside everything was fine. Order drinks and food. The waiter came back and accidentally dropped a whole raspberry lemonade on me.. I'm talking a whole pint all over my lap.. I wasn't mad he apologized we had to move tables it was so wet under us.. fine accidents happen I was extremely nice about it being in the industry myself. So they brought new drinks and food finally came.. My nephew went to the restroom came back and slipped on the wet lemonade on the floor. Great now he has lemonade all on his jeans. I was kinda surprised when I got the check though. They charged us for everything .. I'm not asking for a hand out what so ever.. But being in the industry I would at least bare minimum  bought the two sodas and mojito outta common courtesy ... Walking home wet with sticky lemonade on me really made me upset. Makes me think if I was really shitty to the server we prolly would of had a free meal/dinner. Just common curtesy to take care of your customers ..
author: Darlene G.

description: Idyllic Northbeach location. Cozy outdoor seating perfect for people watching. Great views of the street and short distant of Washington Square Park. Extensive heat lamps make this is a nice place for late night espresso. This restaurant looks great year round but is best displayed during Christmas time with all the lights, bells and whistles. Food is good. Portions are very small. The chicken salad with butter lettuce was divine. Just wish it was three times the size!
author: Rosalyn W.

description: After getting dinner in Fremont, we headed back towards our flat on Golden Gate but I was still hungry. So we got on yelp and found this place! We shared the Dungeness Crab pasta. Pasta was slightly undercooked but not bad. The sauce was pretty amazing. We ended up finishing it off with leftover bread. It was the perfect amount for the two of us to share since we had just eaten. The ice was alright, they ended up giving up extra in a little milk jug bottle which was cool. The atmosphere is alright. The bathroom was gross. The service was lacking but was not bad. Would come here again!
author: Ashley W.

description:
This is one of our SF traditions - we go (or do our best to go) to North Beach, and we visit this place. 
The order - chicken pesto calzone and butter-leaf lettuce salad.  Everything else is optional! Just love this place for their perfectly-baked dough, creative cocktails, a nice seating area outside for the summer and cozy, creative and welcoming inside. 
The service is quick and friendly, the bartenders are there to meet any of your needs and desires (drink related, of course).  
Parking, not surprisingly, in a pain... but that applies to all and everything in North Beach. 
Also, get another cocktail for dessert :) the desserts are OK, but...
author: Marianna K.

description:
After visiting SF for the 6th time I finally gave in and ate at Calzone's. What did I order you ask??? A calzone of course! We ordered the Italian calzone with a side of marinara. I loved it. The crust was thin and the stuffing was full of prosciutto, citerio mortadella (whatever that is...), salami, baby artichokes, tomatoes, and mozzarella cheese. Even with all these ingredients, the calzone was not heavy or messy. It was a delicious and filling. 

To go with the calzone I ordered the arugula salad. Know that when you order the arugula salad it has goat cheese on it. The goat cheese tasted gamey. Exactly how it should taste. All the other ingredients meshed together very nicely. The dressing, lemon oil, was light and unified the salad nicely. 

In the end, I thought this place was where the tourist went on North Beach to dine. However, whether it is or not this was the best calzone I've ever had. But please note that the only other calzone I tried was at the now bankrupt Sbarro's.
author: Angela R.

description:
FOOD/DRINK:
1.) lasagna calzone - yummie pretty good nice light crisp crust
2.) Moscow Mojito - o man this was the delish & strong drink my coworker introduced me! Normally already like Moscow mules, but this is a Moscow Mojito so a lil bit more refreshing :)
3.) Pineapple Mojito - this was good, just tasted like pineapple juice, but covered up what is also actually a pretty strong drink :) their mojitos they add a stick of sugar cane too so that's fun
4.) *** pasta, came here again with cousins, and everything everyone got was good and everyone enjoyed their food. Def a go to and recommended spot for anyone visiting town.
5.) crab pasta - so guuud. At first portion looks small but after eating for half hour still looked like I I barely touched it!


SERVICE:
Good


ATMOSPHERE:
Love the atmosphere, the long sidewalk seating like a real Italian feel, view of the same outdoor seating across the street. Perfect for the warm Sf FallSummer weather. Plus I love the location on Columbus of North Beach. Such a cute neighborhood, best feel, easy to walk to other spots in the area, right next to fidi or chinatown too :)


9.8.13
author: Angela L.

description: It's an amazing restaurant with a great location to boot! You will not be disappointed if you eat here. The food was great and it has a retro feel that really mixes well with the general atmosphere. It's in little Italy, so there are many choices all around the area afterwards to go get desert.
author: Daniel L.

description:
The taste of the food is coming from fat alone. I had the Milanese chicken breast. The bread crumbs were drowned in fat. 
My kids had pizza magerita. The cheese topping was thicker than anything else. 
I would not recommend this place if you are looking for a REAL Italian restaurant.
However, the place is awesome and the atmosphere too.
author: Markus W.

description: On a sunny day or a nice evening in San Francisco, this is the best place to grab drinks and good food in North Beach. We love coming here to people watch from their outdoor tables. Today was an exceptionally nice day out in late February so my friend and I came here for Calamari and Steak Salad. I get the Calamari on every visit because it's good and comes in a huge portion so I can share it with the table. The batter has a nice savory flavor and flakes off so you can tell it's very fresh. You even get some fried veggies with it. The Steak Salad was just spinach with a side of steak. It was light and flavorful and the perfect plate to share on a warm day but it was a bit plain. I usually get their low carb Mixed Grill plate and my friends love their Lasagna Calzone while Steve always gets their Grilled Salmon. The calzones are a bit heavy for a lunch meal but it's large enough to eat and save for later. The Mixed Grill has a good portion of Salmon, Shrimp and Scallops with Cauliflower. It's a healthy option compared to the pastas though the pastas are delish. They used to have an Asparagus Salmon Orzo that I loved but it's no longer available. Bring it back!!! My favorite daytime drink is from here called the Moscow Mojito made with vodka and mint. The service is pretty good, sometimes oddly overly attentive. For instance, today we had two different severs take our order so it was a bit confusing and they both continued to check on us throughout lunch.
author: Jen L.

description:
Sitting outside and watching the hustle and bustle of the Sunday crowd was great. Another plus are the heat lamps that kept us nice and toasty! 

We went with the Spinach and Crab toast for an appetizer. For $15, you receive two loaded pieces of bread with all the fixings. It was great, wish there was more!  My husband and I split the Italian Calzone and the Caesar salad. Both delicious. The calzones are about a foot long so bring your appetite if you don't plan to share. 

Service slipped a bit in the end after we received our food. Not sure where our waitress went however it took flagging down other waiters to get our check, we gave up on trying to get refills. All in all, it was a nice lunch spot.
author: Samantha M.

description: Beware the "new menu". Over the years we've eaten here pretty regularly, at least once every few weeks. But slowly, our favorite calzones have disappeared from the menu and last night our standard order was no longer available. Spotting a Louie salad  (crab/shrimp) - $16 - ("a new item" the waiter said), we ordered one with crab and shrimp mixed. What we had not noticed was the small print up at the top of the salad section - "Add crab +$10 shrimp +$7 etc." When we got the bill, our $16 shrimp Louie was $33 - $16 for the basic salad, $10 for the crab and another $7 for the shrimp. When we protested, the waiter just shrugged and walked away. It wasn't that much money but we felt like we'd been ripped off, that Calzone's had turned into just another tourist ripoff place in North Beach. We won't be back.
author: Robert Y.

description:
Amazing Lasagna, but unfortunately very small.
The staff was polite, fast and very attentive.

The price is ok for what they serve and where they are but I would expect something bigger ( and if it was, they would have my 5 stars).
author: Fernando G.

description:
The BEST lasagna we've ever had. Filet was delicious, as well as the creamed spinach. Outdoor seating with heaters was nice. Enjoyed the full bar as well. 

Did not like the bread-it was a little stale and tasted like grocery store French baguette. We did not like the oil and vinegar either.
author: Chris And April S.

description: Atmosphere is very nice and even better there were strong heaters outside for a chillier night. This is definitely a tourist trap though with the prices. Really... $5 for a soda... what is this the movies!? Pizza was decent, probably should have ordered a calzone. Staff very friendly though.
author: Hoku L.

description:
My boyfriend and I were spending the day in SF and decided that Italian food sounded good for dinner.  He called Calzone's at around 3 p.m. to make a reservation for 6:30 p.m on a Saturday night (during the holidays mind you).  

We ended up showing up to the restaurant a little earlier than originally planned, but the hostess seated us immediately in the outside seating area (Which is heated by the way so you will be nice and toasty).  Our waiter showed up immediately with menus and soon-after came back with water and bread.

We ordered the crab crostini for our appetizer.  As for entrees, I had the Ravioli filled with roasted chicken, rosemary, with cremini mushroom sauce.  My boyfriend had the shellfish pasta with mussels, prawns, clams and spicy tomato brodo along with a very tasty (and strong) mojito. 

The crab crostini was great. The portion isn't too big but it's a great starter for two.  My ravioli was perfection in..well...in ravioli form.  The filling was full of flavor and the sauce was rich and creamy.  I had a little bite of my boyfriend's shellfish pasta.  It was cooked al dente and the chefs made sure to pick out all the dead clams before serving the dish (bonus points!).  We finished off our meal with a very satisfying slice of tiramisu.   

I loved our waiter.  He swung by our table regularly with a big smile and made sure our water cups never went empty.  


Food: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Overall Experience: 5/5

Tip: I think that there is only ONE bathroom in the entire restaurant so there may be a line if nature calls.  Try to use the bathroom at a different place before sitting down at Calzone's for dinner.  Kept my boyfriend waiting for a little while :/
author: Grace Y.

description: I love this place nice and sexy spot for a late night date ;) it's fun and they have out side seating to get the full Francisco experience ;) awesome fresh seafood , amazing wine list and great waiters! I go very often !
author: Jessica S.

description:
******LONG REVIEW****** SORRY*********

I remember being there a couple years ago and forgetting to write a review. Now I find myself back home in San Diego and missing this gem of a restaurant. Oh how I wish I could go back!! :( 
Anyway,  
First let me start by saying that our waiter was so nice. We were in the process of traveling back to Oakland so we had some small luggage with us. Our waiter went out of his way to place our belongings somewhere safe and out of the way (we had outdoor seats and it was a tight space on a busy day) I wish I remembered his name!!  
I remember us ordering 3 items to share (me and 2 other friends)

1st was " Wild Arugula Salad:      artichokes, almonds, roasted tomatoes, humboldt fog goat cheese, lemon oil"
 The salad was fresh and refreshing! So good! Anytime I can have goat cheese and artichokes in a salad im sold! Lol my friend is not a fan of salads but she loved it!!   

2nd was "Dungeness Crab Pizza: avocado, red onions, fontina"
The pizza was cooked perfectly. It was light, thin, and flavorful. It looks like it doesnt have much on it but to me its always "quality over quantity"  and they sure have quality stuff!! ;)

3rd was "Asparagus Chicken House-Made Fresh Fettuccine: oven roasted tomatoes, almonds, garlic, basil" 
Mmmm....you can never go wrong with fresh pasta!! This was so good it was my favorite dish I almost didnt want to share!! Lol the chicken was done perfect. Not overcooked and the asparagus wasnt mushy and overcooked either. I think this is one of the main reasons I liked it so much,  because I always have bad experiences with other places that tend to overcook their foods so it just becomes one big mush.

Although this place is a little small and crowded, the food and cute decor make up for its size! :)
author: Kathy H.

description: We sat on the outdoor heated area and enjoyed wine and a Flatbread style pizza. Very tasty snack. The service was good they tried hard and the patio was cute.
author: Kirsten D.

description:
We came here with a large group on a Saturday night and found a table for 9 right away. The place has a  great vibe and good food. The prices were not to far off for that part of the city either. I ordered the margarita pizza and it was great. Not too cheesy and a lot of flavor. I tried my wife's pasta and it was good too. The portions were big and you will most likely ask for a bag to take the leftovers home. 

Really liked the fact that we didn't have to wait over an hour like the other restaurants. The service was great and they went out of their way to keep our drinks filled and responding to all of our requests. I'll go back again in the future.
author: Michael D.

description: I love this place. I've been stopping by for nearly ten years. The cute little bistro tables outside are great when I'm with a girlfriend but I actually wouldn't recommend for a romantic date as you are sitting side by side. The colorful people who walk by trying to sell you stuff can be interesting too. Any how, they make great mojitos, get with whatever you want rum,tequila,vodka. The pizzas are delicious, light and airy. The pasta is rich and filling but you just go with the chocolate mouse and the mint whip cream with a cappuccino to end your night!
author: Crystal V.

description:
We did not like this place at all. We saw garlic fries were popular but we did not order those or any other appetizer. 

We ordered a fettuccine pasta and ravioli. Both were not upto the mark at all. 
My ravioli was over cooked and dry from inside. The fettuccine pasta was medium warm and felt like it could have used some more heating. 

The service was ok. We were the last to get the bread though we were earlier than others. Half way after the food was over  the server came in with cheese grater. 

I wanted some good Italian food and I did not get it.
author: Tejal D.

description:
I went to this restaurant last weekend because I've been craving a good calzone ever since I moved to the Bay Area from New Jersey. Obviously, a place named after the very thing I craved must be good, right?

Wrong. Not only did I spent almost $70 for a calzone, two salads, and two beers (plus extra charge for marinara... Which is absurd at an "Italian restaurant"). But, I also got to spend a good amount of time that night in the bathroom. 

Listen, I'm not some kind of Italian food elitist. All I was looking for was fresh ingredients, reasonable prices, and a drink. This place is a tourist trap (it MUST be), unless $18 calzones that give you diarrhea is what you're into. 

And what's with the bread with no butter or fresh olive oil/seasoning? This is some basic stuff here... Very disappointed.
author: Robert B.

description: Loved loved loved the gnocchietti with the meat sauce. It was delicious. The margarita pizza was light and crispy, it was good as well. The chicken calzone lacked some flavor. Over all I would come back for the pasta. I do not recommend the mixed drinks. The cucumber cooler was not tolerable it had a strange taste to it, as did the sangria had a perfume type flavor. Next time I will just stick with the water. The ambiance is so cute definitely sit out on the patio, cute tables and you enjoy your food and people watch. Overall I would return to this restaurant.
author: rebecca m.

description:
Went for dinner and the business was brisk
The service was excellent and very friendly  
We ate indoors and we enjoyed looking out the window at the activity on the street
I got the pizza and my hubby got the Italian calzone 
Both were excellent and the portion size was large
More than we could eat
We would recommend
author: Annie H.

description: This savory restaurant has a dish called the "Italian Potsticker" made with real sausage over a bed of micro-greens. Chinese dumplings have themselves a culture-competitor. Hanging out in north beach calls for a perfect city view. If your party is 2-3 in size, choose a time where the sun is not beaming down on the outside patio seating. Enjoy!
author: Benji P.

description: Once again Calzone's didn't disappoint! Service was absolutely top notch and we enjoyed the patio on a calm Indian summer night. The house chianti and cheese plate were a delightful snack!
author: Andrea H.

description: We had dinner there yesterday Sept 19th, 17. The service and food was terrible. Some  of our food was cold and chicken very overcooked on the pasta dish.  We ordered a salad and an appetizer. The salad came first and when we said that we wanted it after the appetizer, we were told that it was a salad appetizer? Too bad. It used to be a favorite of mine. Terry
author: Terry F.

description: I have been wanting to come here for so long and finally got the chance to go a couple days ago. We were not greeted when entering and I had to find a host to get seated. Aside from that dinner was good. I got chicken alfredo and my friend got pizza. Both were very good, as well as the server checking up on us. I was satisfied with the food and will definitely be going back.
author: Rose M.

description: Very friendly service. The calamari, burger, ravioli, Cesar, are my personal favorite. An awesome Italian spot. A Must go!!
author: michael m.

description: Great service, good food. We chose this amongst the other restaurants in the same area because there was more people and I'm glad we did. Great flavors, good size portions.
author: Regina G.

description: Horrible food and customer service. Really wanted to give the pizza a shot and make it better with some lemon but still, a horrible pizza is a horrible pizza. Then they charged me for eating only a slice and Alicia wouldn't take it back. Showed me the leftovers they packed up and it was less than what was taken from my plate and that's why. Pretty cheap trick.
author: Joseph R.

description:
OMG!! THE BEST FRIES I HAVE EVER HAD!!! You definitely have to try the garlic fries!
The pozza is perfect thin crust! Definitely top taste with a casual and comfortable ambiance!
author: Deniz E.

description:
Absolutely fantastic meal. In the heart of NB, we've passed this place hundreds of times, its neon sign is eye catching. We decided to need some visiting friends there to give it a try. Maybe our expectations were low because we thought it would be touristy, but it was fantastic. Crab fettucine with scallop sauce was terrific, perfectly cooked fettucine noodles and plentiful crab. My wife and I shared that and the crab & spinach toast. This was also delicious but very rich. It's a good appetizer if cut and shared between several people.  I wanted to try a meatball, which is my gauge of an Italian restaurant. The waiter said they didn't offer a side. So we pulled a Five Easy Pieces move a la Jack Nicholson and ordered a meatball sandwich, hold the bread and hold the potatoes.  We received an entree sized order of smallish meatballs. They were quite good, not mama's but very good nonetheless. The decor is charming, the walls are lined with packages that I recognized from my nonna's pantry.  
Another friend had the mussels and judging by her eyes rolling back in her head, I venture to guess they were very good. The service was outstanding as well. Our server Rigo was terrific. We'll be back and bring friends for sure.
author: Dar V.

description:
This s a great North Beach restaurant and a lot of fun to go to. It does get busy, so if you want to have a quiet romantic dinner, this place may not be for you. The best thing I suggest is to get there in the late afternoon. At this time there is always available tables. Overall, the food and the drinks are all fun and it is a great place to watch the San Francisco masses, (tourist and otherwise), pass-by.

To get into more detail, parking for this restaurant can be a bit of a pain. As we all understand, trying to find a parking space in North Beach can be a problem. So, if you are planning to eat at Calzone's that is the first thing to think about. If you live within walking distant or travel by taxi or something like that, eating here may become a much easier experience. 

Once you are here it is essential to know that Calzone's has multiple floors. So, just because it looks totally full downstairs that does not mean that you should not ask about a table as they may have one upstairs. 

It is important to note that the tables at Calzone's are fairly close to one another. So, if you hope for that old-school private dining experience this place may not be for you. It is not that they are too close together, it is just that your dining experience is not going to be all that private.

The atmosphere of this restaurant is generally crowded and noisy. This is particularly the case during the main dining hours. 

In the downstairs portion they have full length windows that they commonly leave open when it is not too cold or rainy. And, you can, of course, eat outside on the sidewalk. A lot of people like this but for me North Beach is just too crowded with the walking masses who can really interrupt your meal, especially when the dirty homeless people come by asking for money. But, that's just me...

In term of upstairs dining, you don't have the large windows looking out to the street but it is nicely designed and well ventilated. So, it also a good place to eat. 

The staff is generally really good. Even when it is busy they watch over their tables and take care of their customers. 

In terms of food, most of it is really good. But, some of it may not be for everyone. For example, you can't go wrong with their pizzas, salads, or sandwiches. They are all individual meal size and a long as you know which one you want you are all-good. The pastas and the calzones are also good but, from my experience, you need to be careful which one you order if you don't like certain things. As an example, I ordered the roasted chicken calzone one time and inside it has all this cottage cheese stuff. I am sure some people like this, but to me it is just weird. So, know what you are ordering and if you have any questions ask your server.

Overall, this restaurant is filled with the local and the tourist crowd, with emphasis on the ladder. As there are locals, and everyone known there can be some weird birds in and around North Beach, you occasionally find one of them inside Calzone's. The only time I refused to accept the table they tried to sit me at was when the hostess tried to put us in a tight corner right next to a table where a guy had one of his hands in his pants, if you know what I am talking about. So, just be prepared, you may encounter a weird customer as you are in North Beach. But, most customers are normal, nice, and are just there to have a good meal. 

Overall, good place to go. I eat at this restaurant quite frequently.
author: Scott S.

description:
I love giving good ratings on Yelp, but I had to give this restaurant 2 stars (1. We had a really nice waiter. 2. Nice street view, and it looks pretty cool inside. ) 

A group of us were walking around in Little Italy and saw this place. It looked really interesting! We were craving pizza. We asked the hostess if they serve it here, and she said yes. So we decided to eat here. Our waiter was nice, and the customer service was pretty good too!

But, our food.

We thought since it's an Italian restaurant, it must have really good pizza! When we asked the waiter about their pizza sizes, he told us that their pizzas were squared and really small. We changed our minds because those pizzas were almost $17 each for such small sizes. So we decided to get regular dishes. 
We got bread before our entrees, but it was hard to eat, and it didn't taste fresh.
Some of the guys I was with were pretty hungry. They ordered sandwiches, and they couldn't finish them because those sandwiches were too dry. Too much bread, and barely any sauce.
I ordered the Chicken and Asparagus Fettucine. It had no taste, no salt, no pepper, no seasonings. It literally had no sauce on it, so it was really dry! It tasted like pure water. Also, when I got this dish, it was getting kinda cold. The chicken tasted a few days old as well. This dish was $18. . . :/

I was expecting this place to be 10 times better than Olive Garden, but Olive Garden is 10 times better then this place. I've made Italian dishes at home, and they tasted better then the dishes we ate here, seriously! Everyone at my table said that their food had no taste to it. At the end, $100 was spent.
author: Esther E.

description:
There are a plethora of Italian restaurants in North Beach/Russian Hill.  Some are authentic (or claim to be as "Our chef is from Sicily" proclaimed one restaurant hawker), some are trendy (to see and be seen), and some are crowded.  I found that most were terribly overpriced, and according to my wallet,  Calzone's is in the same category.

Somebody has to pay the outrageous rents in San Francisco?  Might as well be unsuspecting tourists...

We were starving after a day of walking the Embarcadero, (which, in retrospect, is not the optimal time to search for a restaurant) and since Capo's was full (Yelp - you let me down: who the hell knew I needed reservations on a Sunday night???) we settled on Calzone's, judging from the amount of people.  

WRONG.  WRONG.  WRONG.  Triple WRONG.  

As a New Yorker who grew up a stone's throw from Little Italy, they should call this place "Italian-inspired" because except for the fancy cheeses used, there was nothing Italian about it.  Period.

We sat outside to take in the ambiance, as it sort of reminded me of my beloved hometown.  Heaters outside take the chill out of the San Francisco air.  The server's assistant (I hate the term "busboy" because these are men, right?) was right on time with refilling our water, bread and getting us butter, but our server?  He was, most notably MIA for most of our "dinner" (from the portions, more like a snack).  

We ordered the roasted cauliflower colore, and except for the romesco sauce and the microscopic shavings of manchego, the dish was unremarkable.  The cauliflower was too al dente, but the flavor was...nothing.  

We hoped that they'd redeem themselves with the pizza.  Again, WRONG.

We got the cremini mushrooms pizza and this (and the server's assistant) are the reasons for two stars instead of one.  However light the crust and delicate the flavors, it doesn't make up for the fact that this is an APPETIZER not an entree.  If my fiance and I split a pizza at any restaurant, it is not only enough to fill us, but with leftovers.  I don't know how much an ounce-and-a-half of cremini mushrooms (if that much) and Chimay Grand Cru (a sweet yet intense cheese) cost, but again Calzone's - this is an APPETIZER portion.  Oblong with a very light crust (that was surprisingly good), the flavors were impressive, but not to the tune of $16.

And our server?  He was full of smiles (when he did grace us with his presence) but was curiously absent most of our meal.  As far as I know, the universal sign for a woman's meal being done is the reapplication of lipstick.  He saw me reapply lipstick and about 10 minutes later asked "would you like anything else?"  It then took another 10 minutes to get our check, another 10 for the server's assistant to take the bill (not the server).  

AAAAAAAAH!  

Calzone's: you're a tourist trap in which we will not make the same mistake twice.  

If you're bent on dining here, limit it to a cup of coffee and some people-watching.  (Full disclosure - I don't know the quality of their coffee).
author: Teresa S.

description: Fast, fresh, delicious! So many Italian places to choose from and being a tourist it's hard to choose. Didn't regret it!!! Good portions. I got the Brussel sprout and kale salad my boyfriend got the mushroom and sausage.
author: Sara K.

description:
There are many options here in the immediate area for Italian.  Though I have a couple nearby preferences, I stopped in here as they have a new menu with some great 'small plate' offerings that caught my eye as I walked by.

And with that...they have a nice setup along the street.  Yes, it looks out to busy Columbus Avenue (they all do), but the tables are well arranged and attractive. 

Despite the creative new plates,  I had a taste for some calamari frites. They are served up well here. Batter is tasty & light.  Remoulade sauce alongside is a perfect addition. Recommend!  Great service and as thirsty as I was I akways had a topped off water glass.

I'd stop in again for the calamari and explore some of the other small plates.
author: Kevin T.

description:
This place is amazing.
Went looking for a late night italian dinner while staying at the OMNI in SF. Recommended by the bellhop, he was spot on. I had the Italian pizza in a calzone, my sister had gnocchi (pesto), and her boyfriend had a pizza. 

We came around 9 pm and it was crazy crowded (a good sign!), a short 15 minute wait and two mojitos later we ended up discovering an amazing italian place. Hidden gem. 

Also great for people watching! Other things: mojito bar, and I recommend French lemonade as a drink. You'll love it! 

Ahhh..... Not sure what else I can say... But try this place, you won't regret it! It's very hard to find good italian places with my sister and her boyfriend because they both studied in Italy and are very picky.............. But passed all the tests!!!! 


Amazing.
author: Kayla L.

description:
Nice atmosphere 
Food was tasty - we sat outside 
The pasta was NOT al dente.
It was way over-cooked (mushy)
author: Karim A.

description: Pizza was good. My problem was they would not split a pizza. I like a supreme pizza and my wife loves pepperoni. They refused to do half and half. Would have walked out but wife didn't want to. Refuse to come again for that reason. Also beer is $9. Ridiculous. Service excellent but can only give one star because they couldn't give me what I wanted. Funny thing is, you order supreme and only half pepperoni and that would save them money.
author: Jason B.

description:
Walking in the streps of Kerouac and Ginsburg, this cafe could easily be dropped onto a street in Rome. We were able to settle into a sidewalk table and enjoy the bustle of the city.

We shared a fantastic handmade Caesar salad and a Three Meat Pizza. The pizza comes with a paper thin crunchy crust. The sauce is all homemade like mama makes. 

We finished up the meal with a huge tiramisu and a couple of Espressos. 

Park here for an hour or so and enjoy.
author: Jeff K.

description:
Came to eat here solely because the wait at Tony's Pizza was too long. The service was decent and my water cup was never left empty. However, I would not come here again based on the food and price alone.

We ordered the garlic bread to start. The bread was overbaked and too crisp for my liking. I've had way better. We also tried the crab crostini which came with generous amounts of crab and smoked salmon. That was probably the best thing I tried, but still it was only average. Next, we had the chicken and asparagus fettuccine which was subpar. The chicken was extremely dry and the noodles were undercooked. The asparagus was chopped into tiny pieces and was quite tender, but overall I did not enjoy this dish. Lastly, we tried the Italian calzone, which was just decent. For a restaurant with "calzone" in the name, I was not impressed and expected much more. Each dish was pretty overpriced, and 8 dollars for a corona is a bit much. I opted for an IPA which was the same price...

The restaurant is in a prime location in North Beach, but the food is nowhere near the quality of other restaurants in the area. It's overpriced and the food is below average. The ambiance is nice and service is good, but I probably wouldn't come back here. Meh.
author: Cheryl N.

description:
I have nothing bad to say about this place! Came with a few friends on a Sunday night and wanted to sit outside and people watch. We were sat right under a heat lamp, so got to gawk while staying nice and toasty.

Ordered a few bottles of wine and appetizers, including a cheese plate and bruschetta. The bruschetta was pretty forgettable, the bread was hard as rocks and nearly chipped my tooth. The cheese platter was fantastic and the wine delicious. The server allowed us to stay until 2am and finish our wine outside. Amazing service and ambiance!
author: Christine E.

description:
Went here for lunch. We wanted to enjoy the sun so we sat outside.

The outdoor seating is so cute & unique. 
Cute because the tables were so cute & intimate.
Unique because the chairs face the street so it makes it so you are right next to the people walking in the street. Great for 'people-watching' lol.

The food came out before out drinks we ordered.
I ordered a mojito & it was yummy! Pretty strong on a count of I had nothing in my tummy. I also ordered the Margherita pizza, it was yummy & great for two people to share. 

I'll be back to try a calzone since the place is called Calzone's it must be good ;)
author: Camille C.

description:
amazing food, service, ambience.

love the Brussels sprouts pizza, and the Italian calzone. super laid back atmosphere where waiters are with it and responsive, making a full experience
author: Kate H.

description:
Went here the 2nd time and I even felt better. I came with my friends and we got calamari, garlic fries and tiramisu.
Mojito drinks still the best. 
Appetizers were great, I had wonderful time watching people and snacking in front of the restaurant.
Next time I would try entrée meals here and hopefully my next review would be 5+ XD.
author: Phuong P.

description: ZERO if I could. WTF Calzones?!? Got out of a cab at 11:44pm and was told Immediately I, and my guest were drunk and wouldn't be served by a hostess and server. Literally BY JUST STANDING THERE. PS IM SOBER. That's why your HOSTESS and SERVER were sent home in front of my face. I called for the manger. Which sat me, and sent you BOTH home. We had barely walked up. Had not been sat OR ORDERED. I was sat, by your manger, by the way because I was so incoherently wasted. We had a conversation, I expected to spend $150+ tip at your establishment BUT WONT BECAUSE YOU & YOUR ASSOCIATE ARE JERKS.  Had either of us been sat? NO. Had we ordered drinks??? NOOOO Did you have ANY DETERMINATION WHATSOEVER BESIDES 19 y/old discrimination?!?!?!?!? NONE! NOT AT ALL. NOTHING. NO PROOF NO REASON. JUST BEING AN UPPITY KNOW IT ALL JERK. CONGRATS ON NOTHING. Hope your yelp travelers read this and GO ELSEWHERE. BECAUSE WHY NOT. There's a million choices in this city. And no good reason for you. Your own manger agreed you're not good at your job. BUYER BEWARE. IF YOU USE A CAB,YOURE OBVIOUSLY DRUNK AND WONT BE SERVED HERE. NO UBER. NO LYFT ACCEPTED.
author: maria K.

description: I had lunch here recently.  Ordered the soup and salad and the calamari.  Bean soup was OK, the salad was dead, perhaps it was made too long before it was served.  As for the calamari it was fresh but it had no taste.  I think the flour coating was made with flour and cornmeal.  I'm not going back for dinner.  Ambiance isn't everything you need to serve good food to get patrons to return.
author: Ken K.

description:
Sergio is the worst server I've ever had. My niece and I went there last night, and from the minute we sat down, he was rude and rushed us through our meal. He never came to check on us after we got our entrees and we had to flag down bussers to get Parmesan cheese and extra marinara sauce. When we weren't even done eating, he first came and said that he was switching us to another server, because he was leaving. That was fine with us, but then he came back five minutes later and told us that we needed to pay asap, we weren't even done with our meal!

After we paid, we were still thinking about coffee and desert, but we had to ask a busser for more water while we looked at the menu. I let the busser know that Sergio had been very rude and rushed us, I was hoping to talk to a manager, Instead, Sergio came out to our table and asked several times aggressively what the problem was. He was so confrontational, it made the whole situation worse. I decided not to say anything and just write a Yelp because I was so uncomfortable.

We are on vacation, we really wanted to like this place, the appetizers were great. I have no idea why this server acted the way he did, we ordered a good amount of drinks and food.

Anyway, if you go there, try to get a different server!
author: Marie N.

description:
Recently stumbled upon this place after a long day of boating on the bay. First impression: clean, friendly help and cute decor. Very European.

Our hostess seated us immediately, even though they were extremely busy (Saturday evening). The server gave us enough time to look at the menu thoroughly (I didn't feel rushed) and the delivery of the food was prompt. 

We ordered garlic fries with a chipotle remoulade sauce (5 stars just for the sauce!). Fries were perfectly cooked, not at all soggy or greasy. Next came the bruschetta. Again, 5 stars for that too. A delicious pesto sauce, not at all greasy, with slivered, thoroughly cooked garlic, fresh tomatoes and basil leaves. Toasted to perfection, not too crusty or underdone. 

Then, our calzones arrived. OMG. Mine had fresh, whole milk ricotta, tomatoes, artichoke hearts, and mozzarella fresca. Cooked hot throughout. My date's calzone had prosciutto, fra' mani salami, mortadella, baby artichokes, tomatoes and mozzarella. 

Bottom line: Fun, clean and busy atmosphere (perfect for people watching in the heart of North Beach), beautiful Italian men, huge portions, and amazing food. I'll definitely be returning.
author: Marina T.

description:
Back again! Had the same thing and and it was great. Wanted to say that your waitress Erin was amazing! It was slow and she talked with us about what its like to be living in the city, which is just amazing when you're visiting a big city like this for the first time.

Great service too, my glass was never empty. 

Definitely stop by and sit outside for a great lazy evening in North beach
author: Adam M.

description:
We tried this restaurant because we couldn't get in at Tony's - and boy we were not disappointed. We were lucky enough to get a table on the sidewalk with heaters above - very Parisian. 

What I loved above this place was that they allow locals to dine with their dogs alongside. That might sound like a turnoff but to me it's the sign of a friendly family restaurant. I'm sure the restaurant owner was sitting outside with his two dogs as well.
 
The food was incredible. We ordered two pizzas and they were massive.

It was a great spot to sit and people watch and chat with fellow diners. Great atmosphere, attentive waiters and very nice food.
author: Bernard O.

description:
Disappointed - we went for new year had a 9pm reservation and wasn't seated till 9:30
Waiter was great but the food was awful 
You would think a place called calzones would be known for their calzones... Omg do not order.
Seriously a hot pocket tastes better...
