The calzone arrived under cooked doughy and cold.
I sent it back to return when my family was done with their meal and it still was doughy...
Portions are small- beware
My sons steak was good but overall it was $140 for 4 no alcohol and I left hungry .
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Last night, several of us were sitting around, and some were talking about a great Italian restaurant in San Francisco.  I looked it up on Yelp, it looks like it's starting to go downhill.  The good news is, it's only a block away from a place that really is good:  Calzone's.

Calzone's holds a special place in my heart.  I forget how old our baby was, but my parents came over for the day and said, "We'll take care of her, you two go have a good time by yourself for a few hours."  Something that all parents need;  this was the first time we were allowed that privilege.  I found Calzone's, probably on Yelp (before I was a Yelper, that explains why I didn't write a review then), and we went.  Dates, good for married couples too!

This is a stereotypical North Beach cafe, a European-feeling eatery in the most European-feeling neighborhood in The City.  Small tables on the sidewalk.  Small booths indoors with open windows.  Or you can sit further indoors in the colorful restaurant.  Full bar, which we of course did not do.  We both had a calzone and a Coke.  Lots of meat, not so much bread that it overpowers the entree, not too hard, not too soft, but just right.  The price was right, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was good for the heart-to-heart that we had that day.

Of all the Italian restaurants in Little Italy, this is a good choice.  Which one is the best is a matter of opinion, and I won't go there.  But it was a great choice for us.  If you work in the Financial District and want to take a long lunch, Calzone's is worth the walk or the taxi fare.  Also a good date place ;-)
author: Ron L.

description: We love this place! If it's not obvious, get the calzone, it's the best we have ever had. Get an extra side of marinara as well.
author: Dan O.

description: Amazing pasta place! I recommend the artichoke ravioli with gorgonzola and aspargos sauce! The decoration is incredible and the restaurant is open until late time!
author: Luciana T.

description: I've had Italian food in so many countries different cities including Italy but this here is something else, best I've ever had
author: Siraj E.

description:
My favorite spot in North beach for a dessert and cup of coffee, I honestly never tried their food but I will in the future. I love their out side seating area as it is heated no matter how cold it is u will still be warm drinking good coffee and watching people passing by

Will update review after I try their food
author: Sam D.

description: The Best Lasagna ever!  I don't want to bury the lede here.  I have never tasted lasagna this good. Add to that a delicious cheesy garlic bread with ground black pepper and a fantastic pepperoni pizza & we were set.  Did I mention that you can eat outside on the sidewalk? Don't worry! They have heaters so it is quite comfortable.  A truly great experience.
author: Mark W.

description:
Mmmhhhhh so good. Sit outside, people watch, forget you're in SF because they even have heaters when it gets chilly outside  - so fake believe you're in Italy for the night. 
The lasagna calzone is  incredible; in cased is the perfect ratio of lasagna sauce and gooey cheese with the crunch of crusty calzone shell.   
 Not a cauliflower fan at all, but their cauliflower colore is really good. It's acidic which I really like and not too oily. 
Oh yeah get the California Moscow Mule they are delish.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Good food and nice environment. Don't expect to come here and get "basic" Italian food. This is more fancy Italian food with fancy prices. Place is really small and our party of 12 was squeezed into a spot for probably 8 people. Food took quite awhile to come out and we ordered basic pizza and pastas. Once the food came out, we were not checked on and didn't see our waiter again until he brought the check, which automatically included a huge tip. There are many Italian places in SF, I suggest to try others before coming here.
author: Roxanne S.

description:
Why 3 stars? The service...(thumbs down). Food is amazing though. I ordered the "Steak Scaloppini " it was so rich and flavorful (I promise). Small potion, but it's worth it. 
 Our waiter didn't check on us once . I had to flagged down a couple different waiters for the basic necessities (water, refill, etc.) ... Other than that, the restaurant's decor is pretty cool & food is yummy
author: TigerLily F.

description:
We really liked the outdoor seating. 
The food, however was NOT good. We shared lasagna, which was acceptable, lamb, which arrived cold but was good, and chicken and vegetable basil fettuccine, which was awful. 
The menu said homemade fettuccine pasta, but what arrived was stroganoff noodles and microwaved chicken.
author: Nathan G.

description:
Love coming to North Beach, as a local from across the GG Bridge.  During the holidays I met friends for lunch and left behind my furry earmuffs.  So that said, the management did their best to return them to me via postal service since I did not want to venture back the city.  
Applause and bravo - 2 months later - I went again today on a bright spring day to retrieve my earmuffs.  So 5 stars to the management for keeping them safe as my muffs are now back where they belong.  So folks, I'd say they went the extra mile, like I said, even though it took 2 months, never request delivery via a PO Box.  My fault since UPS returned them to the Stinking Rose, then back to Calzones and now back to me.  Thanks Management.  Also had a great lunch today, sitting in the sun on this spring-like day in San Francisco, on a Monday!
author: Cynthia G.

description:
This place is FABULOUS! All the pasta dishes are to die for! All homemade fresh pasta too. The calamari appetizer was great, the dipping sauce is delicious. The ambiance is a very fun Italian vibe. I recommend the gnocchetti with spinach and fontina cheese! Out of the six people in our group, three got the spinach and fontina gnocchetti dish, thats how delicious it looked and was. Another favorite was the fresh tagliatelle pasta with crab alfredo sauce. 

I now recommend this cute Italian restaurant to everyone I know needing a place to eat in the city! 5 STARS!
author: Katie C.

description: Absolutely can't go wrong with anything you will order at this restaurant. Great service & they always keeping the bread & freshly grated cheese flowing. Wonderful vegetarian options which keeps me coming back for more. I recommend the Dinosaur Kale and any of the gnocchi. Everything I tried is wonderful and I've tried over 5 dishes by now. Highly recommend!
author: Angelina A.

description:
Touristy.  To the max.  Over priced for the quality yet a complete classic.  Their bar is very limited.  Pretty much just the basics.

2 of the 2 times I have been here I have had to send something back (cold cazone=no good and another time our order was wrong). Once our orders were right, it was quite yummy.  Quite yummy indeed.   It is large and crowded.  It's kinda fun to sit outside and watch the people go by and the outdoor seating is VERY well out door heated.  Terrible for the environment, but warm.  Service is fast but friendly. 

The decor is busy and eccentric with bottles lining the walls.  There is a lot to look at.  If I had a tourist I would take them.  However, as bay area resident, I'd go get better food and service elsewhere.  And as far as down home Italian food goes, I'd much rather spend a few extra bucks and go to Original Joes.
author: Susan C.

description: Terrific bistro-like bustling Italian for pizza pasta etc. Great service, excellent pizza, wine by the glass. Don't go if you're a frosty person - tables are cosily placed.
author: Benjamin R.

description: We were visiting San Fran and looking for a place to eat and found this gem!  I highly recommend this place.  We were seated promptly, service was great and the food was just amazing!  Everything was wonderful!!
author: B P.

description: The tiramisu was phenomenal. Really cool atmosphere on a bustling street. Sit outside, order coffee and enjoy,
author: James M.

description: Geez, I've been in an Italian food rut for months until...Bam...Calzone's.  I went after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon, and was so satisfied that I went back again the last night of my San Fran visit. I started with a salad of butter lettuce, perfect avocado and red onion with a light citrus Italian. Every bite was thirst quenching, cold, savory. I sopped the plate with  garlic cheese bread.. Next I split a pepperoni red onion pizza and lasagna. I ate my portion, slipped a bit more and loved every bite.  We sat outside, facing the street, with lovely warm heaters, shared a fine wine and reveled in pleasure. This place is not a 3.5.  It's a 5.  The service was also impeccable.
author: G. S.

description:
Wandered in starving with a group of friends at 12am and what an gem. We were seated right away, the staff was attentive, friendly and the food- just outstanding! We tried the bruschetta, ravioli, lamb, and cheese steak calzone and it was all fresh and packed with flavour! Another plus- sparkling clean bathrooms! I will come by again on my next visit to SF.

I took off 2 stars due to the fact that we left around 1am for dessert at a coffee shop right down the street that turned out to be closed- we doubled back since Calzones was open til 2am but they would not serve us. We were not drinking, loud, and tipped well for the excellent dinner service so I was very confused.
author: Steffi F.

description: Sitting at one of the outside tables on a warm summer summer night is fantastic.  Great thin crust pie and the people watching is fabulous.
author: Dustin G.

description:
Who doesn't enjoy people watching?! How about people watching while sitting outdoors, sipping on a fantastic glass of wine?

I especially enjoy the european style outdoor seating restaurants, well there are plenty on north beach/columbus blvd to be exact. But how do you choose between the 10? Go to Calzone! I have come here plenty of time and I don't think I even know what the indoor looks like! 

Food:
Starters:
Italian Pot stickers - filled with wild mushroom, sausage, ginger and garlic
Crab Crostini - delicious! with smoked salmon
Eggplant Crostini
Seared Scallops - wrapped with pancetta with amazing wasabi aioli 
Entree:
my personal favorite is - Spicy sausage Orzo (but i always ask them to change orzo to their freshly made Fettuccine) The caramelized onions and bell peppers give the dish sweetness to balance out the heat from the sausage. It is very flavorful!
Their gnocchi is exceptional as well!
Petit Filet mignon - so flavorful with the perfect sear and tenderness

Calzone has an exceptional collection of wine, also:
Mauro Molino Barolo 2007 is my absolute favorite - highly recommended if you want to try the filet mignon.

Amazing lunch and dinner spot, and it's always sunny on the side of the city. Enjoy your people watching! 

Buon Appetito!
author: Mindy C.

description:
Veggie pizza was perfect!
Calzone was awesome!
Good service even though it was crowded on a Saturday night.
author: Deepak A.

description:
Calzone's. More like CalSUCKS. 
My friends & I came to eat here & had to wait about 15 mins for them to just bring us water. Our Server Sergio P. was very rude to us, with rude comments & also rolled his eyes at us 
The food was great but the service ruined it for us.
author: Marisabel Q.

description:
Food was cold. We didn't get bread served - we had to ask for it. The pasta was flavorless. Looked like it was tossed in the microwave for 30 seconds. My wify got the ravioli and it was like biting in to rubber. 

They move too much product but dont ensure quality is maintained. Value for money is poor. Will not come here again.
author: Yash R.

description: Worst worst food ever and  it's crab season and the crab wasn't even Fresh the pasta was cut lasagna pieces so disappointed we paid $115 for a bill and didn't even eat the food sadly disappointed
author: Kristene H.

description: I love this restaurant!! I come here quite often and it has always been a great or above experience every time! Fantastic food, great service , vibe and location and of course .....Love love love the entire menu and have been here enough times to have tried 90% of it. If you get a chance to sit on the street tables it's a great people watching and fun experience in one of the best eve places in SF! Bottoms line, it's not the cheapest place but to me the best place  in the North Beach/ Barbary Coast/ little Italy Area of SF!  For a great quality dinner in a fun and north beach SF atmosphere!!  Enjoy a meal and beverage here!!! Amazing calzones, pasta and pizza !! And the wines and cocktails are very tasty !! Try the  Mojito!!..Trust me. :)...
author: Pete S.

description:
Just OK. I was so excited before we got here. The Caesar salad was bland and left me feeling like I'd just ate nothing special. Very disappointing. The Filet Mignon calzone was a complete flop for me. Tasted like a steak casadilla from Baja Fresh. Only not as good.
I won't come back. Feeling meh...
author: William J.

description:
Saturday night of the Mothers Day Weekend. 
We made a reservation and even thought we requested a table outside, first we were offered a table inside.  After insisting on the outside table, we were seated in the next 5 minutes. Impressive! Great customer service! 
And it stops right there.  
Service in general was very mediocre - hence 3 stars. Gentleman cleaning table and bringing drinks looked very occupied and may I say not very customer service oriented. May I remind you: Smile can break any language barrier. 
Food. 4 stars. Quickest order ever. We ordered 
-three cheese pizza with prosciutto and artichoke. Perfection!
-Calzone. Yum!
-Scallops. Five small pieces. It does say small plate on the menu but I did expect to see jumbo scallops. 
**I would have gave them 5 stars for food if they would have served bread warm. Waiter was accommodating though and did heat it up for me after he informed me "we are too busy, we don't do that on the busy nights". It was a little too late, as I got my warm bread right after my entree (although as I said food was rather served unexpectedly fast) 

P.S. Beware: Dogs are allowed. 
Management should realize that tables are just to close to each other and try to think about hygiene rather accommodations for the animals. 
To the patron next to our table with two dogs - please be mindful of your surroundings - I get your love for your dogs. But, not only I'm allergic to dogs, I simply don't want dogs hair in my food as you pick your dogs up and down while sitting and playing at your table long after finishing your dinner.
author: Paul K.

description:
ridiculously priced & small portions!!
staff too desperate to wait on you.
avoid! will not be back again!

$3.95 for a soft drink 
$17.95 for a mini sized pizza
author: Justin P.

description:
We had reservations to eat dinner here and I was really looking forward to the chorizo cheese bread. Come to find out they didn't have it on the menu anymore (Why?!).

Bring back the chorizo cheese bread!!! 

Other than that our calzone and pasta dish was yummy as usual.
author: Marisa B.

description:
Love love love this place.  Make sure you do the outside seating.  Great for people watching.  Heat lamps are fantastic on cold nights and you really can get a better sense of San Francisco here.  The little touches like the tiled sidewalk is just icing on a delicious cake.

The food is pretty good.  It's not French Laundry, but then again you don't have a 6 month wait list.  The staff has always been very attentive to me and the family (doesn't hurt that we've been coming here for years).   

Love the bread and olive oil.   The orzo pastas are great and come and order a bottle of wine or two and you won't regret your decision to dine/drink at Calzone's.

Friday and Sat nights are the best to go.
author: Edward M.

description: Fun place to visit.  Nice relaxing atmosphere with unique decor.  Order the Moscow mule and cucumber cooler.
author: JoAnne P.

description: We stopped in after a long day of Napa and finals. The Artisan Pepperoni pizza was fantastic! The staff was nice and we were never without a drink. The outside heater on the street were a very nice way to enjoy our meal.
author: Aaron G.

description:
we tried the roasted chicken calzone and  it was delicious and big! lol 
so we got one for 2people and it was pretty enough!
author: Dina S.

description:
After waiting for almost an hour for Tony's pizza, my husband and I ended up ditching the place and found ourselves here, simply because they were able to sit our hungry selves immediately.

We weren't sure what to expect but we ended up enthralled with our dishes; I had the artisan flatbread pizza with a wonderful blend of various cheeses (many of which I had never even heard of before) and spinach, and my husband had the garlic brie pasta. I ended up snitching my fair share of his pasta as it was so wonderful; mine was very tasty but the pasta was so creamy, savory, and perfectly seasoned.

Ambiance is excellent in a funky sense; mirrors and decorations everywhere and you are never short of interesting things (or people) to look at. You can sit outside if you'd like; we are sorta wimpy so we choose indoor seating away from the chilliness.

Service was quick and thorough with every aspect of our order - drinks, appetizers, and food, and they found that perfect balance of appearing when we needed them but not excessively floating around our table. 

The price was also reasonable for the area. 

The only con was that our fairly expensive Caesar salad ($11) was just a few sprigs of lettuce and parmesan.
author: Leanna W.

description:
For a restaurant in North Beach, this place has pretty good food for a pretty good price.

the mojitos are strong, and delicious.
the pasta is creamy and definitely should not be part of anyone's diet routine
the pizza (specifically Margherita) is crispy yet light and tasteful
Even the bread that they give before your meal is perfect!

I have yet to try their calzones but they are popular since I see one at every table around me.

Love the fact you can sit outside and people watch! 

One star down: It can get a little loud on some nights, parking is a pain in the ass. But that doesn't stop me!
author: Nika K.

description: The lasagna was delicious! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the area. One star off for the ridiculously priced $5 iced tea.
author: Sarah F.

description: I don't know why this place only has 3.5 stars. Lovely ambiance, great food and service. The chicken calzone is especially good! Thin, homemade dough makes this dish the star! Also had the ragu with homemade fettuccine, also very good!
author: Jackie R.

description:
I came on an early evening on a Saturday with my friend and my puppy. I had asked if it was ok so sit outside with the dog, and they said yes. We sat down and were immediately given menus and a bag of dog treats for the pup! Soon after, we were brought glasses (and a bowl) of water. To sum it up: this place is extremely dog friendly. 

I ordered the crab pasta (amazing) and my friend ordered the prawn pasta, which was equally good. The calamari was pretty good, but the chipotle sauce it was served with it was definitely the highlight of the appetizer. Good bread which I dipped in my pasta sauce, and they certainly kept the water glass full. Very attentive and prompt, friendly wait staff. 
 
By the end of the meal I was too full for dessert, but I couldn't help but to order the tirimisu to go. I ate it later at home... Pretty yummy but I wish it was bigger for the price. My only complaint...

All in all, a pleasant dinner on a gorgeous Saturday in fall. I will be coming back with my fur baby in tow!
author: Dominique V.

description:
I Went there hoping for a good Italian pizza. Big mistake. First the service was way below average, they  didn't take our order correctly waited more than 15 min just to get our non alcoholic drinks. we had to wait for everything even silverware. We had 2 pizzas and a pasta. The pasta was average  the pizza on the other end was tasteless and cold. Also it is expensive 75$ for 2 pizza 1 pasta and 3 Coke. 

I really do not recommend this place.
author: Pierre S.

description: Best first experience ever. Extremely romantic ambiance. The service was excellent and the food is the best Italian food I've had in 28 years. We enjoyed a bottle of the MacMurray Pinot noir along with the Italian dumplings (absolute favorite), fresh calamari, and avocado sausage bruschetta.. everything was amazing and kudos to Alejandro for the 5 star service and overall great attitude
author: Clara P.

description: I ordered the filet mignon and he ordered the lasagna. Both were delicious! The steak was seriously one of the best I have had in as long as I can remember. Cooked perfectly (medium rare). Great setting too with very attentive waiters. We will definitely be stopping here again the next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
cute place, love the inside decor, feels authentic.
 ate the salumi (choice prosc. and salami cuts yum) sandwich with side of heart of palm soup===delish.
Wife ate the seafood pasta, it was out of this world, dipped my bread in it to soak up the tomato broth sauce wow.
Son ate calamari even though appetizzy it was big he got full. Said he liked it.
I didnt like the pizza one friend ordered, but not that it was bad I just dont eat it if no tomato sauce.
A great place to try if in town. Prices reasonable. People have you noticed a big mac combo large is $10 bucks. How can you complain 15 to 25 buck dishes for a place like this?
author: GG M.

description:
My favorite food is Italian. Coming to Calzones you have this really nice feel of being in Italy. The food is really good. I ordered the lasagne style calzone. It had mozzarella, spicy sausage, mushrooms and ricotta. The crust was light and flaky.
And just tasted really fresh.

The service is really good. They always refilled my glass with water, always came back to check if we needed anything and they were very courteous. There's a lot of places to try in north beach. Calzones is a spot to try if you want to feel like your in Italy dining on freshly prepared food.
author: Roger P.

description: Great place for an outdoor glass of wine and pupus. Alicia provided 5 star service!  They are on it!! Great spot in north beach to watch the crowd go by!!
author: Dale A.

description:
I have been here twice and both times I have had a pretty good experience. They get a few stars just for location alone. The outdoor seating is fabulous for people watching and it's nice that they have heaters for the cold SF nights! The first time my boyfriend and I ate there was better than the second time. He raved that the lasagna was great, but the second time it was pretty dry. I got one of the calzones on the first visit and the gnocchi the next and they were both good, but not the best I have ever had. 

There are so many amazing restaurants in this area that it's hard to give out 4 or 5 stars. If I could give 3 1/2, I would. Calzone's is a place you have to try for the ambiance at least once. We will probably go back at some point and give it another shot. Maybe they were just having an off night with the lasagna.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Excellent pasta! Such a cute place with a happy sound track! I really just enjoyed my time here! Yum!
author: Jenny T.

description: Came here on a Saturday night for a last minute dinner around 7 because the wait for Tony's Pizza on the other street was 2 hours.  It looked pretty busy inside and out but our friendly hostess said it would only be a 10 minute wait. Ordered a Moscow mojito at the bar which was really good. Our waiter at the table was on point with service. I ordered the gnochetti with garlic and I loved it. I only finished less than half of it since it's such a heavy dish. Can't wait to go back and try dessert next time!
author: Roxanne B.

description:
This is set up like an actual restaurant in Italy. I loved the al fresco dining, but I opted to sit inside. For the appetizer round, I got the calamari. It was fried perfectly, and the batter was nice and light. For my main course, I got the gnocchietta with five hour pork and beef sugo. The sauce was delicious, but the gnocchi was overcooked. It was too gummy. 

The service was great - the servers were really attentive and on top of things.
author: Rachel H.

description:
My friend and I were seated immediately outside. I definitely recommend sitting outside. You'll be facing the street, so it makes for good people watching. There is also a heater above, so there's no fear of getting cold.

We of course had to get a calzone, given the name of the restaurant. We went with the Diced Filet Mignon calzone. The calzone was long, liked a big pizza twist, rather than a crescent moon shape like I was used to. It was a great balance of all the stuffing. The crust was very light and easy to bite into. Each of us had half of the complementary bread and half the calzone and were pretty full. 

Service was a bit slow, and the waiter gave me a stink eye for asking if he could split the check. Thus, 4 stars instead of 5.
author: Victoria C.

description: Fuxk this my first yelp this my first review this place rocksss. Food is unbelievable, tey the eggplant calzone or the bolognesa pasta.
author: Luis A.

description: Sat outside and had a glass of vino and an appetizer .... awesome !!! We would go back for sure !!!!!
author: Christina Bella P.

description: Pleasant atmosphere, reasonable prices.  Service missing a bit. Would go back   Great food
author: Peter B.

description:
Ordered the combo pizza and it was awesome.  Very thin and crunchy!  My wife ordered the roasted chicken Calzone and she killed it. Good food but a little pricey for what you get.  We sat outside and it was a little crowded but enjoyed it
  Overall good food.  OK service.
author: Nick R.

description: Come for the patio not for the food.. If you live in SF you already know it's a tourist trap and although once in a while I have been known to  bring an out of town guest here It's usually because  they are seduced by the patio :) If you are passionate about cusine there are so many  better options in  North Beach do a little research get on yelp and you won't be dissapointed! People watching 4 stars Food 2 stars. It's basically a Italian style TGI Fridays.
author: Susan S.

description: Excellent food, great service. A little on the pricy side but food quality made it worth the cost. Margherita pizza was crispy & loaded with cheese, Gnocchi with tomato cream sauce was delicious, and meatball hot sandwich was loaded with meatballs and so big it was hard to handle.
author: Jennifer D.

description: This place has very tasty & authentic food! It is a very tiny place though. & the outdoor seating that faces the streets is very cool & staff was pretty friendly.
author: Briana G.

description:
For the last 5 (FIVE) years, whenever we visited San Francisco, we always chose to come to Calzones for dinner.  We enjoyed the fresh pasta and the tiramisu, not to mention the cool decor.  We always brought our family here too and in fact came here for dinner this past Friday (12/26) with my brother.

Now, we always came here despite the grouchy almost bitchy hostess (a smile won't kill you will it?) and despite the sometimes rushed service and lack of attentiveness from the servers; however the complete lack of customer service from both our server AND the manager this past Friday has forever tainted our desire to ever come into this restaurant again.

First, we asked if there were any gluten free pasta options--which they don't have.  Fine..no fault there, but our server did not even attempt to suggest a dish from the menu that would accomodate gluten allergies.  For my brother, who works on the Las Vegas Strip, this lack of customer service was atrocious.

Second, we have always ordered the chicken and asparagus fettucine, and have always asked to substitute the chicken for salmon instead.  No problem ever.  This past Friday we were wanting to have the same dish, but upon making the request, our server flatly denied us the substitution.  He said they no longer substitue menu items.  Okay...since when?  He said 6 (six) months ago.  FINE.  We asked to speak with the manager.  He came to our table, but the guy had absolutely NO intention of helping us enjoy eating in this restaurant.  He told us that they only serve what they know works and that tossing salmon with asparagus and fettucini was not an option,  regardless of the fact that we have eaten this same combo for over 5 (FIVE) years!  Again, horrible service.

We did NOT stay for dinner.

If Calzones is not willing to substitue, then they better make it clear on their menu.  IF it is already there, then my bad.  There is still no excuse for the complete lack of customer service.  Perhaps they don't give a shit as they are always busy and there are plenty of tourists to fill their tables; why bother having courteous staff and managers.

In my opionion, the chicken in the fettucine has always been poorly cooked. The salmon was always good.  I have had better chicken at Pasta Pomodoro!

We were fools to have kept coming back here. Do your research and find a better Italian restaurant with higher quality food,  ambiance and customer service!!
author: Ariel M.

description:
I came here for dinner after a long day playing tour guide for my mom and aunt. I had hoped to find a place that was casual, fun and delicious. Calzones was all of these things. 

We ordered the Italian pot stickers first. These were so good my aunt ordered them for her main course. 

We then got the bruschetta and roasted chicken calzone. Both so wonderful. My mother was particularly fond of the roasted chicken calzone. 

Finally we had the Italian calzone which was my favorite of the night. I was expecting something heavy and hearty, but this was light and savory. So, so good. 

The atmosphere is also adorable. Bring family or bring friends
author: Sarah H.

description: Three of us dinned there, one of us thinking they had before.  The calzone was slightly burnt, the noodles were under cooked.  prices were fair, drinks were stiff not watered down.  a little disappointed too many choices to consider returning.
author: Fred D.

description: Food was mediocre and extremely overpriced - even for the area. Waiter was rude and inattentive. Up charged for every little thing. For a place called calzones, you would think they would have at least mastered the calzone. Wrong. Skip this place.
author: Michael C.

description: I live in the neighborhood and love sitting at their bar every so often to drink a strawberry mojito and enjoy the view of Columbus. I'm not normally a strawberry-mojito-sit-at-a-tourist-bar kind of person, but trust me; it's a great view and a delicious drink.
author: Heather M.

description: It's a lovely place in little Italy, it's nice to sit outside on the street but inside seating is very comfy as well. Napoli Style pizza, very nice crust ~
author: Roy O.

description: Great service, great location. The food was decent. We were seated outside perfectly under the heaters which was comfortable for prime people watching. We started with the calamari appetizer which was huge, delicious and filling as I did not even touch my entree. I had the crab pasta and there was quiet a bit of visible crab meat. I would for sure come back!
author: Karla W.

description: Fantastic pizza... Good service! Would recommend this to anyone. If you are looking for Chicago style pizza, this is not for you but I don't like that style!
author: Jean H.

description:
We had a couple of mock-tails, bruschetta, ratatouille pasta... And tiramisu..
Evrythin was delicious and the service was prompt... The ambience is nice... If you sit outside, you can enjoy a nice candle lit dinner...
author: Darshan S.

description: Terrible waitress with an attitude and the food matched. The most bland Italian food I've ever experienced. Don't let the nice appearance fool you. Go to any other restaurant on this street. We ordered a chicken calzone and it was like watered down chicken with cheese...way over priced too! $18.00 for that plate of tastelessness.
author: Alex C.

description: The food was decent and service was OK. I felt it was expensive for the quantity we got though. I enjoyed the meal but its not someplace I will go to regularly.
author: Rashmi K.

description:
We came on a Friday night with a reservation for 2 people at 8PM. We would have liked to sit outside, but they said there were two parties in front of us for outside so we went inside (it was a little warm inside).

We split an order of the bruschetta and the arugula salad to start. Both were really big and yummy! The bruschetta bread was not to crispy which I like. We then split the Italiano (I think it was called that) Calzone and it was pretty good. We were surprised their calzone selection was not bigger considering the name, and were also surprised the calzone we ordered had no marinara sauce, inside or on the side.

Valet was $20, but hey, we were in North Beach.

Would definitely come back! Want to try the pizza :)
author: Alexandra W.

description: 4+ stars! Got right in with a table on sidewalk. The staff took care of us immediately! Pizza was great!( I'm kinda known by my wife as a pizza snob).  Thin crust, crispy and perfectly cooked! Mojito was great, large glass.
author: Kevin O.

description: I feel bad having to give such a low rating however the owners should know.  I ordered the Cauliflower colore on 12/23. The food tasted fine, and the experience was wonderful, however, an hour after dinner I started to feel sick.  To make a long story short I spent Christmas Eve in the hospital with severe food poisoning.  Unfortunately I will not be coming back to this place.
author: Joel G.

description: This restaurant looked nice from the outside. After checking the ratings on TripAdvisor, we decided to give it a try. The walls off the restaurant are nicely decorated with Italian food like de Cecco pasta, tomato and olive oil cans. It looks like in an Italian vintage grocery store. I wanted to order a pizza. But after checking the menu, I couldn't find a normal pizza. I don't want parmesan, brussels sprouts, or Wasabi on my pizza. So I ordered pasta with slow-roasted pork & beef sugo for $20. The serving size was a bit small. There was way too much sauce for the small amount of pasta. But the taste was good. My friends ordered a pizza Margherita and gnocchi with mushroom sauce. Their serving sizes were also small and we were still a bit hungry. But the desserts at $10 each were too pricey to order.
author: Melissa D.

description: I came here for my birthday and enjoyed their excellent food and service! Although busy, they seated us quite quickly and at a table we requested. All of our appetizers came out extremely fast and our entres didn't take much longer. The calamari was the most delicious one I have tried. No matter what you order here it is bound to be good. The house artichoke ravioli was to die for and so was my sisters crab sandwich. All super fresh and delicious. The interior of the restaurant was exquisite! Red everywhere and shelves upon shelves of Italian cooking ingredients and not to mention a wonderful outside seating area that is heated and the sidewalk changes to a checkered floor! So cute. I loved the feel of this place, super authentic. The employees were also super kind.
author: Lexi T.

description: This past Memorial weekend was my first time visiting "Calzone's" and I have to say that it was exceptionally amazing! Snug among the "Little Italy" surroundings and a great patio set up for "people watching" where all the seating is facing the street. (I can only imagine that that is what it must be like in Europe. :P ) They have a speedy staff and delicious food all for a great fare. Totally a spot that you must check out whether you are a tourist passing through or a local who wants some good Italian food.
author: Jonnathan B.

description: Pretty bland and mediocre food. More for tourists than any kind of authentic or fine dining. Ambiance is fine, but that's where it ends.
author: Eric W.

description: This place looks very nice. Food is awesome too. Their 3 sausages pizza was great. Definitely will go back!
author: Manvel A.

description:
Ambiance is huge.

Being able to sit outside on a classic San Francisco evening and watch North Beach unfold is such a treasured experience. Calzone's Pizza Cucina allows this magic to happen with their convenient heated outdoor sidewalk seating.

It's absolutely charming. The heated lamps works superbly and if you're looking to catch up with someone - it's ideal - since it's not too busy or loud.

I wasn't that hungry so I didn't get a chance to try too much of Calzone's food - but I did sample some of their wondrous calamari and had a small beet salad (sans cheese and onions) with roasted pumpkin seeds. The beet salad was pretty straightforward and simple  - but it was tasty enough.

I wasn't necessarily wowed by Calzone's and my own personal dish  - but I was impressed by the plates of food which passed by me. Their individual style pizzas looked beautiful and my dining companion's tomato spaghetti smelled amazing.

If you want a mellow spot in the area with some classic menu items - Calzone's is the spot. 

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: The pizzas were excellent, especially the Dungeness crab with avocado, the service was great, but the coffee sucks
author: Monique T.

description:
Don't you love just being spontaneous, picking a restaurant and it turns out to be an excellent place? I love Italian and made it over to North Beach last night for dinner and drinks. Now I may have had an idea that this was a great place to go by the fact it's been there for years with crowds of people sitting on tables lining the sidewalk. I just needed to take the plunge and try it. 

We took a seat by the window to watch the people pass by. The walls are lined with Italian products and reminds me of a kitchen pantry. The music was Italian Romantic and fit the restaurant well. 

I had the Crab Alfredo which was pretty much the best Alfredo sauce I've had. That's saying a lot, but if you are wondering why it was so good it was the fresh crab, basil, fresh cream alfredo (not too thick) and homemade pappardelle pasta.  

I also tried the Chicken Pesto Calzone, which was huge. It looked like a giant burrito. It was pretty tasty, but I have to say I was in love with what I had. 

I really loved the food here and will come back anytime I'm in North Beach. Next time I am definitely trying the Crab Pizza, I've never seen that on any menu.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Stopped into this place for diner with an Italian from Long Island... She swears it's some of the best she's had! The roasted eggplant crostini was fabulous, served with fresh grated Parmesan was crunchy and seasoned perfectly. The Italian calzone and veggie calzone were both the size of my forearm and hand combined, stuffed with goodies! We did ask for a bowl of marinara to dip in, but other than  that everything was amazing! Service was incredible, everything was fast and fresh :) we WILL return if we're ever in the area again!
author: Courtney S.

description: The calzones are delicious! They're a little pricey, however, so if you want to save some money just split one calzone with a friend. They are quite big, so even though I only had half a calzone, it was plenty of food. We sat outside the restaurant along the sidewalk. It was great for people-watching, though a little cramped.
author: Trina R.

description:
We went on a Friday night around 6:30 with three of us and we were able to be seated right away. They even moved us to a booth when we requested one. We got the Italian potstickers for an appetizer and they were really fantastic. I got the chicken Alfredo, my husband got lasagna, and my friend got the Italian calzone. All of us were really happy with our meals and each of us was only able to finish half of our portion-- made for some awesome leftovers! The service was good and attentive without being overbearing. The ambiance is great-- very casual for sure, but with a nice feel. The weather was nice when we went and they had the windows open so you can see everything going on outside as well.

My only gripe is that the bread for the table wasn't that good. Just a tiny letdown for a bread-lover at an Italian restaurant.

I would, and will, definitely go back!
author: Jess B.

description: The fresh pasta was ok. I really enjoyed the poschitoo pizza tho!! It's a great spot in the middle of little Italy!!
author: Emily M.

description: The place is super cool, I give it five stars when it comes to eye catching decor, however the food itself isn't that great from my perspective. I ordered the Bologense Fettuccine and I really didn't love it. It wasn't horrible but, it wasn't delicious. It was about $25 for my plate which wasn't worth the money to me just to be mediocre. The service was ok, we had to flag down our waiter to let him know that we were ready to order which in my book isn't the best service off the bat. We had one appetizer which was the Bruschetta, it was pretty tasty. I don't think I will return here.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Mediocre service! The calzone was cold, they took too long to bring the drinks and the bread. The calzone was bland and overpriced. Still not too bad.
author: Alex V.

description: Get ready to feast, and enjoy...
author: Phil H.

description: Got here relatively late at night (11 pm) and as such had low expectations. Surprisingly the service was excellent. We ordered the three cheese pizza, margherita pizza, and vegetable pizza. The three cheese pizza had a subtle and highly welcome sweet taste to it. The margherita had a great cheese to sauce ratio and excellent taste. The crust is on the thinner side, so one pizza might only be enough for one person.
author: Herlo Ariel H.

description:
Very disappointing.  First I ordered Pinot Noir and it was so heavy... I think they may have substituted a Cabernet I don't know but it was not very good ...sent  it back. Then I ordered a chicken and avocado sandwich with no sauce and there was sauce but they did get the no cheese correct.
My boys each ordered a calzone & the amount of meat  (the menu says filet mignon there's no way that was filet mignon) was absolutely minimal and chopped up into tiny tiny pieces. My husband's meatball  sandwich also had very few meatballs was just a lot of bread and sauce.  
 Lastly, service was incredibly slow although the servers were very friendly and warm
This place is expensive for what it is and what it is is not very good - I would never go back.
author: Audrey I.

description: If you're in little Italy in SF stop by and get a pizza. Outside seating plus two levels inside. Food was good and service was quick.
author: Josh L.

description:
This was a perfect meal experience for me.  I was in the mood for something reasonably filling, but not a full meal, so ordered the fried calamari, a bit intrigued about what the accompanying chipotle remoulade would be like.

I was a big fan of fried calamari for many years. I quickly lost my taste for it after a spate of consecutive orders that were, to my taste, grossly oversalted (i.e. the breading).

So, after a hiatus of several years, my bold reintroduction to this selection was a delightfully pleasant surprise (I'd love to hear of any other places that serve said sanely salted and savory squid).

The chipotle remoulade was cool, tasty, and a refreshing alternative to the marinara sauces that traditionally accompany this dish (next time I'll try it with a few drops of potent habanero sauce...).

The service was both gracious and perfect.  I felt welcomed and appreciated.  Special thanks and kudos to José, my gracious mesero!
author: Steve L.

description: My wife and I are in San Francisco for.our 35th anniversary.  Stopped in for the pizza and it was very good. My wife commented on how good the crust was, "better than the bread". We sat outside under the heaters, very comfortable.  The house wine was also very good. We'll definitely be back.
author: Ron S.

description: Being half Italian the food here was pretty good.. Service was pretty decent. I will definitely comeback and if the service was horrible the Italian owner would know how we Italians rant about everything....
author: John J.

description: Very touristic. Bad pizza made in a sloppy way. Low quality of ingredients and lack of basic technique in the pizza making. We had to make signals and move hands like TCPs for the cheque but the staff is nice and pleasant. The place is interesting. If they improve the food, it can become a really nice place in North Beach.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Came here on valentines day (and the day after). My boyfriend gives it 3 stars, I give it 3.5, so ill just round up. 

On valentines day we got the calamari and garlic bread to start. The garlic bread was meh. I've had better, I've had worse. The calamari was the best we both ever had! We even came back the next day just for calamari and drinks. I had a margarita and a French lemonade which were both delicious. And very strong! I was tipsy after one drink.

For entrees I had the petite filet minion, sooo good. I also liked the zucchini mashed potatoes, but did not care for the swiss chard. My boyfriend had the broccolini fettuccine, he was kind of disappointed with it, as in his opinion it was missing a sauce...

The service wasn't bad, the restaurant was pretty busy. Our server was very polite and our waters were always filled. Nice ambiance, we will return.
author: Addy L.

description:
I love coming here. The atmosphere is really nice, sitting outside on a warm night is great and the pizza is bomb!!!! 
Service on the other hand...nahh...we had a reservation, had to wait 45 minutes and they forgot about us 3(!!!) times. 
As soon as you have a table and put in your order however the food comes really fast and is just delicious!
author: Caroline K.

description: This was a good place for walk by in the neighborhood we enjoyed the street seating and the heaters above. The gnocchi was really good. I would give it a try not bad at all
author: Jenny M.

description: Went here a few days ago and loved it! Best fried calamari! The sauce is amazing! Not greasy. The service is fantastic! I got a calzone and while it was good I expected it to be a little thicker and more would be in the calzone. While the calzone was good I wasn't WOW'ed by it. The calamari I was WOW'ed by though. Would def come back.
author: Chanel F.

description:
I love this place. 

Friendly service. 

Great food. Loved the pizza and spinach spaghetti!! mmmmm

It opens until 2 am (I think) which I love.
author: Peach K.

description:
Where do I start?

Well.  Saturday night at 6:30 dinner.  We were seated immediately upstairs.

We ordered calzones because well it is the name of the restaurant... And a safe order? Wrong.

Boyfriend got the steak calzone And I chicken calzone.

Food came in a reasonable time.

I cut into mine and it was sausage not chicken (and raw dough).

Told the server.

Server confirmed my order of chicken with me never apologizing for the mistake.

waited and got chicken.  all while my boyfriend  is about 1/3 done.   And my new correct chicken calzone was RAW!!! Raw dough, cold chicken, cold cheese, Not melted cheese.  I told the other server and he grabbed it and said he'll warm it up.  Now boyfriend is 80% done.  Server came back with the same cut up chicken calzone and it's crispy black on top!!!! BURNT!

I looked at him and said it's burnt.  He chuckled like 'what do you want me to do, a new one?'

I asked for the menu and looked for something else.  But I realized my boyfriend is 95% done and there is a million other restaurants with in walking distance that will get my order right the first time!

So that was that and hence 1 star which really should be negative 5 stars!!!
author: Crystal M.

description: Great restaurant with good quality and well priced Italian good! Scallops fabulous! Salad excellent with great traditional Italian dressing and pizza thin crust and perfect flavour! Wine list good but house wines perf txt for value and quality! Will I go again? For sure!!
author: Dave T.

description: Very very good!  As many of the reviewers stated resembles an Italian pantry.  Started with the bruschetta, very fresh.  I had seafood pasta, less muscles yummy.  The service was a bit slow, but very nice.
author: Nita R.

description:
A pretty nice place to dine at on a nice sunny day :)

Came here after working out with my bf for some italian grub, since we both hadn't had it in a while. The ambiance of the area is nice, very spacious, and has outdoor seating which is pretty neat too. Some of their utensils weren't super clean but i won't judge since i could just clean it myself, but they should really look on that. Just saying.

Anyways, my bf ordered their prosciutto sandwich ($9.95) and i ordered the marinated eggplant calzone ($13.95) My calzone was pretty long, and it smelled quite divine. It had tomatoes, roasted garlic, fresh herb ricotta & mozzarella, which were all played into a delicious nice dough. My bf's sandwich was on the smaller side, but it had san daniele prosciutto, artichoke hearts & jack cheese and it was also a nice combo that's new to me. The bread was a tad bit hard but it wasn't to the point where our teeth would break if we bit into it.

Service isn't really much there, but we rarely called the server so it may be different for other people. They do accept credit card, which is good. Overall, i would definitely like to try other things on their menu, despite the high prices.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
Very good thin crust Pizza. We got the Margarita pizza. Simple and delicious with a nice fresh sauce. The tiramisu was light and some of the best I've had. 
Good service, quick seating. All the food on everyone's plates looked so good. Fresh made pasta. I only wish I had a better appetite to be able to taste more of their dishes.
author: Karen D.

description:
Words cannot describe the amount of enjoyment this establishment has given to me. I wish I could put it plainly, but I can't. In terms of calzones - I had the lasagna calzone - LEGEN....... Wait for it....... DARY.

I went here with my best friend and his wife, along with my girlfriend, on a tip from our driver while we were vacationing in San Fran - absolutely worth it. I encourage all fans of calzones to go here. Just amazing.
author: Drew T.

description: Always great food and service here. Had the pizza margarita and the Italian pot stickers. Both were excellent as always. Peachy loved it. House Chianti very good. Food served fast and always with a smile.
author: Harrison K.

description:
Owner, manager or whomever sent me an email about my review in 2012- you should have posted as a follow up so everyone could see. You stated that my claim is an allegation you take seriously. My declaration was pretty explicit as to what happened. Getting ill after my visit to your establishment was a real event and I have my word and experience as solid evidence. That's a fact ma'am!  
Review your health department records and/or complaints and tell the truth.
author: Frankie C.

description: Nice place. I was sitting outside and combined the Italian Calzone with a sunbath. The Calzone was presented on a nice plate and was plenty for an average eater. The stuffing was tasteful and moist. I would recommend this place.
author: Carsten H.

description: LONG WAIT for food coated in garlic and labeled as Italian. One of the waiters spilled water all over the side of my clothes, no compensation. Got hurried to finish our meal since other customers were waiting to be seated. Yes its crowded on the outside but not because its good, place is just awfully small. Don't come here unless you want to spend $100+ for small bland portions.
author: Kimdracula A.

description:
Came here for some grub after the North Beach Festival. We had been directed here to get our parking validated, and saw all the delicious food and drinks people were consuming that we decided we should have dinner here. 
The boy and I had actually made reservations for dinner around 6pm because we thought it would get crowded after the festival, but we ended up grabbing a small table along the sidewalk around 5pm. 

[If you're into people watching, grab a table along the side walk.] 

We ordered a spring salad and some calamari  - both were delicious and came out super fast. The calamari was not too fried, and not dough-y; it was pretty close to perfection. The spring salad was good - not too bland, and not too dressy. 

The boy and I also exercised our 21-year old privileges. I was debating between a Raspberry Iced Tea (w/vodka), and a mojito. And decided to ask the waiter for his recommendation - the strawberry mojito. Boy, was he right. It was so nom-worthy, and the best part - you couldn't really taste the alcohol. My compliments to the bartender. We had also ordered a Great White beer, which was nice and cold. =)

Overall, it was a great experience, and I would come back to try the calzones and the pizza, and would suggest others to order their mojitos.
author: Stephanie W.

description: The calzones are amazing. I've had the roasted balsamic marinated eggplant. And for the my second time I'm having it again! It has olive oil spinach, mozzarella, humboldt fog goat cheese. It's wrapped completely and once you slice through it, it's like a hidden treasure. I'm ordering a cappuccino and chocolate mousse to end the night.
author: Sabrina S.

description:
Great place to hangout with friends. Food is Ok, waiters are great and the decoration is fun.
The outside seats are just under a heater which is very appreciable. If you want to hangout and get a pizza in Northbeach, that is a togo place ;)
author: Kim C.

description:
My boyfriend and I craved Italian food last night and were very pleased with the service and food. 

We ordered a salad, pizza, and pasta. Highly recommend the fresh arugula pasta, super yum!

They have outside seating which has such an Italian-like setting, makes it feel so authentic. We loved it, they have heaters above you to make sitting outdoors comfortable but at one point it got extremely hot above us it was slightly uncomfortable. 

All in all little Italy in SF is filled with amazing restaurants and we loved Calzone's restaurant! Will be back soon!
author: Alyssa A.

description: This is the quintessential tourist trap.  Watered down drinks and nasty waiters.  sky high prices.  Beware.
author: Cindy M.

description: I loved the ambiance of this place , very romantic at night . Outside seating had a cute little table with a candle and heating to keep you warm if it a little chilly . The Cesar salad was different but very tasty ! The sausage trio pizza , I loved ! Normally I like thick crust but I was able to eat more with thin crust  . There's also great seating inside .
author: Lisa M.

description:
This place looked gorgeous when I passed by the first time. At night, with the candle lights flickering, the red glow of the interior walls and the cute streetside dining tables, it just screamed "Delicious food. Eat here!"

Ok, lesson learned: Stop judging the restaurants by the exteriors, because the food here was MEDIOCRE at best and yes, I definitely fell into a tourist trap. 

Came for a late Sunday night (open till 1am!) dinner and it was still very busy. Scored one of the last streetside dining tables. And actually, those tables are quite cramped! Because the tables are pushed in so close together with your neighbors and pushed back against the wall. I'm by no means a big person, but I had to take off my jacket to sit comfortably. The good thing was that the heaters worked very well. I didn't feel too warm under them. 

Ordered the lasagna calzone and the dungeness crab salad. The calzone was so-so. It was meatballs and mozzarella and ricotta cheese inside. I was expecting layers of pasta and meat but it kind of reminded me of a meatball sub sandwich. The calzone crust was very soft, was hoping there would be a tad more of a crunch to it. Overall I wouldn't come back and order it again. It didn't seem very authentic. The salad was ok. The crab was fresh, which I appreciated and they gave a decent portion. The salad was covered in an Asian dressing, which I found a bit weird, since this was an Italian restaurant. But I liked that it was drenched in the dressing. It had the right amount. 

Service was ok. Found one of the waiters to be a bit snooty. But they were really only there to do the bare minimum. Get your food (which came fast!) and hustle you on it so the table frees up for the next unexpected tourist. =P

So 2 stars on the food and the service, but 4 stars for the ambiance. I loved people watching for my dining chair!
author: Julie L.

description: The food was good, but out waitres was horrible! I order steak with spinach, but aked to change the potatoes for cauliflower. When my order came, there was no spinach, he said the he assumed that I was alergic or something like that to the spinach. So I had to wait for more time, while my friends were already eating. And I order a diet coke three times, and in the fourth one he said that the machine was empty and they were replacing the coke. No tips for him that day. Nut the fodd is good, though.
author: Flávia A.

description: Just wasn't as good as before. Ordered the "lasagna " calzone which was ok and a limp undercooked pepperoni pizza. They don't even post soft drinks or iced tea on the menu if you really don't want alcohol. We use to love this spot .
author: Linda W.

description: Still here after so many years and still soooooo good.  Great service, food was excellent and nice selection of beers.  Outside seating is perfect to relax and watch the locals.  A must visit for anyone who loves Italian food.
author: Derek C.

description: I seriously can't believe this place doesn't have 5-stars across the board. I've only been once, but I can't wait to go back! We had an awesome experience there! Love the ambience; it's charming and romantic. The service was great. But the best part: THE FOOD! The food was AMAZING! We started with bruschetta, which was super yummy, but the best was our entree salads. My companion ordered the arugula salad (and added steak), and I ordered the roasted beet and goat cheese salad (and also added steak). We shared the two salads, and we both agreed they were two of the best salads we have EVER had! I don't know what that steak was marinated in, but it literally melted in our mouths and was divine! I think people probably thought we were a bit odd, as we were actually moaning with each bite, that's how DELICIOUS it was. My mouth is watering (actually salivating!), right now, just thinking about it. I can't wait to go back!
author: DJae A.

description: Cute atmosphere, great housemade (I think) marinara. My salad (rocket arugula) was okay - nothing special. My brother seemed to like his calzone. I feel like we could definitely have had better Italian in North Beach.
author: Courtney R.

description:
I really liked Calzone's! I got the fettuccine with asparagus/chicken/tomato, and it was really yummy. My friend liked her lasagna, as well. I'm not sure why other users are claiming that this place is "overpriced", because it's not. There are many "overpriced" restaurants in this city, but Calzone's is not one of them. Friendly staff.

The reason for the -1 star, is because the outdoor seating is very uncomfortable. You are sitting on a slope, so things can slide off the table, and if you're in the seat closest to the road, you can easily fall backwards. Perhaps if the chairs were made of something more sturdy than plastic, it might make it a lot less wobbly. Also, tables are VERY close to one another, so you will likely be bumping elbows with the guess next to you. It was a little awkward. Regardless, I will be back!
author: Kristy C.

description: Met my expectations. A little pricey for what I ordered, which was the calzone burger.  Fine experience.
author: Mark B.

description: Pleasantly surprised given the Yelp rating. Had lasagna which was very good!  Service was a bit slow even though there weren't many guests.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Don't overcook the pasta.  Al dente should not be a new term. We were early in the Dinner Hour and the pasta tasted like it was in the pot for a while. Add more fresh veggies to the meat sauce.  Mushrooms?  Zucchini?  Who am I to tell you how to cook?

Folks here are saying the cheese sauce was very good, should have done that.  The atmosphere is fantastic & the waiter wonderful.

I will not ever try again.  I will read Yelp every time I try a new restaurant.  Good luck with the next.
author: Super S.

description: We ordered soup and sandwiches.  I got the Italian and The Swede ordered the grilled chicken.  Both sandwiches were tasty and served on hard crusty bread.  The soup today was vegetable beef.  The service was very good and very attentive but the food wasn't necessarily spectacular.  It was simple and good.  Satisfying too.
author: Nancy S.

description: Great Service! Homemade fettucini noodles with prawns! YUM! Fun people watching outside too!
author: Paula B.

description: Unfortunately, this place has to be some of the worst food I've eaten in San Francisco. Probably stays afloat with it's location and decor. The chicken was flavorless and boiled, and between blaring EDM music and someone shouting in spanish over the PA system, this place was a let down for a date spot to say the least. Definitely going to avoid this place going forward, lesson learned!
author: Jon S.

description: I am pretty disappointed at Calzone's. Great service but the food is not what it used to be. I came here on my birthday a year ago and had an awesome pasta with prosciutto (that they don't make anymore), so this last time I went I ordered chicken Alfredo and it was just "alright". So sad :( I expect more from a $20 pasta dish.
author: Mihaela P.

description:
There are not very many restaurants with good bars along this street. Or should I say good restaurants with good bars. It seemed to be a lot of wine bars. 

We were starving, and only had 2 hours on the parking meter. As I was walking by I could see the full bar through the window. I looked at the menu and it had a lot of different options than pizza. 

I just said, "Lets eat here." We sat inside rather than outside because it was kind of chilly out. Even though they had out door seating I just don't want to be cold with strangers walking by looking at my food. 

There was plenty of room inside and we still were next to the window so that we could people watch. 

The menu is quite large. Plenty of appetizers, great pizza's combinations, Calzones and pasta combinations. 

We had an appetizer of Mussels in a garlic, ginger and cilantro broth with Linguisa. The Linguisa was outstanding. It was my favorite part over the Mussels. Dare I say better than the Mussels. The tomato sauce was so rich and had the perfect tartness. 

Their cocktail menu is minuscule. Their thing is Mojito's. I'm not that big of a Mojito fan so I steered away from it. 

My husband stuck with the French Lemonade, vodka, raspberry lemonade and Chambord. I didn't think it was going to be good but I tried it and it was really good. 

I had a Champagne Cocktail to start St. Germain sweet bitters. I love Champagne any time. It was good. 

The second drink I had was the Caipirinha--Leblon Cachaca, fresh squeezed lime juice and liquid sugar. This is one of my favorite drinks and this bartender has the hands of an angel to be able to make one so good. 

This drink was one of the best I have ever had. Except for the last one I had had way to many limes and it gave me heart burn but the drink was still good. 

My husband got a regular Pepperoni Pizza. The pizzas are a really neat shape. I actually make them like this at home when I make homemade pizza. I thought I was just lazy but apparently this is a good idea. He said the pizza was pretty damn good. 

I had the Angel Hair with Clams, Mussels and Prawns in a garlic tomato sauté. I actually took a picture of it. It was a work of art on a plate. Then added the freshly grated Parmesan. It was out of this world delicious. 

This dish alone would make me want to come back. They do have a Crab Melt on their menu that I was considering getting. Oh well, there's always next time. 

We will come back again. Plus its really close to the chocolate store so eat your food then go get a free fudge sample next door. A perfect ending to a wonderful vacation.
author: Ivy R.

description:
Delicious homemade pasta and calzones. I've never liked calzones until I went here. Price is a little high but the food is incredible.
Seats outside are the best.
author: Mrs V.

description:
I have eaten at Calzone's a number of times over the last few months.
I love the Ravioli they have.
They generally have on street seating under the heat lamps to make a wonderful eating experience.
Food is pretty good, Experience is great, Service is great.
author: R R.

description: This was always my favorite restaurant.  Now, I won't ever waste my time. Waiters can't even answer a question about the food because they have no knowledge.  Food had absolutely no flavor.  Double yuck.
author: Christine V.

description: Great seating..even though I am usually hesitant of cheesy/overthemed places. Pasta dishes needed a tad more salt..but we were cold and hungry..so got the job done.
author: Howe L.

description:
I've always been curious about this place, as I've walked by the outdoor tables so many times on my strolls through North Beach.  We stopped in on a Saturday night and I was a little surprised to be able to have been seated right away, as they have an upstairs area that I couldn't see from the street.

We ordered the calamari for our appetizer and the bolognese fettuccine and the crab fettuccine.  The calamari was a pretty big portion and tasty as well.  The pastas were good, but could have been better.  They definitely didn't skimp on either of the meats- there was a generous portion of crab and the bolognese almost had too much pork and beef sugo for my liking.  The flavor of the bolognese was a little bland and we thought the crab fettuccine was too oily for us- it seemed like it was swimming in it!

The restaurant has a lively atmosphere with nice decor and the service was good- pretty quick and attentive.  The portions were good for the price, we felt, but we've definitely had better Italian food.  Maybe we should have ordered a calzone since that's what the place is called...
author: Jeff C.

description: The Italian calzone and bruschetta was very delicious. The staff were very polite and attentive. Plenty of outdoor seating. Probably a high tourist spot.
author: Joshua S.

description: This place had great food and amazing service. Would recommend to anyone who likes calzones/pizza.
author: Grant F.

description: Nice Location and Decor. However, I received a Poor Service. They never ask if everything was fine and just brought the food and forgot completely my table until the check. In addition, the Calzone was not what I expected. I tasted better Calzone in other places with better price and service.
author: Juan C.

description:
It was not our intention to come here, but the place we wanted to go to was closed.  Luckily it was closed, because I love this place!  Happy circumstances!

The decor is so cool, red walls with awesome light bulbs above the tables that allow you to see the filament without burning your retinas.  There are chandeliers and faux-food hanging from the ceiling, along with all kinds of other awesomely distracting things to look at during your meal.  The patio was perfect too, single row of tables next to the windows, not blocking the sidewalk too much.

Our party of three was seated immediately on a Tuesday evening.  The host and server was equally as charming.  I must be pretty Minnesotan, because our served called me on it right away.  "You must be from Minnesota".  I think its my O's (oh-yeah-you-betchya).  They must get a lot of tourists I asked, but he admitted he has family there and could pick us out of a line-up.

Any way, we ordered the garlic fries to start.  They came quickly and were delicious.  For our meals, I ordered the san daniele prosciutto pizza (artichokes, mozzarella, 
rocket arugula, drizzled with red pepper oil) it was very tasty.  The mix of ingredients proved to be pleasing to the pallet.  There was a bit too much arugula for my taste, but it was easily picked off as it was not cooked onto the pizza.  The artichokes were amazing, I wish there were more on there, or I could just get a plate of them.  It would've been easily shared, much larger portion than I expected.

One of my counterparts ordered the lasagna-style calzone (bolognese meat sauce, mushrooms, spicy sausage & mozzarella) and the prawns pasta (swiss chard, red bell peppers, pancetta, garlic & basil) which both looked equally as yummy as my pizza.  They had no complaints and both could not finish their large portions.  The person that invented the to-go box is my hero.

We opted not to have any drinks, but there were many flavored mojitos on the menu that really made me want one!  Next time, definitely getting one (or two).

Big time bonus for this place, they take Discover Card!  One of the few places in SF I encountered that did take the card.  

Thank you Calzone's for a great experience.  Can't wait to see you again.
author: Jasmine B.

description: My friend loves this place and since he was visiting, we had to go there.  We sat outside for lunch and it was pretty.  I like the tables and chairs - cute.  I ordered a regular pepperoni pizza and was a little disappointed.  The pizza was kinda small, but yet they were charging medium size prices.  The pizza also didn't have a lot of flavor, so I left feeling "meh."  If I return, I won't order the pizza.  The customer service was excellent with the waiters being very attentive and asking if we needed anything else.  I'll go back and try it again, but as of right now, it's not a destination point for me.
author: Shaun W.

description:
Yep, I'm a fan.  Certainly exceeded my expectations.  

There was a fantastic festival in the streets of North Beach and we stumbled upon Calzone's Pizza Cucina.  We were debating some festival fare but opted to take advantage of Little Italy while there.

We had to wait about 10 minutes for a table out front which was most definitely worth it.  Excellent environment and of course people watching, especially during the festival.  We ordered the Crab Crustini and a San Daniele Prosciutto Pizza.  Both were excellent.  Couple that with our bottle of wine and we were pleased.

Decent service but the food made up for any lacking there.  Would definitely do that again.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I was visiting a friend on vacation, and we decided to eat here.

We were seated inside, right by the window. It was a perfect spot for people watching.

The waiters we had were very nice, even though the service was a little slow. My friend had pepperoni pizza, while I had the chicken ravioli with mushroom sauce. They were all very good.

For anyone who likes to enjoy good food while people-watching, I can certainly recommend dining here.

Cheers!
author: Alexander H.

description: The food is so good!! I got the fillet mignon sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the lamb. Both were amazing and you could sit outside and enjoy the nice weather. Definitely recommend!
author: Karen L.

description: My grandmother and great aunt were visiting SF and wanted them to check out North Beach. I wanted a restaurant that had outdoor seating where we could people watch, so I made a reservation at Calzone's months before they even arrived in town. On the Open Table comments box, I requested outside seating. When we arrived at Calzone's the hostess was running around the place trying to handle all of the people. I told her I had a reservation and that we wanted to sit outside and she looked at me like I was crazy and said we would be seated inside. Not only was that experience rude, but the service was extremely SLOW. In addition, the food was just your basic run of the mill Italian food. This place is swarming with tourists, has terrible service, and greasy food so I recommend NOT coming here.
author: Ashlyn R.

description: I was wondering around solo today and came upon this place. I sat at the bar, Erin was my server, and I ordered the Salumi sandwich and an iced t. The salumi came on a crusty bread roll and had prociutto, mortadella and salami and came with a side. I chose the cauliflower colore. It was al dente, which I love, but tasteless and bland which I hate. All together, it was clean and I got what I ordered, just nothing spectacular for $26 (including the tip). Erin was very efficient and totally did her job. I kinda wish I would have asked her for something cool to see in the neighborhood because I just saw a lot of the same and ended up leaving the area.
author: Christina M.

description: We stopped here for s quick drink and desert because of the outdoor seating and heaters (a plus).  Ordered wine, cappuccino, and chocolate mousse. A quick bite because we had dim sum in Chinatown a little earlier but wanted to stop someplace after hiking up to the Coit tower. Drinks came out quickly but waited 20 minutes and had to ask again for my desert. So of course they had to charge me twice for it. Had to ask twice for the check also. The mousse was very good and the drinks were fine but the bad service turned me off. I'd try it again and hope that my experience was a fluke.
author: Jim R.

description: This place has been one of my favorites since I was a kid. I would come to this place with my family and we would always order garlic fries. Their garlic fries comes in very big portion and my family has always ordered the garlic fries from here. My family hasn't really come back to this place in quite a while. I came on Tuesday night. It was rainy, but I was still able to enjoy the outdoor seating with a heater on. Very cozy and relaxing. I was able to take my time and their service is always on top and asking if there is anything you need. I was able to get Chicken Alfredo Fettuccine. It's a bit different from what I expected because there was spinach and the noodles were wider, but it still has the creamy but not rich texture sauce that won't fill you up so fast. I was able to enjoy my night, eating at this nostalgic place and remember the good times I had here. My family has always known this place as a good garlic fries takeout place. Do order it! You won't regret it.
author: Amita C.

description: One of the poorest quality food in north beach. If you go out for food, cross this place out. I am a local and have been there at least 5 times to try different items of the menu.
author: Omid A.

description:
I couldn't seem to stop thinking about that pineapple mojito ever since that first sip. It was my very first time feeling so strangely attracted to such a simple drink. Mint, lime juice, sugar and rum were all it was. Why did it taste so addicting? There must be something special about this particular glass of mojito. 

I took another sip trying decipher the secret formula. Was it the fresh crashed mint that was leaving this very tingling sensation in my mouth? Or the tart lime juice that gave me the thirsts? That felt almost like a first kiss. My mind went numb and there were waves of chills down my spine. I stared at the huge tall glass for the longest time but failed to make any sense out of it. I closed my eyes and slowly lost track of the dinner conversation.  Another sip of this venom was all I could think of.

I took yet another sip. The glass was almost empty. How was that even possible? What did I order for dinner? Who are all these people sitting at my table? I didn't want to think about it anymore. I just wanted another sip.
author: Mona W.

description: Margarita Pizza with additional pepperonnia is on point. The best place to sit outside and people watch. I ordered a glass of wine and enjoyed the heater as I watched people walk up and down the strip. The food here is great and the service is wonderful. Price is not bad at all for the area and the ambiance is indescribable.
author: Jess C.

description: My favorite local Italian restaurant. I highly recommend this place, open til 1am on weekends.. My favorite dishes are the seared scallops, arugala salad and italian calzone!
author: Stephen B.

description: It's very touristy but the food was good, staff was professional and it remind me of Italy. the main thing I hate about coming to this area is the horrid parking. The ambience was nice and good wine. Would recommend try it out at least once. I had the mussels and the filet mignon calzone with a glass of Zinfindel wine.
author: Tiff W.

description:
Typical tourist trap establishment.  

Food was passable, but you're really not here for the food.  Service was passable, but you're really not here for the service.

But, if you are visiting San Francisco, especially North Beach, you can beat this place: right in the middle of the area, outdoor seating, lots of sunshine, etc.
author: Richard R.

description: Very nice,  convenient and cool spot to have wine and people watch in any weather. Pleasant, helpful and very efficient while maintaining friendliness and great service. Our waiter Marcella was the best, every time we went which was on several occasions! Don't miss the apps!
author: LIBBY B.

description:
My wife and I love Calzones. We've eaten here several times this past year. We like to sit outside and people watch while we're eating.

We usually bring our own wine and take advantage of the $5 corkage. Also, we love that they are dog friendly and the staff usually brings out a water dish and treat for our canine friend.

The food is good and wait staff is always friendly. This is easily my favorite restaurant in North Beach.
author: Timothy G.

description:
DOES NOT HONOR RESERVATIONS. MANAGER EXTREMELY RUDE.

Andre or Antonio or whatever the general managers name is, was incredibly rude to me. He refused to honor a reservation I placed via Open Table claiming that open table reservations are not accepted or guaranteed by them. IF YOU DO NOT GUARANTEE THE RESERVATION WHY TAKE IT? On top of that, his hostess was speaking over him and challenged me to go tell a table they needed to get up so I could have my table. I wish I had- the hilarity that would have ensued would have been worth it. 

The manager was highly combative as well as the hostess. He blamed everyone else- his owners, open table, me- for not having the reservation I made available. And it isnt like he said, OK no problem, 10 to 20 minutes. It was a shrug of the shoulders and a "we have lots of people here tonight"...
