RIGHT, that is why people make reservations, so that when there are a lot of people they can still get a table. That is the ENTIRE point. 

The GM does not have the service skills to be a bus boy- and his staff follows suit. I wish I could have commented on the food but we ended up at another restaurant and had a lovely meal with excellent service. When I told the manager of that restaurant what had happened, he chuckled and said "yea, happens all the time"

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.
author: Marc H.

description:
Went to this place because it looked like one of the more interesting restaurants on the block and wanted to see how their food was as I'm very picky when it comes to Italian food (being Italian). 

Ordered the pepperoni pizza and the lasagna. The pizza was very good, though it's a little pricey for a personal pizza, still it was tasty and served in a way I've never encountered before. It comes out shaped like a loaf of bread. Kind of cool. 

The lasagna was very so-so. It honestly was similar to a Stouffers frozen lasagna but much more expensive. The service was also so-so. As slow as it was in the restaurant, it seemed to take forever for anyone to return to ask for refills. 

Worth checking out for the pizza but this place isn't one I'll likely return to.
author: Tim M.

description:
I 1st went here as a suggestion of my Hair Stylist Elenie back in August of (2009) with my boy friend. There food is so fantastic I brought my best Friend Rodney A. back on 08/21/11 & ventured here again in January of this year with my boy friend. Let's just say there food will have you coming back for more is an understatement.

This place  place had 1st caught my attention while me & my boy friend were venturing threw North Beach & I saw it and it caught my eye with it's neon red lights by there amazingly , adorable awnings  beautiful outdoor dinning, outdoor heating & waiter service all out doors. My eyes were glued to this place. It looked so formal & fancy. There tables & table cloths were so cure & there waiters appeared to be on top of there guest's  every need. It was Italian oh, my favorite. This place had me written all over it.I just starred in awe of this place & starting planting the seed of how I wanted to come back & try this place out. 

So, finally we returned after talking about with my hair stylist & hearing how delicious there Italian Pot Stickers.I was over whelmed with anticipation & went that same day. I was not disappointing what so ever. My 1st time eating here we ate out doors & heated seating was perfect for me as I am fragile & freeze easily because I come from the warmer climate of the  East bay. I sat comfortably at our little table watching all of the people walk down Columbus in North Beach. 

I have also dinned indoors both 1st level & upstairs. If you sit in doors I won't lie to you the quarters are little tight . When you 1st walk in there is a  mini wooden  full bar. To the left is leather booths & some small tables.They use a lot of mirrors as wall accents & there is a lot of liquor bottles & small accent pieces over head. Upstairs is really a comfortable dinning area, as it's more  quite, intimate setting it's like your loft oasis  away from all of the chatter & noise.

So, let's get down with the get down. There Lasagna Calzone is my favorite. Its soft on the outside & you cut it open it's stuffed to the brim with:  juicy mushrooms,   spicy sausage seasoned to perfection & melted mozzarella cheese all covered with a blanket of bolognese meat sauce. 

Another (1) of there enchanting  signature dishes is There Italian Pot Stickers: stuffed with  mushrooms sprinkled with ginger with garlic accents & a fabulous  mild sausage. They are divine & are so much better then Oriental Pot stickers. I can't even begin to describe how scrumptious these are. My only complaint is I wish more came in a plate. These things can be a little pricey. I could probably eat a few servings of these & be satisfied. They are every betas good as Elenie said they are. Maybe even better.

I also really love there calamari as it is just right. It is not too oily, crispy & the squid is cooked just right never under cooked or over cooked. It's just as calamari should be. My only complaint is the really hard bread they serve you while your waiting for you appetizer or entree. It's too hard get some new bread guys. LOL

I love them here. Make sure to make a point to order there wonderful Italian Pot Stickers. You'll love it here! There food is out of this world! Defiantly (1) of the best of North Beach!

-Elena ;)
author: Elena A.

description: Worse Experience ever!! Several servers walked by our table and not one took the time to greet us very disappointed. We walked across the street to Pinocchio and the customer service there was great and the food was excellent!!
author: Su H.

description:
Great little lunch spot in North Beach. They have outdoor seating ideal for Saturday afternoon people watching and indoor seating decorated like an Italian pantry. Been here a couple times and brought our family and relatives here late Friday afternoon for lunch. I shared the Salami Panini and Mussels in garlic/butter type sauce with Chorizo. AMAZING and perfect meal to split with my sister. Everyone else loved their entrees and the service and friendly and waters were never left empty.
Look forward to returning again soon!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Did the "touristy" thing for New Year's Eve dinner.  Was told the wait would be 20-25 minutes, turned out to
Be an hour and 25 minutes.  The bartender was overwhelmed and there was only one.  The calzone was underwhelming.  The chicken and rosemary ravioli had a good flavored sauce but was too pasty tasting.  The bruchetta was great!  I would not go back.
author: kimberly j.

description: Super long waits and undercooked dough. Bartenders are pretty nice, but for a place that specializes in calzones, their calzones are massive, but bland. Unimpressed. Complimentary bread and bread apps were pretty lacking. Bread was stale and tough. Much better Italian places in this area. And you'll be paying $20+ per person.
author: Danny C.

description:
One of my favorite places to eat. You ca people
Watch and just soak up all the ambiance and sights and sounds. I highly recommend the pizza!
author: Anne N.

description: Probably the worst service I've ever had in my life.   Saw the server for our order after sitting for 12 min without even a  water and then again to get the bill.   Don't waste your time on the chicken anything apparently seasoning isn't used on it.   Wouldn't recommend.  Go across the street to one of the competitors.   Bread and the wine were the best part of my experience.
author: Brandon K.

description:
Attentive waiter. Nice outdoor seating on the sidewalk. Food is decent and overpriced.

The bruschetta was pretty yummy. I appreciated that the chef did not skimp on the toppings. I hate it when there's a big slice of bread with two diced tomato pieces on it. 

Lasagna was very hearty. Nothing special. It definitely hits the spot if you want traditional lasagna.

The eggplant calzone was quite good too. However, I would find it too heavy as an entree. I enjoyed a few bites.
author: Margaret R.

description:
Checked this place out on a Saturday night - chose it because we could make a reservation - there were 9 of us...
We sat in the bar area for about 5 minutes waiting for our table, which was fine since it wasn't real busy yet. They took us upstairs and we had our own little area which was great!

The appetizers were yummy - we had the salami and cheese platter and calamari - both were excellent.
The beet salad was yummy and the spring mix was great for the kids to share :)

The lasagna and gnocchi were really good - fresh and light tasting! 

For dessert we shared the tiramisu and lemon torte - both were really good (my vote was the lemon torte, my hubby the tiramisu...)

Corkage fee was $5 a bottle, so each couple brought a bottle which was really fun and saved us some money!

Service was great, food was good - would go back!!
author: H G.

description:
Very good food and very good service. Came to Little Italy to find a Italian Deli. Molinari's was packed so we decided to come here. 

We ordered a Caesar salad and a prosciutto/arugula pizza to share! VERY GOOD! 

Service was more than excellent and the food was good. I'd eat here again but would add calamari to the mix!
author: Cyndee S.

description:
OMG! I love this place!! Been coming to restaurant at least once or twice a year since 2004!!! I really love it. I normally enjoy seating outside under the headlamp but today I picked otherwise!
I decided to bring mom, aunt and uncle for lunch here today! Got here around 1pm and we were able to sit right away inside as actually the lamp outside were too hot! We got a corner table next to the window (yay) so we could ppl watch. My aunt and uncle were in the city for the first time so today was a touristy day. I had them look around the wall and see all the cool decors.
We were all hungry so we jumped into ordering main dish. We decided on sharing different dishes: calzone, combo pizza, and chicken and mushroom pasta.  We had some warm yummy bread and dip before our meal arrived. Bread was just amazing or maybe we were hungry ;) The food came after 15 min so not bad at all. The pizza was super duper yummy thin enough and not heavy at all. Calzone was just bomb dot come. The ricotta cheese in the middle was oh so good and the pasta had lots of great tasting chicken and mushroom. It was a bit on the greasy but not to the point that I would remove a star. 
overall the service was perfect. I am a water drinker and go through it quick. Not even once my glass was half empty today and anything we asked they delivered. I love this place and it is really hard of me to find something negative. granted when they are busy you have to wait but hey this is the city and this place tends to get busy holidays/weekends!
author: Sahar J.

description: Great waiter. Beautiful sunny table out front. Fantastic beet salad and garlic bread lunch. Perfect!!
author: KJ W.

description:
This wasn't my first time here. I had visited with a large group of coworkers after an event in the city and they took very good care of us and were able to accommodate our group of 12. I had also visited with my wife one afternoon for drinks and appetizers. 
On this visit I came alone while in the city for work. I was seated immediately and I chose to sit outside to enjoy the life of the city. However, after sitting at my table for a couple of minutes, I found the heaters to be a little too warm and asked to be moved inside.
Once seated (in the back corner... which I didn't mind) I was greeted quickly by a waiter, and put in an order. He came right back with bread to munch on while I waited.  This led to my only gripe of the night, which was the bread. Though it tasted fine, it was cold. I would have preferred some warm bread... At least lead me to believe it is fresh baked!
I ordered the Lasagna Calzone, which was large enough to split and cost about the same as a large pizza at a chain pizzeria. I also let it sit for about 5 minutes, as it was a little too hot at first. The Calzone itself was very tasty. It was filled with sausage, ricotta, and bolognese sauce. The dough was also baked fresh and was very good.
author: Brian S.

description: Decided to eat here because prices weren't too bad and the inside decor was cute. Bread was hard and very bland. I got the lasagna, which was OK. I love meat, but there was almost too much for me. It was pretty much all pasta and meat, it looked like there was only cheese on top. The outdoor seating is cute but a little too crowded for me. Service was pretty good, although we got served by 2 different guys and it seemed like there wasn't much communication between them. I won't be back, there are better restaurants in the area.
author: April N.

description: Chicken is far from fresh in the dish I just had took 3 bites and was done. Tasted like diner food. Definitely try elsewhere if your searching for fresh and quality as you won't find it here.
author: John N.

description:
We went to Calzone's for the second time yesterday and had a fabulous meal. The ambiance is stellar; both times we've come we've sat outside at the pretty painted tables and watched people go by. They have toasty heaters for cooler evenings, which makes it extra cozy. I've had sandwiches and calzones here, and both are excellent. The sausage sandwich wasn't super inspiring, but it was ever so slightly spicy. The calzones are really what shine -- the lasagna calzone is basically lasagna with pizza crust (can we say perfect combo?). 

The service is here is quick and professional -- really enjoy this place!
author: Rachael H.

description: we just stopped in to watch the Columbus day parade..  Great place to watch people walk by and have an adult libation.  Did not have a chance to have any of the food, but our wait staff was wonderful while this place was packed.
author: Paul G.

description: Late night dining...not a lot of choices. Table of 4 ordered 3 pizzas. Usually it is assumed that pizzas are round. They are oblong at Calzone's. At $18 bucks a pop, I expected more portion-wise and flavor-wise. Toppings were skimpy. Bottle of wine brought our bill to $100 for basically a snack and a good bottle of wine. What a rip...
author: L v.

description:
I LOVE THE FOOD!
Went to Calzone's to compare their calzone with the many others that I've eaten over the years while living in the Boston area. I've got to say that this was THE BEST calzone I've ever had in my 50 years on this planet. The dough is perfect!  Other guests in my party had the crab fettuccini, which was sampled and was delicious. The service was attentive considering we had 12 people in our party. 
We're going back to Calzone's next time I'm in town!
author: Leonard L.

description: Great place to eat and people watch when visiting San Francisco. Service is solid. Appetizer recommendation Italian potstickers
author: Tim D.

description: Yummy! This place was great! I had the Fetuccini Alfredo and could really taste the freshness of the pasta! They had several vegetarian options and the calzones were served on a long plate! The outdoor seating has you facing the sidewalk, with people walking feet from your table it's ideal for people watching. The atmosphere inside is great and very Italian. I will definitely come back!
author: Julia V.

description: Right on Columbus Ave. in the heart of Little Italy, basically "tourist central."  Not a place that I would expect much from, especially when it comes to service.  We seated ourselves right on the sidewalk mainly because we had a small dog with us.  The heating lamps were perfect to counteract the moody San Francisco spring weather. We were promptly served and they even provided a water bowl for the dog.  The service was excellent and the chicken sandwich was good.
author: Lars S.

description:
Were it not for the allure of the seats-a-deux, behind colorful tables and under heat lamps on a chilly day, I doubt we would have stopped in to the place.  The bonus is that because Columbus is so tight, making tables that seat more than two a pain in the ass, there is prime people-watching to be had.  Another thing is that you can sit next to your companion.  Usually, we are across the table from our dining partners.  It's so nice to share the same side of the table once in a while.

The artichoke was soft (overcooked) and I thought better that they should have served the butter as a dip and not puddled on top of the artichoke halves.  The bread that was served in the little Calzone bag was without flavor.  And hard.  My crab melt was served on the same hard bread, and extremely dry - I had to ask for mayo.  The garlic fries had absolutely no flavor, and very little garlic.  You know, we're all used to the garlic fries from AT&T Park or Shoreline...the ones that leave you breathing fire for an hour.  Or at least until you can brush your teeth, Scope, brush your teeth again, floss, and then rake your tongue with fine sandpaper to get off any residual.

A star to our sweet and attentive waiter.  Another to my very limey Caipirinha.
author: Tamar D.

description:
Cool place to eat and people watch if you can get a table outside. The music is eclectic, everything from frank Sinatra to house music. 

Calamari was great, ground sausage was awesome. All in all, it's a great place to eat. We will go back next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Cody H.

description:
A not to bad of a place!

Came here with a large group of girls, and we were seated immediately without any reservations, so that was great!! The place itself has so much character, it's also hard to miss since the name "Calzone's" is written in big red neon letters. There is outdoor seating, most of them looked like they only seated 2. The inside is filled with so much character! Tons of bottles and little trinkets everywhere (def. instagram worthy). There's two levels, we were seated upstairs at a large table. Aside from seating us quickly, they also got our food to us super fast!!! Thumbs up for that :)

-They serve you bread with oil & vinegar to start. 
-Portions are large
-I ordered the mushroom & chianti gnocchi which was pretty good. I liked the mushrooms more than the gnocchi itself

**Bathroom is downstairs and has only one stall
author: Abby G.

description:
Been avoiding this place since the last century. Never eaten here.

Surprise.

Bam - got a table outside on a Friday night. Professional, courteous service.
We had the caesar, pot stickers and Italian calzone.
All were top notch. In fact we had to order another Italian calzone cause it was so good.

It's kinda like a Delfina pizza folded over - thin, crisp, sumptuous crust.

Best calzone I've ever had in the city.

If you are walking by and see an open table outside - go for it pronto.

Party.
author: Anthony A.

description: Absolutely incredible food and a great experience after having just had an awful experience around the corner. The pizza was amazing, the drinks were amazing and my wife and I left feeing very full and happy from our experience. I loved the ambience of the place, the peacefulness and the authenticity of the men and women working there. Highly recommend this spot to anybody looking for Italian food/ pizza in the area.
author: Mitch B.

description: We're walking down memory lane here tonight.  It's been close to 30 years!  Best memory?  Long Island Iced Teas at lunch.  Stretch limo picked up from the office... They were off that night unfortunately.  Would I be back?  Maybe.
author: Chary P.

description:
This has been one of my favorite places to get calzones since high school!  The food is always amazing, and service is great.  I always like to sit outside.. it faces Columbus Street.. and knowing that area, you know you'll have fun people watching ;)

I will warn you however, it is a bit pricey... and touristy... and parking sucks... (I'm totally not selling this place huh..)  

BUT, just come and check it out!  They seriously have great food, and the ambience is just really fun and energetic.
author: Cecilia S.

description: Excellent restaurant ! the place is well decorated, you fill like in Italia. The food was incredibly good especially the Italian calzone and the tiramisu. The service was quick and friendly.
author: Celine D.

description: I wanted to order the roasted vegetable pizza but I do not like mushrooms, bell peppers, or onions. The waiter looked at me and said they don't like to change the items so he wouldn't make my pizza. We ordered the garlic cheese toast and it came out disheveled, such poor presentation. We're leaving to go elsewhere.
author: Katie A.

description: this restaurant is located in excellent location and how to San Francisco. I've had a lot better Italian food. But it's definitely great to go order food and sit outside people watch while you enjoy your dinner or lunch.
author: Adam W.

description: Great Italian calzone. Not to bready and not to oily. Just right mix of Italian meats, mozzarella, and artichoke hearts and tomatoes. Fried. Calamari was a great appetizer.  Delicious.
author: R T.

description:
This place is so fast. Ridiculously and unreasonably fast. Since we were late to a show, this happened to be awesome.
We ordered two drinks, a pizza and some pasta and were done with everything in half an hour.

Aside from the speed there isn't anything special about this place. The food is very average. There was nothing that was bad or special.
The wait staff was friendly, prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was typical lively North Beach.

I would come back if I needed a quick meal again. :)
author: Amber F.

description: This place was delicious. I had a crab pasta while my friends had the calzone, calamari, bruschetta and pizza. We all shared and all of the food was good. The pasta was missing a little bit of flavor but the crushed red pepper fixed it. The only think I don't recommend was the bruschetta. It was tomato with no flavor. The outdoor area is perfect on a nice day. This is a place worth wild visiting.
author: Judith F.

description:
I like it here, and got here in time to get seated right before the big Columbus Day parade...yee!  Delicious virgin mojitos, yes, virgin...I'm the designated driver.  I drank 3 of these in a row, so delicious, and was totally refreshing while we sat under the hot sun that was beating down on us.  I was officially lobster red by the time the parade was over.

Delish lemon butter artichokes and garlic fries too.  This place is a definite staple right on Columbus.
author: Emy B.

description:
My family and I were passing through little Italy and wanted to try something to add to the list of memories for our visit. 
Forgot why we stopped but I think it was mostly because there was no wait.
The bread that is offered here is blah. Just a little too crispy and no butter is given unless
asked. 
Prices here are super high. It's like $22 for a plate of pasta but at least the taste made up for that a little. Portions aren't big; reminds me of cafe/bistro portions. I ordered
The crab Alfredo, mother got seafood capellini, everyone else got what I did. Like I said, flavors are good so no complaints there. Just portions small, prices high for quality, and service could be a tad better. Other than that, decent San Fran Italian cuisine memory.
author: Sarah C.

description: This place has pretty slow service and id say pricey for what you get. I got an Italian calzone and boy was the huge. They had fresh grated cheese which was amazing. Did not try the pasta but it is handmade and the sauce is really thick and good.  This place is located right off chinatown and the decortions are adorable as its a kitchen themed resturant.
author: Cindy T.

description:
I have to agree that the people watching here is probably good.  We didn't get a spot outside.  In fact, my little family was stuck upstairs-- by ourselves.  It was the equivalent of dining in the employee break room.

We started with fresh bread. It was okay. There was olive oil and balsamic vinegarette at the table, so that was a bonus. I had the house red wine, which was smooth, not over sweet or dry and worth the $7.50.

There was no children's menu.  I hope we weren't stuck in the attic because we had children-- as my children aren't that small and this place isn't that great.  My husband and son got the pepperoni pizza which was thin crust and looked pretty commercial.  I got the lasagna, which was also commercial tasting. I have had similar at Olive Garden.  My daughter got the spinach angel hair with olive oil and tomatoes-- it looked boring and devoid of flavor and sparse of veggies.

If we would have been on the main level, maybe the experience would have made up for what was lacking.  We paid a lot for an unsatisfying, commercial dining experience.

We liked our server, but he was stuck running the steps for us.  Nobody refilled our drinks, which were empty by mid-meal.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Came here with high expectations because I had been craving good pizza the whole time I was in San Fran. 

Walked in and was greeted by someone who asked if we wanted inside or outside. I really wanted outside but was a little chilly and I only saw tables for 2 and we had 3. (I'm sure they would have accommodated if we asked to be 3 outside) but we compromised and sat at a table inside by an open window. 

We probably sat for 10 minutes without a server. Granted, someone came right away and brought us waters. There was probably 5 or 6 employees, including the bartender that were all standing around doing nothing and messing around. At this point I got up to go to the bar to ask for a server. Before I even said a word the bartender pointed me to the bathrooms. I asked for a server to be directed to our table. Sat another 3 minutes when finally someone came to take our order, asked if he was our server and said no but would take our order. You could tell he didn't really know what he was doing. So someone walked behind him and took over. We were ready to order right away so I ordered everything at once. He told me to slow down and it took about 5 minutes to get our order in on their weird little computer device. Idk, I'm from vegas so I expect good service, it doesn't have to be out of this world but at least decent. So past the service onto the food and drinks. 

My bf had the anchor lager. Super good I love lagers, pilsners, and Belgian whites. So, great choice on the beer. I forgot the name of my drink, but it was a specialty cocktail on the rocks, which was super good. For food, we got the heirloom tomato salad. It had heirloom cherry tomatoes, avocado, cristini, and red onions. The cristini was really soggy and the tomato didn't taste of quality. I love every ingredient in the dish, but combined was absolutely disgusting. Now for pizza we got the artisan pepperoni pizza with some added goat cheese. I love pizza so it's hard for me to be displeased. It was very soggy and barely had any goat cheese. They charged us $2 for added goat cheese which is no problem if it had it on more than one piece.  

Overall, very disappointed with service and food. I work In the vegas restaurant industry and would understand if it was crazy busy. It was not. So bummed the food wasn't better considering I was looking for 3 days for a menu that looked amazing with pizza. I was just in awe with how terrible the service was. Someone needs to have their staff do a steps of service training. 

Also forgot to mention the table outside in front of us was complaining about something. They poured their own wine every time I saw, even when the glass was empty. That's a big no no for me.
author: Andrea S.

description: My husband and I often drive from the East Bay to have dinner here. We enjoy sitting outside people watching while we have dinner. The food and service are always prompt and excellent! There is a waiter assigned to your table but there are others that bring drinks and bus dishes in between so it feels like there is always someone taking care of you.  Our favorites are the Italian Potstickers, Garlic Fries & Pork and Beef Sugo. Portions are big enough to get full and have leftovers or to share with someone else. All in all this is a place I would recommend.
author: Patricia L.

description: The Milanese was spectacular.  The chicken was fried perfectly so it was light and crispy.  The capers were fresh and the service was excellent.
author: Justin L.

description: Excellent service from Alisha. Wonderful dinner from wine to Calamari to the smoked chicken ravioli. Everything was perfect. Loved the outdoor dining.
author: Bill M.

description:
The food is damn good (at least most of it).

I would recommend getting a calzone, either the Italian Calzone or the Lasagna Calzone. They were rich in taste and the dough was soft.
The bread they give is not warm and there's no butter automatically given--put some balsamic and vinegar on a plate to enjoy the bland bread that way.
The Bruschetta appetizer was also good.

I would not recommend getting the Garlic Fries (our order was cold and all the garlic was on the bottom of the bowl).

If I were to go back, I would try the Italian Potstickers or the Salami Plate.

I know that this is the spot to sit outside and people watch, but I was in a group of 6 people. We had a roomy table on the mezzanine. I think that if you want to sit outside (an experience that's worthwhile), then you should only come as a party of 2 and you should probably get a reservation if you know you're coming at a busy time.

It's pretty pricey here, but what can you expect at a prime location on Columbus Ave. in San Francisco.
The service was great and afterwards it's a nice area to walk around. I'm happy I finally got to check this spot out.
author: Marlon T.

description: A little pricey but worth it. Delicious, quality food and good portions. I would definitely recommend Calzones!
author: Aysha J.

description: Great spot in North Beach!  I had the filet mignon calzone while hubby had chicken Milanese both meals were fresh and exceeded our expectations. We'll be back!
author: Angie J.

description: Love the late night kitchen till 1am, $5 corkage, apps, pizzas and the ambience especially when is wrm enough to sit outside under the heaters with the Italian deco tables!
author: Vanessa G.

description: Great, great eggplant and goat cheese calzone. Just damn perfect. Good service, too.
author: Joe S.

description: Seriously over priced tourist trap. $19 for a calzone the size of a noodle string? I'm not joking, that thing was thinner than a sushi roll. Wasn't even filling ( literally and metaphorically). Do yourself a favor and avoid this place and get more bang for your buck at any other Chinese restaurant near this area.
author: Dreski S.

description: We walked over the North Beach area and decided to have lunch here. This is a cute little place with fun decor with table on the sidewalk, as well as open window table seating. We were there pretty early so it was just us and another table in the whole restaurant. To start we had some garlic bread, which was yummy and garlicky! For entrees we had the lasagna and another pasta dish. Both were very good! It did take a little longer than usual to get our entrees, which I thought was a bit strange sincere there was only one other table in the whole place. Other than that the service was great!
author: Heather G.

description: Loved the ambiance and outdoor seating!! Food was served quickly and awesome!! The calamari was OH so good!! Gnochetti was superb!!
author: Soojie K.

description: Had dinner with family.  Service was delightful but food was expensive.  Order the mix grill for $26, shrimp alfredo fettuccini, cappellini and house special calzone (husband enjoyed).  The restaurant tables were very, very close together. It was overall good but would search for another restaurant to try next time in little Italy.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Second visit here, and really disappointed.
Brought two friends, and my pasta was brought almost immediately, while they waited forever for their calzones. I was finished with my meal before my friends even got their food. No explanation or apology from the waiter- mostly because he simply never checked on us.
They never brought us bread (I asked someone twice), and we had to flag someone down to get iced tea refills. Never offered grated cheese for my pasta, while they did for tables right next to us.
Waiter took our order and NEVER RETURNED until he dropped the bill at the table. Just awful tonight, and this was a Wed night, not a busy weekend or anything. 
There are plenty of other restaurants in the area, and I don't intend on returning to this one ever again.
author: Jen L.

description:
I picked up carry out here but can imagine the people watching out front is quite fun.  

I had the beet salad which was nicely accompanied by goat cheese and pumpkin seeds (I think they were pumpkin seeds- forgive my culinary inequity)- anyway the beet salad with delicious.
I also had the chicken and asparagus fettuccine.  The homemade fettuccine was divine.  The chicken and asparagus were cooked well, well seasoned, and accompanied by pine nuts.
Service was efficient and friendly, I would definitely recommend a stop here.
author: Amy D.

description:
Hi Andre
It was a few weeks ago on a Saturday afternoon.  We were seated upstairs and fogotten about.  The server brought our food out luke warm, like the order had been left sitting for awhile and was not delivered.  We were pretty much out of sight out of mind.
author: Linda F.

description: Standard pizza, expensive drinks ($8 for a small beer is a bit much!) Probably wouldn't go back, but I think you can do worse. Good atmosphere.
author: Tim W.

description:
The Good: Very friendly and attentive staff. Pretty big restaurant inside. Sitting outside is nice on sunny days. My 2 friends and I started with the Italian Wontons and then ordered Chicken with Asparagus Fettuccine, the Chicken and Pesto Calzone, and the Crab Melt Sandwich. The Italian Wontons are meaty and delicious with a nice soy sauce vinaigrette over it. The Crab Melt was good, cheesy, and creamy with the delicious avocado.

The Bad: We all agreed that my $15 Crab Melt Sandwich was the tastiest main dish we ordered. My friend complained that her pasta was flavorless. She would try putting salt, pepper, olive oil and whatever else in her pasta to make it edible for her. Although the calzone was large in terms of length, my friend said it wasn't as filling as he had hoped. I had some and it wasn't by any means bad, but it didn't do anything to impress me. It was very nice to sit outside, but you gamble who you get seated next to. My friends and I were fine until this large family was seated next to us and the father was rather loud and obnoxious. He never once politely asked me to move, he would just move all over and behind me and expect me to comply. Common courtesy goes both ways. This detail doesn't really knock on the restaurant, but maybe they could space their tables a little more.

The Ugly: The delicious Italian Wontons were $10 for 4 fairly sized pieces. The complimentary bread they give you to eat had a crunchy firm crust, but it was also used as the bread for my $15 sandwich. This place definitely wasn't cheap.

The Verdict: Food tasted around average, but nothing worth writing home about. Not the worst place I've ever eaten at in San Francisco, but definitely not anywhere near the best.
author: Corey P.

description: We stopped here on our vacation to meet up with friends.  It wasn't our planned destination, but it was wonderful!  Each couple shared a pizza and salad, and both were delicious!  Cute location, good drinks, and great food!
author: Courtney L.

description:
Great food, great service! 
Loved the energy. I recommend sitting out side, it's so nice, plus they have heaters so it's "warm".
The calzone was delishhh! 
I recommend it!
author: Gaby M.

description: Went here last night for my birthday.  Our waiter was nonexistent.  Finally ordered drinks and food when he graced us with his grumpy presence.  The food was horrible - my daughter and i spilt the crab alfredo (inedible due to the amount of crab shells) and caesar salad (whole limp leaves of lettuce).  Definitely go somewhere else for your birthday (and every other day!)
author: Margaret S.

description:
It was mediocre in every way but the service. The well-lit place was bustling with people filling water glasses and keeping your table free of extra plates. But the calzone I ordered was cooked, not to a crunchy brown crust with piping hot innards, but simply medium. The innards themselves were somewhat wet -- which I would have expected from ham toppings at a deli, not necessarily inside a baked calzone. 

The bruschetta was fresh! I'd order that again, but overall, not impressed.
author: Trace D.

description: Loves the calzones! Tried the chicken with artichoke, lasagna calzone and Philadelphia calzone. All were delicious! Great, friendly service :)
author: Athena C.

description:
I love Calzone's because they have:

- THE pineapple mojito by which all future mojitos shall be judged
- The creative genius to mix two of my favorite things, thus creating the almighty Lasagna Calzone
- Heat lamps so you can sit outside at night without freezing your ass off
- Outdoor tables perfect for people watching
- Thin crust pizza with amazing sauce and a soft, doughy crust
- A crab sandwich that made me want to do a happy dance

Tip: Try parking on the Chinatown side rather than the North Beach side. I've have good luck there lately.

Arrivederci!
author: Mariela D.

description: Sadly, Andre and his team have never gotten back to me to discuss the details of my visit.  I have asked him repeatedly through Yelp messages and e-mails to please call me.  Andre assured me 3 months ago that his team was working on getting back to me.  Drew Cronis, Dining Room Director, sent an e-mail to me on 12/10/16 asking for my phone number so that he could "speak to me personally" about my visit.  I provided my phone number that day but I never heard back.  I sent a follow up e-mail on 12/20.  Drew responded asking for my phone number.  I responded the same day and he responded via e-mail on 12/21 stating that his laptop was upgraded and he lost all e-mail.  He promised to call me first thing in the morning the following day.  I did not receive a phone call.  I followed up on February 11 and am still waiting for that phone call and/or e-mail response.  All I wanted to do was explain what happened in greater detail so that they could make the appropriate changes to their service. Unfortunately, they were not interested.  It saddens me to this day that I wasted my Thanksgiving Day and over $100 at this restaurant.
author: Brandi I.

description: This is a go-to for SF for me - always good food, good service - good prices.  Cool space - fun location - it has it all!
author: Carrie C.

description: I'm pretty sure they took my order incorrectly. Food was just ok. I had the margarita pizza.
author: Mario J.

description: Good food and ambiance, great Calzone! Sitting outside with view of the street is amazing. Bit on the expensive side thoigh
author: Anoop K.

description: The food was so-so, prices were decent, service was acceptable, seating was terrible, nothing memorable.
author: Spenser T.

description:
Awesome fresh and authentic.  Great location, friendly staff.  GO THERE!
I highly recommend the spinach capalleni dish.  Sauce so fresh and full of flavor.
author: Harry P.

description: No complaints. We were seated quickly, given excellent service, and the food was very delicious!
author: Misty T.

description: We went there on a typical chilli Thursday night .. and we chose to sit out side under the heater , which was the best part of the dinner . Awesome food with excellent service.  We had the crab crostini as a appitizer followed by calzone smoked chicken entree and last but not the least chocolate moose with raspberry sause and mint cream all the three were delicious.  Will definitely go back fir more.
author: Masiha H.

description: Came here 6 years ago on our honeymoon.  Came back yesterday . So happy to see Dino still on the wall. Enjoyed the wonderful service and food. Highly recommend the dungeness crab pizza and the roasted chicken calzone. Tried the cucumber drink and loved it (although I can't remember what they called it.) Keep it up guys and gals. Thank you
author: Lee N.

description:
Brought the gang here yesterday; someone ordered orzo with salmon, a couple people had the signature calzone. I ordered a prosciutto pizza.

Also, I submitted to my inner need and ordered a small glass of their house red: it was deep, fragrant and delicious. A measly $7/glass. A sweetdeal.

After the food was delivered the table was very quiet.. everyone was happily enjoying their food.  

The calzones, basic pasta dishes, pizzas start at $13.95; so it's not cheap, but you can taste some quality here.

Decor: touristy but fun. Most seats have a fine view of Columbus street.

Customer service: first rate.

Parking: none, you gotta find a spot on the street or park at a public garage.
author: Bert K.

description: Slow service. Fair pizza. All show. Not much substance. Would not waste my time when there are so many other good restaurants nearby.
author: J. K.

description: Terrible service! Mistakes happen but it's all in the way you handle them.  The waitress was so beyond rude.  The managers response was "don't tip." Horrible establishment with even worse food and overpriced, watered down wine.
author: lysee k.

description:
There's something to be said about under-promising and over-delivering. It would do Calzone's well to learn this when it comes to wait time. Don't tell me it will be 15 minutes and sit me 40 minutes later. Come on guys!

Although we weren't pleased to wait longer than we were told, all and all Calzone's isn't a bad spot. The place is decorated rather cute, and the upstairs is a really fun place to sit. Especially if you're lucky enough to score the corner table that overlooks downstairs and outside. :)

The price is right and the food is good- but nothing spectacular. I ordered the pasta with chicken, asparagus, tomato, and pine nut. It was good- but REALLY heavy on the oil. I think the pasta was home made- it was light and delicious.

If I'm ever in a pinch for a meal, sans reservations, in North Beach- this could be a go-to spot. Again, nothing spectacular, but certainly not disappointing.
author: Annalise F.

description:
Best Calzones in the city! :)
You cant go wrong with any of the calzones they offer - theyre all delicious and quite LARGE so its worth the cost. For lunch I'll usually split 1 eggplant calzone with my friend! delicious!

oh, and you cant leave without trying their tiramisu. Also a good size piece! not small.
author: Yana B.

description: Pasta was fresh made.  Flavors were homemade.  A very good Italian-American restaurant.  The meat sauce had the perfect amount of "good fat" to coat the noodles like it's supposed to.  The seating upstairs is cramped and a few degrees warmer.  Perfect for working loud conversation and extra drinks.
author: Joseph C.

description: This place is just ok. They were able to accomdate a large party of us on Easter sunday and service was friendly. The calzone was not very good and if your name is Calzone's they better be fantastic. The calamari appetizer was delicious. Stir clear of the Pink Lemonade, it is nasty.
author: Maria H.

description: A wonderful dining experience and excellent food! Calzone's has a fantastic atmosphere, servers that are as amused by you as you are by San Francisco, and strong tasty cocktails. It's easy going and, despite rumblings of tourist trap, has class and style. Enjoy!
author: Em L.

description: Well I had to order the Calzone just to see what everyone was talking about. It was delicious. We sat on  the street under some cozy heat lamps. The food was good and so was the service. My only suggestion is that if you are on a date, don't sit outside on the side walk where there are pedestrians walking by. Some are crazy, some are stinky, and some just have really poor manners. It took away the romantic feel of the night. Otherwise this place is great.
author: Linda F.

description:
I've been avoiding North Beach restaurants for years because I was convinced they were all tourist traps. I had always been absolutely sure this particular one was a trap because of all the sidewalk tables on the cute checkerboard tile, not to mention the garlic garlands inside. But I happened to be in the area and a friend recommended I try their pizza. Boy am I happy that I did! Note that I only tried one menu item but it was outstanding and I'll definitely be back.

I had the combo pizza. It has eggplant with bolognese sauce baked under great mozzarella cheese, topped with sausage. (I asked for no pepperoni or onion.) I only like thin crust pizza and they did a fantastic job on this thin crust- tasty, crunchy, perfect. The waiter recommended that next time I try the Italian Calzone but I'd love to have this particular combo pizza again.
author: Marina N.

description:
Return visit after being a regular years ago..    Still a great place.
Excellent food and spot on service.
author: John W.

description:
If you're on a 1s casual date this place is a must!!!!  All my life I always use this perfect place to unwind all the pressure that you get for the first date even though I got it all..It's  so natural the feeling the this place offers , cozy and all kind of walk of life is walking by.My favorite plate is the organic chicken 
With mashed potato and a side of "broccoli." And their wine selections is very good.The waiters stuff are very sweet people and they take care of you.
My last date came from Australian soil and she turned out to be my sweet heart and soulmate all together..lI brought her there 3 years ago and she knew nothing about it and she loved the place the same way I always do.. "This will be the place where the magic happened "It is worth every bite you pay for!!!
I highly recommend this place..
author: Pedro D.

description: Excellent ambiance with sidewalk seating. Attentive service. The gnocchi was homemade and delicious. Calzones are thin crusted and flavorful. Good spot to sit outside and people watch.
author: Erik L.

description:
This place must be lovers' spot. 

My boyfriend and I first came here when we were looking for a place to eat when I first got here in the bay. The heated outdoor seating and the dim lighting dragged our feet to its doorstep. When we got inside, the decor is amazing. Its like a big italian pantry. They also have a bar area where you could get some drinks while waiting to be seated. 

This place could get really crowded, don't get too easily discouraged and walk away because the answer is right when you hold that menu with very affordable prices and it would just get better once you get your generous portion of food and the taste is surprisingly good.

Now, I must say their tables for two are pretty small and it could get crowded once your food arrives. So if you think you'll have a lot of food on the table, try to request to have yourselves seated in a bigger table. 

We came to this place 3 or 4 times and we always loved it. We sure will come back again.
author: Lora M.

description:
When I finally matched the actual location with the name, I was pretty surprised that a fellow Yelper would direct us here, to this most touristy of eateries in the North Beach area.  But I trusted his judgment and marched forward anyway.  

Although seating was available everywhere, we were taken to the boonies in the second floor in the very back.  They might as well have sat us next to the bathroom or garbage bins.  The service was all downhill from there really.  The cold bread came in a paper sleeve as if I just bought a roll from a grocery store.  Really?  You're not even going to feign authenticity by nuking it in the microwave for a few seconds or putting it on a plate, in a napkin, or in a basket?  There was nowhere for us to pour the vinegar and olive oil either.  I guess that's what the paper sleeve was for, just like the French fry sleeves at fast food restaurants.

Onto the food we actually ordered.  The mussels tasted fresh enough that they didn't have to be swimming in broth.  We didn't have anywhere to put the shells, so we put them on our plates.  When our calzone came, the server seemed surprised we wanted new plates.  The calzone was simple and tasty, but the service just left a bad taste in our mouths.

Apparently the mojitos are really good here, but I'm not exactly eager to go back and find out.
author: Jenn C.

description:
I came back here later with a group of guys for GDC in San Francisco. I was raving about the food and the place and when we got there it was less than spectacular. I feel like I should have taken them somewhere else. It had been a couple years and maybe some of the people have changed, but the food just wasn't as AMAZING as I thought it was before.

I was disappointed. The food was just ok, rather than the terrific I remembered it for. I will stick to some of the other authentic Italian places nearby from now on.
author: Ronjini M.

description: Amazing food. I can say I've had a lot of fettuccine Alfredo's but theirs is the best. Nicely done!
author: Alan O.

description:
Visited here with a friend during a Friday night in November. We found this place after ditching another nearby restaurant's wait and decided we wanted to "people watch" at its outdoor seating. 

+ the ambience of this restaurant
+ the heaters above the outdoor seating tables; I was in a blouse and completely warm!
+ the waiter service; answered all our questions, made sure we knew about their specials for the day, etc.
+ major shout out to the water waiter - he definitely made sure our water cups were not lacking at any time of our dining
+ the calamari appetizer - MUST GET! cooked to perfection (literally).
+ chicken ravioli - the flavors and texture were definitely there!
+ overall location, atmosphere, food, everything!

Would definitely return during my next San Francisco visit and highly recommended!
author: Sherry Z.

description: Super cute place,  but the food was very disappointing!  Zero wild caught fish options,  dry calzones and the "olive" oil for dipping bread in is not good extra virgin olive oil. The service was friendly, but overall the price is not worth the mediocre food.
author: Tricia B.

description: My favorite place in all of San Francisco. When I return home after traveling around the world, this is my first stop from SFO. When my friends from out of town visit, this is the first spot I take them too. The lasagna, to die for. I love the ambiance. I love that I can sit outside anytime of the year and watch the people walk by. It's perfect.
author: Liz D.

description:
I love the location. Right in the middle of North Beach. The restaurant itself is very children friendly, but parents beware, there are a lot of strip clubs not too far down the street. Don't let this deter you from going, just be aware. Plenty of seating, I have never had to wait over ten minutes to get seated, even on a busy day. There is outdoor seating and yes they have heaters to keep you warm out there. 

Do not order the salmon (it was terrible). Stick to the pasta and you'll be fine.
author: Kevin W.

description: Since we live in Big Bear, CA, we won't be back soon, but the Mussels were amazing. Andre...The mussels were plentiful and tender and the spicy sausage, lots of garlic and ginger made for a yummy broth. Really fresh tasting, the ginger really made the broth pop. If I lived closer, I would want to eat it once a week! The outdoor seating was wonderful. Great service, great hostess. We had a wonderful Easter lunch.
author: Karin H.

description:
Came here Saturday night after watching Madama Butterfly at the SF opera House. I don't know if it was the hunger or  boredom while sitting through the opera, but this place was fantastic in contrast.
1) It's open super late. I think we sat at 11 and  there was no signs of closing even when we left.
2) Outdoor seating, the place has a nice view and interesting people walk by. get some wine and feel like you are in Europe.
3) Food -.I recommend the lasagna, they use super thin sheets and the cheese is nice and crisp along the edges. Also- they don't go overboard with the Ricotta!
author: Lee X.

description: Good Italian food, great people watching, fast service. We have been several times and I was particularly impressed this last time. I ordered gnocchi with Chianti cremini mushroom sauce. It's safe to say I won't forget how delicious it was for a while. My husband ordered capellini with a kale sauce- just ok.
author: Melissa C.

description: Had a delicious calzone, the atmosphere made for a fantastic lunch. Service was on point and the sidewalk seating allows you to enjoy the ambiance of North Beach.
author: Josh S.

description: I give it 4 stars for the outside seating, but 3 stars for the food. We had the pasta with pork and beef bolognese sauce, and a chicken ceaser salad. The pasta was good, although it came overflowing with sauce. Luckily the sauce is quite tasty, so we didn't mind. The chicken teaser salad had mixed reviews. The salad itself was not well tossed, resulting in some portions with dressing and some without the dressing.
author: Yoshi T.

description: This is your typical tourist trap Italian place. Overpriced, crowded and only average food. The chicken in the chicken calzone was a bit dry, flavour was surprisingly good. The food might actually be better if they would serve it hot instead of almost cold.
author: Peter W.

description:
The place seating outside is amazing
Great atmosphere and the food is just fine. Nothing so special about it. But I might go back there again for the sake of the atmosphere only.
author: Omar M.

description: An eclectic well priced menu keeps local's and tourists coming back here for the ambiance and friendly fun. Great North Beach favorite.
author: Deepak S.

description: We were driving around late at night trying to find somewhere to eat dinner in San Francisco. Everywhere else was closed or looked gross. This restaurant looked very nice from the outside. There's lots of lights and there was nice outdoor dining. We parked a few blocks away. We didn't need a reservation to get taken care of. The staff was friendly. The food was prepared very fast since it wasn't very busy. I don't believe they have a kids menu. I wouldn't recommend this to families with very little kids. Keep in mind that their pizzas are kind of small so one pizza would only feed one person. There was indoor and outdoor seating. The inside was decorated very nicely and tastefully. On the outside there's a ton of lights and there's tables for two. It would be a cute spot for a date. There are outdoor heaters above the tables so you can still dine outside comfortably even when the temperatures dip down in the evening. Overall, I enjoyed my dinner here!
author: Julie K.

description:
If it's sunny and you're with one other person, Calzone's outdoor seating is just perfect for that.  You sit by side at a small, tiled table looking out onto Columbus, primarily staring at how few people are eating at Cafe Greco.  Even on hot days, they turn on the heat lamps here but you can definitely ask them to turn yours off.

Being that the place is called Calzone's, I ordered a calzone... the Smoked Chicken one to be exact.  Inside is pomodoro sauce, ricotta, artichoke hearts, and mozzarella.  Sauce was on the light side and ricotta is on the heavy side.  Beware if you are lactose intolerant and think you can handle this!  For some reason I was expecting a large, triangular puff of an entree but this is longer like a stromboli with dough that doesn't overwhelm you.

Chicken was tender but overall I found myself continuously sprinkling chili flakes on this because I wish there was more flavor or at least sauce.  This really is big enough to share so I recommend getting this and a salad.  Ultimately, I would come here more for the view and North Beach experience than anything else.
author: Shannon L.

description: Food and service was extremely average.  My husband ordered lasagna, it was cold and not appetizing at all. I got eggplant rollatini, which was very oily and not what you would expect. Would not recommend.
author: Emily S.

description: This place is full of lies and crap. Don't believe their wait time. When I first put my name on the list, the waiter said 10-15 mins. Twenty-five minutes later, I checked in and she assures me it's another 5-7 minutes. Ten minutes later, I check in with her again and she tells me that it's going to be another 20 minutes. WTF? There's nothing I hate more than a hostess that lies about an estimate wait time to get my business. SHADY.
author: Tanny Y.

description: WTF is with the no phone orders and you don't have an online ordering option? That is total BS. I called just now after over a year of ordering take out and they said I have to come in person and order. Totally defeats the purpose of take out, I might as well eat at the restaurant if I am going to have to wait. Step your game up Calzone's. I know you cheap asses make a ton of money off that location! You're letting your neighbors down.
author: Jason P.

description:
Calzone's is an eye-catching restaurant located in SF's North Beach district. With its big restaurant sign, tables lined against the front of the restaurant's big glass windows, and the checkered sidewalk that runs along the front of the restaurant, Calzone's is as interesting looking inside as it is outside.  The decor inside the restaurant includes pasta boxes, dangling sausage and garlic bulbs (plastic i assume), sauce jars and cans, etc. that sit in the nooks of the restaurant walls. I came here during a work outing so the restaurant does a great job of accommodating large parties.  

I tried their garlic bread and mussel appetizers, which were nothing special.  For my entree, I ordered the shell fish angel hair pasta which I was hoping to taste like a good frutti di mare dish.  Unfortunately, some of my muscles were still closed and the pasta/sauce of the dish was not flavorful at all.  Each person in my party was given a mini bag of bread and I was hoping to dip pieces into my sauce but given that my dish lacked overall flavor and that I didn't have any sauce to sop up with my bread, I was pretty disappointed with my dish.     

On a positive note, their tiramisu is worth trying, service here is good and their bathrooms smell like fruity pebbles.  All in all, Calzone's catchy decor does not live up to the quality of their food.
author: Maya S.

description: Amazing!!! Bring the kids, have some wine, order it all and enjoy!!!! Ask for Rico...
author: Joy P.

description: Every time I go here I'm in amazement at how every dish here is flavorful, and finger licking good. I have tried the majority of the menu, and still return to try it all again. I would recommend the pesto chicken Calzones, all the appetizers, and whatever else tickles your fancy. Bon Appetite!
author: Michelle F.

description:
only 3 stars for me because it's really pricy and it took long to get served.
I paid $20 for just one calzone with no drink or dessert, the calzone was ok but not amazing, so it's way too much money.
author: Andrea C.

description: I love calzones! I go there (AT LEAST) once a week! Josh and Carlos are the best! Food is quick and amazing!
author: Monica H.

description:
A friend from Hong Kong came and we had her choose which Italian restaurant she wanted to go to at Little Italy. She chose Calzones because of the pretty lights and it just seemed higher ranked. Eh.
When we got in there, I noticed the "red" environment and the alcohol bottles all over the walls with fake chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. There were 5 of us and we wanted to do family style but the portions came out to be smaller than we thought. I ordered the crab salad and it was pretty much salad with a strong dressing and shreds of crab. my friends ordered the lasagna, ravioli, crab pasta, and we had the calzo, which was pretty good!
I think what just made the place really cool is the outdoor heater and the decorations inside. We all ended up paying $25 each. Pretty pricey for a plate of salad!
author: Linda K.

description: Looked this place up on yelp and it was amazing!! It was full in the restaurant, service was great. Food came out super quick, so at first i was a bit worries but i shouldn't have because it was brilliant! I recommend prawn pasta, the slow roasted pork and beef ragu and  the olive and cheese pizza! Was amazing, everything was so fresh and clearly home made, truly italian! Would go back
author: Stef M.

description: Loved everything about this place- the food, the ambiance, the service. The lasagna calzone was delicious and I would also recommend the ravioli in mushroom sauce. Love love loved the food. They have outdoor heaters, making sitting outside at night just perfect. This place will not disappoint, we were drawn in by the heated outdoor seating  and dimmed lights. Favorite place I tried in San Francisco, and I would love to return in the future for another calzone!
author: Whitney W.

description:
I don't believe in using this app for only bad reviews, so I'll be fair...

The food here was fantastic. We got a pizza with crab, avocado and onion with fontina cheese. It was delicious. We also ordered a crab fettuccini that was just as amazing. The appetizer of calamari was pretty good too. It was plenty for two people. 

The service on the other hand was beyond sub par. The wait staff had the personality of a rock. It's like they don't know how to be friendly or smile. I hate when I'm at a restaurant and the staff makes me feel like I'm inconveniencing them by being there. Sorry that you have to do your job like everyone else! Then when I got home, I realized that they double charged me. The price charged was also wrong on both. I called and the manager said it would be fixed automatically and that's just how it shows up. Well the next day the price was changed to the amount I paid with still another charge of about 65 dollars. I called back and was told that there is no managers at the restaurant until after 5pm (a total lie). So I called back and explained my problem again to the person that answered the phone and was then promptly hung up on...3 times. At that point I was pissed and let them know it since before that I was extremely polite and kinda laughing about the situation. All I expected was for them to fix the mistake that they had made. But instead I ended up giving them an ear full and had my banks fix the problem. They are incompetent and rude. I wouldn't bother going back there ever again. Not worth the trouble and too many other restaurants that look delicious in the area!
author: Jeff F.

description: Terrible food. Looks good. But taste not there. Service was lousy. Charge to the game
author: Jason W.

description: This is my #1 favorite place to eat in the city. We have a blast sitting outside to eat while enjoying the nightlife of SF... pure entertainment! The food is amazing and the service is always great.
author: Nicole B.

description: The food was delicious and the service was excellent. My boyfriend had the breaded chicken milanese and it was juicy and tender. I had the steak with gorgonzola, fluffy mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. The cocktails were refreshing, the mojito came with a piece of sugar cane.
author: Ada R.

description:
Had an absolutely perfect experience here. It was just starting to get dark and a little colder, and sitting underneath the heat lamps, being able to sit outside with my jacket off while eating was awesome. 
We had some drinks off their special menu, their form of Mai Thai is really good. We also had some starters; a Caesar Salad and Calamari, both were delicious. I love the look of the inside as well. I went inside to use the restroom and saw they have a HUGE collection of little liquor bottles. I have this collection at home, mine is much smaller, but still, it's nice to know someone else thinks they're cool. Definitely be going back to try more.
author: Roxanne R.

description:
If you are looking for "spaghetti" stop!   You can try the angel hair but the best thing on the menu is their Bolognese.  It is a wide fettucini noodle that melts like butter in your mouth and is complimented by a perfect sauce.  And hot (temperature) it stayed to the very last bite.  Their Fuji apple salad was also a perfect lead in, with candied walnut/pecan (I couldn't tell / didn't care), cranberries and ... wait ... Fuji apple slices.

Ate here three nights on a five night stay.  Lasagne was great but a little bulky - Pizza a unique experience - you can taste the wood fired oven in the crust and you KNOW this is authentic.

We did not try the desserts because we are spoiled by their next door neighbor...
author: Keith S.

description: Another 5 stars for a recent revisit.  This place is a family favorite.   Great food. Great service and a wonderful sidewalk atmosphere!
author: Paul J.

description:
Great food and ambiance.

4 cheese pizza and tiramisu are amazing.

Totally recommended
author: Ivan B.

description:
Calzone's is great place to eat, drink and people watch if you're able to snag a table outside.

A couple friends  and I recently dined here and the experience was ooookay.  My BFF and I chose a table outside and felt weird sitting side by side at the table. I guess outside is made for couples.  But, we enjoyed our time people watching.

We visited on a Monday night and it wasn't that busy in the early evening. We decided to order a few appetizers so we went with the Italian Pot Stickers (not yummy) and the cheesy garlic bread.  The pot stickers were made with sausage and mushrooms and just tasted off. It would taste better with sausage only.   Not a huge highlight.  We, of course, ordered a few mojitos ($9 a piece) and they were quite tasty.

For the main course, I tried a calzone and my friend tried some type of past dish.  I have to knock off a star for the actual service portion. The restaurant did seem to get busier, but there were times our waiter and drink orders were non-existent.  Another low point was my calzone. It literally came out about 10 minutes after I ordered it.. and it was cold. 

I see their technique for the calzone. Basically their flat pizza dough rolled over and baked. I ordered the chicken pesto calzone. The chicken and ricotta cheese were cold.  I tried to get the waiter's attention a few times with no luck. I finally flagged someone else and asked them to fire it again.  When my waiter finally came by and I explained my food annoyance, he didn't really apologize or care.  Sorry Calzone's. I would have given you the extra two stars if not for the cold food and lack of attention from a server.  The place did start to get busy after awhile, but  completely ignoring your guests and serving cold food doesn't intice me to return.
author: Theresa N.

description: The atmosphere drew us in!  However food and service were mediocre at best!  Disappointed in soup temperature and inattentive waitstaff.
author: Kathy V.

description:
I've been here twice. Once on a first date and once with my aunt and uncle visiting in town. 

I really enjoyed the food and the ambiance outside was better for a date, inside better for the family-dinner style. 

Good food, quick service, decent prices (especially compared to its neighbors)
author: Maggie F.

description: I can safely say that this is one of the best restaurants I have been to. Me and my family were roaming the streets of San Francisco in little Italy, and it definitely fits the Italy theme. It's extremely cute with little tables in front of the road, where you can observe people come and go by. If it's cold out, there are heaters overhead. The service is very attentive, and just don't quit smiling (: To top it off, the food was delicious. The pasta was well made and fresh. They make the pasta Homemade and you can sure taste it. My whole family loved all their meals (which is rare). From the soup, to the Fretucinni Alfredo, it was all very delectable. We will DEFINITELY be coming back here as soon as possible!
author: Yarden A.

description:
Delightful! 

My boyfriend visited Calzone's at least ten years ago and still raves about their garlic fries.  We went for his birthday last weekend and really enjoyed ourselves! First, we loved the outside patio.  People watching on Columbus Ave is always fun.  Next, the food was great.  We ordered the garlic fries, of course, a pepperoni pizza and eggplant bruchetta.  All of the food was fresh and very reasonably priced.  I can't wait to go back!  One side note, during the late lunch hour the place is packed!  Make sure you get there early, or call for a reservation, to ensure prime people watching seating.
author: Taylor W.

description:
I came to Calzone's on a friend's recommendation due to the amazing strawberry mojitos. The service was great, pretty quick as well, and the drinks were definitely as delicious as promised.

My only complaint would be that my pasta was extremely greasy. I had the parpadelle pasta, which is one of my favorite things, but the bottom of the bowl was full of runny, buttery, greasy mess... Pretty off putting.

Overall I would recommend it but would probably say to steer clear of the pasta dishes. My friend got the pizza and it was quite good though.
author: Peyton S.

description: It is a little bit strange for me with the bread they serve you as an appetizer here. If you don't order anything you wouldn't be served with that bread. Seems to be a little bit mean in my point of view.
author: Sweetie Joanna A.

description:
This wasn't the original plan for dinner when we met a friend last night but the other place seemed to be closed so we just walked up the street and ended up here. Ugh, crappy location if you have a car and need to find parking - good luck with that. So like Julie I was also excited when I saw the decor and seemingly tons of good food. Service was pretty slow.
The calzones looked pretty good, the boys seemed to enjoy theirs but I didn't hear any rave reviews, just 'yeah, it's okay, or it's good." K then. 
I ordered the Broccolini Fettuccine which was much better with the tons of parm cheese they dropped on it, but as soon as that was gone so was the flavor. I think I added a little bit of everything I could get my hands on to add flavor to no avail. It was just oil and well, flavorless. There was certainly more broccolini than noodles, which were an interesting take on fettuccine. 

Disappointing as I was looking forward to a good Italian meal.
author: Erin H.

description: The outside tables make this a cute little restaurant in North Beach, we ordered the calzone based on the reviews and the name of the establishment...we were disappointed, the crust was flat, not too crispy.   The filling was mostly ricotta, not much meat nor any other ingredients....   As a epicurian snob, I would say...Try another restaurant if you are looking for great calzones...
author: Robert S.

description:
I've been coming to this place for 20+ years when traveling, and have never had a meal that was not terrific. The waiters use handhelds to take your order, and the food comes out super fast. The plates are large, very fresh, and always very tasty. The salads are outstanding. They used to have a pappardella dish years ago that was possibly the best pasta I ever had. Sadly this came off the menu, but their offerings today are nearly as good. Even the bread is great.

Apologies to those who think this place is mediocre, but I think it's top notch.
author: Howard B.

description: I can't say enough good things. I just love the food here. I got the crab Alfredo and I ate every last bite and enjoyed it so much. Asked the waiter to take our picture and he made sure to get the background, and made the extra effort to make sure we liked it. The prices aren't cheap but the food is worth it. The only thing that really bummed me out was that last time I was here I had some kind of Alfredo with pine nuts and I couldn't find it on the menu this time. But I ordered the crab Alfredo instead and it was just as good. My favorite italian restaurant!!! Yum!!!
author: Reba B.

description:
I have been to Calzone's many times and have always had a great dining experience. The staff are friendly and helpful and I have never had to wait a long time to be sat or wait for our food.

I have had a few things off the menu , which is not traditional but also not completely out there, but these two stand out for me- 

Italian potstickers - its technically an appetizer but its also great as a main course. Theres just enough for dinnertime but its also a great option if you want to share. 

Prosciutto sandwich & garlic fries - great for lunch and is a pretty big portion. The sandwich comes with jack cheese and artichoke hearts, which I love. Garlic fries are crispy and have just the right amount of garlic.

Overall, a great place for lunch and dinner. Also its right next door to Stella, so stop in there for some dessert ;)
author: Stephanie C.

description: Carlos rivas is a great sever! I've only had the best service from him. I came a couple months ago to have dinner. I sat in the outdoor seating ( outdoor seating has heaters). They bring you a plate of sliced bread as well as oil and vinegar. For dinner I had heirloom tomato salad. Its tossed with a balsamic dressing with croutons. Yumm! Second course I hate the ratatouille. Ugh so good! Food was hot and delicious. Warm soft vegetables with tomato sauce ugh so good. I wasn't able to decide for dessert. Thankfully Carlos helped me out. I had the rum cake. For lack of better words, it was the icing on the cake. Service is a bit slow because it is in north beach and is a high demand restaurant but it is so worth the wait. If you do eat here make sure you sit in Carlos section. He's fantastic.!!
author: Susana R.

description: I love the mussels with chorizo and cilantro!  The broth is AMAZING! The pizzas and calzones are great. The cheesecake was probably the best I've EVER had! The house Pinot Noir was excellent.  Well done Calzone's!
author: Candace B.

description: My boyfriend and I stop by every time we're in the city. Consistently good service and great food. Try any of the seafood pastas or pizzas. Try to walk if you can,  there may or may not be parking.
author: Alana B.

description: All in all the food was pretty good. Beware the pastas don't come with sauce, but if you ask they'll add it. The pizzas are cooked in the oven and are crispy and delicious!
author: Colleen G.

description: Good location on Columbus. OK wine and food. Good selection of cheeses on their salami and cheese plate. This is more of a place to grab a quick glass of wine and people watch.
author: Anthony V.

description:
Awhile back a friend posed the question "Name one food you could eat everyday for the rest of your life?". I immediately knew the answer was pasta, but took the query further by racking my brain for the pasta I'd most enjoy eating. It didn't take long until I was smacked, like a wet piece of angelhair to a stone wall, with the realization that my meal at Calzone's was literally the best pasta I'd ever had in my life. Period.

The bruschetta variant appetizer my group ordered was superb, with fresh tomatoes and eggplant over thick crostinis, but the best was yet to come. For the main course, I asked the waiter what he'd recommend, and he quickly offered up several dishes with homemade pastas, bragging theirs was the best in the city. He was absolutely right. The combination of broccolini, red pepper, olive oil and thick slices of garlic over a bed of fresh, homemade fettucine was simply divine. 

Call me a pastitute, but when I die, I hope heaven is Calzone's.
author: Danielle G.

description:
So we ended up here after seeing the line wrapped around the block for Tony's pizza. I could not be happier that we did not want to wait. This place was INSANE. I had the crab over housemade pasta with the garlic scallop sauce- it really new my mind.  Everything was so fresh, and the flavors married perfectly.  
My husband had the four cheese pizza and was equally impressed. Perhaps it was the use of bleu, but something definitely set this flatbread apart from standard cheese offerings. 

Great food,  excellent ambiance, lovely service.
author: CC W.

description: Walking through Little Italy, we came across an adorable place with a checkered tile sidewalk.  There were beautiful, candlelit bistro tables along the sidewalk, so we stopped.  We were seated immediately and ordered drinks and a cheese board (we had already had dinner).  The service was very friendly.  The people watching was pretty great too.  The cheese was excellent and we also ordered some scallops, which were cooked perfectly.  My wife didn't like the wasabi aioli, but I did...just a matter of taste.  I'd definitely return.
author: J R.

description: Nice Atmosphere, the pasta was a great,  eggplant with cheese is phenomenal, good  servers. they closing late at night.. highly recommended
author: Maya F.

description:
Hollered at my man and them up here the other night. Sat outside, got serenaded by the homeless... What a fantastic spot! The outdoor seating is a plussss. It just sets up everything perfectly for you. You can chill converse and be amongst the people. Don't have to worry about the lady being cold because the heat shields are on and above you... It's comfy cozy. I like the level of lighting here also...Set up Italian themed throughout. Anyways, got some nice Chianti, a shot of Henny and some Alfredo w/ Asparagus, Broccoli. Everything was well presented and in fine condition and temperature. Only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the Alfredo sauce is canned I think. It was lumpy. But, the service is fast, they're open late too, or past 11pm.

Ding-ding! NEW SPOT!
author: Erik R.

description: Had the Ghochetti and the Pesto Chicken Calzone. Both AMAZING! The service was less than stellar; the waiter felt rushed and wasn't personal at all - the food more than made up for the downfall in service. We will be back again! :)
author: Katie K.

description: Go here everytime I'm in San Fran. So great to have a capicino and sit on the sidewalk and watch the world walk by. My favorite place in North Beach. The gnoci is the best I've ever had.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Today was my dads birthday, we were walking down Columbus ave. when we passed Calzone's and I gave it some thought told him it was a good place, that I have herd good things and so we find ourselves sitting at a table inside soon enough, since it was cold. Everything was going fine until, right when the waiter was taking our drink orders and my dad could not decide which wine to go with, the waiter just walked away. When he came back he had my drink and a glass with a splash of wine for my dad, he told me he liked it. Since my dad cant speak good English, I tried to catch the waiter to tell him to pour my dad a full glass of their house wine. 

Once we ordered the drinks, we went down the menu picked out an entree and ordered, I asked the waiter what are some of their popular vegetarian options, he really pushed towards the broccolini fettuccine, it seemed to sound good so I ordered it. Once we received our meal, it was squished in a very deep small bowl, which is fine, but I suggest something more shallow and wide, especially for any time of noodles or spaghetti and pasta. Anyway while we were eating the meal I noticed the waiter kept wanting to come up to our table, but every time I turned my head he turned away and went the opposite direction. I don't know if I came off as intimidating or what...but the waiter did not look like he knew what he was doing. I do not think that he worked their long, he probably just started at that position. 

As for the food itself, I felt the the fettuccine was not seasoned, the broccolini was a bit bitter, and the flavors together were not a good mix.
