I did not taste the freshness in  my fettuccine at all, it was stuck together, which indicates that its not fresh.  When any pasta is stuck together it means its been out for a little bit. I'm not saying it's from the previous day but it was not prepared fresh. My dad told me he liked his meal, he ordered the salmon and asparagus. Anyway, 2 stars are for the food and one star for the service and hospitality. This restaurant has potential to be better, they need to make some serious changes.
author: Svetlana T.

description: The service was adequate, the environment is warm and inviting. Wine selection isn't large but the wines are good. The food, which is usually why you go to a restaurant, was mediocre at best. I had the crab Alfredo and the pasta was a little too chewy and the spinach overpowered the existence of crab in the dish. We also had the margherita pizza, which I understand is a simple item, but it was disappointing. Three stars are for wine, service, and environment. Zero stars for food.
author: Mindy B.

description:
I walked in front of this restaurant a million times before. Every time looking at the food the people were eating and wanting to stop by. When my mother came to visit, she urged me to take her to North Beach and I treated her to lunch at this spot. 

My mother wasn't really hungry and neither was I so we decided to SHARE the seafood pasta. We had some antipasti, calamari, she had wine, I had beer (Franziskanner) and everything was going as planned. It was one of the rare times when my mother and I actually get along.

But when our entree came, the pasta plates were HUGE. I had the suspicion they brought us each one of the same entree; rather than split it for us to share. I asked our waiter. He said only one entree and shared.

Well, that's not what the bill said! When I asked him and pointed to him my bill was charging me for two entrees (not shared) he decided to say "Oh, we don't do sharing here"...

Well...maybe you should have told me that when I first ordered and when I asked you the first time. I was mad. I tipped nothing. Speak with the truth, or lie and there goes your tip.
author: Alexia R.

description: Service was horrible! Although we got our table fast, it took forever to get water. When it came to the food, for a highly ranked calzone place.. It tasted like it was from Costco, and not to mention, the very bland pasta. Will not be back to eat at this restaurant. So many other amazing restaurants to eat in this town for the price you have to pay
author: Kies J.

description:
4.5 Stars

Delizioso!

There is a lot to love about Calzone's Pizza Cucina. The taste of everything is spot on and I haven't had a bad meal here so far. Maybe it's because I usually order the same dishes, but I find them enjoyable every time I come. 

Mussels
*Garlic, cilantro broth with Linguisa sausage
*Great appetizer with a scrumptious tomato sauce that is perfect for dipping with the bread.
*I counted around 10 mussels in this dish.

Crab Pasta
*Garlic Scallop sauce with Grape Tomatoes
*Amazingly fresh pasta noodles. I can really tell the difference because their wide fettuccine noodles were so soft.
*They actually used lump crab meat and it was very fresh and sweet.
*The sauce may be a little more wet than most people are used to, but I didn't mind. 

Lasagna Style Calzone
*Consisted of Bolognese Meat sauce, Coteghino Sausage, Mushrooms, and Mozzarella & Ricotta cheeses.
*The calzone had nice, sweet sauce.
*It almost reminded me a of a Lasagna Hot Pocket, but it was way better.
*If this is your first Calzone's experience, I would recommend trying this calzone because you can't go wrong with the ingredients in this dish.

Strawberry Mojito
*I love Mojitos and Strawberries so this was an obvious choice for me.
*The drink was sweet and I even saw Strawberry seeds.
*It was paired with a sugar cane and I had a great time gnawing on the ends to extract some of the sweetness.

Everything was absolutely DELICIOUS at Calzone's. My only complaint was that portions could have been slightly bigger, especially with the mussels or pasta dish. Aside from that, I had a great experience and can't wait to come back.

== A MUST TRY! ==
author: Jason H.

description: Quick service great food. And best of all its Italian culture I like the fact that they act like Italians I'm not catered to just  served good food.
author: Clinton M.

description:
This place wasn't that bad.  If you just want a quick bite and craving basic Italian food, then this is the place to be.  I came here before a Kevin Hart show at Cobbs Comedy club.  We only had time to grab a quick bite. 

Dinner/snack:

Mussels- in basic butter sauce.  Not bad. I enjoyed it.

Calamari - can't go wrong with that.  Large portion.

Steak - Medium rare and not bad.  

Overall- the service was great. The food wasn't bad and came out real quick.  Made it to the show on time :)

Definitely come back here next time for a calzone.  Looked amazing!
author: Ying F.

description: I love sitting outside at this restaurant! A nice Italian glass of wine and mussels was the perfect way to end my shopping trip:) the service is really prompt too! Even on a colder night they have the heaters outside its quite pleasant.
author: Silvia S.

description:
Took the kids and their cousins, to the exploratorium on December 29, during their holiday break from school.  Went to North Beach after, and walked around looking for a place to have lunch. My wife spotted this place, so we went in.  Our party of seven was seated instantly, despite the place being pretty busy.  

Observations:  They have sidewalk and indoor seating.  The sidewalk is narrow and busy with pedestrians, and sitting out there didn't really seem to be much fun.  Wait and host staff were pleasant.   Initial impression of the place is the decor is, well, red.  The interior literally glows RED.   At first it was kind of fun, but after awhile my retinas were burning.

After being seated our waiter took a while to come take our drink and food orders, but, we received our food really fast.  We all had the individual pizzas.  There are so many to choose from, and everyone thought their pizza was very good, especially the crust.  Personally, I have had better, but it was not bad.  I had the San Daniele Prosciutto.  The crust was done very nicely, but the pizza itself was a little overly salty.

All in all not a bad place for a spur of the moment choice. But, it was VERY expensive.  I know its the city, but I have had better in the city for less.
author: Rob B.

description:
Just had a delightful dinner here.  We had their chaucuterie platter; their chicken ravioli, and their delightful tirimisu.  (Alas no pizza this time...)  We enjoyed two beers, a capuchino, and expresso.  All was good.   We ate inside with a good view of the street - there were also a lot of people sitting outside on the tables (it was a nice day in San Francisco).  Service was pleasant and quick.   We had a wonderful time.   Prices are reasonable.

They have a great menu (see their web site), lots of wine and a nice beers.
author: Samantha K.

description:
Although this is a very touristy join in North Beach, the hubby and I thought we would give it a try a few weekends ago. We chose to go the non-traditional route and get the fried calamari as an appetizer (~$7) and the crab fettuccine to split as an entree. Both were delicious and we were quite satisfied. I was very impressed with the amount of crab in the pasta, as I expected them to skimp on the expensive ingredient. There were large chunks of meaty crab and the sauce wasn't too heavy to overwhelm the light crab flavor. 

My only complaint is that this is not the place for a quiet dinner. The restaurant is busy, loud, and generally chaotic. Waiters are actually running through the restaurant and the red walls only add to the feeling of being rushed. If you can get over this, the food is pretty good.
author: Emily S.

description:
What a perfect place to end an adventure in the city and appreciate all that the city night life has to offer. Pizza and a glass of wine late into the evening really hit the spot. What a great restaurant to bring a date! I couldn't be happier with a seat outside underneath the heat lamps and twinkling white christmas lights. Definitely sit outside if it's not freezing cold - the heat lamps will help a lot.

All the pizzas come in one size and are $14 each. I'm not sure if it was the wine we were drinking, but I savored every bite of that pizza. Each pizza is enough for one person, maybe two if you don't eat much regularly.

I had the COMBO PIZZA with eggplant, pepperoni, sausage, onions, bolognese sauceand mozzarella cheese. The crust was thin and crunchy! The toppings weren't too heavy and didn't overpower the crust. It was pure relaxation and satisfaction with a glass of Pravis, white wine. I liked that it was a little sweet and it warmed my tummy.

The PROSCIUTTO pizza included san daniele prosciutto, artichoke hearts, fresh tomatoes, and jack cheese. The flavor isn't as memorable as the combo pizza. The artichoke and the prosciutto are what makes this pizza eye catching.

How can we eat at a restaurant called Calzone's Pizza Cucina without trying a calzone? The PESTO and CHICKEN CALZONE tasted just as expected. I found it a little bland just because my combo pizza was standing tall above the others with all it's meaty goodness. The calzone was very large though and easily shared.

Extra brownie points for being open until 1am! I am absolutely coming here again with a date or with friends.
author: Samantha L.

description:
We walked past this restaurant on a Saturday night around 10:00 PM and noticed it was very busy. As a lively restaurant with an inviting ambience should be indicative of good food and service, the following day we decided to capitalise on it being Super Bowl Sunday and not having to endure a wait for a table to try it out.

My suspicions were confirmed: it was indeed a restaurant offering very good food, attentive service and a pleasant atmosphere to enjoy your meal. We had the calamari, shrimp fettuccine and the shell fish cappellini between us. The calamari was light and crisp, yet flavourful and delicious. The shrimp fetttuccine was the better of the two pasta dishes. It was one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. It tasted fresh, delicate, well seasoned and balanced. Unfortunately, I had filled up on the bread and calamari so I couldnt finish it, much to the bf's delight as it proved to be an excellent lunch the next day.

The only criticism I can offer is that it would be nice if they provided a herb blend for the olive oil to accompany the bread. 

I would definitely return here. The outside seating on the pavement is quaint, and even on a January evening we were not cold. I didn't go inside, so cannot pass comment on its interior, but judging from the previous night's occupancy, I cannot imagine it being off-putting. All in all, a very pleasant experience.
author: Jackie A.

description:
The place was really cute and super romantic, full of couples and what not.  

The service was good, they were really attentive and pretty quick with our order.  After we ordered they brought out the bread, individually wrapped, which I thought was weird.  But whatever, it was good, and warm and the olive oil and vinegar was at the table so you can make your own bread dip.  

The linguine bolongnese was so good.  I was so full after eating half, but for some reason, I couldn't stop eating it.  I just couldn't put my fork down.  It was SOOOO addicting.  I'd definitely come back.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Just a quick update because the manager (owner) took the time to contact me and ask what they could do to make things better. I think it's a very good attitude and bodes well for the level of service/food they are serving. 
I might give it another try if I'm in North Beach, hungry on a sunny day. I would gladly upgrade my rating if I have a better experience.
author: Vithiet L.

description:
The open window wall in the restaurant totally improved our visit to San Francisco, being able to watch the locals stroll by, see the fashions of the area and drown out the sound of our wining kids.

Paris and I shared a very juicy steak, Melissa and Trinity shared a very yummy pizza that I got to sample. We'll definitely be back!
author: Steve W.

description:
I've driven by it, walked by it and never had dinner. How embarrassed I am to be born and raised Bay Area and not tried this place!
That being said. My husband and I had a night without kids, left the Davies Symphony Hall and came to North Beach to try Calzone's. I'm so glad we did! It was raining and we were able to sit outside under the heat lamps and not get wet once. I had the pasta with asparagus and chicken. It was magnificent! Fresh ingredients, lovely flavor, beautiful presentation. Service was quick, romantic ambiance.
My husband raved about the food as well (he never raves about anything not sport related) He really loved the mojitos. Cant wait to go back!
author: Sabrina B.

description: I have eaten here twice in my short visit to San Francisco, and have enjoyed the food and environment both times. The vegetable pizza is delicious, and they were great at making small substitutions in vegetable toppings. The heirloom tomato salad was delicious, although the first time the ratio of tomatoes to small pieces of crunchy balsamic bread crusts was greater, and the second time, there were fewer tomatoes. The flavors of both were delicious. The outside seating at the darling painted pottery tables with heaters under the awnings is fun for people watching, fresh air, and warmth while outdoors in the wintertime. I would come here again.
author: Gwen S.

description: Broke my reservation less than 2 hours before the reservation time with the only explanation being "we got other reservations." DO NOT BOOK A TABLE HERE.
author: Nate W.

description: This is one of the first places I ate at in SF and I keep coming back for more. Nice atmosphere with outdoor seating to people watch on a busy street on Columbus. Food is decent, good pasta, good calamari, portions are good.
author: Ross I.

description: Went there when we had guests from out of state for an early dinner. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was incredible and the decor is super cool. Definitely gives a unique feel for little Italy. The food though was just so so (we all got calzones); Not great, not awful. Fun experience though. I'm glad we tried it out.
author: Ana C.

description: Pretty good food usually, but they screwed up a to go order and wouldn't rectify the situation without me having to trek back to the restaurant in the rain, and help them void the  incorrect order. They also attempted to place the blame with me - I ordered a calzone and when it came to toppings, the kid pointed to 'pizzas' on the menu. I found a topping combination I liked and told him I wanted that topping combination in my calzone. Based on that, they claimed I ordered a pizza, and not a calzone. Anyway, I would have liked better customer service than what I got, which was disappointing. Probably won't go back now.
author: Mark H.

description:
Walking around North Beach, craving a little snack-a-roo, and this little spot catches my eye.  The outdoor tables are filled, so I know right off the bat, that this is a good choice. 

Boyfriend and I dined inside for a quick appetizer and drink.  The decor inside is super cute - like my Italian grandma's cupboards exploded and settled in every nook and cranny on the walls.  The booths are nice and cozy.  

We decided to share the calamari and each have a pineapple mojito.  The calamari came out hot and plentiful on an oval sized plate.  The cocktail sauce also had a nice punch.  The pineapple mojitos were delish!  I'm a fan of sweet drinks, so this def hit the spot.  It's also jazzed up with a sugar cane stick for your polynesian pleasure.  

Overall the service was fast and I would come back here for another quick snack!
author: Kristen D.

description: Long wait and very low quality food. Not recommended. Ordered the calzone and bruschetta.
author: Michael P.

description:
One of the best Calzone EVER.... I had the Egg plant Calzone and it was absolutely divine. My friends had the Chicken Calzone and said the Egg plant one was WAY BETTER... 

Other opinions in my group... Crab Melt OK..Butchers Burger good but meat was dry...Prawn Fettuccine was nice... Shell fish angel hair pasta was great too... 

And now the true test.. Will I go back.... Answer: I am a permanent customer
author: Farhan Y.

description:
Came here late at night after a BBB show because we didn't want to walk around looking for a place open at 11:30 p.m. 

Unfortunately, everything was Bland! The sauce that came with the calamari appetizer tasted like Heinz ketchup.  Luckily, the calamari itself was pretty good. Then the food came and I had the smoked chicken calzone. It's kind of depressing to say that the best thing about the calzone was the occasional bits of ricotta that I was able to discern from the dry chicken and dough. The person I was with had the orzo with sausage and that was also bland. Maybe because it was late the ingredients had lost their freshness, but in an area populated by some of the best Italian restaurants in the West Coast, this place needs to step up it's game to compete.

We left regretting that we hadn't just popped into a pizza joint and gotten a couple of slices rather than drop $50 for a meal that was regrettable.
author: Lucius M.

description:
This is just another one of those standard touristy North Beach Italian restaurants that relies more on its location and ambiance than its food to survive.

This calzone was good, but it's pretty difficult to make a bad calzone, so they didn't earn too many points there.

The garlic bread was like something you'd expect a college student with no cooking experience to prepare.
author: Raza M.

description:
I've been to Calzone's twice for lunch. Being that I am unadventurous, I went with the Lasagna both times. 

The portions are average, but the food is good enough. I've certainly had better lasagna, and I've eaten at much better places in North Beach - but Calzone's was good.  If it were in Oakland or San Jo, it would make a killing.

Cool place to eat outside on a nice day, but I can suggest much better spots in Little Italy. 3.75 stars.
author: Joel V.

description:
Busy place! Took longer to get seated than expected. Took even longer for our waiter to take our order... We ordered the garlic bread with mozzarella, seemed small for the $7 price; however it was good and flavorful.

Our waiter was very helpful and nice. I ordered the Crab Fettuccine; my wife ordered the Crab Fettuccine and added artichoke; the waiter was very accommodating with modifying the ingredients. ($2 up-charge)

I have had the Crab Fettuccine previously a couple times however it has been a few years. Previously it was not a red sauce, the tomatoes were more of a garnish and it had more of the garlic scallop sauce flavor which I had preferred. Still good with the red sauce, just not as good.

We sat outside under the heater and enjoyed all the people watching outside which is always fun. Cute place.
author: Michael T.

description: I haven't been to this place is probably 7 years, but took my dad hear to do the tourist thing and was pleasantly impressed with the food. You MUST order the ROAST CHICKEN and ratatouille. Maybe not the most authentic italian dish, but some of the best roast chicken in SF hands down. Service was also very good.
author: Susannah R.

description:
Maybe it was our fault going to an obvious tourist trap for lunch, but my sister lives close by and I've always wanted to try this place. I have to admit, it was nice sitting outside in the nice weather and people watching. 

Now to the bad stuff. The service was horrible, mainly the waiter who would waddle by without paying any attention to his tables. The only saving grace were the bussers who we had to ask for all our needs, i.e. water, Parmesan cheese, menu questions- since the waiter was sparsely visible. 

I ordered the chicken asparagus "fettuccine." First off, the noodles were more like Asian flat noodles or papardelle, which I like, but don't call it fettuccine. The meal was served in a bowl that was far from conducive to eating it. The pasta was piled at the bottom with a layer of dry shredded chicken and asparagus on top. Everytime I tried to take a bit e the chicken would fly off the bowl and I would still be trying to scoop up a noodle or two. That's it. The only hint of sauce I got was the smothering of oil left on the noodles. This was one of the most flavorless, bland dishes I have tasted and even the Parmesan cheese I waited five minutes for did little condolence to the dish. 

My sister's crab melt wasn't much better. Very, very salty. 
And without a drink, I still had to throw down $20 for a horrible pasta dish. 

Well now I know, even if you're starving, you should venture away from the North Beach touristy spots. Hell, even I felt like a tourist just sitting there. 

Grazie for making me never come back here again..... although the pizza and Calzones did look pretty good...
author: Rachel G.

description: Sat on the heated sidewalk which was manageable in late August. Corkage is very inexpensive- only $5. We had the calamari which was just ok along with the garlic fries. The short ribs were absolutely skippable- under-seasoned and over-cooked. The crab fettuccine was decent, but would've been better with a lighter sauce. Service was a bit slow as we had to ask for our water, food, and the check. Maybe because we were on the patio? Overall, just ok.
author: Megan D.

description: I know that there are many good restaurants in SF, but Calzone's is my favorite. I love being there for lunch and the energy there is for dinner. It's cozy. I will always stop by anytime I am in the City.
author: Ismael G.

description:
I like drinking red wine outside and taking in the atmosphere.......if you like drinking red wine outside and taking in the atmosphere then go here.

Myself and my girlfriend stopped off here one evening while sightseeing in San Francisco. We sat outside under the awning and had a glass of red wine.

Great service, good atmosphere!
author: Gavin D.

description:
Everytime I pass by this place, I've assumed it was the McDonald's of Italian but a step above Pasta Pomodoro. We stopped by and grabbed an early dinner before the comedy show at Cobb's. It was super busy. We sat outside and shared the bruschetta, the Italian Calzone and lasagna. All were surprisingly good but not great. The wait staff is fast and the food came out even faster. 

The bill came out to about $50 for 2. This place was a nice pit stop but not a place I'd come back to for spectacular food.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Nice place, but I took a limoncello and another drink and they were supermarket quality and CRAZY expensive.
author: Gianluca M.

description: Came here with my date after Bubble Lounge, luckily they were open late.  The thing I liked about the place was the seating, you get to eat outside and they have crazy hot heat lamps so you can feel very comfortable eat outside during winter, plus the seating arrangement is side by side (which is perfect for a first date). The only downside to eating outside is that you get some really crazy peeps getting too close to your table while there walking.  Now don't get me wrong the food was good too (not the best I've ever had) it was very reasonable for the price, plus had a big selection of dishes on their menu.  I would totally go back, especially during summer time and eat outside again.
author: Mike M.

description: Our experience was as good as it gets! First, I loved being able to reserve a table on Yelp. Two clicks and done. Great! Second, we arrived early and were seated right away. What?! That never happens. Third, we got one of the sidewalk tables; wide awnings with over-head heaters. Nice! As avid people-watchers, we were in heaven. What about the food? I'm glad you asked. ;) Amazing! The pork and beef sugo calzone was to-die-for. The chicken alfredo with spinach and almonds was delicious. We were satisfied, but not over-full. Perfect. Spent the rest of the evening walking it off around Little Italy. Calzone's, we'll be back.
author: John B.

description:
Colorful Classic

Italian born chef Andrea Froncillo is nationally recognized for his appreciation of the sensuality of texture, presentation, and fragrance of food. His web site, Sex and the Kitchen, is filled with recipes for two and recommendations for romantic travel and dining throughout the world. Calzone's is located in the heart of North Beach and a great spot for people watching through the window or on the outdoor patio. Serves delicious calzones. Split one with a salad unless you are a mangione.
author: Desiree P.

description:
I have to agree the reviewer Bruce on this place. Its been years since I was here, and remember it much better. Since we were invited today for lunch I suggested Calzone's for some Italian. Good thing my other half of the party did not show (long story, boring and not for here to be told).

We got sat immediately, in a big comfortable booth, while we waited we ordered Italian potstickers, french lemonade for the lady, and a stella for myself. I told my lady if they are not here by the times the appetizers are here, were ordering (no breakfast). When the potstickers arrived, we ordered our entrees and salad. This thing though really irked me was the lack of personality of the wait staff. I mean I don't need to be gushed over to feel comfortable, not that kind of customer. But a hello welcome to calzones, offer the specials of the day or suggest a wine? All he said was "are you ready to order"? I could have gotten this from dive pizza joint down the street. Also those lil PDAs they have to take a order makes it that much more cold and robotic. I coming to sit down and enjoy myself, food is always intimate especially from what I am expecting from a place like this. 

Well the Crab salad came, tasted good, but for $16 seemed (give or take a dollar) steep. Took a bite of the calzone (can't remember what was in it) but talk about bland. Bread was dry and never really hot or moist. Seemed like something out of a microwave (like a hot pocket).
I had the Bolognese pasta, and yet was sadly disappointed. Did like the fat spaghetti, but the gravy (sauce) was sweet but uninspiring. I wanted some spice or some taste. I am no cook, but even I could have made this same dish, and come out the same. I expect something I could never replicate, thus me wanting to come back. Overall, everything was just bland. It seems to me that the chef or owner has left this place on autopilot and let the cooks rinse and repeat the same recipe for years, and has lost its flavor. 

Oh I almost forgot, the prices are way steep for the two of us, $75 with a app., one round of drinks, a shared salad and our entrees. I expected something way better tasting for what I had, at the very least.

Honestly I would not come back just for the blah food and boring atmosphere. The wait staff did their job, and that is all. I just think a server or any staff needs to bring some energy and/or personality. I hate to say this but (and I hate this place) but even places that corporate restaurants like Cheesecake Factory has better energy and food, (bite my tongue). I think that this place is just for the tourists and nothing more. Locals just stay away. I will be looking for my pasta fix somewhere else when I am in the city again.

PS What is up with hard lil crusty roll in a bag they give you. I thought it was a rock in there because it was so hard!
author: Danny Q.

description:
Good atmosphere, good sidewalk seating, eh food.

Except the calamari.  The calamari is good.  Everything else is eh.
author: Mike D.

description:
Everything about their service said they did not want my business. From waiters speeding into the bathroom when they see you head to the bathroom and spending 15 minutes there, to getting an order of Coca Cola wrong three times in a row, to taking my brother's order and saying to me, "and for the gentleman?", I got the feeling they did not want any business that day.

The food was disgusting. I have had reheated frozen pasta dinners that tasted better than the chicken ravioli they served. The soup tasted like it came out of a can. And I don't know what that was floating in my drink, but it was not Coca Cola or ice or any recognizable globule of food.
author: Rob C.

description: Great food eat inside or out (dog friendly).  I've been by myself and with people and it's always been excellent service with a delicious meal.
author: SO S.

description: Just ok, only been there once, service was bad but I say go check it out if you have not been there. Calzones were good of course.
author: Mo O.

description: Very disappointing start with the "fresh beet salad" with pickled beets...move to asparagus chicken house made pasta that was dry and tasteless with the stringy ends of asparagus - not tender.  The kale pasta was equally tasteless and already cool when it arrived. Worse than chain pizza store pasta.  Don't waste your money!
author: Mary C.

description: 1 margarita pizza, 1 pepperoni pizza, mussels, and pot stickers comes to $100.  The pizza is small - about 4 slices.  I didn't think 4 dishes was worth a $100 lunch for family of 4! I would look into other Italian restaurants near by to get a real Italian experience!
author: Jason P.

description:
Though I've not lived in NB for over a year now I still come back to one of my favorite spots...Calzones. The Organic Beets followed by the Chicken and Mushroom Orzo is my favorite dish by far. My favorite thing about this restaurant which keeps me coming back for more is their location and their Moscow Mojito's!

Their service is worth 2.5 stars as they don't go out of their way to make this a memorable experience, but I guess that's what you get in a very touristy part of North Beach. The bartenders are actually really cool and friendly if you do sit inside near the bar. 

Their smoked chicken calzone is worth 3.5 stars since it's supposed to be their claim to fame, it still falls short of being anything but mediocre. They do stuff it with a generous portion of ricotta cheese which is great but it's just a little too dry and doughy for me with not a ton of flavor bursting in your mouth.
author: Kristy M.

description: Too expensive for what you get. Portion sizes are just too small. The outside seating is great and some of the drinks are very good, but nevertheless not worth the price gauging. I've had a good calzone here. It's just too expensive for what you get, and some of the dishes are hit or miss. The seating is nice but not worth the extra money if the food and service isn't always good. I don't know if I will be coming back.
author: Joy H.

description:
I agree that this place has very good atmosphere.  The outdoor seating is great, and the location can't be beat.

Unfortunately, the food and service are well below many other Italian places in North Beach.  I went there again the other day and walked away disappointed. I ordered the gnocchetti.  While the Bolognese sauce was good, the gnocchetti were very overcooked.  I realise that gnocchetti can be more difficult to cook than pasta, however I would expect an Italian restaurant in North Beach to get it right.  The service surrounding the food was slow and poor, especially as it was not a particularly busy.  All in all, there are just too many better Italian places in the neighbourhood to come here.  For a great Bolognese sauce at a reasonably priced place go to Cafe Maria, and for a great Italian table experience go to Franchino's.

I give this place four stars for location and the outdoor seating, and less than two stars for price , service and food quality.
author: Derek n.

description:
Came here last night because it was an hour wait for Tony's pizza and it was already after 8pm. Overall it was a great place and I would have no problem recommending it. We got a table right away and since it was nice out, we got a table outside. I wouldn't say it was cold but have that little extra heat from the heaters was nice and made it comfortable. It is kind of weird having people walk by while you're eating but it was later in the evening so the streets weren't too busy. But I enjoying eating outside and the people walking by weren't ever a problem (never bumped the table or anything annoying). Someone who walked by actually knew my friend who he hadn't seen in awhile so that was actually kind of cool.
We both got calzones which were pretty big! I only ate half and wouldn't have had a problem sharing if I'd known the size. They were very good and came out fairly quickly! Service was above par. Attentive but not to the point of annoying. One of the waiters would come outside and scan the tables to make sure everyone was enjoying themselves. Overal a good experience!
author: Rikki B.

description: The Location, The Service, The Food, The Flavors...all so amazing!!! My boyfriend surprised me with a birthday getaway to San Francisco and we found this awesome place!!!! Made my birthday extra special...thanks you guys!
author: Michelle S.

description: This place doesn't deserve its current rating 3,5. Apart the decoration which is really nice, the service is unfriendly, particularly with kids. The menu is incomplete for an Italian restaurant and the food is not good, not even warm. You have many other places that deserve a visit. Definitely not this one !!!
author: Carole W.

description:
The only thing good about this place was the service. The bartender was very nice and personable. But his dirty martini was one of the worst I have tasted. Our server was also nice, and my water was refilled almost with every sip. We sat outside - the outdoor seating was a plus, heat lamps and good people watching. But the food was no good. The complementary bread was dry and tasteless. The calamari was ok, probably the best thing we had, but forgettable. We split the spicy sausage orzo. It was not spicy, and the sauce tasted like mediocre spaghetti sauce.  

It was a disappointing dinner. I would not recommend it and will not be back.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Deciding to troll for hot men like Carrie and Charlotte do in an episode of Sex and the City, MC and I decided Calzone was the perfect place to do so on a lovely SF evening.  Sitting at the quintessential outside table under heat lamps, we enjoyed a few good laughs and some not so good food.  

I can't decide what was worse... the calzone or that we only had two "yes" checkmarks and tons of "no's".  We ordered the smoked chicken calzone with pomodoro sauce, ricotta, artichoke hearts and mozzarella.  

The chicken was horrible, grade F, disgusting.  I scooted it to the side of my plate and didn't eat it.  I was wishing for more sauce and artichoke hearts but all I was left with was ricotta and mozzarella.  I was unimpressed.  I was nearly pissed but I knew after a night of drinking I'd end up getting a slice at Golden Boy pizza anyways, so that was the saving grace.  I let it go and decided to yelp it out.  

Service was just sad.  With plenty of delicious Italian restaurants in NB with excellent service to choose from, I won't be back at this spot.
author: Michele O.

description:
We really wanted an Italian meal and this place was a little bit busy and had decent reviews.  The 5 of us had Crab pasta , fettuccine bolognese pepperoni pizza,  four cheese pizza gnocchi bolognese plus Caesar salads and bread.

There were a few things that  were irritating about this place, the most noteworthy was that they were waaay to fast with the service and sometimes the courses came too fast.  Since they were not very busy the night we were there, I am not quite sure why they were seeming to rush us through each course.  In fact, this tendency influenced us to not bother staying for dessert

The food was good, and reasonably portioned.   The service was about average and I found the prices to be a little on the high side.  We split two salads, had two glasses of Chianti and three sodas  Everyone had pasta and the total bill was $160 which for what we had it seemed high for pasta and pizza.  

I know that SF is expensive but there are some really exceptional places for the same amount of money and  this place is not someplace I liked well enough to return to.  It's good but really on average at best,.
author: Greg G.

description:
If your looking for an affordable/cute date night with some decent italian food I would defiantly go here.
Just had date night and I ordered a nice crab pizza which was delish! Not pricey at all and they did not cheap out on the crab. For an appetizer we ordered Calamari  and their red sauce was to die for.

The seating is cool we got a little table right outside the restaurant facing the street. If you don't want random people watch you eat i suggest you don't sit outside, but either way when your in good company you don't realize that. Anyways on a chilly night they have a nice heater over you so your not cold.

Anyways great place!
author: Pinky B.

description:
Had the arugula pesto gnochetti and hubby had the roasted chicken and mascarpone ravioli. Also got the Red Russian with vodka strawberries and cream and shared the cheesy garlic bread.

Definitely will come back but not so often since everything's really pricey but everything also sounds so good. So cruel Calzone's! Totally want to try all their cocktails.
author: Lauren L.

description:
Went here for a late dinner.

Pros:
- Ambience - lots of seating
- Menu - looks extensive, lots of veggie options!
- Portion sizes were great - ordered one pasta dish and split with a friend and still had food leftover

Cons:
- Ordered the pesto gnocchi. Although the pesto sauce was great, the gnocchi was not. The gnocchi was super sweet and annoyingly dough-y. The weird taste of the gnocchi overpowered the pesto and made it a really unsatisfactory dish. 
- Friend got the melon mojito - it was good initially, but ended up being a little too sweet and difficult to finish at the end. The stick of sugarcane in the drink was a nice touch, but probably contributed to the excessive sweetness of the drink.

However, our waiter Jose was incredibly generous and took the whole dish off the check, even though we did not complain about it to him until the very end. I've heard great things about their pizza/calzones, so will go back to try something else, mainly due to Jose's kind gesture and patience!
author: Vaibhavi U.

description: Excellent Calzones. None of them that I've tried so far have been gross, so yay for that. I love that they have heated lamps for that SF-always-cold-why-would-I-want-to-sit-outside days. As for the pizza and pasta, they are okay, but they are definitely better places in the area. But the point is that they're known for their Calzones!
author: Sandy T.

description: Great food and a great atmosphere.  The outside dinning area on the street is super cute. A great place for the family or a date.
author: Angela H.

description: We started our North Beach night here.  It was crowded with happy patrons so we knew we were in the right place.  The servers were nice and friendly.  It's a great place that is would recommend you visit if you are in the area.
author: Craig M.

description:
Visually appealing restaurant... During evening hours.
The food was mediocre at best, so it didn't justify the prices.
author: C T.

description:
Came through here after finding out that our first choice restaurant that I had chose was actually closed for a private function.  Little disappointing, but in SF there is always a backup restaurant not too far away.  My friends then led us to this strange Italian American like establishment which I had probably passed by a number of times while passing by this part of N. Beach.  This outing was for a friends b-day in late September, yes I know I'm a bit late on many of my reviews...  

Anyhow, we started getting comfortable with some melon mojitos and house wine.  I'd like to note how the french lemonade and the red russian look equally or more interesting than the mojitos.  The general dinner crowd was a lot older and more relaxed.  The place is located in a pretty busy intersection of Vallejo and Columbus so there are plenty of al-fresco dinners that like to watch pass-byers.  A lot of the staff here look pretty Italian which makes me regard the whole experience as more authentic.  I was almost going to order a pasta but then decided to try the classic Italian Calzone which seemed popular with other diners...  I mean how can you go wrong when it's in the restaurant name???  They must be known for it right?   

I believe my other friends ordered gnocchett, some salad, and pizza.  The menu here wasn't really too complicated, cause it was broken down into the basic Italian food sections. My calzone was actually pretty good for $15, and it wasn't overly huge like you might find at some fake Americanized Italian restaurants.  The gnocchi I also had a bite of, kind of strange consistency in the dumping that I'm not used to.  It is nothing like that of the Asian dumplings I usually eat, but it's probably because of the use of potato.  I always hear about gnocchi but never eat it.   

All in all, this place is well located and still stays very busy.  It is classic and closer to the original Italian food establishment but is too simple and old to even earn 4 stars in my opinion.  When I go to a restaurant I want to be excited or puzzled by things that I see on the menu, and this place just doesn't do that.
author: Kenny P.

description:
I blame the boyfriend for making us and another friend coming here.

Boff: Let's have pasta for dinner.
Me: Okay, but all the good places are in the Mission.
Boff: Fuck that, I hate the Mission.
Me: Perbacco in FiDi?
Boff: I want to go somewhere to eat where I can dress like a hobo.  PLUS, we live right by North Beach!
Me: Fine.

You might think I'm whipped by hobo boff but I was too tired from work to Yelp a place.  And I paid dearly for this.  We came to Calzone's because every half-decent spot in North Beach is ass packed already on a Friday.  

I left this place feeling like I ate a stick of butter with a pint of cream instead of a crab alfredo pasta.  I shit you not, it tasted exactly like the Michael Angelo's pasta TV dinners you can get at Safeway.  That's not to say the ingredients aren't fresh.  The pasta was al dente and good, but the sauce, it really tasted just like that TV dinner sauce.

I give them two stars because we didn't have to wait, all our food came at the same time, and service was acceptable.
author: Erika C.

description: Nice place. My husband got eggplant sandwich with a cup of soup and a lime margarita. I ordered chicken breast sandwich with cheese, avocado, and onions, and a cup of coffee. His eggplant sandwich was plain, but the lime margarita was good. Coffee there sucks, and when I got my sandwich I realized that there was nothing else but a chicken breast and a cheese. I called a waiter telling him that some ingredients were missing there. He replied that they forgot to put them! How can you forget to put a half of a sandwich in?)) The full version of it was delicious, by the way ))
author: Benedetto A.

description: Went here with my partner for breakfast and the waiting staff was very rude. We left after we paid for our coffee. It may have been because we were a gay couple but they gave us the nastiest glare when we walked in. Blatant homophobic discrimination is a terrible customer service strategy. Also, the coffee was barely drinkable. If zero star rating was available that is what they would get. Don't go here.
author: Blake S.

description:
Overall, it was OK.  W had the pizza - good, MUssel - Great; Garlic Bread/Fried - good; Pasta - not good; overcooked. Lasagna - Not good. 

Service was prompt. waiters helpful.  

Will try other italian restaurants in North Beach before coming back her.  A great italian restaurant should execute pastas and lasagnas well.
author: John R.

description: A very unforgiving place that does not allow outside food even when we were ready to pay for drinks and appetizers. we bought a small tiramisu from the pastry shop next door and we really wanted to enjoy it while having some wine. Waiters at this place did not even allow us to sit inside the restaurant when we said that we only wanted drinks. Next, we were asked to put our tiramisu away even though we were the only customers sitting at the corner and we were about to order a bunch of wines. While I understand that it is not customary for restaurants to accept outside food, their attitude and inflexibility at 11pm at night (non-peak hour) was truly disappointing.
author: Vickie T.

description: Sitting outside was the best part of the meal. Serve was fine, food was mediocre and pass on the bread (I'm pretty sure it was served stale). The Chianti was drinkable. Not a date worse than death but nothing to write home about.
author: Kate N.

description:
The server recommended the lasagna calzone, I think that's what it was called.

It was A-OK.

The dough wasn't evenly cooked and in some spots where it was folded, it was still a little raw and I don't find that appealing.
author: Marie H.

description: This place is the bomb. The neighborhood is rocking with party-goers, tourists, and families. We walked here from AT&T park after a Giants game and got some tasty beers and split a Pesto chicken calzone. Good thing we did because it was more than enough. The cheese inside was tasty. They also serve your standard bread with oil and vinegar to hold you over. The price is cheap for the area. I will definitely come again. If you can, and the weather allows you should sit outside on the sidewalk seating.
author: Marty J.

description: Good food, not Great food, but it is not about great anything. It's about attending to customer's need for good food efficiently. Crowded on weekend nights, so be patient. It would be better if they had a few standard Italian-American dishes that were basic noodles with meat sauce. But, overall, fun place to eat and service is solid.
author: Average Guy R.

description: great place to enjoy and great ambiance. Next time i am in san francisco  il be sure to stop by.
author: Diana G.

description:
On a cold and dreary night, a friend and I sat down outside at Calzone's.  I hadn't eaten all day, so I was really looking forward to some amazing Italian food.  The menu seemed very limited.

As my friend was getting a low-maintenance calzone, I took a shot at the equally no-frills pepperoni pizza.  It came in an elongated oval shape, but that was the only noteworthy thing about it.  The cheese, sauce and pepperoni were all standard.  Based on this, I would never say, "Hey, let's go to Calzone's!"  I would be more likely to say, "Meh, everything else is busy.  Let's go to Calzone's."

This place doesn't appear to have a ton of seating as my friend and I ended up seated outside under heat lamps facing the street.  Awkward.  I guess if you're sick of looking at your dining companion, it's nice not to be facing them.  Otherwise, it makes conversation a little strained.

There simply must be better options in the neighborhood.  I didn't hate Calzone's, but I doubt I'll remember it for any reason after tonight.
author: Ben B.

description:
I thought this place was just for tourists, but boy was I wrong!

I've been here a few times now and the food, drinks and service have been excellent every time.

It's important to note, that they have the best mojitos in town. The Moscow mojito is my personal favorite; it's made with vodka and chambord.

Best appetizer? The Crab Crustini. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

Great for date night or a long evening of drinks and laughs with the girls. What are you waiting for? Get your mojito on!
author: Kaylie P.

description: Recommended by a SF native and we loved it.  No reservation for 5 on a Wednesday night -- seated right away.  Great service.  House red was terrific.  Had the gnochetti with sugo, which was excellent.  Others in the party had the filet mignon calzone (says it's one of his favorites) and crab fettucini -- both excellent.  Even the two who ordered salads, raved.  Don't hesitate -- visit today!
author: Geralyn H.

description: This was my fourth time to Calzone's. It seems like every time I return, I hope it will be like the first time (pretty good), but it only seems to gets worse! This time is my last for sure. I had the chicken calzone and it had zero flavor, and for $18! What?! We also ordered the calamari and it was ok, but again...kinda expensive for so so. Huge disappointment.
author: Jane Y.

description: My boyfriend has brought me here a couple times now, He used to come here often with his ex and her family and loved the food. He Brought me to share a good place. It is a small place with very nice outside seating with  checkered sidewalks. We have sat inside and outside. I will say the inside gets stuffy and you loose some of the experience sitting inside. They have heaters outside too, so even on the chilliest days, it should be a pleasant experience. Last Saturday, was not particularly a hot day nor cold day, just beautiful out and we sat outside. We got a little hot with the heater but still okay. We have never had anything but the pizza there. Which is super good. My boyfriend loves the margherita pizza while i had the pesto pizza. Super good! the bread is good that they serve you as well. We also  love their olive oil and balsamic vingrette. We both had mojitos which were good, but slightly too strong for me, as i like things more sweet, but thats okay! We will be returning.
author: Ruthe Ann G.

description:
Decent Italian in SF's little italy...
Wasn't Great, Wasn't terrible either...
author: Damon L.

description: This restaurant genuinely made an effort to get back to me. I am convinced that I just caught them on a bad night.
author: Spencer R.

description: Came here with my boyfriend on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't crowded so we got seated quickly(chose to be inside so we could sit across from each other). The staff here was very friendly, got our orders quickly, and came to fill our cups a few times throughout our meal. I ordered the chicken&mushroom pasta while my boyfriend got an Italian calzone. The servings were pretty decent and the food was good. It is a bit pricey, but overall a nice place to eat.
author: Winnie Z.

description: Great food, great people watching.  We went here twice in 5 days!  My 9 year old said their pizza was the best he has had.   We had the filet mignon calzone, alfredo, burger, and a cheese pizza and it was all fantastic!   You will not be disappointed!
author: Amanda W.

description:
This is based on a visit from a couple of years ago, but I thought I'd post it anyway as a newcomer to Yelp and because these reviews provide a cool trail of crumbs to remind me of where I've been and where I should or shouldn't go again.  

There isn't a whole lot to say about the ambience, decor or service here.  The big pink neon sign out front is a great tourist lure and the dusty wine bottles and spice rack theme says "Can you guess what kind of restaurant I am?"  Both times, they served us efficiently but nothing more.  

I went here with an ex twice and I had two dishes that I still remember today.  He had the same thing both times, the calzone with bolognese sauce.  It was a thin crust of bread surrounding a decadent tomato based meat sauce.  I got a taste and it was really rich and good.  I had the homemade fettucine bolognese the first time and it was wonderful.  Tender pasta and thick, rich sauce.  I finished it easily as a lunch.  The second trip to SF, I had orzo with pine nuts, herbs and grilled chicken.  It was superb, same tender pasta and wonderful flavor in the sauce, but this time I couldn't finish it.  I had them box it up and I nearly died when I realized later I'd forgotten in the frig at the hotel.  I was very sad.  

End summary:  If you go here, ignore everything else.  Just go for the food!
author: Ami K.

description: The service was fast....the food was excellent and delicious house made ravioli awesome..... it was so good i have no more words to describe also pizza and salad perf.
author: Hector M.

description: Here visiting and read great things about Tonys. Unfortunately, I stopped by and it was closed for a private event. I kept walking and decided on by Calzones as it has a fairly appealing outdoor seating area. I ordered the "cremini" mushroom pizza and a glass of wine. The service was great. Fast and friendly. The pizza was mediocre at best. The crust is cracker-like and dry and I love thin crust. The cheese lacked the nice salty flavor you crave from pizza and the mushrooms were definitely not cremini. They were your regular store-bought button mushrooms. For the $30+ I spent on both items, I'd say very over-priced and sadly underwhelming.
author: Karen P.

description: The best "traditional" pizza outside of Italy itself. My family visited this place and I was so impressed by their service, food, and hospitality that I had my After wedding dinner there. All of their ingredients are fresh from their tomatoes to the real garlic cloves hanging inside. If you are looking for NY style Pizza go somewhere else. You want a pizza that will change your life... come here.
author: Brusso L.

description: Something for everyone (large menu) with a fun North Beach vibe. Sit in a high booth or outdoor table to people watch.
author: Vicki L.

description: Came here for lunch with my family and it was great. Service was quick and friendly. We all ordered a different kind of mojito to drink and they were great. We all ordered some food we could all share and all of it was great, my favorite was the lasagna calzone, so yummy, soft crust and great sauce, we also had the italian calzone, lasagna, and a prosciutto pizza. Everything was great and if I am ever in San Fran again this would be the first place I'd go back to eat!
author: David S.

description:
The food is alright, but it's a great place for sidewalk dining & people watching, especially during the North Beach Festival!

We had the...
-Fried calamari: Nothing special, very average.
-Combo pizza rustica: Looks like a pepperoni pizza but all the other toppings (Italian sausage, eggplant, onion) are hiding under the cheese! 
-Fettuccine ribbons w/ chicken & asparagus: Nothing special. One negative thing was that the pasta clumped together!
-Auto Moto Riesling: Fruity, not dry at all. Would pass on this.
-Mojito: YUM! Tasted like a limeade with a kick.
author: Miss H.

description:
I'm not trying to sound like a hater ,but I'm really disappointed with my first visit to this place.
My fam and i took my little bro here today for his b-day because he said he wanted some Italian food.For appetizer we got garlic bread w/cheese for $6.95 don't do it its a total rip off you get baguette cut into four pieces the same baguette you get for free with you dinner but they slap a little cheese and garlic on it. I ordered the Italian calzone which  was very plain and soggy I've  had better calzones at small pizza shops my brother got the chicken alfredo the sauce was watery and the chicken was very plain not much flavor my dad ordered the roasted chicken which wasn't cooked all the way . The waiter was garbage he would bring our drinks after we would ask a second time then when we got the bill there were two mocha's on it we didn't order...  This places is a sorry excuse for Italian I don't know how they managed to be around for so long I'd rather just eat a frozen Italian dinner then this garbage maybe it was just what we ordered or maybe this place just blows the goat.
author: Josué P.

description: Great Italian food, fantastic atmosphere. Ideal place to have a good time. Good service. One of my favorite in North Beach.
author: Kiki H.

description: Eat outside and enjoy the view.  Love the food and especially the seasonal tomato.
author: Linda C.

description: Calzone was HUGE and delicious i may add. Also had the fettuccine Alfredo with crab and my husband had a pasta dish as well. They were very large portions so i wish i knew that ahead of time so that i could order less cuz this place ain't cheap !
author: Lena E.

description:
I was here for a meet and greet with friends of my new sis-in-law. I like the friends, but I didn't like the food...and that made me sad. I should have known by the crowds of tourists that I am going to be condemned to "tourist" italian food hell.  That means average to mediocre pizzas and calamari. I missed the appetizers since everyone already came, but drove straight through what I thought was a can't mess up mini-entree of calamari. The moment I put it in my mouth, I knew no amount of seasonings is going to help the mealy textured squids on my plate. 
My company should have known that if I pass all my food to share, that usually means something ain't right. 
I tried their salmon pizza...the crust was kinda hard, but there wasn't enough salmon on the pizza to make me excited, but they had plenty of capers.

Low lighting, crowded Saturday evening, service was brisk. Parking was hellish but that's not new.
author: Pauline L.

description: This place is just a tourist trap.  Nice outdoor seating and ambiance is nice but don't be deceived by the over priced food.  And yes, pasta pomora has way better italian food.
author: g s.

description: Stopped in for a late night dinner. We started with the calamari. It comes with a nice chipotle remoulade dipping sauce, and also fried red and green peppers. Very good, I would have this again for sure. We also had Pizzas, the Zoe's Pepperoni was a bit bland, but then waiter grated some parmesan cheese on top, which was a delicious game changer! Really enjoyed that pizza. My companion had the Spicy Sausage pizza it was also a good choice. As a side note, the left over pizza's are also really good cold the next day!  The restaurant also has really good fast and friendly service. Nice seating both indoors and out. When the weather is cool, the outdoor seating is heated, which is very nice.
author: Tami J.

description:
We were drawn in by the large crowd and weren't at all disappointed.  We had about a 15 minute wait for a table - not bad for a busy Saturday night - and got a couple drinks at the bar.  Their mojitos are fantastic!  They come with a stick of sugar cane in, and it's a real treat to chew on after your drink is gone to suck out the sugary sweetness and delicious rum.

We ordered the lasagna and the petit filet mignon.  My husband says his lasagna was pretty standard, good but not great.  Meanwhile my steak was ridiculously good.  Perfectly cooked with a gorgeous sear, served with swiss chard sauteed with garlic and butter with zucchini mashed potatoes.  The chard was delicious, the potatoes were creamy and a textural joy - red skinned-potatoes with the skin still on while mashed, with small bits of unmashed potato and - the real kicker - zucchini pieces mixed in.  It was delicious!

The outdoor seating area was perfectly heated, and we had an amazing troubadour come by and sing us some beautiful, bluesy tunes.  Fantastic evening!
author: Sadaye M.

description:
I was disappointed with the service that night.  It wasn't very attentive but we got a table right in the front by the hostess station so there was a lot of food traffic.

The food was good, but it wasn't too amazing.  The interior was very cool though and you can't beat the location.
author: Tony M.

description: Excellent Italian restraunt on Columbus. Great view. Nice staff!
author: Tommy F.

description: Brought some friends here last night and got embarrassed. The service sucked big time. Not even one our waiter came to check on us. The calamari was good and that was it. My mom's steak was burnt. My shellfish fettuccine was over cooked and drowning in sauce. We were told that the chef is new and that might explain the experience.
author: Ghiz S.

description:
I gave them 5 starts, only because the service is amazing.
It was my friend's bday party, we had a reservation at Steps of Rome. They screwed our reservation up; so we decided to leave and go somewhere. Obviously, we wouldn't go to far and just stay on Columbus St. And I am so glad we did. We went here, we asked for the table for 12 people, and preferably on a second floor. Those people did everything to seat us on a second floor at a small private corner. People, who work there, are so friendly and grateful for every customer.
The food is good. I had fried calamari and prosciutta pizza. It was so delicious. I really want to come back and have more.
The Bartender is such a sweetheart. Delicious Cocktails. 
Thumbs Up. I am coming Back!
author: Jenna F.

description:
This is a prime location for people watching.  Columbus has so many people coming and going you there is plenty to see.

The food was pretty good here.  I wouldn't say it's the best Italian I've ever had but good.  The drinks were decent.  I really have to commend the waitstaff.  I was eating with a couple of my friends who are obnoxious punks and were being...I think asses is the best word.  The waiters took it all in stride, took a picture for us and even tolerated my drunk buddy who wanted to pretend he was gay that night.  I rewarded them for their patience with a generous tip.  Thanks dudes.
author: Brian K.

description: Updating a previous 5 star rating... About 6 months ago the menu changed and they must have gotten a new chef. Quality of food dropped... For example, the calamari is nowhere close to what it used to be.
author: Rob W.

description: Came in this afternoon around looking for a relaxing place for a drink and some food. Sat by the bar in front of the open window, which was quite nice on this warm day. The gnocchi with mushrooms, leeks, kale, sage, and garlic was delicious. The bartender took care of my friends and I, and was quite speedy and attentive to us, gave us a great bar recommendation to check out. Definitely will be back again sometime i'm up in the city.
author: Grant P.

description: This is an ok place, we have ended up here a few times. We usually sit outside & enjoy the weather, or the heaters, and people-watch. The service is usually good. Some servers and/or host/esses are better than others. But I have to agree with a lot of the other reviewers about the food. Yesterday we had the Cremini mushroom pizza, the pork sugo, and calimari as an appetizer. One virgin Bloody Mary and one cocktail. $85 before tip. A small, thin, tasteless pizza with an ounce? of mushrooms and bland cheese. The sugo was not bad, but sort of tasted like ground beef & pork in a tomato sauce that my mom used to make when she was unmotivated to cook with any more effort than absolutely necessary. Pasta was cooked right at least. But overall bland. We ate maybe half of our calamari...it was ridiculously chewy & again, tasteless. The thought actually crossed my mind that an Olive Garden meal might've been better.
author: Priscilla M.

description: We had the four cheese and the pepperoni pizzas and both were amazing.  Great place to people watch. Service was precisely right on target.
author: Tina E.

description:
Came here on Saturday night during fleet week.  The food here is sub par! We ordered the Arugula salad and the Chicken and Artichoke Calzone to share.  Both were a BIG a disappointment and lacked taste.  The Arugula salad was mainly just that, even though it was suppose to have goat cheese, tomatoes, artichokes and almonds.  The salad dressing tasted like straight olive oil.  The roasted chicken calzone was dry.  The chicken had no seasoning, not even salt and pepper.  It was not served with pasta sauce for dipping, we had to ask for it and we were charged an extra $1 for maybe 1/2 cup of sauce!.  In addition,my husband asked for butter for his bread and we were charge $2 for a 1/2 stick of butter with the wrapper still on it.  The beers where expensive too, $8 each (we paid $2 less the night before at a nicer upscale restaurant).  While the food was disappointing the service/buser were exceptional, considering they were asked to cover a large area and had to work their tails off. I would give the two of them 5 stars!!! 
 Bottom line, It seems to me that the owners only real interest is to gouge it's customers with sub par food, extra charges for items that should come with the food and expensive drinks. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.
author: Suzanne S.

description: Amazing pizza and filet minion calazone!! We sat outside and enjoyed people watching!
author: Suzanne M.

description:
After so many great meals in San Fran it's hard when a place is just okay. 

We stopped here for lunch while on our North Beach tour because the place was packed and we thought that meant something. I had the scallops with wasabi pesto aioli wrapped in pancetta. The wasabi sauce was a little watery but the heat it gave was good. The scallops were caramelized well and pretty good. I've had better but certainly had worse. I also had the garlic fries. HUGE serving but pretty tasty.

T had the sausage sandwich with fontina and arugula. I had a bite with just the fontina and arugula and it was good. A good, quick lunch spot if you're in the neighborhood but I wouldn't seek it out with so many other options in the city.
author: Elena M.

description:
I went here on a Wednesday afternoon for lunch after being scared away by the ridiculously long line at Mama's.  We requested to sit outside and were seated immediately.  As expected in the streets of the city, don't expect to have a lot of room to sit around the table.

We started off with the "Italian Potstickers."  I usually avoid Asian fusion dishes, but this day I was feeling adventurous.  They were actually quite good; the sauce they are served in is delicious and sweet and the sausage inside was tasty.  The wonton didn't contribute much to flavor but was cooked decently.

I had the pesto chicken calzone.  Despite a pretty good amount of cheese and chicken inside the stuffing it was actually quite bland and not very satisfying.  Pesto was given in small amounts and wasn't distributed well; only one in every four or so bites had any pesto flavor in it, and the ones that did didn't have very much of it.  Avoid.  I also got to try the chicken and asparagus fettucine, which was also very bland.  It took some salt and olive oil before the pasta had any flavor.  The pasta was also overcooked.  Also avoid.

I got to try my friend's crab melt.  The bread they use is very obviously the same bread they serve for appetizers, and overall the sandwich was very small.  However, the crab mix packed wonderful creamy flavor and it was by far the best tasting part of the meal.  Whether or not it's worth the $15 charge I'm not too sure about.

Service was friendly and attentive until the place began to fill up.  We had to go in and find our waiter to get the check and we had to drop it off to someone else because he disappeared afterwards.  The price of the two good dishes, the crab melt and the potstickers, were pretty high, but the calzone and pasta were appropriate.

In conclusion: Considering the amount of competition in the area, I wouldn't bother going here again.  If you do go here for the convenience or experience, try the crab melt and potstickers.  The pasta and calzone were forgettable.
author: Brandon W.

description:
The heirloom tomato salad with balsamic dressing we had as an appetizer was good.

I played it safe by ordering the Margherita pizza and was impressed, it had just the right amount of cheese, sauce, and basil and came in an oblong shape, which was just right for the table. 

The pinot noir was excellent.

They offer outdoor heating which is great for a chilly night in North Beach, San Francisco. The street setting was great, you can have intimacy as well as street entertainment such as women looking for prospective clients for the night (in a well mannered way of course) never a dull moment there.
author: Valorie E.

description: What a disappointment!  Let me say first I had to run not walk home after dinner to expel what I had ingested.  I arrived with two friends who were celebrating the last day of their honeymoon.    Though we had reservations at Original Joe's we were attracted by the outdoor seating and took a leap of faith.  Bad idea.  The heirloom tomatoes salad was rich with pithy tomatoes none of which were heirlooms that I could tell.  The eggplant appetizer clearly was made the week before.  The calamari was undercooked but the sauce was tasty.  The fish pasta was OK not great.  The Calzone was mediocre at best as it was dry.  My chicken Milanese was overcooked and the mashed potatoes that came with it were cold.  There was a lull in the service that was noticeable though the waiter was very personable.  Overall it just sucked.
author: Dew W.

description: This is the worst restaurant in all of San Francisco. Horribly undercooked chicken and airplane-quality pasta. Slow service as well. Never coming here again
author: Ummara S.

description: Great ambiance and excellent pizza's, although they were square and long, not round. They probably should have been called flatbread instead. Nevertheless, yummy food and we loved their outdoor seating.
author: Annet R.

description:
Reviewing on Drinks only! 

After walking around North Beach, my friends and I did an impromptu bar crawl. This was one of the places we stopped.  We got a few seats at the end of the bar, which was nice except it was near a closet where the wait staff kept their belongings and clocked in so we were constantly being asked "politely" to let them through.

The drinks are good! The group went with the basics of Fat Tire on tap, gin and tonic and mojitos.  I had the Mojito and it was average. The saving grace was that it was served in a huge glass!  Its nice to be pleasantly surprised with a "bigger than you would expect glass" at the same price as the small ones.
author: Vanessa L.

description: We made reservation for 7:45 on a Wednesday evening. After a five block walk from our hotel we arrived on time and were seated immediately at an outside table held for us, yeah!!  Service was prompt and the food was delicious.  Get the OUTSIDE seating, it is a scream.  Inside is good as well, the large sliding windows open to project a wall-less front.  As a side note, I left my very expensive jacket on the chair. A block away our waiter came running with it: he was not hard to miss with that big smile and white apron!  He ran back but I followed to the restaurant to insist he take $20. Well worth the prince of my unique jacket! Go here! It may be a wait on the weekend, but well worth it!
author: Kelly C.

description: The calzone offerings are wonderful. My party and I ordered three--Italian, Lasagna-style, and Filet Mignon. All were equally delicious, with the seasoning being just to our tastes. Every bite was gleeful, and sad at the same time because we were getting closer to finishing. Couple these things with a great ambience and great service, and it's an all-around satisfying experience.
author: Eric L.

description: The three stars is for the drinks and the service.  The waiter was polite and fast. We got our drinks quickly. I give the food one star. The atmosphere is great. We sat out front and enjoyed the view and people watching. I had a margarita and it was fantastic. My husband liked his iced tea. Then they served dinner....my crab Alfredo was rather tasteless and the sauce it was in was very watery.  My husband had a seafood pasta and he said it was okay but that it was average and reminded him of the quality of food you get at Denny's. My advice is to stop, have a couple of drinks and then go to dinner somewhere else.
author: Gina K.

description:
Late outdoor dining under a heat lamp gives it a cozy bistro feel while you sip on wine and people-watch in North Beach.

Their handmade fettuccine with fresh crab is to die for. I have not been able to find anything comparable. Great for dates, but awesome when you're just bored like me.
author: Candy C.

description: I just had a Dungeness Crab Pizza and it was awesome.  Clean and full taste of crab. The Pino Grigio is great!
author: Claire B.

description:
Had a late Christmas day dinner here with my family and was surprised by some aspects of Calzone's Pizza Cucina. 

My sister ordered the Basa Fish with Zucchini Mashed Potatoes and it was DELICIOUS!!! I'm not a fan of seafood, but the Basa fish was fresh and perfectly seasoned!

I shared the Crab Fettucini with my other sister and it was pretty good! The fresh fettucini pasta had a strange texture to it and the sauce was very watery.

The service however is mediocre. Although we never had to ask for a water refill, the male servers we had were unfriendly.
author: Juliette R.

description:
My sister wanted to take my boyfriend and I out to dinner, so we took a cab to North Beach and randomly chose a restaurant. Glad we chose Calzone's, cos I really enjoyed our dinner there. 

I had the crab alfredo, which was pretty good, but what I really loved was my sister's shellfish angel hair pasta! She couldn't finish it, so I took the leftovers to go and ate it this morning (yeah I'm cheap like that) and it was still delicious. I liked the texture of the pasta in both dishes, and would definitely be interested in trying out their other pastas. My boyfriend had the pepperoni pizza (he just HAS to order this at every new pizza place he goes to) and he seemed to enjoy it.

Service was good, but not spectacular or anything. The ambience/decor of the restaurant was nice though. Kind of like a mix of classy and cosy/cute.

An enjoyable dining experience overall; definitely wouldn't mind eating here again if I'm in the area!
author: Ju J.

description:
It can be difficult to get a good Italian meal in North Beach ... surprising but many places are now just for tourists, others don't really try very hard with their food and yet others are overpriced relative to the quality.  Not so at Calzone's.

We often come to Calzone's when we are in the mood for a good + very fresh Italian meal, superb service and wonderful ambiance:

- on nicer days, we sit outside (under the wonderful heat lamps on cooler days) and have a leisurely lunch.  

- inside for dinner is great for a nice unhurried meal 

This place takes care of its patrons - you are made to feel welcome and valued.  

We always have such a nice time here - the food is consistently good but the service even better ... we love the feeling we get there and that we take home with us.  We invite friends or sometimes it is just the two of us. If it's a nice day we usually bring our dogs too - the feeling is very European. 

The food is Italian with a modern twist: the ingredients are very fresh and the flavors very well done. If you go, try to eat in the Italian fashion with courses of shared dishes ... you'll get to taste more things and not be too full for dessert.  If the arugula/apple salad is on the menu, I highly recommend it ... and the crostini!

One of the best in North Beach and clearly the best terrace dining with a superb staff.  We'll be back again soon.
author: M P.

description:
I went with my parents just after Christmas 2009. I liked the restaurant and service, but I can certainly make a better calzone than the chef there. It was simply UNDERCOOKED! Stuffing was so-so. A calzone should be golden brown like pizza crust, not white! I think I should go teach that cook a lesson!

If you want to see how to make a REAL calzone find my sausage or vegetarian calzone at http://www.youtube.com/divinechef
author: Scotty P.

description:
Pretty unique place, loved it! 

The interiors are super charming... the colors, the thousand different objects in the walls, the chandeliers, everything is awesome. 

Regarding the food, you can easily start off with some garlic fries, and if you are into shrimps, try the prawns alfredo fettuccine... it's amazing.  I also had the mushroom pizza with caramelized onion, great combination. Need to go there again so I can try a dessert to suggest it here ;)
author: Gisele M.

description: Delicious. Cool atmosphere and lots of stuff to look at inside. There is outside seating as well as inside; upstairs too. I ordered the homemade raviloi and it was the bomb.( if you don't like mushrooms I would not reccomend) my boyfriend got the homemade lasagna and loved it as well. Pretty big portions and great service. I will DEFINATELY come back here:)
author: Taylor M.

description:
Tuesday: January 16, 2007. 
6:55pm, raining.  
Dinner with my drinking gal and one of her good friend.  

4-STARS for the Mojito Bar alone.  I tried the Strawberry Mojito -- refreshing, not too sweet and garnished with a sugar cane and lime.  I would definitely go back here again soon just to try the different kinds of mojitos:
- Mojito
- Melon mojito  
- Pineapple mojito  
- Strawberry mojito  
- Cuban blue mojito  
- Baja mojito (tequila)  
- Moscow mojito (vodka)

The food was great -- affordable and big portions.  We shared several dishes including the Eggplant and Seasonal Tomato Crostini sprinkled with goat cheese and vinaigrette dressing, which was an excellent choice.  The eggplant was cooked to perfection and the crostini stayed crispy.  The Popcorn Calamari rolled in seasoned semolina did not smell nor tasted fishy at all and were cut into big thick slices.  I loved the crust of the Prosciutto Pizza topped with mozzarella, red pepper oil and arugula the best.  The food was so filling that the three of us didn't even managed to finish all of it.  

Service was good and bathrooms were clean.  It's a pretty big place, seating available on the second floor and outside on the sidewalk with heaters.  The one thing I'll remember most about this place are the shelves all around against the wall filled with food items including Olive Oil, different kinds of pasta, bottles of various sizes and boxes of random stuff... very cool, indeed :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
Drove past this place place a couple times and it looked like a great North Beach Italian place.  We had gone to North Beach to go to another restaurant on a Monday night (this other place just re-opened a week prior), and I don't think they were ready for the throngs of people.  That's when we turned to trusty open table, and found Calzone's had availability in 15 minutes, the time it would take us to walk there.

We walked in and shown to our table instantly.  Its a very cute, very Italian, and kinda touristy place, but the food smelled awesome, the prices were right, and we were hungry.

After placing our order, bread arrived to the table.  It was a nice Italian loaf that was the perfect size for the two of us. My only wish was that it was warm and/or not as tough... seemed like it may have been day old? Olive oil and Balsamic vinegar was on the table already (I hate when you go to an Italian restaurant and these are not condiments set on the table).  Our appetizer of Calamari arrived quickly.  The breading on it was awesome.  The menu says semolina, but it was almost polenta/cornmeal like. A very large portion for the two of us, would have been plenty for 4.
