The cocktail sauce is a horseradish ginger sauce, that I thought would be odd, but was quiet tasty.  And for my husband who hates horseradish, he loved it.

Our entrees arrived which we split.  The peperoni pizza (because if Pizza is in your name, you gotta try it) and the gnocchetti which we got with the bolognese made with pork and beef sugo.  The gnocchetti was perfect.  Light and airy little dumplings that the sauce just sung with.  The fresh parma cheese they shaved on top table side was the perfect compliment.  The pizza was good, fantastic crust, lots of good melty mozzarella,  but my only complaint was it was the same bolognese used as the pizza sauce.  It wasn't bad, but having the same sauce on two dishes was a little much.  I would have preferred a marinara sauce to really just let the cheese and crust of the pizza shine.

Pricing was perfect, service was great, and it was the perfect little dinner in North Beach on a monday night.  They also have free refills on the diet coke, which is much needed with the carb fest we had that night!

I wanted dessert, but honestly we were too full!

-1 star for the bolognese on the pepperoni pizza and the bread not being the best.
author: David P.

description:
North Beach restaurants on Columbus are designed for tourists but that doesn't mean they can not be good. If you look pass the sidewalk tables, fobby Italian waiters, and bright neon lights, you will see they have some awesome dishes. I had the "crab" pasta which was fantastic. Nice bowl of pasta coated in a garlic scallop sauce. It was generous with large pieces of dungeness crab meat and had nice juicy roasted grape tomatoes. Combination was off the hook and I was impressed. 

Calzone is all about making customers feel comfortable, even if it is bringing a water bowl for my dog I was taking care of.
author: Ed L.

description:
Came here yesterday to celebrate my managers birthday. It's a pretty big restaurant on Broadway, you can't miss it. It's right across the street from The Stinking Rose.

I tried my first calzone. Though they had a whole list of different calzones, I got the Lasanga-Style. It was super yummy and bigger than I thought that I only ate half of it.The price is average, $14.95, not bad at all.

The only thing I don't really like about the restaurant is the interior design. I got the same feeling as I do with Bucca Di Beppo. I don't find it attractive when there's too many things on the walls, it makes me feel claustrophobic.. ehh.
author: Jessica R.

description: Great tables for two outside (there are heaters above so don't worry if it's a chilly night). Service was friendly and efficient. Food was delicious. I had a cup of the minestrone and the lasagna calzone. Will definitely come back.
author: Drew S.

description: While in San Francisco, my boyfriend and I were looking for a place to eat dinner. We were literally in a cab and found this place in Little Italy on accident. The tables outside were VERY charming with heat lamps which made it very comfortable. We ordered beers and calamari to start. I must say, it is the BEST calamari I have ever had! The sauce that came with it was MAGICAL! We then split the Fettuccini Alfredo with chicken and it was AMAZING! The service was awesome! LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Definitely our favorite meal of our 3 days in town! We'll be sure to stop by when we're in town again!
author: Gina W.

description:
YUM!

The pasta is housemade and WONDERFUL.  The Blue Cheese Alfredo rocks my world so hard. 

And everyone in our party loved the various mojiots.  

The atmosphere is SuperItalian and fun.   The calamari was just beyond delicious.

Only complaint? The garlic bread only comes with four tiny pieces per order.  No big deal except it's served on this GIANT serving dish that just seemed wrong.  Like four tiny crumbs on that great big platter.  We ordered two garlic breads for our large party and there was barely enough for everyone to try it.
author: Emily L.

description: Wonderfuly, awesome, fun place to hang with friends on extremely late nights.  Great food to munch on i.e., calamari, garlic fries, ravioli, chicken calzones, shrimp pasta, desserts/coffee.  A variety of mojitos to choose from, and each one has a sugar cane to chew on.  The outdoor seating area is a wonderful place to enjoy eye candy on a pleasant night.  The overhead heaters keep customers cozy, while eating & enjoying Northbeach.  The spot is centralized to everything else nearby, whether it's comedy at Cobb's, a taste of Brazil, Chinatown, adult entertainment, Joe Dimaggio's, clubs, live bands, more bars, and the Wharf.   Also hilarious to watch all the drunks walk by & stumble into trees, meters, & light poles!
author: Christine R.

description:
I frequent this place with the boyfriend and his family on random nights. 

I've had some pizzas, some pastas, and bite or two of the lamb. It's all better than decent. 

Service here is superb. They are quick and attentive. It's a lot better than some of the surrounding resturants.
author: Jeanette P.

description: Great dog friendly restaurant! Found them in the dog lovers companion to California book. As soon as we were seared at the outdoor table, the host brought over a bag of mixed dog treats. They then brought out a silver bowl of water. Food and service to us humans was just as awesome. Highly recommend.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
The feel is European-- at least I think so. The lighting was warm and romantic. Outside seating is available and if it is a cold night, no worries because heating is on. The food is as good as any decent Italian restaurant, so no disappointment (although considering how it looked, how it presented itself you'd think the menu would be as nice). The service was attentive and quick. It is a tourist destination area, so prep for that. Considering that it is in a tourist area the price was still reasonable. It does get pretty loud in there. The mirrors give an illusion of it being a big space but it's not, at least the first floor. Remember my comment about the selection of foods? Although it may not be what you might have expected there is something smart about a menu that does not overdo itself. 

Calzone and pasta-- seriously, it is America and it is hard to mess those things up. 

Yes, go. It's nice enough, romantic enough, and dark enough for a cute/warm date. Remember that this is where the Beat Generation of San Francisco happened, in part, so keep that in mind you will enjoy yourself. 

Full Bar.
author: Jason T.

description:
Great bruschetta. The bread was exactly the right crisp and the tomatoes on top were super fresh. 

Great atmosphere sitting outside. Perfect for a glass of wine and people watching. Make sure the day/night is warm though.

 They're also one of the few places that had decent Calzones. Recommend the Lasagne-style and the smoked chicken.
author: Yue Z.

description:
The atmosphere goes a long way here! I have come a handful of times in the past year, and love this place! The restaurant is located on a busy pedestrian street, and they have cute tables set up along the sidewalk's edge is you can enjoy the sights and sounds of the hustle bustle while enjoying some decent Italian food. 

Despite the name, Calzone's, I have yet to have a Calzone here, but my fiance loves them! He definitely would rate this a 5 star. But for me they lose a star due to a lack of variety on the menu. I am on a strict gluten free diet, so Italian can be challenging with all the breads and pasta. They do have some awesome appetizers, like the calamari and the fries! And their salad's are of decent proportion... but they lack originality. Overall, the walnut-pear salad is my favorite. 
The service is great! And the wait time is usually managable to none.

Honestly, I think the best part of this place is the location! But do note parking can be a challenge.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I can remember sitting out side Al Fresco dining on the hunter style chicken dish and sipping a red glass of whine like it was yesterday. I would love to go back.
author: Nick V.

description:
MANAGEMENT HAS THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS. IF YOU HAVE A BIG FAMILY THAT LOVES TO LAUGH THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR YOU! WE HAD OUR 80 YEAR OLD PARENTS TOO!! COME ON!


My family and I (13 total) had dinner there last night as we have for several occasions and we enjoyed 4 bottles of their wine and were laughing and having a good time. Our server asked us to keep it down! We couldn't believe it! We were doing nothing more than sharing and laughing... of course it's loud in there already so we of course had to talk louder.. could being upstairs have an inpact?? Don't know.. we asked for the manager and he was the biggest jackass ever. He told us people couldn't hear themselves.. this is not a fine dining type of place but a very loud and busy place. The food is good and the wine, but the customer service and that from the manager is terrible. Who in this day and age tells a party of 13 to keep it down? We were going to have dessert but didn't after the comment and the manager never once came up until we requested him too... he sent his wait staff to do his dirty work and then had the nerve to say he was coming up to check on how things were with us!

We will never dine here again and I'm pretty sure the rest of our large family who also enjoys the food will not either. It's not the place for a family that laughs and enjoys a good time.
author: Gele B.

description: Love the lasagne here! It's simply the best. I'm also obsessed with the crab pasta. The pasta is so thin and sauce compliments the fresh crab so well. This is always our first stop whenever we drive up to San Francisco.
author: Vivian S.

description:
When in SF, a stop-off here is an absolute must. While there may be the comfort of home in a NY slice, Calzone's commits the unthinkable: meaty marinara sauce. I don't think you heard me; allow me to reiterate: MEAT SAUCE on a pizza!!! =-O

So--w-w-w-wait--you're already eating pepperoni pizza (& I don't even eat "swine," but this is a marriage in which there will be *NO* talk of divorce)... but then (oh, then!) there's a rich, meat sauce, adding to the amazingness. Pizza-gasms? Now if that's not proof of The Resurrection, I don't know what is. Scarfing it down to the last drop, I just feel so unworthy. 

The sword in the stone, however, is the restaurant's namesake. I'm of the mind that the founder(s) settled on "Calzone's" because calling the place "perfection" would've been too cocky for SF's laid back atmos; still,  the titles are synonymous anyway. 

The crust of the calzones are nonpareil; thin and crisp, w/out being hard-crunchy. Inside, only the freshest ingredients massage your buds. The mozzarella arrives daily in shady little disguised packages that would be entirely inconspicuous if not for the "Sicily" stamp. Okay, so that part is NOT true, but it could be, & I'd believe the authenticity. The mozz isn't clumpy or stringy, just melt-on-your-tongue-a-licious.

And no one, NO ONE in the Milky Way produces an eggplant dish that makes you all fuzzy inside for the fact that you're actually eating eggplant & loving the sh*t outta' every mouthful.

Calzone's is often crowded, & there is often a wait, but wtf did you expect? GMAB. There's a line to enter the Pearly Gates; there's a line here!

Personnel are friendly & happy to make suggestions, not that you need a suggestion; choose anything: EVERYTHING is sublime. 

Uhhh... Do *not* roll into Calzone's with your last $20 as it will not take you far. Come on payday; bring the whole check; be darned proud that you have such a wholesome place at which to spend it. You *will* want to take something home, in addition to doggy-sacking  your in-dined mouthstuffs.

Put it this way: It is St. Peter's enduring wish to be on Calzones' list.
author: Kali K.

description: Excellent authentic Italian experience!  We sat on the sidewalk with the sun setting on our faces, sipped wine, and savored a piece of heaven.  The service was good; the food was incredible.  The only thing that could have made our experience better?  Nothing!  It was perfect.
author: Cameron H.

description: It used to be a great place, but now it is more of a tourist trap than an authentic North Beach spot. The last time we were there, I had Eggplant Rollatini that were absolutely inedible -- lukewarm, filled with some cold mixture of what supposed to be cheese and artichokes. When I asked the waiter if the rollatini were fresh, he said that "originally they were cold", but he assured me that they were "deep fried" before being served. Needless to say that the "deep fry" fact was not mentioned on the menu. Also the menu had no mention of a random strip of bacon that I found inside -- an interesting surprise for somebody enjoying a vegetarian dish. In the middle of a meal, some guy came over and asked us a question in a language we failed to identify and understand. We assumed that he inquired about our dining experience and, in the interest of saving each other a painful exchange, nodded enthusiastically. On the bright side: good pizza -- although the "designer" boat-like plates take all the space on the table and it is very uncomfortable to eat. Also, lovely house Sangiovese that cuts through the grease. Addio, Calzone, never again...
author: Natalya M.

description:
We made a reservation a couple of weeks in advance and confirmed a couple of days in advance for dinner July 4. We called a half hour to re-confirm and a snotty girl informed us "it is first-come first serve tonight."
You mean you will not honor a confirmed reservation? "That's right!."  The food is not that good and the slow service and bad attitude are awful.  Good luck if you choose this place.
author: Grady M.

description: Great spot for people watching as you can eat on the sidewalk.  The lighting and date like atmosphere is just right here.  Service was pretty good but food was nothing to write home about.
author: Alan R.

description: After waiting 45 min at Sotto Mare to only get treated very rudely by the older lady who runs the front desk, once before waiting 45 min and again after 45 minutes, see my review,  my friend and I decided to eat here. I haven't been here in a few years and loved it before and have to say, blessing in disguise what happened at Sotto Mare because I love this Calzone's place yet again. Too bad I wasted almost an hour waiting for Sotto Mare.  Calzone's has a way more relaxed feel which I prefer anyways. Great service right off the bat, a gentleman outside greeted us with a smile, we were quickly seated and from there the waitors treated us like gold. The calamari was our favorite part and has some deep fried jalapeno rings in it and a great dipping sauce. Definitely will be coming back soon!
author: Nise R.

description: Good ambiance, great for people watching, excellent location.  The calamari was perfection - crispy and perfectly seasoned. I highly recommend it! Also, the raspberry lemonade was delightful. This is a excellent place to go to if friends are visiting you from out of town. Plus, the prices aren't ridiculous like other restaurants in the area and the menu provides a lot of options. 3.5 stars!
author: Abena O.

description:
This is a great spot to hit up if you're in the Bay Area and you're in the mood for Italian. Went here with some girlfriends and although it was a weekend night, we were seated in reasonable time. A bit of a wait, but not that bad. 

Excellent service from the staff. We were well taken care of during dinner. I ordered a smoked salmon sandwich with wasabi which was about 6" long, but I wasn't satisfied with it since I tend to like my salmon cooked. This one was half cooked, and the wasabi was a little too strong for my liking. The bread given as an appetizer was too...hard. I like bread that's warm and moist, so I guess this type of bread just wasn't my type. Drinks were strong and tasty. If nothing else, go for the drinks.

Decor on the walls were busy but really interesting to look at. If I had my DSLR with me at the time, I would have snapped a couple photos!

Warning to the ladies: The bathroom is in an awkward location in the restaurant. It's hidden near the kitchen where staff come out. When you walk in, there is literally one stall in the "bathroom." Very tiny place, so learn how to get cozy with your fellow females!
author: Jenny B.

description:
Everyone who goes to North Beach, San Fran's "Little Italy", has to have at least one Italian meal. But mostly I loved their sidewalk tables, so great for having a drink, chilling and watching all the colorful SF characters walk by. (And thank god for the table heaters in the winter)

Calzone's isn't blow-your-mind-amazing Italian food, but it's decently priced, very tasty for what it is, and is great for people-watching. It's the atmosphere and location that brings me back time and again. The outdoor service is super slow so don't go if you're in a rush and be prepared to walk up to the bar to order your own drinks, but it makes for a nice leisurely somewhat tasty meal.
author: Carol Y.

description:
i always walk by this place and no matter day or night, there's always a bunch of people sitting outside. finally gave this try and sat outside since we've been having such nice days in SF lately.

my friend and i had the pancetta wrapped scallops, five hour pork and beef sugo pasta, and the prawns with swiss chard and red peppers pasta. the scallops were good, but so small!

maybe its my fault for not knowing what "sugo" is but it was pretty much just looked and tasted like store bought sauce mixed in with some ground beef. i enjoyed the prawns and swiss chard pasta and really liked the fresh and thick fettucine pasta. however, both pasta dishes came to us lukewarm so that was disappointing.

overall, not a place i'll recommend as a *MUST try* but i guess if you are in the area walking around and like the idea of people watching while you dine, its an alright place.
author: Katherine C.

description:
This spot is great for a date, but wouldn't suggest coming here with a group of people. 

The heated outdoor seating sounds nice in theory, but the sidewalk isn't really that big so people are walking right in front of your table the whole time and to me, it's a little weird. 

I had a lasagna calzone and although it wasn't bad at all, I can't really sit here and rant about how awesome it was either. 

This place does have some decent cocktails though. Oddly enough, they make some good Mojitos. 

I sat at the bar and the service wasn't so great, the bartenders were too busy effing around between mixing drinks for the table orders to really provide any good service for the people sitting in the bar.
author: Edgar S.

description:
Pretty delicious food for the budget!  I used to come here with my girlfriend all the time when I lived very close by North Beach.  We would get our favorate Salmon Pizza and garlic fries and shared. 

The pizza is thin, crunchy, "wood oven-ly", with yummy smoked salmon on top.  And you can't go wrong with the garlic fries.  

Pretty cool place to chill if you're on a budget.  And pick up some dessert afterward and kick it at one of those cafe on the strip of columbus!
author: Gigi T.

description:
Got placed upstairs with a big crew,
Strawberry mojito is amazing! 
No crab pasta.. Them things had a whole can of morton salt in it! Yikes! The calamari is decent.. and i don't remember the rest. Oooo. I replaced my pasta with a salad--- 0_0
author: Monika T.

description: I came here with my friends for thanksgiving and it was delicious! The ambiance was fabulous and the food was great. It was very flavorful yet light and not to heavy or greasy. I sat inside because we had a big group but it would be nice to sit outside with the heaters for a romantic date!
author: Jazeena B.

description:
No reservations? 

I spent over an hour researching restaurnats in north beach that could accomodate a large group of 15 up to 20 people for my birthday.

Most places in North Beach are small so I know it would take some research. North beach is a great location so my friends can park and after dinner we have so many choices to go after for either dancing or drinking. 

I was so excited to see Calzone Pizza took reservations (according to yelp & their own website) and is good for large groups. However when I called (over 1.5 weeks in advance) the guy on the phone asked me all the questions as if he was taking my reservation: name, date, time, number of people. Then he said oh no we Don't take reservations on Fridays & Saturdays in the evenings. I am so dissapointed :( 

this restuarant gets a 1 star for me & I don't feel like going there at all.
author: Mariana S.

description:
okay... sunday and we were too late in getting to the city in time for dinner at my favorite italian joint on green street so we walked up toward grant and encountered a waitress on a smoke break in front of her restaurant. "yeah they're all mostly closed now. try calzone's on columbus, they're open late. or maybe cafe puccini across the street."

so we walked back down grant and made a left and ended up under the red glow of the neon lights of calzone's awning.... of course, i had to ask the hostess if the food was any good as she ushered us to our table. "oh, i think it's pretty good," she smiled back.

holy cow she wasn't kidding. well, at least the scallops in pancetta with a weird cold wasabi sauce was okay. smallish scallops (with a big price) but bursting with flavor. my friend couldn't do the sauce but i did soak it up with the excellent bread they provided us.

i ordered a pizza and was surprised when this elongated object came out. but it was good (i had the roasted veggie with fontina) and it filled me up. the cracker crust was decent and the fontina cheese had a good bite... i don't remember if it had tomato sauce or not, but if not it wasn't needed at all. 

my friend ordered the lasagne and was disappointed. he asked for a side of tomato sauce because it was too dry. i didn't try his lasagne but i thought it looked pretty delicious. had a nice layer of browned cheese on top. he ended up liking it, because it was all gone in a few minutes flat!

in fact, we were so stuffed that we didn't have room for dessert. waitstaff was good humored for the most part, amicable to our silly banter, and all around us were customers that seemed to be having a good time.

sure, it's a tourist spot, one which i avoided because of just that, but in the pinch we were in, it worked out nicely. the decor is unique, lots of very clean mirrors lots and lots of glass jars and bottles and whatnot on shelves stacked waaay high up. not an especially good design move for earthquake country, perhaps, but oh well, no shaking that night.

i would definitely try calzone's again, especially if entertaining people from out of town. you can sit on the sidewalk and watch other tourists walking (or weaving) by late a night. how fun is that?
author: Dawson S.

description:
Wearing black? Bring a lint roller! Their white napkins will leave lost of fur buddies on you!

We had a long wait for this place. We requested to be seated inside. Once we got our table upstairs, it was hot and stuffy up there. Kind of like a loft area.

I ordered the Italian calzone. It was just ok. I figured I had to try one of thei calzones.

They serve you mini baguettes when you sit down. They weren't warm, which was ok because we toasting in the loft and packed in like sardines.

Overall not the most authentic Italian place in the area but had to see what it was about.

If I had to do a touristyy place in the area again, I would prefer the stinking rose.
author: Heather C.

description:
Went with 2 friends on a Friday night and we decided to share the plates. We ordered Garlic Fries, Pesto Chicken Calzone, Alfredo Chicken Pasta, and BBQ Chicken Pizza. Yeah everything was chicken xD Out of those four items, I would pick the BBQ Chicken Pizza and the Garlic Fries. They're so yummmy!! The Calzone was okay, I didn't really like the stuffing. For the Alfredo Chicken Pasta, I'm allergic to nuts and there were pine nuts in it so I kinda had an allergic reaction to it. 

We were done with our meal and then there was a blackout on half the block which included Calzone's and the restaurant next door. I think the ambiance was good and we were sitting outside. The service was great actually! They were really nice when the power went out. Helped us take pictures and wrote our checks by hand. 

Overall, it was a good dinner :)
author: Polly L.

description: Amazing service, delicious inexpensive food and wide variety of options! They even accommodated for the big group of people we had!
author: Scholastica S.

description: One of the BEST pastas I've ever eaten- and trust me, I've eaten A LOT of pasta. The atmosphere was family friendly and everyone I was with loved their food. The ice tea was amazing! It tasted flowery. I have no clue what was in it, but I was good. This was My favorite Italian place in SF and I will defiantly go back!
author: Caitlyn P.

description: This is by far one of the best restaurants, just for passing by.. Not for enjoy an afternoon, the place is cool something fast is good nice employe nice service nice food perfect, a passing by restaurant
author: Specky T.

description: The Place is nice and cozy. Staff is very friendly and the coffee was good. Nice to just hang out side on a sunday afternoon! :)
author: Joyce A.

description:
Famous producers, comedians, gays, and US.

Friends and I were craving italian today. Usually I drive thru Little Italy in SF but never have i ate here since 2004 when i went on my very first date with this guy i now avoid. Honestly, I've always wanted to eat at Calzone Pizza Cucina because it's always packed. We rolled by 4 restaurants of blocks and blocks of Italian restaurants and decided to eat here. 

For one thing, you can't come to little italy trying on a tight budget; they don't call it "Little Italy" for nothing. Since it's "rain season" in the bay, we sat inside because I wasn't trying to be bundled up, shivering under no existing heater lamp, and having random tourist point and stare at our food while walking on the damn sidewalk. 

Order:
Chicken Pesto Calzone $13 - damn it was good! best calzone i have ever had tasted in my damn life. the crust was really good. Though i wish i had ordered a salad to go with my calzone... but wasn't trying to pay for $12 some leaves with dressing. 

But i have to admit, the crowd that eats here... they were mute? maybe because they come here with their families and older people come here. we were the loudest ones there and we were really keeping as quiet as possible. but a group sat next to us and they were famous. they striked conversation with us first and they were very friendly. that i digged. 

My experience here was short and simple. Order, eat, and go. I didn't pay much attention to the service but they filled my water frequently and that i do appreciate. I did notice the bill took forever to come but they split our bill individually, which is very appreciated. 

HmmHmm calzone!!! i will be back.

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: For some reason I remember this place being a lot better, but then again I was a kid, and anything "pizza" was great. Came here for dinner the other night, and I wasn't too impressed. The lamb entree shrank a bit, I could have sworn that the lamb pieces were bigger, but to fill the plate this time around they just added more microgreens. My calzone was disappointing, because it was luke warm when it came out. However, when I brought the other half home and heated it up to eat, it was ten times better. I think they need to heat the calzone through and then serve to customers while piping hot. The pork milanese was different than what I'm normally used to, it seemed like a pork loin that has been breaded, and stuffed with cheese and pan-fried. It was still good. The cheese added a nice element.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Excellent service and food. Tastey Roasted Chicken Calzone.
author: Tom D.

description: Terrific bolognese and fresh fettucini,  Loved the whole vibe of this restaurant in a great neighborhood with lots of foot traffic and other businesses.  Friendly staff is always a plus.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Nancy L.

description: Yea man this place sucks honestly. I always pass by this place driving and I have to give them mad props for their "allure" on the outside. The neon cursive calzones sign is for the naive. And yesterday I was naive. I ordered the Philly cheese steak calzone and it was bland. No taste. No seasoning. Not to mention the middle of the calzone was luke warm and under cooked. I was hungry so I "Manned Up" and just ate it. Small glasses for water is a tease also. Don't gimme a sippy cup size glass of water lmao. Overrated overall.
author: Tareau B.

description:
Went here for Thursday lunch. I ordered a Italian Calzone and my friend ordered a salmon orzo. It was ok. The food was to the bland side. Seem healthy, well healthier than McD of course. 
The bread they given for free, its as hard as a rock. Well not that solid, but hard enough. Doesn't seem fresh bread. Well the cola taste, well, like cola. If they can make a cola bland, I think that would be a problem.
As for the atmosphere, I sat outside, not much of a view since there are cars parked up front. 

I am being generous right now for giving 3 stars. Hey, I gotta be nice to some people sometime.
author: Albert W.

description:
I loved the outdoor seating with heaters to keep you warm even when you decide to eat in the chilly San Francisco evenings.  Some of the tables are a bit on the small side but our party of 3 made it work.  We were even greeted by a local San Franciscan singing some songs for us on the street as we ate.  He played a lot of old school rock songs and was nice to show out of town visitor some of the local flavor.  

The pesto chicken calzone was affordable, filling, and was longer than the plate it was served on.  Accompanied with the popcorn calamari appetizer, and you have yourself one heck of an Italian dinner.
author: Albie F.

description: This place was OK. The best part of this place is its location..I think. I ordered one of their prosciutto pizza's and it was OK. My friends ordered the chicken Calzone and a sausage one. They were OK too. Overall, not bad but not great. Sitting outside is fun though.
author: Cat K.

description:
I'm not a fan of the ambiance here, waiters are slow and forgetful (but to be fair it is pretty busy) and it's pretty cramped quarters. On several occasions it took 20 minutes to get our check. They don't take time to go over the menu or make wine suggestions, so it's not as charming as some other north beach favorites. The outdoor seating is nice since they got the warmest heatlamps! But overall don't enjoy dining there.

However, I love getting take-out here! A thin-crust goat cheese pizza and a spinach salad go very well with a dvd and my couch... and i don't have to wait to get the bill.
author: Nikki M.

description: Way overpriced for mediocre food and bad service. The calzones themselves were $18+ and lacking. Waiters didn't bring us water throughout our meal.
author: Mark C.

description: I ate here this past Saturday. Place was really good. There is a lot to choose from in the area so I was glad that the food was good here and really happy when I found everything to be delicious. We started with Italian Pot Stickers, the sauce was delicious as well as the stickers. Then came the Seared Scallops with the wasabi, weird little combo in print but nothing weird about the taste, it was quickly gone. Yum. We ended the meal with the crab fettuccine, which was the best thing we ate that night. It was so good I wanted to move in. lol So yeah this place is solid and will make you very happy you gave it a try!
author: Paul B.

description: The food came out pretty quickly and everything I Ate tasted delicious, especially the mushroom pizza and their garlic fries. Only downside is the servers aren't too friendly.
author: Katrina V.

description:
If you ever want to renew your belly, and not break the pocket book, this is the place for getting that perfect level of pampering, peeping at the North Beach crowds, and enjoying a wonderful meal.

I have never walked away wondering, what was it I just paid for...convenience?  

Love this place, love the lamb over arugula salad, and I will always make time to come back.
author: Laura G.

description:
We went in search of perfect Italian and wine and ended up at Calzone's.   We walked up Columbus and decided that we would just find a nice looking place in the North Beach "Little Italy" section of town.  We loved the low-key ambiance and the outdoor seating (along with the wine list).

We were quickly seated in a booth and were served water while we waited for our third.  We perused the extensive wine list and decided to stick with the Italian theme each ordered a fantastic glass of red.

We also ordered some app's - cheesy garlic bread and artichokes.  Both were fantastic.  

The service was adequate but not anything special.
author: Amy B.

description: The family and friend are here last night.    The restaurant was nice.  I had the calzone and two of my friends had pizza.  We started with calamari it was very good.  We were given some really nice bread to start with but no butter.  My friends and I figured out that the oil and balsamic vinager was for the bread.  I think I nice touch would be having someone point this out and offer a plate to use for the oil and vinager.  Better yet the waiter could have placed a plate and started the oil dip off for us.  The little things make the difference between and good and great.  So now to calzone and pizza.  All ingredients  were fresh. The dough to my liking it was not a tradition dough and it seemed a little under cooked on both pizzas and the calzone.  The service was good and they were attentive.   If you are looking for traditional pizza this is not the place.  The linguine and shrimp my wife had was good.
author: Mike C.

description:
Great looking place, so we decided to try it and were glad we did.

My friend ordered a dinner salad and got more than she expected. She said that it was perfectly put together and just the right amount of dressing. I had fettucine with bolognese sauce for dinner and my only concern was that I wished the portion was bigger! It was really good and really fresh. She was also really pleased with her meal as well.
author: Richard R.

description:
Everything we ate was so good, it was like a mouth-gasm!!!!!
They also have a restaurant in L.A. too called the stinking rose
author: Aja R.

description:
Came here with two others on a LATE sunday night. We were surprised they were still open at 11pm on a sunday.

Food was just decent, nothing to rave about.

Loved the decor of the place. While you're waiting for your food,browse around and check out their walls with shelves of goods from the past!

For pictures: http://winendinesarahstyle.blogspot.com/2009/12/calzones-pizza-cucina.html
author: Sarah F.

description: Had a great time there. Love how they've decorated the interior. The were packed and managed to deliver quick delicious food
author: David R.

description: Not impressed unfortunately.  My chicken and asparagus pasta was really dry, so was the chicken itself.  Probably should have gone with something "safer" like pizza!  My husband's prawn pasta was better seasoned with more sauce.  For the price ($55 for two meals and an appetizer), I wish I would have enjoyed the food more.  Also, the water glasses were the tiniest I've ever had at a restaurant & service was on the slower side.  Too bad!
author: Vanessa S.

description: Good Italian food, however, I felt a little claustrophobic. It was crowded.
author: Savannah R.

description: Best thing about this place is the outdoor seating. The calzone was okay but I've had much better. The dungeness crab pasta was good.
author: A A.

description: Calzone's beckons with its inviting outdoor seating, romantic lighting, and perfect location in the heart of North Beach, San Francisco's Little Italy. The service is impeccable, with a team of guys who keep the water glasses full, clear the plates a moment after you've finished, and time the delivery of the food just right. With all that they do right, it's hard to believe that they get one thing wrong: the quality of the food. It's terrible! What's going on here, Calzones? I enjoyed the place so much that I came back a second time, thinking that maybe I had one bad dish, but my second experience was no better. No flavor in the sauce, bad temperature on the calzones, salty appetizers. If you can get the kitchen's act together, this could be one of the nicest restaurants in the neighborhood!
author: Johnny W.

description:
Smoked Salmon Pizza never fails!

Every time we come here, we leave safisfied. With everything: service, food, even the price.

For lunch, standwiches and pizzas are outstanding. You taste the flavor of meats and leaves and cheese and whatever else is in there rather than chewing on an inch-thick dough.

Pastas are oustanding as well: just enough of every ingredient. Not like some other places that serve a chicken alfredo with chicken practically floating in greasy alfredo sause...

Touristy or not, this restaurant makes me want to come back. And that's what I call a 'good business model.'
author: Tatyana S.

description:
Came here around 10pm (they're open till 1AM!!) on a rainy Wednesday night.

Got seated very quickly and had water and menus within seconds of sitting.  Also got a small baguette in a Calzone's paper wrapper.  Was disappointed because I was hoping a) the bread would be warm and b) there would be more than one tiny baguette for two people.  I tried to flag down the waiter but didn't see him until our appetizers came and by then I   had forgotten about the extra carbs I was so eager to consume.

Ordered the garlic fries.  The french fries themselves were delicious... crunchy, delicate, shoestring perfection with just the right amount of oil creating a tender balance of crisp and softness.  Unfortunately there was almost no garlic.  I found a little bit at the bottom but no where near my expectations.  And I thought Italian cuisine was quite fond of the stinking rose!  Did NOT like the horseradish dipping sauce.  Looked like ketchup but reminded me of something you'd eat with seafood.

I had the san daniele prosciutto (with artichoke hearts, tomatoes & mozzarella).  The crust was a little disappointing (reminiscent of pita bread) but the subtle flavours of the artichoke and tomatoes paired well with the saltiness of the prosciutto.  Was delicious as leftovers.

The service was prompt and more or less attentive.  For two people, no drinks, just fries a calzone & a pizza the total came to around $40.  Not bad for a Wednesday night out.

LOLAWESOME @ the couple dining outside, in the rain (there were heaters) watching YouTube.  Awesome.
author: Kimiko Q.

description: Stopped here with three others after a couple of drinks in the area. We sat outside  under the heaters, which was good as it was midnight. We only had coffees and desserts (1cheese cake, 2mousses & 1 T.miseau). Only one of us seemed impressed by the dessert, and the coffee was average. Not sure I'd go back and try a main, because of the quality of the dessert. Pluses- the staff were friendly & the location is great.
author: Barry O.

description:
Decent pizza with a fun atmosphere. The mojitos are solid and the outdoor seating is fun for people watching on a warm night. Service was pleasant and efficient.

The food however is nothing to write home about and is overpriced, in my opinion. I'll echo what others have said, it seems like a tourist trap with boring food.
author: Rajiv S.

description:
Ultimate tourist trap. The $5.95 garlic bread appetizer was a joke. Like 5 small pieces of bread that were barely room temperature. The lasagna wasn't too tasty but maybe it's cause I like a soupy lasagna. The pizza, again, was barely room temperature, and the sauce was so bland that it saddened me. The cheese plate was pretty good and so was their salad. They do offer pretty decent portions so that's good and there complimentary bread was pretty good too.

The service was fast but the waiter rushed us. He didn't even bother to make eye contact he had one of those handheld devices and it felt as if he was taking our order at a fast food restaurant. I would stay away from this place if possible.
author: Estee P.

description:
Always seated right away without any reservations, great design inside, cool seating outside, great size portions - if some reviewers here think they are small maybe they should take a good look at themselves in the mirror.   I love how Joanna R. gives all the positive descriptions, but then gives 3 stars because her 300 lb "boy" found his portions small ... maybe your boy would be happier at Chucky Cheese next time.

My fav here is chicken and mushroom orzo pasta as well as calamari and pot stickers for appetizers.  Just a great place to come for a drink and appetizers or a full dinner if you are hungry.  I recently decided to try something new in North Beach and was totally disappointed so definitely sticking to Calzones from now on.  You can see my recent review for a new place in North Beach which sucked big balls despite the 4 stars reviews on Yelp.  Goes to show you that yelp is far from perfect and you gotta take its reviews with grain of salt.
author: Ruslan K.

description:
Went here on Sunday, 10/12 to watch the Columbus Day Parade. In terms of location and being able to have the table saved during such an event is reason for one star.

Their Chicken and Asparagus Fettuccine and their Bloody Mary (spicy) was quite delicious, is for the second. Lastly, their calamari was yummy, which gives the third.

Minus two for having too many runners for the table. A lot of times the guys couldn't even understand me, which was annoying because just trying to get a Coke was a chore. Next, for the management not having the balls to come up to our table to inform us that outside food was a no-no (doode we were with a bunch of Italians!) and that last year's acceptance of such does not exist this year. To stand there and glare, no one was a mind reader at our table, so no one knew what he was thinking. Lastly, for the teeny tiny bathroom which has the toliet under a heat lamp. 

Would I go back? Who knows.
author: Jamie L.

description: Enjoyed a nice lunch on the sidewalk here. Calzone was excellent as was the pizza. Prices were reasonable as well.  Never saw the inside as we were served outside, but the food was very good.
author: Justin G.

description:
I saw this place from across the street and it just LOOKED like a great place to eat (lots of people sitting outside, candles... it was just cute)- so we walked across and got seated outside right away :)
LIKES:
-has outdoor heaters
-generous servings of wine- I had a glass of the red zin, it paired well with my dinner
-AMAZING lasagna! (Sorry vegetarians, it's made with meat sauce)

DISLIKES: It was hard to find street parking on a Tuesday evening at 9pm, but it's SF... oh well, it made for a nice walk afterwards :)
author: Selena M.

description: Overall not impressive. My friends and I thought that we were in war ravaged Europe with the way they were rationing out  minuscule pieces of bread. Even the glasses of water were rationed! They were about half the size of regular glasses The rest of the food was pretty bland. Nothing spectacular, no fireworks. The only bright spot was the service. It was above average.
author: Dirk C.

description: Just ok. Nice sidewalk seating if the weather is nice enough. Decent sounding menu. Calamari is decent, not amazing, but I'd order it again. I ordered a chicken pesto calzone, which was quite bland and tasteless. Sad, considering the namesake. My wife had crab linguini which was good but oily. Lasagna was quite tasty. Overall ok food, but not stellar.
author: Mike P.

description: BOOM! Chicken Ravioli with Rosemary... to die for! I don't usually order ravioli, but this looked light and tasty... oh and was it ever! The bruchetta was a nice snack before we received our lunch and the cocktails were pretty tasty too! Slide in for lunch on a beautiful day in the city.. you'll thoroughly enjoy it!
author: Kathie R.

description:
Excellent calzones!

I've been here twice now and simply adore the lasagna calzone. It's the perfect ratio of meat, cheese, sauce, and bread. Tried the garlic bread both with and without cheese, not the best. I wouldn't bother with an appetizer again, just go straight to the calzoney goodness\. Wonderful to sit outside in the rain under the heaters, too!
author: Ayleen D.

description: I'm not a huge fan of pizza, unless I'm in Italy, but I must say that the pizza here was pretty darn good. Super thin crust (which I like), great flavor, totally hit the spot. We ordered a side of marinara sauce that I put on top of my margarita pizza, which made it that much better. The customer service was great! My significant other ordered a calzone, which was good, although a bit different than I'm use to -  very thin crust, and rather crispy. Overall, pretty decent place.
author: Mandi C.

description: I've rarely had a bad experience at any Italian-related restaurants. I can't really see how restaurants can mess up on pasta (unless you are ordering from Pizza Hut). Then again, the name of this restaurant is Calzone's Pizza Cucina. I shouldn't have expected that the seafood pasta or the lasagna would be decent here. Perhaps I should have ordered calzone or pizza. Either way, this rating is for the seafood pasta and lasagna. The pasta was so bland and it was so difficult to eat. I couldn't even finish half of the plate. The lasagna tasted like the kind you buy from the grocery store and microwave. It was a bit better than the pasta but it was not worth paying over $10 for. I don't believe I'd come back. On a positive note, the outdoor seating looks really lovely.
author: Julie H.

description:
the food was good, but the ambiance is even better. this place has always caught my eye because of their very european vibe and outdoor seating. they've even got the same kind of chairs that line the streets of paris. the lighting is fab and super inviting.

i finally tried this place while driving around looking for a place that was open for dinner on a monday night after 11pm. much to our dismay, there wasn't much that was open. we decided to try north beach and came across calzone's which seemed to be the only place serving food still. they've got everything you'd imagine an italian place to have on their pretty extensive menu. if i'm ever in need of a late-night spot in the city, i'll check out calzones.
author: Mandy A.

description:
this place is a total tourist trap, for all you sucker tourists.  We had their ceaser salad & pizza.  First off the food is served on these little square plates, that didn't much appeal to me. The pizza was served precut and arranged like a rectangle on a long plate and tasted like it has been sitting under a heat lamp.  I'll never go back to this restaurant no matter how many out of town relatives tell me it looks cute.

p.s. the fact that this restaurant is at a 3.5 star rating at the moment makes me question the positive ratings of other restaurants on yelp.
author: Spencer W.

description:
II had an enjoyable time =) 

 had the chicken & mushroom orzo. It was good, I thought it was a bit cheesy because I realized that I was more in the mood for something lighter. 

My friends had pizzas and calzone. I thought it looked puny for it's price. 

The bartenders are super cool though!

I'll come back again to try other dishes and the garlic fries.
author: Mandy D.

description:
Meh. That's literally how I'd describe it. 

It's crowded so that's gotta mean it's popular right??

The place serves everything but Italian food. I mean, it's like Applebee's, CPK, Bucca di Beppo all in one. There's just too much going on here.

Bread? Should never be served in a paper bag unless it's to go. 

A mocha shouldn't be served in a 22 oz. Tom Collins mug tasting like a Swiss Miss with artificial Reddi Whip to accompany it either. 

$7 for garlic fries are only acceptable if at AT&T Park and even then, it's a bit pricey. They're just fries people. 

Seems like a tourist trap has found a niche in North Beach.
author: Jessica K.

description: Good food & not badly priced for the area. Was very busy so clearly people like it. Tables outside & in with beautiful mosaic tables outdoors. Nice decor inside with authentic Italian goods stacked up on the walls to the Ceiling. Wine list good. Staff attentive.
author: Madison S.

description: Food just meh...bland and nothing special. Good people watching. Save yourself $, enjoy a glass of wine and the view and eat somewhere else.
author: Jen E.

description: I was here with my brother and my brother in law and my son and it was delicious. We ordered the Italian calzone and roasted balsamic eggplant calzone and my son got a bowl of pasta with butter and cheese. The pasta tasted really fresh. The eggplant calzone was really delicious. the Italian calzone was also really delicious but it was very salty. I liked the eggplant one better. The service was great also. our waiter was very quick and polite. I will go back again. I really enjoy this restaurant.
author: Lisa B.

description:
I've had two meals at Calzone's and both were what I would describe as "adequate." Neither was remarkable in any way, and both visits took place before I moved to the neighborhood. Having lived in North Beach for six years, I find it difficult to eat here since their sidewalk tables are such an affront to the community. I pity the servers who have to work on the sidewalk and I wonder why anyone would want to eat in the middle of a neighborhood thoroughfare that makes no accommodations for the pedestrian traffic of a living city. 

The layout of the sidewalk seating at Calzone's gives the impression that the restaurant's owners are not "city people," but are happy to give an faux-authentic cafe experience to tourists, no matter how inconvenient the experience. 

While the meals are inoffensive and the service is capable, there are so many other places to have a terrific meal in North Beach, it's worth it to bypass Calzone's if only to suggest to the owners that they should get their tables off the sidewalk and out of our way.
author: West R.

description:
Some friends and I went here for a late dinner the other night and my review lands right in the middle. 

On the plus side, the recommendations the waiter gave for the proscuitto pizza and the tiramisu were spot on. The pizza had an incredible crust and I am hungry just thinking about it. And the tiramisu was probably one of the top 3 I've ever eaten--you will not regret it! We also got the arugula salad which was enjoyable if not terribly memorable. 

The low points were the spaghetti, which was pretty basic, and the artichoke appetizer which was pretty oily and woody at the same time. I think this was a combination of an un-ripened artichoke and poor preparation. The service could also only be qualified as decent. We had to flag down our waiter every time we needed something. 

As another reviewer mentioned: ORDER THE PIZZA and you will not be disappointed!
author: Emily B.

description: I love this place! We always ask to be sat on the 2nd floor, because it is more quiet and cosy over there. The service is  always great and the food is delicious. Their Mojito is awesome!  =]
author: Olga B.

description: This place is OK.  They don't really consistently pick a theme, the decor is sort of happening but also sort of sterile, it's strange.  But the food was decent and the prices were reasonable for the area.  A good casual option in North Beach
author: Mike L.

description: Great place for a sunny day. Sit streetside, have a delicious beer and enjoy the amazing pizza and salads here. Great spot. Everything was great here, and i will definitely go back!
author: Michael A.

description: I am definitely a FAN! From their moscow mojitos to calamari to their rum cake, it is absolutely delicious! Love coming here to sit on the outside patio under the heat laps and people watch as I sip on a yummy mojito!
author: Karina A.

description: It was so nice to sit outside under the heaters...have a nice glass of wine...enjoy your company and watch the city life.  The calimari was great.
author: Jaclyn T.

description: Finally a 5 star review. This place was amazing. I had the seafood pasta which had clams, shrimp, mussels, in a spicy garlic red sauce over angel hair pasta. It was incredible. There were 6 of us in the party but after SEVERAL great drinks, I don't remember what everybody else ordered. Everybody had something different and EVERYBODY raved about the food.
author: Sal P.

description:
I went last night for dinner on a whim.  My dinner was amazing.  I ordered the gnocchi and it came in just the right amount of tomato cream sauce.  The sauce had sweet bits of tomato and slivers of fresh basil and just the right amount of cream to make the sauce pink, but not so much that it mad it heavy.  And the gnocchi were fantastic!  They were like light little clouds of potato.  

The only draw back of the night was the drunk girl at the next table over screeching about her trip to Vegas.  My date and I gave up on trying to talk because nobody could hear over her.  I wish the staff had asked her to keep it down because it was excessive and this isn't a bar.

This place was great though.  I would definitely go back, but sit outside next time.
author: Julie U.

description: This place has one of the best calzone's i've had in my life!!!! The dough was superb and so was the service. I would definitely come here again!
author: Mertani G.

description:
The food came out from the kitchen really really fast.
We ordered: 

Calamari
Pesto Chicken Calzone
Smoked Salmon Pizza
Fresh Tomato Salad
Chicken Asparagus Pasta
And some other pasta. 

Food was good but not 5 stars worthy.
Best dishes were probably the smoked salmon pizza and the fresh tomato salad.

Atmosphere was great and had a great experince.
Would come back here again
author: Jerry L.

description:
Note to self : When you go to a pizza place, EAT THE PIZZA!

I decided to order their Roast Chicken instead, since i was tryin' to be all healthy, but ALAS, it was the most lifeless chicken I have ever tasted.  No amount of salt or pepper could save the dish.  It was a pretty crumby lunch to tell you the truth.  Other than the Strawberry Mojito and their Garlic Fries, it was mediorce at best.  And it was pricey too.  But, i guess that's North Beach for you.
author: gEe C.

description:
Two years ago I would have agreed with most of the reviews on here. The food was always generally good from what I remember.

My long withdrawl from Calzone's ended this past weekend when I stopped by with a party of 10. Out of the ten of us, no one could rave about their food. My lasagna calzone was quite flavorless and the pasta someone else had was downright bland. The chef gave the table a round of complimentary bread that were on the brink of being stale.

The ambiance at Calzone's is great, but I can't say the same for the food. As a previous yelper had said, Calzone's menu is simply fast food bistro. My reccomendation for them is to shorten their menu and make the dishes they serve more exceptional. Really, at least their calzone should be mind blowing or they should just change their name.
author: Bruce M.

description: Service was decent, food was really good, very nice view outside and good ambiance.
author: Sean M.

description: Great service. Crab bisque was delicate and flavorful, and the Pan-Seared Scallops were perfect. Pizza has a thin, crispy crust that is awesome. Just a great place on a sunny day to sit outside and people-watch!
author: Robyn W.

description: Delicious crab Alfredo! Second time visiting this restaurant and I will definitely be returning.
author: Ashley M.

description: There might be better Italian food out there, especially in North Beach, but the food is pretty good and if you sit outside the people watching is even better. Great service too.
author: a f.

description: Service was terrible we were seated then the Matradee  unseated us and was a total terd  about it will never go back !!!
author: Brandon L.

description: We went to this restaurant yesterday and it can only be described as a disaster from the moment we arrived!  Waiting staff very welcoming, not a smile or a friendly greeting.   I only wanted a starter and was unaware it was cold.  Could not eat it but was still charged!  No bread on table either.  Never be back.  As a visitor to this wonderful city it was not a good reflection on the hospitality industry!  Overpriced and not worth a second try.
author: Carol F.

description: I still love this place.  Had an amazing ragout and the BF had this delish orzo dish a few weeks ago.   Love love love the calamari!   Service was a little slow that night, but they were super slammed.
author: Samanta V.

description:
My mom owns the art gallery a couple of doors down from here, so on occasion my parents ask me to work on the weekends when they both have something to do. Last weekend I was alone in the gallery on Saturday and figured this place would be a good option for something i could call in and pick up without having to leave the gallery closed for more than a couple of minutes. 

Based on the reviews, I ordered the prosciutto and artichoke pizza. It was okay. It wasn't anything fantastic, and it's definitely not something I would order again... 

If I were to ever go back to Calzone's it would probably be to sit out front and people watch and maybe share an appetizer or something that comes with low expectations...

of course, a new place called Colosso (sp?) just opened a few more door down the block that also has heated outdoor seating, and the atmosphere looks 10x's more inviting... so i'm not sure i'll find myself with a reason to come back to Calzone's at all...
author: tina p.

description:
Hands down the best lasagna in San Francisco! It's homemade and melts in your mouth! The calzones are pretty amazing too.

The restaurant itself is lively and large. Even though it's a popular restaurant, I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes to be seated. They have an outdoor seating area with heaters which is fun for people watching. 

Love this place!!!
author: Terry K.

description:
Every time I go to Calzone's I always have a good time.  Sure it's touristy, but who cares when you can people watch all day?  The food is not outstanding, but the portions are large and everything tastes good with some beer or wine to wash it down.

I recently brought one of my colleagues from China here and we just sat at one of the tables outside for over an hour just talking and drinking and watching the crowds walk by.  I ordered a prosecco but I think they just gave me a cheap chardonnay.  The garlic fries and calamari portions are huge and more than enough for two people, unless you're the size of a linebacker.  The service is friendly and they don't try to push you out despite the crowds that gather waiting for tables outside.

I will keep bringing my friends from out of town here because it's entertaining to people-watch, the food is reliably good, and service is efficient and friendly.
author: Rosella S.

description:
I came here about a month ago. 

That pork scaloppini was scrumptious. Try it.
author: C. Z.

description: Always a great choice in North Beach - for lunch, dinner, late night dining. A little bit of everything for everybody. Never had a bad meal here and I've tried so many things on the menu. Also great for stopping for a drink to people watch in the bar!
author: G K.

description:
I'll keep this review short and sweet.

- Pomodorro is decent, with the tomatoes/basil/garlic remaining in full form rather than minced.
- Bruschetta is extremely flavorful...but very small in portion.
- Thin crust pizza is PERFECT.
author: August A.

description:
We ordered chicken ravioli last Monday evening.  The filling had the texture of sawdust, taste hard to define.  Was it finely ground chicken?  Why would they do that?   Overpriced to boot.  Pretty bad.  I did not want to make a scene in front of our out-of-town guest, so said nothing.

Maybe I do not understand Italian cuisine, and am happy to hear Calzone's side of the story if they wish to respond.
author: L S.

description:
So, it looked to me like a tourist trap and maybe it is, but the food pleasantly surprised me with its quality, freshness, and flavor. It reminded me of the authentic Italian places I've been to in North Beach. Yes, the calzones are good. But the kicker is, so are other items on the menu (like the lasagna...yum!). We also ordered the calamari, which was light and crispy, not overly breaded and/or spiced. It was really very good. Service was good and we didn't have to wait for a table on a Saturday during peak lunch hour.  

I will say that the bread they bring out to start with is not impressive...cold, hard little loaf in a little paper bag. But what's with people complaining about not giving plates to mix oil and vinegar? There were bread plates waiting for us at the table when we sat down. 

I would come back here again, but alas, so many awesome restaurants in north beach...so little time!
author: Kristen S.

description: The food is okay, nothing special, However it is not fair to say that about everything as their menu is extensive and I'm sure there are items on there that are really good. The place is to crowed and I'm guessing it's due to tourist in the area. The drinks are horrible, do not order the speciality drinks, stick to beer or wine. Plus if you sit upstairs be prepared to be toasty, you'll feel like a Calzone yourself when you walk out of there.
author: Lannette G.

description: Worst Italian on the block. The waiters don't even know the basics of serving tables. We had to ask for a bread ( to have with olive oil and vinegar). The bread was brought to the table not in a plate, but in a brown bag! We also had to ask for crated cheese. The chicken in the pasta was horrible, almost on the verge of decay and full of disgusting little bones. Stay away from this place.
author: Ramoun M.

description:
Fast service, busy, crowded, noisy but vivid
Food ok
author: Ronnie A.

description: I wish I knew how the food taste here but I never got the chance to try it. I was really looking forward to eating here. I'm new to the North Beach area and this restaurant looked like a nice place to have lunch, I walked in and stood there for like 5 minutes and no service. I finally asked a lady how they work, do I sit any where or do they seat the customer. So she told I could sit any where. I sat down and looked at the menu. I waited for service, waited, waited and waited........ No body came to my table. The waiters walked pass me over and over again and they just ignore me. I got up and toll the lady who by the way is not a server she just serve water I told her its too bad I didn't get any service. She said your waiter is outside taking pictures of customers. I looked out and there was my server taking pictures. Wow! I left this place. THERE IS NO SERVICE AT ALL. SUPER BADDDDDDD
author: Glenda P.

description:
Nothing too special about this place. They have outdoor seating which makes a great spot to people watch. It's a bit touristy for you SFers so beware.

We didn't get a calzone but got pastas instead. We had the prawn pasta and chicken one. Both tasted really fresh and healthy but just didn't have that extra kick of flavor. 

Yes, like everyone said, they don't give you a plate to mix your olive oil and balsamic..and the service was ehh--took forever to get a second glass of water
author: Joy A.

description:
I came here with two friends on Halloween when our other dinner plans fell through and it was great! It was packed, but we got seated right away at a cute little table (not that big) but it was comfortable (I did notice outside seating with heat lamps, which looked cozy!).

 The waiters were very nice and prompt, we got our food super fast! I never had to ask for my drink to be refilled. I had the chicken alfredo ($14.75) and it was FABULOUS... no joke, it's probably the best I've ever had; I would not share this plate though, it's only big enough for one person. My friends and I also shared the vegetable pizza, which I would recommend as well:) 

I've only been there once, but I would recommend it to anyone who might be wondering around North Beach and wants to get GOOD Italian food. Yes, it's a bit touristy, but it's all part of the experience. I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit!
author: Samantha C.

description: I love dining outside and it's seven better in North Beach because it's so charming and cute; also it's fun to people watch! We came here on a Saturday and didn't have to wait too long before we were seated, also there's a small bar area where you can sit and have a drink while you wait. We ordered the vegetable salad which had mushrooms, bell pepper, and eggplant and a pizza which had dungeness crab avocado, onions & fontina- everything was very good, except for the baguette they served, but we didn't need it anyways since the pizza was pretty filling. I highly recommend this place!
author: Natalie M.

description:
I've eaten 15-20 meals here and I usually order the same thing. Now that could either mean A. I'm boring and need to get out more or B. What I order is just THAT good.

My boyfriend and I met here 2 years ago so it sort of holds a special place in my heart. When we come here we usually order the lasagna and the lasagna calzone and split them.

The lasagna is so amazing and I crave it all the time. There are lot's of layers and they are so thin that it just MELTS in your mouth. The calzones are huge and delicious, I especially love the crust on the outside. The mojitos are really really good as well but my FAVORITE part of the restaurant is the heated outdoor seating. It's romantic and perfect for people watching.

Definitely one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Meagan R.

description: Limited menu, boring options. Ive had better chicken alfredo at Olive Garden, seriously.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
A group of friends and I, tired after a day of shopping and exploring the city, ate here for dinner. It was kind of packed, and we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. It was definitely worth the wait. The pasta I had was awesome. I forget the name of it, but it's the pasta that looks like rice but really isn't. The calzones here were delicious as well, but I think the highlight of my night was the thin crust margarita pizza. It sort of tastes like bruschetta, but it's definitely worth a shot if you're here. 

The decor is nice, and the service was good. There was some nice outdoor seating on the sidewalk, and the bathrooms were clean, especially for a place so busy. But beware, there may not be much arm space for you to move around, it was really crowded(not so much with people, but the way the tables are set up against the wall) Anticipate a wait for dinner!
author: Yong L.

description:
This would be a cute place for a date night or a date lunch! I came here for a date night, and it was very satisfying. 

First off, the seating. You have an option to sit inside or outside. Originally, we opted for the outside seats. It was a nice sunny day in San Francisco, so why not? A few minutes in, we realised why not... The wind picked up, and it made it harder to enjoy the meal. Luckily, the workers were kind enough to let us switch to the indoor seats. (If you do go on a very good day, I highly recommend sitting outside. The experience should be quite different ... and it's pretty cute.) Inside, I couldn't help but adore their decor. It's very interesting, and the mirrors make it seem like it's a larger place.

The food was very good. My boyfriend ordered the chicken pesto calzone, and I ordered lamb. He loved the calzone, and so did I. It was very good, the moment you cut it open, you're simply bombarded with the smell. Simply delicious! In my opinion, it is very heavy, but he managed to eat the whole thing ... The lamb was delicious. What shocked me was that it didn't have that heavy lamb flavour that most people aren't too fond of. The sauce was good, and I liked the green, though it had a strange aftertaste ... but that's just my preference. 

Overall, good service (depending on who you get), and great food! (: I'd love to come back here again.
author: Bianca W.

description: The staff were really attentive and very friendly.  The only reason I give 3 stars is because the food was just so-so.  My fiancee ordered the rocket arugula salad, which had no flavor at all.  You couldn't taste the dressing and the artichoke hearts had no flavor.  My pesto chicken calzone was good, nothing special.  The atmosphere was great and the restaurant had a good vibe to it.  Will be back just for the outside seating and a couple drinks, but not for the food.
author: Chad N.

description:
Its okay.  Would I come back...ehhh, there's a zillion other Italian restaurants to try in north beach.  

The host was great, seated us immediately and gave us the menus.  The waiter was nowhere to be seen for a good, solid 15 mins.  We would have appreciated even a "I'm finishing up over here, I'll be right with you!"  The busboy was quick with the water and bread, and then refilling water and removing plates. However, the ordering food/receiving food turn-around was amazing! We received our food so fast, which compensated for the slow start!

On to the food, I had the Italian calzone which was very good.  It had artichoke hearts, salami, another kind of meat, tomatoes and mozzarella.  The three other people in may party agreed that they should have ordered a calzone.  The other people were satisfied with the pasta dishes but, all agreed that they were missing something.  Definitely go for the calzone.  

The decor is awesome, lots of Italian products line the walls.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Atmosphere: great spot for people watching if you only have two people, the table is a decent size so it doesn't feel crowded once your food arrives

Food: Meh, the calamari wasn't very good, kind of mushy and the sauce it came with was way too sweet, the crab melt was lacking in crab and wasn't open-faced as most "melts" are

Value: food is not worth the price

Service: fast and attentive, but the service can't save bad food

Overall: if I wanted to have a drink and people watch I'd come back... I wouldn't order any food though
author: Emily C.

description:
To start it off on a good note I had my boyfriend's 29th birthday here a year ago it was a party of 20 or so I made reservations and they were very nice about me calling to change the number of people a couple of times. The dinner was great! Everyone seemed to enjoy everything and the crab pasta that I ordered was the best I've ever had. That is saying a lot because I love crab and am very picky about it.

Now a year later for my 25th birthday I thought back to the wonderful time we had for his birthday and decided that I wanted the same for me (also dreaming about the great crab pasta). So, I call to get the same thing, table for 20 give or take a few. The woman on the phone told me they no longer take that big of a party after 5pm! Nooooo! I'm so upset about it. I was so excited for so long only to get turned away. In times like these I don't think its best to be changing policies in such a way that people can't spend their money at your place of business; I can't call people and tell them they can't come to my birthday dinner just so I can eat there, thats extremely rude. 

All in all I can't say the food or service is bad but I can say that because of this new found policy my birthday will suffer and for that Calzone's, two stars for you!
author: Jenelle C.

description: I went to Calzone's after catching the 6:30 pm Beach Blanket Babylon show and afterwards went to Calzone's for dinner. I ordered the salmon in the lemon butter caper sauce with the tomatoes, black olives & asparagus on the side, my hubby had the salmon too. We both found the salmon to be overdone and dry and some of the tomatoes on my plate tasted a bit mushy and rotten. A lot of the reviews I've read for this joint seem to be reviewing the alcoholic beverages. Maybe I should have one first and the food would have been better?????
author: K A.

description:
My wife and I were walking around North Beach trying to find somewhere for lunch and due to the fact that many of the higher rated restaurants are closed for lunch we decided to try Calzone's. When we arrived we were able to find a nice table outside which was great because it was a beautiful day in the city. If you like to people watch the outside seating is the best thing this place has going for it.

As for the food, we ordered the pancetta wrapped scallops in a wasabi aioli as an appetizer and neither of us were thrilled. My wife ordered a pizza margherita which she said was bland and tasteless and I ordered the Italian calzone which was pretty good. It was stuffed with artichoke hearts, mortadella, salame, and cheese. Drinks were fairly priced with beers on tap for about $5.

All in all this is just an ok place to eat. The service was ok, food was ok, and the price was ok. It won't knock you're socks off and there are definitely better places to eat in North Beach.
author: Jeff V.

description: Amazing pizza and nice waiters. This place also kept us warm on a cold new years night
author: Anthony T.

description: Looks romantic when passing by but not the best. Only been here 3 times. Can't remember the first. The second time I asked for bread and butter and got a hard cold piece of bread with a half of stick of butter that I could of got myself from home or Safeway. Third time I got a glass of water and there was food stuck to my glass. The food was bland and boring. All the workers look like duh....not to be mean but like if they don't know what's going on.
author: Lady L.

description:
I've come here twice for dinner. The first time, I enjoyed some really good pizza. Great, thin crust. This time, I had Broccolini-- a pasta dish with pappardelle, broccolini, tomato, pine nuts, and red pepper oil. It was a bit too oily for me, but I love pasta with lots of veggies and they were generous with the veggies. 

Service was great. The seating was kind of crowded and tight (we sat downstairs towards one of the ends of the restaurant), so this place is better recommended for small groups or couples.
author: Karen W.

description:
LOVE IT!

This is my spot when I want something hot, tasty and awesome to eat but there's nothing good open in the East Bay at 11pm on a Tuesday night.  I will take my butt all the way to SF (cuz there's no traffic)  just for their yummy calzones and mojitos.  Oh yes...I said it...mojitos.  I'm especially fond of the pineapple ones. =)  

Plus great outdoor seating heated from overhead makes for great people watching.  Just ask the guy who's been there EVERY SINGLE TIME I've been there on the netbook with the calico cat on his lap.
author: Angela N.

description: I love this place. I live in SF. The food is quality! The ambiance is awesome!  Calzone's has that Italian Piazza outdoor feel to dinning there! I'm Dinning there tonight after a show downtown. Their late night hours are a blessing to us that live here in SF. Having a quality fun place to eat after a show, is like the chocolate on your cannoli. Andre I've read your replays to all the post, it's great to know your keep up with your clientele. I'm a very happy patron. I love suggesting Calzones to my friends. Great culinary delight. Keep up the faboulous food & service!
author: Linda L.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant in North Beach. I always bring my good friends and my special person to dine at this place. 

This restaurant always catches my eye with its big red romantic sign right in the corner of broadway & columbus. You can always see that the tables are always filled with people. Try to sit out door to watch various unique passerby while you enjoy your dinner. (don't worry about being too cold to sit outside since they have very effective heat lamps above you!)

Anyway, even though they don't have a lot of variety of food but the food is very good. Try it's orzo and tilapia. Yummm!!! I always come back for those dishes.
author: Reyner T.

description: Great food and wonderful service on a beautiful Saturday afternoon.   We were seated quickly and our server (Rigoberto) got the entire order correct without writing it down.  Would recommend the Calzone burger sandwich and Margarita Pizza.  Will be back again...our favorite spot in North Beach to eat!
author: John V.

description:
I ordered the arugula salad.  There was definitely a lot of arugula salad, but I would have appreciated more artichoke and cheese in my salad.  The salad was okay.  I think it's kind of peculiar that they serve bread in a bag as opposed to a basket since we were eating in?

Maybe my friends and I weren't the brightest, but we came in under the assumption that the pizzas on the menu were for large groups, but instead the prices were for personal pan size...
author: Rona H.

description:
On a nice Sunday evening we were seated at one of the outside tables at Calazone's.  They have heaters over the table, so it was comfortable despite the summer evening weather :) 

Dinner consisted of Organic Beet salad, Shell fish angle hair pasta, and Swiss Chard Calzone.

I started off with the Blue Cuban Mojito.  Nice.

The Beet salad had colorful red and yellow beets (yellow?).  It tasted wonderful.  The Chard Calazone was flavorful with nicely sauted sweet unions.  The Shel fish pasta dish was good, but not memorable.

We topped it off with Tiramisu.  I thought it was a very good tiramisu, I am glad we had it.

All in all I think that the company and watching the people walk by were certainly the highlights.
author: Paul W.

description: Get the italian potstickers!  Get them.  Get them. Get them.  They are so good, we have actually driven many miles out of our way just for these.  Their fettucine and orzo dishes also really good.  Sit on the sidewalk and "people watch".  I have been there a few times a year for about 6 years and always good.
author: Joe T.

description: Wow!  When my non-foodie sister recomended a place called calzones i was expecting a place with bad pizza, calzone, and cheap wine.  Boy was I in for a surprise.  The pizza and calzone were great and they had pasta and meat entrees.  My pork scalopinni was incredible and my wifes salmon was just as good.  The wine menu was extensive and they had a full bar. I wanted to to back during our weekend stay but didn't have time.  Will definetely be back next time we are in san fran.
author: Mark R.

description:
love love love the fritto misto -- perfectly cooked, includes slices of lemon, outdoor seating.  Also, *huge* fan of the crab alfredo.  The italian potstickers didn't work for me.

I work next door at the Mercato (http://goo.gl/zHQjp) and I have to resist the urge to just eat here every day.
author: adam s.
