description: I didn't love this place. The pasta dishes were alright but kinda dry. Luckily, I was able to have two different entrees since I had hair in my first dish. I told the waiter and he came back to tell me the hair didn't match any of the chef's hair so it must have been mine. That was rude and annoying. The customer should always be right. Anyways, it wasn't anything special. I did feel like I was biting into a brick when i tried the bread so that was a bummer as well.
author: Kelly H.

description:
I went here recently for lunch with the boy.
We ordered appetizers (Italian Pot Stickers and Garlic Bread with Smoked Mozzarella.) A++ for the garlic bread!
I ordered a veggie sandwich which I LOVED!!! It consisted of:
roasted mushrooms, eggplant bell peppers, artichoke
humboldt fog goat cheese & mozzarella.
They give you a choice of soup, salad or fries If my memory serves me correctly. 
Everything tasted so good with little taste explosions in my mouth!
Decent service. We were greeted right away. They give you great bread in a convenient bag to take away if you don't want to eat it right there (or you don't finish it) 
I only wish the portions were bigger. He ordered lasagna and it wasn't enough for him, but he does like to eat a lot! He also really loved the Italian pot stickers. 
I would like to go back and try their calzones and their wine selection!
author: joanna r.

description:
A solid three stars for Calzone's.

I got their orzo w/ mushrooms and chicken, mostly because I have a huge box of orzo at home and needed some inspiration on how to get through it.  Theirs was pretty good, though perhaps a bit bland (nothing a little salt and pepper couldn't fix to my liking).  It came nice and cheesy, which I love.

Friends ordered the salmon (he said it was amazing) and a sandwich+salad (she also enjoyed it very much).

The outdoor seating (plus heating) is great and the servers were very attentive.  

This place gets a solid three stars because the food is good but not mind-blowing.  I'm sure I"ll be back here at some point, but with so many other Italian places that I've yet to try in North Beach, it may be awhile before I eat here again.
author: Naoko M.

description: Made a reservation for a large group through OpenTable. Restaurant called us two hours before our reservation to let us know that they got too many reservations so they can't accommodate us. Isn't the whole point of a reservation to keep them from making other reservations? Bad business.
author: Teny S.

description: We were really hungry when we sat down for lunch here. The lasagna style calzone was expertly made and presented. It was also huge and could easily have fed two people. The angel hair pasta with tomatoes was not flavorful. Stick with their house specialties. During a second dinner, we sat inside and enjoyed some more of the calzones. My marinated eggplant one was great.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Just was here last night, definitely a plus for how quickly we sat on a saturday night. drove around looking for a spot for 30+ but that didnt work out so we finally decided on a garage. got up there and the place looks packed, but the 3 of us were sat immediately. Everything was super speady (except the check oddly) we parked at 1145. seated by 1150. appetizer came at 1155, we got cheesy garlic bread. nothing special and is really probably only for two to split. food came just before midnight and we were done eating by 1210. crazy fast! good thing since we were starving, but probably not a good thing if you want to take your time and have a nice relaxed meal.

seating is all pretty squished. mainly just a bunch of small 4-people tables and i dont know if they've notice but their plating is so large the table's space quickly runs out! not that serious though. 

food was decent. not really anything special, and kinda pricey. each entree is between $15-20 basically. didnt see anything cheaper, and im sure the more seafoody items were priced a little higher. we got the pesto calzone, which is like a foot long but pretty skinny, i shared w someone else and was still hungry. my mom got some spaghetti w tomato sauce, which had little sauce and was a pretty small serving for being around $16. it was ok. the place is definitely entertaining to the eyes though. :) happy eating.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Call me a cheese- ball but this is my FAVORITE pasta place in the city.  The atmosphere on a warm summer night is amazing and I am transported back to Europe immediately. Hands down the freshest pasta and delicate sauces partnered with great wine at an excellent price. Like their namesake the calzone's are delightful, but I always lean towards the crab alfredo with artichoke hearts. Sit outside on a nice night and have a mojito. Its the kind of place that makes you say "life is not that bad". About $40 for two people.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Maybe I've been spoiled by the living on the East Coast, where the Italian food is just so much better, but when I ate here last week with some friends, I thought the food was pretty mediocre.  My sister and I split the Fuji Apples salad, which was fine but nothing special.  I had the gnocchetti with the basil and garlic tomato sauce, and it was really not very good.  The gnocchi didn't melt in my mouth like good gnocchi should, and the sauce was even less impressive--I certainly tasted mostly tomato and very little basil or garlic.

The mojito was good, though--very strong.  And the atmosphere is festive.  But I'd search out better Italian elsewhere.
author: Zsaleh H.

description:
food: everything is just a-ok here...but it's not bad!  the chicken dumplings are pretty good, bruschetta is ok...salads are nice, etc.  nothing too amazing, but it's decent!

service: decent service, but if you sit outside...they might accidentally forget about you!

final thoughts: cute, very touristy place...decent food but not super delish or anything
author: Kara P.

description:
So clearly if you embark on a visit to a restaurant with the name Calzone's, you're throwing your ban on carbs, cheese, and everything else that tastes good out the window.  I made such a sacrifice last Friday and it was so so worth it.

Calzone's is situated in what I would consider (but who am I), the heart of North Beach.  If you love to people watch, their outdoor seating will become your Mecca.  Tables on the sidewalk, each adorned with an individual heating lamp so you don't freeze your ass off while you gawk ... I mean it really gets no better.  Or perhaps it does. 

Now before I go into what we ordered, I feel obligated to say that this was my first visit here, with friends that had been before, thus I relied on their recommendations and allowed them to take the lead when ordering.  In hindsight, and after further exploration of the menu, I would probably order a bit differently next time.  

In a nutshell, the food here is on point.  We were all wearing elastic waistbands that night so we ordered like true fat kids.  Garlic fries and a caesar salad to begin, followed by the pesto chicken calzone, chicken and asparagus pasta, and the chicken and mushroom pasta.  The garlic fries came with a tasty chipotle remoulade.  The caesar was traditional, but the dressing was a bit oily for my taste.  The croutons were actually homemade crostini which I thought was a nice touch.  The calzone was yummy but the real star of the show was the pasta.  OH EM GEE.  Homemade, like someone's Nonna was in the back rolling out da sheets a' da pah-sta.  The pasta's weren't heavily sauced and tasted very clean.  Lately I'm into clean eating so I fully appreciated the care with which the food was made.  Also, I love their pasta bowls (yes, the actual ceramic bowl).  The calzone was good, but wasn't as hot I would have liked.

We were too full for dessert, but I would love to try their tiramisu.  Other notables (based on what I saw on my fellow diner's tables) are the calamari, rocket arugala, and crab alfredo.  Good eating at this place... give it a try.
author: Alana L.

description: Good location but mediocre food. I'm a sucker for space heaters so that is what drew me in. Lunch was average. The $10 soup and salad deal was decent. I got the chicken sandwich with avocado, onions and fontina. The soup of the day was a vegetable soup. Calzone's is pretty much a tourist trap but if you are looking for a good people watching spot this isn't a bad place.
author: Debbie C.

description:
This place was great.  Yes, typical North Beach experience.  It's a San Fran spin on a great street-side Italian experience.  

The place has a smallish but full bar.  We got a cab there with no reservations anticipating being at the bar while we wait.  The wait wasn't too long, and the weather was nice so we asked specifically for a sidewalk table.  It is nice when the weather is nice. They have quaint mozaic tables on the side walk along the length of the resturante.  You can people/traffic watch during the dining experience.  They have seating inside too, but overall it's smallish compared to some of the tourist joints near the warf.

Overall a good DINK experience with my wife.  We enjoyed North Beach so much we gave it a go twice, albeit at two different establishments.

If you're in San Fran, you have to give it a try.
author: Ben C.

description:
YES, I admit I was another fool attracted by the nice candlelit sidewalk cafe ambience of Calzone's but ultimately left disgusted with the price and mediocrity of my dish.  I ordered the Salmon w/ Orzo pasta only to receive several small cubed chunks of salmon mixed in with flavorless orzo.  Totally disgusting meal!  I had to force myself to finish it just because its so darn expensive here for the smallest and grossest things ever!  Also, they bring out one cold, hard, stale, loaf of bread for diners to munch on sans the olive oil.  

I was thoroughly disappointed with the slow service as well as the, I'll say it again, ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE food.  DO NOT waste your time or money eating here!!  There are so many other really great Italian restaurants in the area...don't get suckered in by the cute ambiance as so many of us have..
author: Lonna G.

description: I took my pasta loving boyfriend here last Saturday and we had a blast! I've been here several times over the years in a group or a couple and it just has the best atmosphere definitely a San Francisco restaurant landmark. I made a reservation through open table for 9:30 on a weekend and I was seated promptly. Our waiter was attentive and quick wish I could remember his name. We decided to eat inside since we didn't know how cold SF would be that night, but I'll take an outside seat next time cause of the perfect people watching tables and warm heat lamps. On to the food, we started off with the Italian potstickers basically a tasty meatball dressed in a potsticker so good! We had the kenwood Chardonnay with all the fancy decoration, for dinner we had the ravioli which is a must! It still manages to be a casual place that serves til 2am while keeping the Columbus North Beach Italian charm, we will be coming back!
author: Nadine M.

description: Very tasty food, and great drinks. The seating area outside is very romantic and relaxing. I highly recommend to visit this place and try one of the mojitos.
author: K. D.

description:
Went here on whim last weekend with my beau. We had stumbled across this one because it was open late and we are famished. I liked the outdoor seating and the comfy-ness the environment gave off. 

One of the things that I immediately noticed was the mojitos on the menu. I mean, who would have ever thought, mojitos and pasta? It goes SO well together! First off, the mojitos are wonderful-They actually put sugarcane in the mojito, which in my eyes makes all the difference. I ordered the crab alfredo, because I am lavish like that. My beau ordered the chicken alfredo. I LOVED the use of chard in the pasta. The sauce was light and the noodles were wide style. The crab was fresh and they gave you an adequate amount. They also put artichoke in the alfredo which is a delight. I am used to getting the same ole creamy, buttery, over-thick, alfredo sauce, so this was a sure treat.

I can't wait to come back as I feel a hankering coming on for their pasta and a mojitos. Tummy satified. :)
author: Stephanie H.

description:
We went there last Saturday after seeing a early show of BBB and had a great time.  The wait was a little bit long, but nothing to not be expected on a weekend evening. The host was very friendly and helped us find a place at the bar to sit while we waited for a table.  We waited maybe 20 minutes for a table wbhich again totally expected. 

The waiter was friendly and helpful and allowed us time to peruse the menu.  The timing between courses was perfect.  Sometimes the timing is off and you feel like you are being rushed through your appetizer or wind up with an akward wait between appetizer and main course.  

Two people in our party ordered calzones and they were very yummy and filling.  Very generous portions.  The chicken alfredo with artichokes was my choice and the sauce was just right as was the portion size.  

The only thing I wish they had was a more varied wine list.  Other than that, I was very please with the service, food, and ambiance.
author: Michele P.

description:
As others have said, the calzones --this place's namesake -- are bland and mediocre.  

Service is average but ambiance and those mojitos are still there.

What more can I say?  May be back if I've got a craving for a stellar mojito and some garlic fries, but that's about it.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
I'm a firm believer that if a menu is too large, they are probably spreading themselves too thin, and nothing is going to be exceptionally good. 
Caszone's has a really large menu, so that scared me at first, but actually everything we ate there turned out to be pretty good. We had pizza, gnocchi, calamari, and mussels. 
I personally LOVED their Pizza. 
Its hard to eat at a place like this too often because North Beach is overwhelming with good restaurants, but I always recommend it to friends because the food is good and there is something for everyone. 
Also, try to get a table outside on the street!
author: Tori E.

description: Dry, boiled chicken, pancetta the size of eye boogers, less than a quarter of an avocado and dressing so bland that I needed to add balsamic...that was Calzone's chicken salad. Such a disappointment. Dry, boiled chicken in their pesto chicken calzone, also. Even outdoor seating in the sun couldn't redeem this meal.
author: NickJess S.

description: This place was ok. Glad I was not paying though. Service was good. Food was average, not any special flavor and was pretty salty. My fish was a little overdone. Kind of fun atmosphere, but cramped. My fellow diner and I had been walking around town all day and there was nowhere to put our stuff other than the floor and not much space for two people to maneuver around dishes on the table top either. I probably wouldn't go back again since I'm gluten intolerant, but if I weren't I might give it another try because their calzones and pizzas looked pretty great!
author: Abby D.

description:
Don't know how there are so many positive reviews. We were seated promptly upstairs with our 7 pm reservation. Interesting decor, uncomfortable chairs, good crowd but some open tables. We started with calamari and bottle of house chianti. Both not bad. Busser dropped off a torpedo loaf of cold bread, no butter. Asked for butter and the man sighed and said a sorrowful "OK"  He delivered a half stick of Challenge butter still wrapped in the wax paper and took our dinner order. Lucy ordered baby greens n chicken salad, me Italian Calzone. Bam! The food arrived in under 5 minutes! Wow that calzone I ordered must cook 
fast in the 500 degree wood fired oven! The appetizer plates weren't cleared and he started to put them on top of them so we scrambled them out of his way. I thought his hand was burning from the hot plate he held with a towel. The plate was cold! The calzone tepid! They must pre- cook them and then rush a failed re heat! The salad had greens, 4 cherry tomato halves, a few red onion strips, 5 pine nuts, and a substantial amount of bland pulled chicken breast. No one ever asked us if everything was ok, we were ignored until he came to push dessert and espresso. No thanks, check please. Outta here never to return!
author: Jeff S.

description:
This place was really somewhat of a letdown.  It started off very promising.  It had the right decor, and the restaurant was packed with patrons.  Being a SF tourist, it looked enticing from the outside.  When we sat & ordered, the food came and looked picture perfect, fancy and yummy.  However it failed after the first taste test.  The smoked chicken calzone was decidedly average (bland and quite boring), while the seared lamb was way too salty!!  The only redeeming factor was the prawns fettuccine pasta.  It was excellente!!  Maybe I'd come back if I'm ever craving that one dish.

The prices are not exorbitant, most dishes are under $20, however the portions are really quite small.  Overall had the food been better I'd rate it an easy 5 stars.  

Such disappointment..
author: Roy W.

description: Great experience here. We sat outside so we could people watch, and the outdoor heaters were very warm and inviting on a cool winter night. My gf got the margherita pizza w/ spicy sausage. The pizza was thin crust, and we both thought it was damn near perfect. I got the spicy sausage with orzo, which I also thought was pretty flawless. They are byo with a $5 corkage fee (def a plus). Our only complaint here was the music. The mix of J-Lo songs and random 80's music kind of ruined the authentic Italian restaurant feel I got when we arrived. Overall, I'd like to go back, but there are many more places in the city to discover still.
author: Kevin H.

description: Calzone's is a lot like The Godfather Part 3: It's okay to like in theory, but not in actuality.  Skimpy portions do not make up for its supposedly trendy North Beach location, and interacting with the wait staff feels like one big long con until the check comes.  Do yourself a favor and realize it's a cash grab, just like The Godfather Part 3.
author: Michael D.

description:
I ate here 8 months ago.  I'm still having dreams about it, so I figured I should finally write a review.
 
The lamb with arugula and wasabi vinaigrette was absolutely incredible.  One of the guys at our table had ordered a calzone.  After tasting the lamb, he ordered himself a plate and took his calzone home.
author: Brian M.

description:
Wanted to grab some food before the night's festivities began and came across Calzone's. There were tons of people sitting outside at their tables so my friend decided that it was a good sign. And boy was it! The food was fast, service was great and the decor was cute. We were seated right away on a Saturday night too which was great! 

We started off with appetizers - strawberry mojitos (YUM!! I wanted more!), scallops w/ wasabi pesto aioli, and calamari. 

The appetizers were so delicious! We were damn near licking the scallops plate off so that we could get every last bit of tangy goodness. And the calamari tasted so fresh! It's so hard to find a good plate of calamari. This dish was beyond my expectations. 

Our main dishes were... 
Well, the BBQ Chicken Pizza was delicious. Yum, yum, yum. 

The Chicken & Mushroom Orzo was quite, well, bland. No matter how many chili flakes I added, I couldn't seem to get any flavor out of it. 

Nonetheless, I am still a fan! The appetizers and drinks were enough to make me want to come back. I'll just know to pass on the orzo next time. ;)
author: Payal P.

description: If you're looking for a beautiful restaurant with heated outside seating - this place is it. Great place to people watch with a large patio out front and a full bar. The specialty mojitos are incredible but the food is just good (a slight lack of flavor). To sum Calzone's up: great relaxing restaurant but not the most authentic Italian you can find in the North Beach area.
author: Michelle M.

description: you know what, i have been to this place a handful of times and each time I am so happy, so I thought it was finally time to write my review. Service is good, but the food is great. Sadly I still haven't had their pizza or calzones - always their pasta, and I have never been disappointed. Also, their seared lamb was possibly the best I have ever had - obviously not expected at a place like this. You must try this. Writing this review makes me hungry again! Definitely try.
author: leah n.

description: We just ate here. Sat outside..Awesome location. Great people watching. The service was mediocre and the food was shit and cold.
author: Caomhain M.

description:
In my opinion, the location is great but that's pretty much all it has going for itself. The food is overpriced for basic foods like pizza and calamari. We had seating outside which was a bit congested being near the door. The servers would take a very long time to take an order and to close the check. If you aren't in a rush and don't care if someone stubs your toe, than this place is for you.

I am the kind of person who loves taking pictures of food to remember just how great it was, however, this place was not one of those places to use my camera.
author: Ayesha N.

description: This place was recommended by my boyfriends mom (who's from Argentina).  We went with another couple who were visiting from the Midwest. We got the eggplant and brucheta appetizers. The crab fetachinni and  gnocchi dishes. Amazing food and the give you small baggetes and oil. Great wine selection and saw some amazing pizzas going by on trays -- CHECK IT OUT!
author: Valerie W.

description: Came here for my birthday recently and ate here with a few friends.  We ordered some appetizers and dinner with wine.  The friends I was with were so nice to recommend this place.  We got there and were seated quickly at a nice table.  Our waiter was a nice looking guy with a strange voice.  Anyway, he took our order but before the appetizers could come out, he had the salad come out first when I asked to be brought out with the meal.  Anyway, I asked him how long he had worked there and he responded that he'd worked there 17 years.  Anyway, I had to remind him to give us an update on our appetizers.  Then, later another server came to our table and one of my buddies asked if they did anything special for birthdays/people.  The server said no.  Was strange that being a restaurant they don't sing, give a complimentary slice of something.  I personally wasn't looking/expecting anything but when I heard this server said the restaurant didn't do anything for birthday patrons, I suddenly was disappointed.  Anyway, the food was OK.  Nothing to rave about.  My birthday dinner experience was OK.  Not sure if I'm coming back. Especially since there's so many restaurants in the area.
author: Epi I.

description:
This was my hood growing up as a child.  Went to preschool at the St. Francis on the corner of the street, so use to walk by this spot all the time.  We never got to eat there, because my parents were too damn cheap.  Well, now that I'm all grown up, I was honored to step into the place known as Heart of North Beach.  

It was a Tuesday night, so wasn't busy at all.  Got there early, so we went to the bar and asked, what's your specialty.  Mojito, the lady says, so we ordered a round.  Oh my, you don't even know how much I adore sweet and sour, and sure enough, it was.  It was more sour than your typical mojito, but I didn't complain.  Sucked it up dry the instant it touched my lips.

While waiting on friends, I looked at the decor and thought to myself, is this place earthquake proof.  Walls were lined with shelves of empty beer bottles in the bar area, and old relic canned goods and nick nacks in the dining area.  They better be super glued down, because the only thing holding them back is a wire placed across each shelf.  It is a sight to see though, and a lot to admire.  Just feel bad for the person who has to dust them weekly to make sure they look presentable for customers.  

Now let's move on to food and service.  There were plenty of service staff members on the floor that night.  They were pretty cool, but they all kind of looked alike, so i kept getting our waiter confused with our bus boy.  When they gave us our bread in bags, i was so hoping it was warm, but it wasn't.  Oh well.  I ordered the Caesar salad and crab alfredo.  While my friends ordered the lasagna, and lamb entree.  My salad was decent.  Not saturated with dressing, but evenly spread out.  The side of chicken for $3.95 was a little bland.  It looked like boiled and shredded chicken instead of nicely grilled or seasoned kind.  The alfredo was fresh pasta, and it was so silky and perfectly done, I couldn't believe how easily I could slurp it in.  The crab was present, but had some cartilage in there, which I am fine with.  The only thing I wished was that they didn't offer me some fresh pepper and parmesan.  Fudge, moving on.  Tried a bit of my friend's lamb and it was medium rare, so they should of asked how she would of liked it cooked, but it was still pretty good.  

Overall, this place has its charm and you do feel like you're in a different place, like a little Italy.  And the food was pretty good, but it could add bonus points if rolls were warm, pepper/cheese offered, chicken looked more decent and if they added some music to the place.  I would definitely go back though, on another day that wasn't busy.  I can imagine this place being chaotic on popular nights, so avoid that if possible.
author: Janice F.

description:
So this might be my favorite place in North Beach.  I can't say the best because truthfully its really the only one I try.  Why fix it if it aint broke right? 

I love the outdoor seating, after five or six times I still can't really imagine the inside of that restaurant.  The house white is great, the bruchetta sooooo yummy with big chunks of fresh tomatoes.  It is so big and so good I never even eat my entree at the restaurant.

I always get the chicken and asparagus pasta.  It is always done perfectly.  The only thing that keeps this place at a four is one bad experience.  My last time I ate at Calzones I filled up on the appetizer and wine and decided to box my meal for the following days lunch.

Fast forward next day..a very hungry lady gets out her calzone box, anticipation running through every bone in her body, to open up the box and find someones left over orzo rice.  I almost cried.  Actually I might start crying now just thinking about it.

Hmm, maybe I better head back to calzones.  Put this bad memory away once and for all.
author: Kierstan G.

description: I live in North Beach and this place has the best sidewalk dining in the neighborhood. Service is great but better food is nearby. If you eat here, sit outside and enjoy Columbus Street. An excellent place for visiting relatives and people watching.  The chicken wad horrible and dry making it inedible.
author: Nors D.

description:
The strawberry mojito is phenomenal! The fresh stick of raw sugar cane enhances the novelty of this sweet and refreshing, yet highly intoxicating treat, and I couldn't resist chewing it even though I knew it meant instant cavity. 

The balsamic-marinated eggplant calzone and arugula/apple/candied walnut salad were also tasty, but not as memorable as the mojitos. 

After a lovely dinner, stroll down the street to Gelato Naia and treat yourself to creamy, hormone-free gelato goodness. Well-made mojitos and gelato always seem to put a smile on my face.
author: Contessa S.

description: Awesome pizza, tasty salads and drinks that quench a thirst. Excellent service and darling decor.....very Italian and a fun place to people watch. So glad we went here....prices are amazing. We will be back.
author: Heather E.

description:
It is true that a crowd attracts a crowd.

Stumbled upon this place on accident while trying to go to another place around the corner that happened to be closed. We saw this place was busy and decided to give it a try. I'm glad we did!

My friend had a regular calzone and it was DELISH! I had pasta... I can't remember what it was but I remember it was a cream sauce... ha ha Another friend has another pasta with crab and hers was even better than mine! We were all satisfied =D

The ambiance and the customer service were superb =D I'll definitely be returning to this joint.
author: Andrew-Brian N.

description:
What a mistake! My son & daughter wanted to treat me to a nice Italian lunch at the North Beach festival on Father's Day June 19th.  I suggested North Beach Pizza but we changed our minds. Columbus Ave was a mass of humanity & vendors. But we were seated inside right away.
That's a plus. That's the ONLY star.  We ordered 2 appetizers & a pizza.   The scallops appetizer was tasty but only 3 silver-dollar size pieces for $10. Do the math.  Overpriced for 3 small bites. The 2nd appetizer was the Italian pot stickers. $10 for 4 small potstickers.  Tasty but overpriced.  Then came the Rocket Arugula pizza. What a joke...we were shocked. It was served on a rectangular plate about 4" x 12",,,thin crust with NO sauce, NO cheese and covered with a 1" bed of arugula. Why...because the arugula was hiding 2 thin slices of prosciutto in the middle of the pizza. Both ends were bare. I asked the server if that's the way it comes. He said when the chef cuts the prosciutto it falls off the knife into the middle. You have got to be kidding me.  This pizza??? cost $15. My son said it was the worst excuse for a pizza he ever had in his life.  Shopping mall pizza or county fair pizza would blow this place out of the water.  Talk about an overpriced tourist trap. I'm a SF native but would never recommend Calzone's to anyone. What a disappointing experience.  I should have demanded a credit on our tab. Maybe the manager will read this review & offer us a refund.
author: Robert L.

description: We stopped by here for a coffee (or in my case hot chocolate) after lunch.  We sat outside where all of the chairs were facing the sidewalk (like the cafes in Europe).  Overall, it seemed like a decent place, but without any experience with the food, I hesitate to give them any more than 3 stars.
author: Anoop G.

description: I LOVE the strawberry Mojitoes here... it makes me squeal like a Japanese school girl each and everytime... IEEEIEEEIIIEEEEIEEE! Lamb's good too as well as the bruschetta... it's a great thing to do on Sundays... but if you're an alcoholic, it's a great thing everyday! And for you straight folks... strip bar's stumbling distance... all you gotta do is look sober for 2 secs and they'll let you in...
author: Nathan D.

description: I have always meant to try Calzone's but for some reason just have not made it in. We went tonight, waited a fairly long time for a table, and then got squeezed to a spot upstairs. We were between some other diners having a good time, so this was actually okay, but the service was really pretty slow and the food pretty ordinary. It was okay, but it could have come from Safeway. Maybe I just didn't order the correct thing, maybe this cold is worse than I thought, or maybe we should have been on the sidewalk with a mojito (THAT would have worked).  Just a bit expensive for the quality (but, hey, it's North Beach).
author: Robert M.

description:
been here four times now I've had the petit filet all four times it's so good sat outside every time. I love this spot. 
Last time I went was on weekend for first time I thought service might be a little different since they were busy but it was actually better than when they were slow.
My girlfriend got the pasta which was good but I can't get enough of the steak.
two for dinner and dessert was like 65 to 75 with tip with one glass of wine cause I don't drink. This spot is awesome I will continue to go here.
Order the steak and sit outside.
author: Mark C.

description: My angel hair pasta with tomatoes was a little over done, but not too much, not a whole lotta flavor either. My daughter loved her gnocchetti. My son had the orzo with sausage, really tasty with the peppers and onions. Not the greatest food, but not bad. It was nice sitting outside watching all the tourist's go by.
author: Roger M.

description: We were visiting San Francisco for the first time and had lunch here. We ordered a pizza and the Cesar Salad, OMG it was the best! The service was fantastic. My husband said after lunch that he was glad that this restaurant was not close to our house because he would be eating there all the time. I will definitely be coming back for seconds!!! Way to go Calzone's. A little bit of heaven in Little Italy!
author: Sue U.

description:
I just got back from a trip to San Francisco and we actually went to this place twice.  Once, just for a drink as we walked and the second to order a calzone. 
The outdoor seating area is awesome to just people watch.  The staff is friendly and on it!  The food was great!  Plus my boyfriend and best friend loved their mojitos.  My beer was just as good.
I only shared a calzone with my boyfriend and we both cleaned the plate.. so no complaints.
author: Andy G.

description:
Sundays are fun days!

I've been living in NB for 17 years now and just today I'm tried Calzone's for the first time. After many years of having my mom rave in my ear about this restaurant, I came here with pretty high standards.

We ordered:

Bruscetta: Nice crunchy crust on the bread. However, the only thing that kind of "grossed" me out was that the basil shreds were pretty wilted-- meaning, it was probably made a while ago. 

Shellfish on angel hair pasta: There were mussels, clams, and shrimp on top of nice pile of angel hair pasta. The dish was very good but a little on the small side. 

Margherita Pizza: this was probably the highlight of the meal. I loved how it was flat bread pizza. Perfect balance of fresh ingredients.

Now, the reason why I gave Calzone's 3 stars is because of the wilted basil shreds, the long wait between the appetizer and the main course (25 minute wait) but put aside those reasons... I left the restaurant still hungry. 

I can totally understand why this restaurant would capture my mom's taste buds though-- it is very good. I will be coming back-- maybe I'll even up their stars :)
author: Lin L.

description: From the outside Calzones looks like a really great spot to sit down, enjoy some dinner, and check out the interesting foot traffic in San Francisco.  However nice the restaurant looks and feels the food does not match.  My girlfriend and I decided to both eat the prawn linguine with the kale and garlic. The food was disgusting, they had obviously scraped the burnt pieces of food and drenched the pasta in the oil from the bottom of the pan. There was hardly any pasta in this pasta dish, just super oily, burnt pieces of garlic, kale and prawns.  The little pasta at the bottom of this pile was sitting in a puddle of oil.  It was really unfortunate because the decor and location of Calzone's is really enjoyable, but without good food its just not  worth it. Thank god we had wine!
author: Ryan H.

description: They have amazing food, outdoor seating, walking distance to little bakery's where you can have desert and listen to old women speaking Italian. You won't be disappointed. Oh and kik @ss drinks!
author: Tony M.

description:
I went here today to way at a place with a friend of mine from out of the area, both of us were wandering around looking for a place actually open before 11:30 am in NB.  They sat us right away in a booth. We shared a salad that had Fiji apples and walnuts in it, very good. I had some pasta dish with garlic, mushrooms and cheese. Really great food! My friend had some kind of calzone. She couldn't help herself, she ate the whole thing and utter surprise at that fact. They don't seem to have much a/c and it was over 80 F w/ 57% hum. To be fair, who does around there? Btw, I recommend the lemon tart thing for dessert. It was do good, I took the other half home and finished later after putting it in the fridge.
Hot day.
author: Matilda H.

description:
Several times I was there were ok, though cannot call it a pleasant experience. The wait stuff needs to be trained. 
It's a very nice idea with their tables outside. 
Last time I was there, it was my friend's B-day party. Waited too long to order, were brought mixed up drinks, they forgot about 1 drink, the other non-alchoholic Mojito had strawberry, even though we ordered regular non-alc. Mojito. I don't even know if it was a problem that our server took the order and somebody else brought everything out? At least, if you have a table of 10 people, come and make sure your table gets what they order.We were waiting for bread to come, but never got it until we asked for it. They brought 3 breads for 10 people. It was cold and no butter, we sent it back to warm up.  Food was ok, the good ones were calamari, mussels and lamb.  My Alfredo somehow had blue cheese in it, which I hate. And I only found it out the next day, coz I didn't taste at the party and took it home.
I think next time I want to sit outside I'll try out Colosseo, right next to Cazone's. At least, I saw servers smiling there...
author: Anastasia B.

description: Loved this restaurant! Went there with some friends on a Thursday night and the food was amazing. The location is good, lots of people walking around but the traffic is not disturbing. Ordered a calzone pizza, which was great, but there are many other delicious options to choose from. You have the possibility to sit outside as well but it's just as nice inside. Would definitely recommend this to others.
author: Laura D.

description: Came back again for the Dungeness Crab Pasta and it was not up to par. Unlike the last time where the pasta was perfectly cooked, this time they were all sticking and clumping together. Also, a friend got the chicken fettucini and the chicken was so unbelievably dry it was pretty much inedible. We ended up requesting that they drown the whole thing in Alfredo sauce to salvage the dish =/. Maybe it was an off night, who knows...
author: Christina L.

description:
So, this place isn't really for vegans, but it's okay... Their salads (the ones without the meat) ordered without cheese are all right. But I really only go there for one reason:

GARLIC FRIES!!!

These are the crispiest but still soft inside fries with the right amount of garlic/herbs/salt on top... and they serve them with some yumalicious horseradish ketchup! And I know they're good, since I've had my boyfriend bring them home after work and they survived a 20 minute drive across town... Oh, and the best part is when I opened the box, they were still crispy!!!
They must put some magic in those fries...
author: Miss C.

description:
Had a wonderful dinner there...the service was great and the food was delicious.
We love the North Beach Area...very lively and we just happened to be there when the Giants won the World Series!!
author: JD R.

description: I've been going to this place for years.  We used to go every Sunday night around 10pm or so, and they were always VERY accommodating of our large (15-20 ppl) group.  I've also been with just the 2 of us, and had a great experience as well.  A solid choice in the many identical restaurants along Columbus in SF
author: Daniel B.

description:
We felt obligated to try Calzone's out because we had several of our wedding photos taken out in front of the place last month. We walk by the restaurant all the time and on Sunday (bright and beautiful day) decided to check it out for dinner. 

We were seated almost immediately at a nice little table outside. I had one of the calzone's and my wife had a salad. Both came out extremely fast and were just ok. Overall I wasn't impressed by the food. There are so many great restaurants in North Beach, I wouldn't recommend going to Calzone's unless all you care about is eating outside.

Maybe Calzone's would be good for lunch, the food is overpriced for what it is, although it isn't particularly pricey.

I'd recommend getting a sandwich at one of the nearby delis and eating in Washington Square park instead of eating at Calzone's.
author: Ryan S.

description:
A compact, busy place with overall good food.  Outdoor tables with overhead heat lamps make for good people watching.  I had a mojito which had a nice presentation with the sugar cane in it but the drink was too sweet with an excess of simple syrup.  
The calamari would have been good but was slightly undercooked, I like the coating a little crispy.  Can't go wrong with cheese bread.  
The calzones are about the length of an average adult forearm.  The gnocchi is made in smaller pieces than most restaurants and was better than average.  I will come back for that!  The server was quite generous with the fresh parmesan.  At first I thought it was too much.  Then, I tasted the quality, super-fresh.  Way too full to consider dessert.  We left full and happy.
author: s p.

description: Ate here with friends last night and we were all happy with our orders. We ordered the salumi plate as an appetizer and the meats were excellent. My entree was the Mixed Grill, which was also very good. The service was as expected and the prices were reasonable.
author: Sea M.

description:
We're here every few months so I can't really give it anything but 5 stars. It's become our fave place to eat in North Beach. We always sit outside and their tables seat you side by side facing the sidewalk so it's great for people-watching on Columbus. All the tables are in the sun- when it's out. We usually split a bottle of chianti and a bowl of pasta or a calzone. Service is always friendly and efficient with water glasses constantly filled and bread with oil and balsamic is served upon seating. The fresh parm grated from a wheel onto your plates is a nice touch. It seems like it's always pretty busy but we get a table right away every time. I think we've tried each of the calzones- all good and my fave pasta dish is the gnocchi in creamy vodka marinara. We like to do a stairway walk up Telegraph Hill, past Coit Tower and down the steep sidewalks into North Beach to get to Calzones. It's a really beautiful city hike to a consistently enjoyable dining experience. The walk (and many others) is in this book in case you'd like to check it out: 
http://www.amazon.com/Stairway-Walks-Francisco-Adah-Bakalinsky/dp/0899974295
author: Jen G.

description: Romantic spot, rich flavor food and good wine. Interesting outside seat setting like Europe feel. Love this place!
author: Suabot J.

description:
Quaint place with nice charm. Good service! Had the Italian calzone, pep pizza, vegi soup, garlic bread & 2 beers. Food was 'ok' but small portions. It's i
n the heart of Littly Italy or whatever they call it in S.F. Was on vacation so wasn't worried about price but if I lived here I would go elsewhere for a better value.
author: Kelly B.

description: This place was amazing. I especially loved the outdoor seating area with heaters. The service was great even though we sat outside. (Sometimes at restaurants service is bad when you are out of sight from the staff). Great food, great presentation and reasonable prices for portions. This is going to be a regular on my list for when I go to SF.
author: Georgia P.

description: Outdoor seating area was clean and comfortable - great people watching!  Prices for entrees and drinks were reasonable - considering the area.  However,  $7 for 4 smallish pieces of garlic bread was crazy.  Calzones and pizzas were good - fresh veggies on the veggie pizza - including shaved asparagus.  Wish I could give it 3 1/2 stars.
author: Rebeccah D.

description: 15min wait for sidewalk table - not bad. Service was great and helpful. Got the lasagna calzone. Was delicious and worth the price. No real complaints and will definitely go back
author: Jason M.

description:
This place always looks so crowded during nights so I thought it would be a good try. Also, because of the name, I automatically assumed they would have amazing calzones.

I was wrong. I don't even remember the name of my calzone, I just remember it was bland and very mediocre. I like my pizza dough/crust a bit crispy, but the dough looked totally under baked and tasted soft.

My friend got the pizza with the crab and avocado. I liked her pizza more than my calzone, but it wasn't anything too special.

Probably will not come here again unless I am dining with a friend and he/she really wants to. Restaurant is also a lot smaller inside than it looks on the outside. At least the decor is pretty cool.

My hunt for the best North Beach restaurant continues...
author: Jamie W.

description: The five star is base on the BRUSCHETTA! YUM!! you just have to try it to believe me. I would return and I have just for their  bruschetta. I also recommend the chicken alfredo (which is something I never really order anywhere), but this is actually really good. The pine nuts suits it well. I had a bite of the pepperoni pizza and the crust was amazing! I also had a bite of the pork milanese, but that was ok. A little too salty for my taste.
author: Stephanie T.

description: A little touristy, but that's sorta par for the course in NB.  The mini gnocchi in an asparagus cream sauce was really the highlight of the entire meal, but everything else was very good, and some were great.  Nearly everything served here comes on long, narrow dishes, making for the longest pizza I've ever seen.  Really good pizza dough, father-in-law loved his calzone, and consensus on the cream of broccoli soup was 5 stars.  Although it's nice to sit on the sidewalk occasionally, the upstairs is more conversation-friendly.
author: Roland F.

description:
The outdoor seating and the decent food and service make this place stand out among the Columbus Avenue clip-joints.

Yes, they're owned by the same people that own Dead Fish in Crockett and Crab House on the wharf.
author: Justin C.

description:
We came here for lunch and didn't have a great experience.
The service was EXCEEDINGLY SLOW!!!  Thank goodness we had our beers to enjoy...racer 5 & stella  ;-)
I had the salmon sandwich and it was average at best.  The hubby had a chicken pesto calzone and there was a BONE it-not good! 
There are so many great restaurants in the city that this one does NOT warrant a return visit.
author: Lizete S.

description:
This was my second time coming here. 

My friend ordered the lasagna, while I ordered the Chocolate Moose, since I was in the mood for something sweet. The moose was horrible. It was no where NEAR sweet. The only thing sweet about it was the Raspberry sauce surrounding it. It's a cute little place, and the waiters are kind. But next time, I'll order an actual entree. And I'll get back to you on the REAL food they have here. So three stars for now, people!
author: Denise D.

description: So my coworkers and I came here for a dinner break after training.  one of my coworkers is a regular at Calzone's and she ordered the crab pizza with fetuccine sauce and I forgot what the other one was.  Dude I must say I am glad I was introduced to this place!!! I love it!!! Pure goodness in my mouth! Foodgasm man! The crab pizza was to die for especially the sauce.  Since my coworkers and I had to split it, I think I ate most of it! haha.  But I loved it! We were sitting outside as well so it was a nice setting cause we were under the heater that kept us warm on a cold October evening.   If I lived in the area I would be too spoiled from this place because of the food selections they have.  Yumm-O!!!
author: Sharjah M.

description:
I'm a big fan of Calzones.  My girlfriend and I stumbled across this restaurant while looking for a late night meal and loved how the outdoor tables faced Columbus St so we decided to eat/drink here. The food was good, especially the chicken alfredo, and the prices were very fair.  For drink prices my gf got a bottle of wine for $20 and I had Fat Tire beer for $4 or $5 a glass.  

Even though I don't think he was hired by the restaurant there was also a musician taking song requests and playing the guitar for the couples sitting outside.  My gf and I enjoyed the music but some people could find that annoying.

It was a fun yet romantic experience.

We went there for lunch a few days later and tried a calzone and it was very good and big as well.  Definitely plan on splitting the calzones with someone else.

The service can be a little slow.  It seems like they don't wait on you until you close your menu and then they take your entire order at once, including your drinks and appetizers.

It's also important to note that the outdoor tables have heaters that warm the area up nicely on cold nights/days.

Overall I recommend Calzones, especially at night.
author: Joseph D.

description: Took advantage of Christmas vacation to hangout in North Beach. Decided to sit outside, sip some wine, eat and people watch. Great place to people watch, but the rest is dismal. Owners needs to get good staff, people who care about the service and the food. My impression is that they live off the tourist, locals need not come.
author: Evaristo V.

description: Love it. Perfect for an outdoor pizza and people watch. Pasta is homemade and totally recommend the margarita pizza
author: Cat M.

description: THIS IS THE BEST ITALIAN RESTAURANT in San Francisco !!!! The pasta is always fresh....Everything ther is GOOD. Really DELICIOUS......I LOVE MY CALZONE'S PIZZA CUCINA Restaurant !!!! I always bring my friends  when they come to visit me here in San Francisco from my country and they love it.....
author: Carlos M.

description: I liked this place and I'm glad we tried it.  Waitstaff was really good, which is not something you necessarily expect in San Francisco.  Food was tasty, but nothing really to write home about.  Club music and Cher/David Bowie type stuff was a bit loud, but whatever.  All in all it's a good place.
author: Nicole D.

description: Went with friends for dinner on a sat night around 7ish. Took a while for the waiter to get our order but the food came pretty quick afterwards. I got a mojito it was $9ish but came in a huge glass they usually would b only serving soft drinks in. For entree I got a Norwegian smoked salmon sandwich. The sandwich is a bit small tho enough for me. I ate it open face coz didn't want too much bread. The salad that came with it was pretty good tho! Nice mixed greens :)
author: Jenny C.

description: The worst service I have ever met. I was here with my friends from Russia. They were shocked by the low level of service in Calzone's Pizza Cucina. The food wasn't good too.  Alfredo Shrimp Pasta was overcooked. In addition friend of mine found a bug in his Cesar salad. General manager did not even apologize for it. He was very rude and sarcastic.
author: Tatiana F.

description:
One passer by might mistake Calzone's as a tourist trap, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that it's quite the contrary. Yes, it attracts many out of towners, but what place on Columbus doesn't?! The main difference is that you will find a mix of locals and tourists and the food to back it up.

What genuinely surprised me, was the quality and price of their food. Their massive calzones will please your palate without taking a big bite out of your wallet. They also offer colorful and creative salads that you won't find at other pizzerias.

If you're really going to do your experience right, you have to sit outside on the candlelit checkerboard sidewalk. The heaters will keep you toasty regardless of the unpredictable San Francisco weather and you'll eat a fulfilling dinner at the same time.
author: Lauren T.

description:
I love this place!!!
Eat outside and watch all the interesting people go by.  The lasagna and crab salad is amazing!  where can you get a crab salad with real crab for around $15?  The lasagna is baked with thin pasta and the best sauce ever!!  
I really can't say enough about this place!  my girlfriend and I split a lasagna, crab salad and each had a glass of wine, $55.  w/o tip.
author: D M.

description: This was my first venture into the North Beach area and I must say that I was very impressed. The service was excellent and the food was to die for. The salumi plate was so delicious and was a very generous serving. My personal favorite of the night would have to be the San daniele prosciutto. Definitely one of my favorite SF restaurants.
author: David R.

description:
Love the seating in this place. Been here before and sat outside under the heat lamps watching crazy Little Italy night life of out of towners and tourists. Went there last night after watching "Beach Blanket Babylon" and it was literally a hop, skip, and a jump from Green street. We walked there and told them we had 6 people and even though the place was packed we were seated in a timely fashion. 

Let me just tell you the array of good looking men working was nice. I felt like I was in Italy. We got a cute little private table upstairs and we ordered right away with Sergio. This restaurant has hand held devices that go right to the kitchen and bar area so service was fast. I ordered the regular Mojito which was absolutely fantastic. It was just perfect (not too much alcohol or sugar...PERFECT!) Another friend ordered the strawberry mojito and she said it was good. Another friend had the Red Russian (which looked fantastic- Vodka, strawberries, cream). Honey, put cream on anything and I'll drink or eat it. 

We ordered appetizers and they arrived promptly. Salad with Asian dressing, garlic bread with melted mozzarella cheese, salmon cakes... devoured by the whole table. When we ordered Sergio recommended certain things and I went with his advice and ordered the Orzo with sausage (I've never heard of that and I have food phobias...but I'm trying to be different and expand....so....I ordered it). The other food on the table looked good. The servings are pretty grand so I recommend sharing if you're there to nibble, especially if you're still heading out to party. 

That was my third time there and I must say I will go back. Parking is impossible at night so plan on taking a cab.
author: Feleciana S.

description: Cozy outdoor seating, underneath continuous awnings the restaurant front, generous heating systems underneath each and other seat (of course) = the perfect romantic San Francisco treat! My husband always orders the gnochetti with the bolognese sauce. Delicious! and trust me, I don't even like gnochetti, but this is the only place I will have it.  The fresh, soft texture, but small in size to not overwhelm you of potato-ey flavor is made to perfection.  I had the crab and fresh fettuccine dish with a garlic and grape tomato sauce...delicious.  The mixture of fresh garlic and sweet grape tomatoes was fantastic.  Great service, waiters are terrific and fast!  This place is highly recommended.  You will love it if you're in the mood for some good italian.
author: Jacky F.

description:
After an evening concert, a couple friends and myself were debating on where to eat.  While the restaurants around SOMA were an option, we decided to venture north instead.  We landed ourselves at the tail end of Columbus and drove around the street, noticing the wild crowd walking around.  We parked and did the same.

We saw a huge restaurant around here and decided to head in, called "Calzone's".  I was confused with the actual food "Calzone" and expected it to have only Calzones.  Fortunately, there are other items served.

I grabbed a quick seafood pasta dish (forgot what it was called), but I was so hungry that I took the bread offered on the side and wiped my plate with it.  I guess it was that good.

Even at around 1am or so, it can still be crowded, so watch out!
author: Ren L.

description: Went to the bar and sat for a drink. Bartender seemed to allow bottles to slam down making it loud and annoying. He reused dirty shakers that had mint leaves left in them and made martinis. The dirty martinis were disgusting and hard to drink. Also he made a mojito by mistake and strained it out I to an empty glass and used it about 10 min later.  He dropped items into the bar in dirty spots like the muddler and didn't rinse it.  When asked, he didn't know how to make common drinks that are not on their menu. Didn't try food but looked good. Would not recommend to go for just drinks unless you want beer or wine.
author: Jason L.

description:
Cruising North Beach with some East Coasters and folks from Shallow Alto (take that! hahaha). 

I would recommend public transit to this area because parking is hella hard to find! 

Can't help but be in the mood for Italian grub in the area. In the mood for Calzones? Sure! 

+Good service
     +Always made sure our cups were full and that our table had bread
+Vibrant atmosphere
+Interesting, Euro decor

Food wise, we ordered: 
*Chicken and pesto calzone
     -Chicken was good but the interior was way too dry
*Chard and swiss calzone
     -Preponderance of chards overtook other flavors
     -Onions weren't really caramelized, at least it didn't taste like it =/
*Italian calzone
     +I don't think you can go wrong with 5 types of meat!
*Italian potstickers
     +Sausage + mushroom = juice galore for the taste buds
     - Holy flapjacks...4 pieces for $10!? 

Final Call:
I dig that there's seating along the street for the Euro feel. I welcome the good service too. I'll be back to try different dishes - no go on the calzones!
author: Chuck N.

description:
This place is fine if you're walking around and want to stop and have some drinks/food and people watch while sitting outside. Food is fine. We had salumi plate, calamari and shared a calzone (three of us).  For a place called calzones, I did expect better...skimpy on the meet and cheese, but i did like that the calzone wasn't as doughy as you expected...It much thinner and less filling than you'd expect. I had a cocktail to start...one of their specials. Too sweet for me (even after i asked them not to make it too sweet). After finishing it I swapped for sonoma cutrer chard...can't go wrong with that and a hefty pour, so i was happy. Again, good food if you're in the area, but not a "destination" or "regular" spot for us..plenty of other places we'd intentionally walk to.  

PS-to the guy letting his dog lick his plate and eat his food at this place...seriously, come on. Disgusting. Calzones should have made you leave, no one wants to see that while eating. And to the rude women in the bathroom line...lay off the botox, it's scary to see your masks when it's not halloween!!!
author: Erin T.

description:
Somebody, ANYBODY, needs to explain to me how I haven't written a review yet of this delectable and fantastic North Beach landmark! The tiled sidewalk, red neon sign...it all just comes together under those glowing heat lamps and the recipe calls for a first-class outcome. 

The food has always been really great. I highly recommend the pizzas. They aren't thick crusted so they are perfect to share with friends over a light lunch while people watching outside. The Fulton Valley Chicken is great if you want something a little more filling; typically it comes with mashed potatoes and broccoli. I don't typically drink wine here, I usually go straight for the mojitos. Yes, you heard me right! Mojitos at this little Italian joint make your fire-y hot heart melt with their minty goodness. The only downside to the food is the really crappy bread they serve when you are seated. I mean, it's nothing special and never warm or hot. Just a cold baguette. What's that all about?
author: Stephanie J.

description:
After being cast off by the guy I felt could have been the love of my life (he felt a little differently), my people convinced me to lay off the Vicodin Vodka cocktails, change out of his stained t-shirt that I had decided to let mold to my skin after 3 days of wearing it --- (seriously, I was wiping my mouth and hands on it by the 2nd day), take a shower and attempt some form of attractive.

Why they took me to Calzone's?  I'll never ever know.

The food was similar to my life at the time --- a sham.  I thought I was in love, the smoked salmon pizza at Calzone's thought it was Italian.  I was sure it would end in happily ever after; the antipasto at Calzone's thought it was Italian.  I heard wedding bells; the sweet, sticky tiramisu at Calzone's thought it was Italian.  Very sadly, the jig was up for both of us.

In a desperate attempt to feel good about myself, I flirted shamelessly with our faux-Italian waiter and in true slut style wrote my digits down on the bill.  He told me he would call me when he got off that night.

I waited.  And cliche of all cliches, like Calzone's white and black tiled floor, he did not deliver.  By the next morning I was back in my ex's stained t-shirt, eating canned frosting with my fingers trying to to figure out where my life went, but more importantly obliterate the memory of my stale meal at Calzone's.

Yes, you can do that with canned frosting, ok?
author: Rachel G.

description:
After an unsuccessful day of attempting to get into the opening of the Academy of Sciences, we made our way out of Golden Gate Park, and found ourselves in North Beach.  The evening was mild, and perfect for strolling.

We really didn't have any lunch so we decided to stop in here for an early dinner.  There were 7 of us:  4 adults and 3 kids.  We were seated upstairs on the mezzanine, in a little alcove.  Perfect for us, since it allowed us a little close off area for the kids to roam around without bothering the other diners.  Also had a nice view of the foot traffic along Columbus.

We started with 2 orders of Caesar salad.  Didn't realize that each one was huge, but we finished it off any way.   Two older girls shared an angel hair pasta with mussels, clams, and prawns.  Must have been good, because they cleaned off their plates.  Didn't have a kid's menu, but they did make a small bowl of fettuccine with butter and parmesan for the 5 year old.  Pasta was not of the pre-made variety.  It was freshly made and cut to order.  Very good.

One person in our group ordered a calzone (can't remember which one), and his wife ordered an eggplant pizza.  My wife ordered a Hawaiian White Fish with a ginger-soy glaze, over Romaine.  Very huge piece of fish, but found it odd to be offered in an Italian restaurant.  I had a pork scaloppne with eggplant, cheese, over Swiss chard, served with a side of garlic mash.  Very generous serving, pork was tender, not dry.  Nice touch of vermouth in the sauce, without overpowering the entire dish.

Overall, pretty good place, prices are reasonable considering the size of each course.  Servers are very friendly and attentive.  Too full for dessert, so we decided to walk dinner off, and find dessert elsewhere in NB.
author: Steve L.

description:
You can only walk by so many times before you need to stop and taste for yourself. I sat outside with my best friend, her boyfriend, and my little dog who came along for the walk up Columbus. There's a lot of foot traffic there, so maybe not the best place to bring a dog...

I'm not big on calzones, but figured if they named the place "Calzones", the calzones better not suck....and they most certainly do not.

Smoked Chicken Calzone- almost gets all the stars on its own.  HUGE and amazing. Probably the best calzone I've ever savoured.

Popcorn Calamari- Pretty standard, definitely tasty. 

Chicken Asparagus Fettuccine- Real, legit fettuccine ribbons. The kind you imagine your grandma would make if she was Italian and a "big mama" type in the kitchen.  My big mama would've given me more of the ribbons though.

Chicken Mushroom Orzo- my least fav of all the dishes, and of course it was my own. 

Tiramisu- delectably gratifying.

Overall pretty satisfying. Priced well for great portions. I'll go back :)
author: Courtney B.

description:
Okay, so following my hangover review of Craig's Place - where I ate right before I went to Calzone's - I ordered a bloody mary. That is all I got, that is all I needed. It was a BANGIN' bloody mary.

Plus Jeff Garlin was hanging out there - that makes any restaurant experience sweeeeeeeeet.
author: C P.

description:
Not one of the greatest italian places, but the company I came with made the choice to eat here before going around the city to check out a few strip clubs. There was a party of 15...imagine, 14 guys and one girl. I didn't have to pay a single dime with the fellas...so, I ordered whatever the hell I wanted off the menu. 
My choices:
appetizer-dungeness crab crostini (with salmon and avocado, drizzled with extra virgin olive oil).....I found this to be a delight and I wish I had more of this instead of the pizza.
pizza rustica-Dungeness Crab with fontina, avocado and onions....a little overpowering to my taste
entree-Mixed Seafood Grill (salmon, Hawaiian white fish and prawns with sautéed seaweed in sesame oil)......I found this to be light because the sauce was a great mixture, seaweed and sesame oil...so-so

Did I mention that they have mojitos? YES! I love me some mojitos....good! So that's why they get the extra star besides the service and not waiting too long for a table of 15 people.

Don't be surprised that I didn't eat all of it from what I had mentioned. My portion of the food had disappeared after I had a couple of bites of each dish. Would I come back for more...maybe if one of my guy friends would do me the honor of paying for my meal. That would be sweet!
author: Fraulein C.

description:
mmmmmmmmmmojito! 

i can't lie. i went here at 1pm, because everyone was day drinking. i didn't want to feel like an outcast, so i started ordering mojitos. thankfully, a nice silver fox ordered me a second (and maybe a third). i went here by myself, while i was walking around little italy. i stopped, because it was a nice enough day, and the al fresco dining looked so great.

 the service was phenomenal, and i think it's so cool that the waiters and waitresses use a palm pilot to make orders. the sidewalk is a great spot for people watching. i saw prostitutes and nuns walking on the same street. go figure! hehehe.

it's kind of expensive, so i wouldn't make a habit of coming here all the time, but it's definitely worth it for the stiff drinks and the good food.
author: amanda y.

description:
3 and a half stars?!?  Come on people!  Calzone's is the SHIT!

They have the BEST wood oven pizzas and calzones.  They serve till 2am, they seat you quickly, have great Mojitos and they have the BEST bread!  Good bread is very important to me.  They have this one pizza with avocado, red onion, fontina cheese and crab meat- I dream about this pizza all the time.  Its one of my favorite meals ever...god dammit now I'm craving one again.  Also, the procuttio artichoke heart and some other meat calzone is delicious as well.  The crust on those pizzas and calzones is so perfectly crusty...that wood oven really makes a difference.

My bf likes to come here also because of the large smoke-friendly patio outside, and of course the people watching.  And, you gotta love the Austin Powers soundtrack blasting away...oh, Calzones...SF wouldnt be the same without you.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
We were randomly walking around Chinatown and sort of ended up at this restaurant because it was one of the first ones we cam across while we were crossing over to North Beach, and we were all kind of in the mood for Italian food. 
Unfortunately we were not impressed with the food. One of my friend ordered the prosciutto calzone only to find out that there was no prosciutto in it, just regular ham- what's up with that?! Another friend ordered one of their pizzas and found it unmemorable. I ordered the pasta dish with clams mussels and prawns which was awful. It was basically a small little heap of oily pasta with no sauce, 2 clams, 2 prawns and 2 mussels... NO FLAVOR!!! What a disapoointment. I strongly recommend skipping this place, and going to one of the many other great food establishments in North Beach.
author: Daniela A.

description:
While driving home from Berkeley Greek Theater, I frantically searched yelp on my pda to find a late night restaurant... but that screen is too dam small, I need an iphone.  So I decided to hit the thing that is just as good as yelp, Theron L. a fellow yelp friend that lives in the neighborhood that i would like to eat.  He gave a great idea for Calzones, GREAT IDEA!  

We ordered the chicken salad and the lasagna calzone!   Then to finish we had the three moose chocolate cake, which was out of this world, surrounded with raspberry ice cream.  Minus one star for no ice cream but it was still fantastic!
author: Megan L.

description:
I had the most perfect later Saturday afternoon lunch here. 

I decided to drag my buddy N. to the city with me and do lunch in North Beach. We ended up at Calzone's as we walked by and were taken in by the lovely outdoor seating and the beautiful place settings. And the food. My God, the food looked good when we walked by.

It tasted just as good too.

Get the calzone by the way. the place is named after them, after all. I did not order one and was perfectly content with my gnochetti in tomato cream sauce  -- until I had a bite of N.'s Lasagna-style calzone.  the crust was light, crispy (not at all like the big doughy calzone's one's used to getting), the ricotta, mixed with the sausage, was just perfect. Oh. It was a good meal. And the waiters did not roll their eyes at us when we asked for butter with our bread (instead of using the lovely olive oil in front of us) and cheerfully gave us a quarter-stick of butter instead. 

It was a lovely lazy afternoon. The waiters took great care of us, the food was fantastic and you could not ask for a better spot for watching people go by. 

Fantastic!!! Five stars!
author: Monica G.

description: Classy restaurant and bar when you walk in. The atmosphere is definitely friendly and what would you order in a place called Calzone? Delicious, fresh "Italian Calzone." Very fulfilling too. Amazing experience and relatively good service. A bit of a tourist spot for anyone who has never been in San Fran in my opinion.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Been here many times but went this Saturday and as per usual Calzone's did not disappoint!  Best mojitos, calzones and bruschetta!  Love the prawn alfredo its so light and delicous!  One of my favorite spots in North Beach for sure!
author: Jacqueline M.

description: Excellent! The most delicious pizza and tiramisu. Lovely, fast service. Beautiful location, and the best strawberry mojito I have ever had!!
author: Lacey L.

description:
What do you do on a lazy Sunday afternoon when the weather is nice? Come down to Little Italy, stop by Calzone's... Sit outside and drink some wine and munch on some appetizers... 

Pinot Noir for him...
Sauvignon Blanc for me...
Mussels in garlic butter and bruschetta to munch on... 

People watching... 
Wind blowing a little...
Slight rain... 

Sharing a lazy afternoon with my sweetie... 

Ahh... This is the life... 

Service is good... Food is fantastic... Minus one star for the weird music they were playing...
author: Jen D.

description:
Calzone's is a great place to relax in the outdoor seating and have a slice of pizza under the heat lamps at night. If you are a people watcher it is an added bonus, seeing as though the main attraction is the street of Columbus and it is usually pretty entertaining. 

Reminiscent of a real Italian joint you can enjoy a cigarette at your table without the worry that the table over may complain. They have ashtrays you can ask for. The only downside is the tables aren't big so going in a large group is out of the question. Stick to a smaller, more intimate group unless you want to balance your plate on your lap.
author: Natalie N.

description:
Okay, I love coming to this place!

Yes, there are a few places in the area where the food may be a bit more flavorful, but I really like the atmosphere.  I like the big windows and the option of dining indoors or on the sidewalk.  It can get a bit noisy, especially on the weekend, but overall it's a great place to eat.

I typically get starters of calamari and bruschetta...both are pretty good.  The roasted chicken is pretty good, as is the salad, and thin crust pizza!!!  Oh yeah, I prefer deep dish, but the pizza here is  GOOD!!!

If you have guests from out of town, this is a great "San Francisco" experience!
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
First night of the family vacation, and I wanted to eat a good Italian meal in North Beach.  Unfortunately I couldn't remember the name of the restaurant that one of my friends highly recommended, so it we made the decision democratically. I lost the vote. This is an obvious tourist trap, and such restaurants are always on the bottom of my list. 

Still, I tried to keep an open mind as we were herded through the very crowded floor and greeted by a server who looked way too busy. I was optimistic when I saw the homemade fettuccine options. I ended up ordering the blue  cheese alfredo. It wasn't that bad. The chicken and veggies were nice. But I think I only tasted blue cheese in one bite. If you're going to call your dish a blue cheese alfredo, I think you should be a lot more generous with said ingredient! Usually my complaint is too much blue cheese, because it can be so overpowering. But in this case, I felt like Christopher Walken advising Blue Oyster Cult, "Needs more Blue Cheese!"

The rest of my party did not do as well. The calzones were deemed a disappointment. But the real loser was my brother's chicken asparagus fettuccine. Not only did it taste just blah, but the chicken was severely overcooked. It was rubbery, dry, and overpowered by char taste. Why a line cook would serve that to somone is beyond me. It was so bad, that we actually returned it and got another order of the blue cheese alfredo. And we NEVER return food unless it's truly awful. Jussayin'.

The reason why this isn't a 1 star review is that we did try dessert and this was hands down the best part of the evening. The tiramisu was just how I likes it: light, loose texture and not too sweet. Also delicious: the lemon torte. I almost licked that plate clean.
author: Anthony C.

description: Delicious!  Great atmosphere.  Very good service.  There are a million restaurants to choose from here in Little Italy and I assume they are all great, but I loved this place.  Excellent calzone and salad.  I had the artichoke calzone with swiss chard, onions and cheese.  Excellent.  The butter lettuce salad made me very happy!  The wine was great.  Affordable spot.  Get a seat by the window and watch the parade of people go by!  Loved it!
author: Thomas B.

description: Let me state right off, my wife wanted to give it 5 stars. And I'm close to that. We just really liked the place. Service was very good and attentive. We shared a chicken Caesar - excellent. Scallops appetizer - very good. And the pizza, while different, was delicious. Then we sealed the deal with the tiramisu. Yum. A very good dining experience. Would recommend it if you are in north beach
author: Tom S.

description:
Calzone's  is another place that I always walk by but have never stopped at so after figuring out Tomasso's is closed on Mondays we decided to hit up Calzone's.

We decided against eating outside on busy Columbus so we sat inside at a table upstairs. The interior is setup to look like the inside of an Italian grocery store and kind of has the feel of a retro T.G.I.Fridays. The food wasn't bad but it was also nothing special. All in all it was worth a trip but I won't be frequenting Calzone's.
author: Thel D.

description:
I've been here a few times and I really love their food.

So far I've had the beet salad appetizer which is pretty good and my friend's favorite (she gets it with chicken added).  Their lamb tenderloin is my favorite along with this seafood dish they have with mashed potatoes and roast seaweed.  Awesome!

This place also makes some of the best mojitos I've ever had.

Enjoy.
author: Theron L.

description:
hmm what should i put this?...it will be a 3 stars if my kid didn't end up with a stomach flu and we didn't find a actual hair in our angel hair.

I like the service, the people are nice, they replace the dish right away with no question asked. I like that.

several things beside the hair make me think that they didn't preserve their ingredients well.
dish up too fast.... and they are warm, not hot. Even,..... the calzone.

i remember in some places, you have to wait for about 20-30 mins if you have calzone in your order. that is how much time it will usually take to make a calzon from scratch...dish is up in 10 minutes? that has to be a precooked calzone. 

so, if you are looking for a great experience, i will recommend to try someplace else. 

on the other hand, if you are looking for a fast food style Italian restaurant, congratulation!! you find the best place!!.
author: Joel K.

description:
big portions
reasonable price
philly steak calzone was yummy and big.
outside sitting was warm and comfortable.
calamari appetizer was not good: it looked like left overs from cutting and chopping main part of calamari. more than enough pieces of pepper were mixed with calamari to make it look like a big dish of calamari while many of pieces were peppers!!
author: Neda M.

description:
Calzone has an amazing outdoor seating area with heat lamps that keep you cozy while eating.. Inside has crazy decor full of all sorts of bottled, canned food, & other randomness.. Place is always pretty packed but the food is worth the wait.. Prices aren't outrageously expensive & the atmosphere is awesome.. Service was quick other than having to wait a good minute for our waters

I've tried their strawberry mojito which was off the hook & their calzones alone are worth coming out for.. upstairs tends to get pretty hot though..

Overall, a great place to check at least once
author: Jason B.

description:
Oh dear.  

What's with all the good reviews for this place?  I live in NB and I am still on the hunt for the good Italian places.  This is definitely not one of them.

When people ask me where to go in North Beach I literally say "anywhere but Calzone's.."

Maybe there are good things on the menu but when I went our entire party had bland, overpriced pasta.  

Don't do it!  From my experience all the good places are one block off Columbus. (Bocce, Sodini's)
author: Derek B.

description:
This place is decidedly average. It's good for big groups, but the food is just okay. Not bad, not fantastic. I did think that the drinks were generously poured and the service pretty attentive considering we were upstairs in a HUGE group. 
I particularly enjoyed the time we got a group of strippers to give our birthday boy 21 kisses. Happy-fricken-birthday!
author: Kat C.

description:
I'll get right to the point and say that it's the lasagna that brings me to this place all the time.  There is just something about it that I really like and makes me want more.  They use a very thin pasta, super thin.  It's like sheets of paper layered with a tasty meat sauce and cheeses.  Cheese lovers beware though, it's light on the cheese.  Nothing is stopping us from loading on the parmesan though.
