Only once have I strayed from the lasagna and had an adulterous affair with the crab fettucine.  It was very tasty though with plenty of dungeness crab and tasty pasta.  it was just spicy enough for me but those sensitive to heat might want to take a little caution before ordering and clarify how spicy you do or do not like it.  I didn't even know it would be spicy when I ordered it.

Other characteristics such as service, wait times, atmosphere are all decent.  Nothing mind blowing about it but also nothing to complain about.  It's a great spot to people watch at any time of day or night with it's location in North Beach.  If you are avoiding this place because it's a "tourist trap" then you are missing out on some good food.
author: Luis M.

description:
Once again Anna B took me to a good North Beach restaurant. It is a fun place, even though it does scream tourist. The restaurant is pretty, it is in a good location, and the food is pretty good. And like Anna mentioned, it is open late, which always gets huge points in my book.

I had the gnocchi with aparagus, which was much creamier and rich than I would have liked, but I still ate it all. The artichoke was also good. 

Not as good as Gondola down the street, which earned four stars, and I am still looking for the amazing 5-star italian restaurant in North Beach.
author: Lauren H.

description: It was a pretty good Italian restaurant in North Beach, but not the best by any means. The only good thing about this place is that they stay open pretty late and their menu has everything you would really want from an Italian restaurant and then some. The prices are fair and the service seemed quick and courteous.
author: Kate D.

description: While walking around San Francisco last month, my girlfriend and I discovered Calzone's by default.  I say by default because we only went there after Opentable made an error, an old favorite restaurant of mine was closed, and we were both too lazy to walk any farther.  That being said, serendipity can be sweet, and Calzone's was surprisingly good.  I had an outstanding plate of pasta, my girlfriend loved her pizza, and the wine list--although nothing to write home about--had some nice and reasonably priced options.  The service was friendly, and the atmosphere was a relief after being trapped in North Beach with throngs of people.  You can definitely do a lot worse up there, so Calzone's is certainly worth a look.
author: Ty D.

description:
After a small fiasco of "where to eat its 11pm" crazyness we end up here. The only restaurant place on north beach thats open till 1am. (plus 1) We got a bottle of wine not too expensive and pizzas which weren't bad. Street seating isnt bad either.

Wow and i almost forgot the bruschetta!!! really awkwardly big but delicious.. mmmmMMMMMMMM
author: Eric F.

description:
A beautiful night in San Francisco, could help but want to dine al fresco.  In fact, the heat lamps really weren't necessary at all!

I've walked by Calzone's on so many occasions and this was perhaps only the second time in my life that I've ever eaten there, and I was pleasantly surprised.  It was worthy of at least 3.5 stars, which I rounded up to 4, until I have the chance to go there again and try a few other things on their menu.  

I wavered a bit before deciding on the orzo with seafood, which was extremely tasty!  The orzo was in this wonderfully flavor-packed in a butter and wine sauce and the seafood was plentiful and overflowing!  I devoured everything on my plate.

I didn't really feel like having dessert, but we ordered up the chocolate truffle mousse cake with a raspberry sauce anyway.  It was divine!  Just melted in your mouth and left a lingering sweetness for you to savor for a few more moments before diving in for another bite.
author: Evelyn K.

description: The staff was not really helpful in explaining the menu, didn't really like the food, and everything else was just ...eh
author: Mohamed S.

description:
After getting turned away by the sub-par manager at Roy's, we celebrated at Calzone's. This place hasn't failed us yet. The food and service are excellent! Juan is an exceptional waiter. 

We had our favorite default pizza, salmon and capers on a very thin matzah-like dough crust. We also ordered a new favorite, crab, red onions and avocado pizza. Their bruschettas are pretty fab, too. 

Tony ,the bartender, made the best Skyy lemon drop and dirty martinis. Bar none (pun intended). Highly recommended. And I do mean, HIGH!!!

We brought our own 1999 Chandon's Etole Brut Sparkling Wine to compliment the dinner. Orgasmic!

Signore Froncillo, Il vostro ristorante  eccellente.
author: Miles G.

description:
i'm so glad my boyfriend lives within walking distance to all of these great italian restaurants. 

calzones by far has been the best as far as the food goes. the portions are huge and the price just about average and taste even better. and did i mention they have awesome mojitos! 

great place to dine outside on a sunny saturday afternoon (if there are such things in san francisco. haha i know quite rare)
author: Anh P.

description:
After reading some of the statements below, I've come to the conclusion that there's a really good reason some of us do not get paid to write reviews  =)

In my humble opinion, sometimes service is everything. When the food delivered is exactly what it claims to be, there's very little reason to not love this restaurant.

OK, granted the true, Italian, menu options are a bit short for a restaurant located in little Italy - but that's a small oversight. I'm not Italian and I'm not complaining about their lack of Italian noodle options. I don't even know what that means. I just had a few Italian friends dine with us and kept asking for items that seemed to be commonplace with the Italian community. 

Back to the grit: both times I've visited, we were sat upstairs. While the bottom level seemed crowded, small and busy, the upstairs area was nice and quaint. There were only a handful of tables accompanied wuth a  gang of employees.

Service - there are about 3 different people per table assigned to cater to all your needs. I swear there was a water boy, bread man, waiter and busboy all within arms reach. Needless to say, the service was second to none. We were waited on hand and foot beyond the regular expectations of a restaurant. Let's be real, we all cringe when we see the 18% added to the bill when we felt like the server earned 2%. With this restaurant, I wanted to give more.

Food - who goes to an Italian restaurant for pizza? I don't care if it could, would or should be better than our homegrown deliveries.  I go to Italian restaurants to eat something I can rarely have delivered. Color me weird I guess. Both times I went, I had the pleasure to taste a handful of dished and appetizers. Everything thus far is far above par. The appetizers were incredible.

notables: 

- Mojito's
- scallops appetizers
- Shrimp and mussels with angel hair
- any desert


If you go, ask to be sat upstairs and enjoy. Come back and thank me later =)
author: Randall B.

description: The food was pretty good. service was good. Not the best calzone we ever had but it made for a nice date night out while we were visiting San Fran.
author: Keli G.

description: Service was slow, food pricey (given the quality) it was average at best. We had the lasagna calzone and were not impressed. I will not go back...  Too many other choices in the area.
author: Adrian J.

description:
A little overrated and a little overpriced. However, I enjoyed what I ordered which was the baby romaine salad. I added chicken breast and ordered an appetizer of garlic bread. All was good. One of my friends ordered the chicken calzone, wasn't good at all.
Someone at our table ordered the garlic fries! OMG! they smelled heavenly, like sweet roasted garlic, and tasted even better.
The atmosphere was nice, first time I'd been to North Beach...But, i think I'll try somewhere else next time. This wasn't as good as it could've been.
author: Candida B.

description: This place has great atmosphere and the service is awesome. I've been here twice since moving to the bay area and both times have been great. The food I've had has been very good but I haven't done dinner here yet. I will definitely be back to try dinner sometime soon.
author: Jessica W.

description: Their food is amazing!!! Everything is good. Went here a few years ago and counted remember the name. Came to North Beach to eat Italian and magically found it again and it didn't disappoint. They have outdoor sitting, which makes for an interesting experience (I remember seeing a cat on someone's shoulder). Prices are decent and staff was nice. Will definitely be returning
author: Olivia M.

description:
It's a funny thing that North Beach would be known for its food and nudie bars.  This place was a stop based upon a recommendation we got.  I had the calzone and my wife had a salad.  I won't comment on the salad because there was nothing going on there except chicken and salad.  Calzone was served on a lengthy plate which makes the food look bigger than it actually is.  The doughy outside was piping hot and the goods inside which happened to be mushrooms, cheese, sausage and sauce were pretty damn good.  

The real entertainment was sitting outside.  While we were stuffing our mouths tourists would come up to us and either ask how the food was or where Pier 39 is.  I'm thinking, yeah right buddy you're in North Beach.  Just ask me where's a good place to see some boobs and I'll point your way to that greasy Italian guy wearing the Men's Warehouse suit.
author: Bill P.

description: Romantic. Fun. Outside dining with warmers. Great people watching. Terrific desserts. Can't say enough about this. If there's a room available at La Boheme next door, you may want to stop in there too. The boutique hotel next door is cute, cozy, and fun. Read some beat poets first - and before your stop in, go to City Lights bookstore. Perfect night for romantic couples. Or, if you happen to be alone, pick up a Farhlengetti book at City Lights (he owns the place) in the neighborhood - and sit and read and meet someone with charm walking by or sitting next to you. You may see Jack Hirshman walking by!
author: Frank G.

description:
I live down the street from calzones and I consider it to be my san francisco comfort food.  San Francisco's greatest asset is being able to walk down the street to have a nice relaxing dinner.  Everything that I've ordered there has been pretty decent but what keeps me coming back is definately the ambiance.  It's the perfect place to just sit back and people watch over a glass of wine or pineapple moquitos and reflect on this wonderful city that I now call home.  I'm the type that likes to have 2 hour meals and the waiters here are not one to rush.    

This is a good place to come with friends to just catch up on life.   The price is decent, it's not too loud where you have to yell across the table to be heard, and it's open late!  It also works for a romatic date as well since they have cute little tables outside that require you to sit really close side by side since the tables are pretty small.  :)
author: hanh b.

description:
Fantastic place to sit outside and have light brunch on a lazy Sunday!! You get heavy doses of sun on this side of the street, especially true with this place since the chairs are facing the street so you are really sitting next to your company!

I have tried Arugula with Artichokes and smoked salmon and it was great and refreshing. Bread was so so but service was pretty good. Love their colourful tables and overall decorations.
author: T L.

description:
Calzones
430 Columbus Ave
San Francisco, Ca 94133
415.397.3600
 
 
Calzones is a great family/touristy restaurant.  The food is okay, the service is terrible.  It is a novelty restaurant that is entertaining kind of like Disneyland... It's not for me, but many famillies I send here love it.  It is in the heart of North Beach and has a very vibrant atmosphere...It is on the same level to me as The Stinking Rose.  The wine list is minimal so order a cocktail, the wine I chose was terrible (and their was only one choice for Sauvignon Blanc.)  The Calzones are their specialty, obviously, so I would stick to what they know best and order a calzone....
Not every restaurant is for everyone....they must be doing something right...they are always packed!
author: Michele K.

description:
Very decent bruschetta. I don't know why, but I generally judge Italian food by it's bruschetta. The pizza, however, was...unique. Spaghetti meat sauce was used in place of the tomato sauce. The bottle of Zin got me sauced. I sat upstairs with my "dinner date" as she called it when she answered her phone and told her friend that she couldn't talk.

Complaints: So minor. The tables were a little high and the seats were a little low. I kind of felt like I was in Fast Times at Ridgmont High while waiting for Demone to bring my wallet.

Dessert. Go for the chocolate mousse thing with the rasberry...slammin'! ('cept the bill read, "moose")
author: Patrick G.

description: Did the management change?  I have been going here for the last four or five years about three or four time a year.  It's touristy but the food has always been consistent, super tasty.  On my last visit a couple of weeks ago, I found that the menu options were greatly reduced and that a couple of my favorite items were gone.  I'm not sure if it's been halved but the menu really is smaller.  When I commented about this to the waiter he said they changed it a few months before.  He could not tell me why.  I used to do the Angel Hair with Marinara or the Fettuccine with Broccolini and pine nuts/garlic.  Those dishes were my go to and were the best on the menu, in my opinion, and now they are gone.  The place is largely the same, free bread is the same but without the funny little bread bags they used to include, of course there are the missing menu items, which is a real bummer and the service was never good, just ok but it's more about sitting outside and watching the people walk by and having food and drinks.  I never had a bad dining experience here, never made a reservation, my chicken fettuccine was not as flavorful as the dishes I like to order but maybe that is my perception.  I might go back again in a few months to see if they brought back the old menu items, if not, I may have to find a new spot in North beach that is not one of their sister restaurants.  Bummer.  I give them four stars because I have had some fun dinners here, even if they aren't the most foodie of the places around.
author: Randy S.

description:
I was visiting from out town and this place was recommended to me by a born and bred Franciscian (?). Admittedly, the neon sigh scared me, but I went in, ordered a margherita pizza and was so happy. Finally, a pizza not covered in cheese, canned sauce and surrounded by dough. It was light, crisp and covered in FRESH tomatoes, basil and garlic (not too much though). I added a bit of salt, just to my liking and ate the whole thing. I don't feel bloated and disgusted with myself as I usually do after a pizza bender. 
Also, I was flying solo that might, but was checked on by my waiter in timely intervals. Great place for solo diners, and seemingly groups of people.
author: C M.

description:
Its a good thing that the calzones here are good, because I don't think that the restaurant name would work if it were not the case.

The pesto chicken calzone is my favorite - in addition to the minestrone soup and the tiramisu.

A great place to have a social and casual meal. While I haven't eaten outside, it looks like a fun thing to do.

Eat a calzone, at calzones!
author: Brian D.

description:
So let me get this out up front: I'm not giving this place 4 stars like I'd give NOPA 4 stars, or Town Hall 4 stars. Calzone's plays for a different league, bats for a different team, or waxes on while everyone else waxes off. It doesn't roll on Shabbas, and if it were an employee it would show up to work slightly hungover and unshaved. 

Basically, this place is king of the I-talian restaurants of North Beach -- the row of red-sauce spaghetti houses that give Columbus Ave. it's Disney-esque Mediterranean gusto. It's the kind of place you hit up when you want an evening in Roma without the expectations or the price tags or Perbacco, Del Fina, etc. 

Personally, I love Columbus and its cafes. It so desperately wants to be Italy that it's kind of charming, or at least heartwarming. And Calzone's, in my mind, offers the right balance of good food, great setting/locale, plenty of outdoor seating, nice small bar where they sometimes forget to make you pay for your beer, and prompt service. It's the kind of  place that makes you want to do Godfather impressions, even though I'm pretty sure none of the staff has ever been to Italy.

Try the pasta Bolognese, bruschetta, and of course the calzones. 

So if you're on an eight on ninth date, want a casual and festive place to dine with friends, don't feel like burning through your paycheck on dinner or want a quick bite with great atmosphere before you hit the bars, head to Calzone's. And be sure to ask for lots of gravy on the noodles.
author: Andrew K.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to take out-of-towners for an authentic North Beach experience. Calzone's boasts a great location, a fun environment and outdoor seating. Lovely place to eat when nights are not too chilly, although they do have heaters. You've probably walked by Calzone's a million times, you can't miss it, with the black and white checker-board sidewalk and the bright red, neon letters. You probably avoided it thinking it was a tourist trap, but give it a chance, you may be surprised.

It's usually pretty busy so grab a drink at the bar while you wait for your table. They make great Mojitos (7 kinds). Once you're finally seated they will bring you lots of fresh-baked bread and butter (don't you love them already?) The bread comes in a funny little baggie. It's cute. 

The menu is mostly Italian but with a California/fusion flare. But don't assume that all of the dishes are fusion, because they're not. I always get the potato and asparagus ravioli but I just looked at their menu and it looks like they don't make that anymore. Here is the menu: http://www.calzonesf.com/pdf/menu.pdf

Check them out. Remember, it's okay to be a tourist in your own city sometimes.
author: L. L.

description: Atmosphere. Bolognese. Crab Alfredo. Salmon Asparagus Orzo. Sergio. Wine. The view. A superb experience.
author: Mike F.

description:
3.5 stars, you must be joking! I wasn't even going to shame myself by admitting to dining in this establishment, but I simply must bring down this average! Only went to this tourist hell because it was Monday and I didn't realize Tommaso's was closed. This was the first place we hit that wasn't a strip buffet, the stomach is a powerful machine.

Ok, the pizza was a lavash with cheese and toppings, no sauce. Actually the same mix that was the bruschetta (best thing). Pasta was ack. Also, don't sit in the mirrored back corner because the fun house feel only makes the realization you are in culinary hell even worse. If anyone mentions this place, stay clear...the outdoor tables may look cute and inviting, but this is SF, you have options!
author: Cassie C.

description:
My girlfriend and i tried this place because of the huge line of people we saw waiting outside the restaurant.

I have to say that we definitely give this place mixed reviews.   We ordered the prosciutto calzone, the waldorf salad, and the bruschetta.  Contrary to a review i read earlier, my calzone was perfect! The crust was light and flaky and it was filled with great tasting cheese and a great deal of prosciutto.  The bruschetta was very good, definitely not the best ive ever tried, as their tomatoes weren't as fresh as they could be, but overall i thought it was definitely worth the price.  The downside of our meal was definitely the salad.  The ingredients didn't look or taste so fresh, which is a big portion of why this place only got 3 stars from me.  To their credit, everything else that other people ordered around us, looked amazing!

The reason this place really got such an average rating despite their above average food is the bad combination of long lines, tightly compacted tables, and really hot and humid interior.  If you have the flexibility, definitely come early and definitely ask to sit outside as you will not only sweat inside (which is horrible for dates :-p) but you will get very annoyed by the claustrophobic feel of the table setup.  And if your unlucky enough to get seated very close to the very loud group of  drunk people, then your experience will really get ruined.  

The service here was just so-so.  While our server was really nice and helpful, we was pretty good at disappearing for most of the night as we really only saw him before and after the meal.  To their credit, the people refilling the water were very good and always around.

So in conclusion, while i do feel like that the majority of the food here looked pretty good, looks can be deceiving as this place is absolutely hit or miss in terms of the menu.  The menu is also a bit overpriced which i feel is a little unwarranted and definitely gives a touristy feel to the restaurant.  

The best way to describe this place is that it is hit or miss.  It all just depends on what you order, where you sit, and who you sit by...If your up for a challenge and are feeling lucky, then this is for you!
author: Mark R.

description:
An ok place to have lunch on a nice day.  We sat outside and watched tourists walking by and looking lost.  We also saw some really bad parallel parking jobs; an elderly lady backed her car straight into the  front end of a car behind hers and just drove away.  Yikes! Remind me not to park my car around here!

Food wise, I had the chicken melt which was kinda bland.  Maybe I should've ordered a calzone instead? Doh! Anyway, I washed away my dismay with an amstel light.   Didn't feel like trying anything else after this.
author: Jeff H.

description: I've had much better Italian food, but gosh do I like to sit outdoors and people watch. Still, the food isn't bad, and the drinks are super cheap (compared to LA prices).  The service is excellent as well. :)
author: Benito L.

description:
The people watching was better than the actual food.
That being said, the people watching was pretty darn fantastic, so really . . .the food was above decent.  Being a Saturday night, we had to wait.  Once we were seated, however, we ordered and within ten minutes our pizza and salad appeared.  Big plus.  My heirloom tomato salad was supposed to have avocado as well, but I swear I didn't discover even a sliver of the green fruit of the gods until I made it to the bottom.  The margherita pizza was fresh and yummy, but kind of overpriced.
Basically we ate here because we had never been her before and we had always walked by it and were curious.  Now that I have gotten that out of the way, I probably won't be back.
author: Lacy T.

description:
My fiance and I didn't intend to wind up at Calzone's the night we went there, but boy are we glad we did! I was craving a BBQ chicken salad from Cheesecake factory, so we decided to beat the crowds and head to the tourist trap early so we didn't have to wait... except by the time we got there (like 5:30!), it was already at least an hour wait! So, we decided to hop on the bus to NB and try out Calzone's, because we had walked by the outdoor seating countless times and really wanted to try it out. 

There was hardly a wait for an outdoor table, and we sat down in the glow of the warm heat lamps. We had to wait a few minutes for attention from the waiter, but we didn't mind. We wanted to get a bottle of wine, but we weren't impressed with their wine list. It was pretty small, and kind of pricey... but we got the cheapest chianti on the menu, and it was decent. We ordered bruschetta, which was yummy, but didn't compare to Panta Rei's. I ordered mini gnocchi and my fiance ordered the pasta with asparagus and chicken. We were both really pleased with our meals, but I liked the gnocchi better. 

If the food was better, it would have gotten five stars. It was good, but not amazing... and for an Italian restaurant, it definitely needed a better wine list. But, the ambiance was incredible. I loved sitting next to my man and watching the people pass by. It was great not needing a coat in December because the heat lamps kept us so warm. We didn't feel rushed, which can be a rare thing in some of the fast paced restaurants of North Beach. The ambiance was slightly disrupted by the homeless woman who came by twice to ask for money, but that just served to remind us that we were in SF, and not in Italy. I would really recommend this place if you want to spend a romantic evening outdoors with your partner. I think it's safe to say we will be back.
author: Bridgette A.

description:
I've discovered a trend among the Italian restaurants that sit on or just off of Columbus... they aren't bad. They ARE overpriced, and this "pizza cucina" fits that bill. The calzone I ordered was $13, and while the dough was amazingly warm and chewy the filling was simply meh. The appetizer (crab and salmon crostini) pretty much just tasted like smoked salmon... again not bad but nothing to write home about.

Food aside, the service was quick without being rude, and the wine list left something to be desired. Fun enough to visit once, but be prepared to go pop-eyed when the bill arrives.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I absolutely love this place! I've been here quite a few times and have never had a bad meal. My favorite is the crab pasta and I get it with cappelini =) YUM! and they have a really good wine list.
the place has been here for who knows how long and has a nice vibe to it. The service is always excellent even when they are insanely busy and it's fun to each on the sidewalk tables and people watch in North Beach.
author: Melody T.

description: Food was just ok expected more based on the reviews. Might give it another try drinks were good!!
author: Finan H.

description: I absolutely enjoyed the feel of this place! My friends and I gotten pasta and Shirley Temples and we all enjoyed it! Although, one thing I wish the pasta had was garlic bread. The  bread we did get for free was a bit stale, and dry. Good food service. Nice street view. Other than that, must go place to enjoy Italian food.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Hungry at 3pm? Want to dine along the sidewalk and people watch? 
I can ALWAYS count on Calzone's. 
Ironically, I have never had a calzone here, however they have one of the best thin crust crab pizza-- made with fresh dungeness crab and avocado-- that I've ever had. It's covered in crab meat, cheese & avocado and the crust is just the right thickness, IMO.
Their crab pasta is excellent too. You can go with the recommended ribbon-style pasta or ask for another type- I like the angel hair.
I've always found that eating just one dish here is enough to satisfy me, but their appetizers are tasty as well... mussels, fries, calamari, bruschetta... my advice is to go with a big appetite!
author: John Eric S.

description:
One of my favorite places in SF. I come there at least once a month and I take all my friends who come to visit me to Calzone's. 

First of all, they have the best Mojitos in town. Their seafood appetizers are delicious and price wise affordable. Calzone's staff is friendly and they always make compliments and smile at you. 

I never had a bad experience at this place. Good coffee, tiramisu is delicious here. 

I don't like to sit inside, so I usually sit outside at their heated patio. I love to people watch and it gives me a European feel to it. 

Definitely recommended!!! I'm going back next week....yam...
author: Katja S.

description:
The atmosphere at Calzone's is pretty fun if you can manage to get one of the street-side tables out front under the heat lamps.  I recently had out of town guests visiting and took them to Calzone's because I figured they would get a kick out of the ability to eat on the street.  I was right.

Aside from seeming to be a little touristy (I prefer the hole in the wall NB Italian joints when I'm not entertaining guests), the food was not bad.  i wouldn't have minded larger portions, but the quality of the food was pretty good.  For some reason, I just associate Italian food with large portions.  If you do also, this isn't the place for you.  Maybe I'm crazy, but this is just how my Italian mother and grandma raised me - giant portions.

Service was good.  They managed to screw up my friend's order (brought lasagna instead of lasgna calzone), but upon informing them, they were very apologetic and accommodating.  My friend ended up keeping the wrong order and enjoyed it anyways, so who really cares.
author: Brian J.

description:
It's good, straightforward Italian food. It's extremely loud, but this was fun for me because I was drunk and being a little loud myself. *Smiles sweetly

Halfway through our yummy meal, I noticed my friend looking alarmed. It smelled like marijuana! (He was an R.A. in college..his R.A nose was twitching..)

Oh, those crazy SF hippies!
author: Christine N.

description: Lamb an arugula. Nothing better than a little rocket with some perfectly cooked and seasoned meat. Delicious and amazing at the same time
author: Vito F.

description: I've found myself bringing my family and friends from out of town to this place on several occasions.  Lots of seating for a mom and pop restaurant in San Francisco.  Food is really good for the price. Outside seating is great. I'm a pretty big fan of the Fillet (yes I know this is an Italian restaurant). For $19 it doesn't disappoint. It just melts in your mouth.  Everyone that I've brought here has left full and satisfied.
author: Chad H.

description: Great little spot in little Italy area. Open late, suggest the outside seating so you can people watch (there are heat lamps). The items on the menu are surprisingly very good and tasty for such a little spot you happen across. Lots to choose from is your biggest worry. I would describe it as more than you asked for.
author: Eric W.

description:
There are soooo many Italian restaurants next to one another in Little Italy it really is a hard choice to pick the perfect place but this was close enough! The seating outside is a bit tight and tables are small and service was slow but definitely not a deal breaker.
We ofcourse tried the Italian Calzone which was absolutely delicious, best I have ever eaten. Also ordered a pasta dish with asparagus and chicken however there was little to no sauce at all, very dry. The house Cabarnet wine was perfect!
author: Krisss M.

description:
Better choices in North Beach.  This is not authentic Italian food, very touristy.

And our waiter  was horrible.  He was difficult to hear and I don't think he could hear us because every question we asked him he answered very oddly.  And when asked if we could get an Il Forno Calzone, (add cheese and sauce to the top of the calzone), he didn't know what we were talking about and told us no, without asking the kitchen.  

Won't be going back!
author: Tami P.

description: I came here Christmas Eve with my mom and sister. I thought everywhere would be bananas, but surprisingly Calzones was only a 20 minute wait. We got the bruschetta, garlic fries, chicken & asparagus pasta and the crab & asparagus pasta. To the point - I was not a fan of the food. The only thing I had that had some flavor was the garlic fries. I was deeply disappointed by the pasta and prob won't be coming back.
author: Jackie M.

description:
As said by another yelper - the only redeeming quality is it's open late. Yeah, I'll have to reiterate that.

At 9:45 we were looking for something infused with cheese and italian (much like I like my men) so we opted to go here. I had been here once before at 1 am and ate some delicious crab mush appetizer, and figured my experience was positive that time, I'll try dinner.

Very sub-par. The menu sounds good, but then you get the food and it feels like a very literal translation of description. Like, "Yes. That is asparagus. With orzo. Asparagus orzo it is." There is no surprise of delicious spices or tastes. It just seemed bland and boring. I got some sort of prawn dish, and I spent most of my time picking through my pasta de-shelling the creatures.

The mojitos had sugar cane in them which seemed cool, but were dried out and tasteless. Oh well. I won't be back here unless I'm drunk at 1 am in north beach I guess.
author: Serene L.

description:
San Francisco is the mecca for food, culture and art on the west coast.  It is sad but true that a place like Calzones exist to feed off of the consumers rather then to help them out.  My sister and her boyfriend where in town and wanted Italian food, they searched Columbus street looking for the right Location and as marketing 101 deemed it to be Calzones' neon signs we beckoning my sister to their door.

I followed reluctantly, but wanted to be a gracious host. The restaurant was not busy, but service was questionable. Our waiter came up to take our order, not giving any specials, took our drink order and 3 mins went by and someone other then the server brought us our drinks, .
The bags of bread were okay not the best that I have had.  The waiter  came back with the food and asked if there was any issues? None good.  Never heard back from him.  We saw him standing around talking to people, but no attention to the table. We had to ask an expediter to bring refills.

At the end the check was dropped and hurried...
 
If you want a decent food, and do not care about your service, go here, but otherwise I would venture.
author: Brent M.

description: Nice place to hang out and eat if your in the city past midnight. Love to hang out outside where you can see people walk by. Pasta is delicious, I especially like their orzo's. Portion's are just right, not glutton sized.
author: Paul V.

description: Went there last night. Had the garlic bread with smoked mozerella. It was about $7 for 4 pieces. YIKES! I ordered a side of alfredo sauce to dip the bread in - it was about the same size as what they put the ketchup that comes with your meal in and they charged us $1 for it. Crazy! The alfredo was divine though. My fiance loved loved loved his butcher's burger and garlic fries. (The fries were really good) My lasagna was ho hum, especially for the price. Nice meal but I don't think it's anything I would go back for.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Pretty good.  A little too Americanized for me compared to other places in North Beach.  But if you want a hearty dinner, order a calzone, because they are huge!  The pesto pasta I ordered was fine.  The fettuccine itself was the way I like it- fresh, but the pesto was not anything memorable.  My friends calzone was big but also nothing mind blowing by any means.

If you want to sit here and have a coffee, this would be the place because people upon people walk by, making this place pretty fun to sit at.  I also felt that the prices were a bit much for what you were getting.  Not a steal, but hey, it gets the job done.
author: Cara D.

description: Great people watching from the sidewalk tables but the food is questionable.  It tasted OK going down, absolutely nothing special, but my dining companion and I felt indigestion several hours later.  Unfortunately, it lasted most of the night.
author: Frank H.

description: There was so much to choose from on the menu and it was so hard to decide what to even order.   3 of us sat outside, people watching under the heat lamps (the wind still left it pretty cold though), and we shared the met plate appetizer, a prosciutto sandwich, calamari and a Caesar salad and it was all very tasty - not off the charts but nummy.  I also had a regular mojito and a Moscow mojito and both were awesome!!  I look forward to another trip there to try out more of their awesome menu, and enjoy the unique atmosphere.
author: Angela R.

description:
Not sure why this place gets bad reviews! Anyhow, I went with friends and had the pizza....yum! It's really thin and long, and GREAT! Not too greasy either. Had a glass of the house wine - not the best, but oh well. My friends all enjoyed their entrees too. 

I liked how they had the place decorated too. We sat upstairs on the balcony and enjoyed it. 

Probably better places in North Beach, but you should give this place a shot!
author: Ian C.

description:
Five-star food, but absolutely tiny portions, so it gets four stars.

I got the four-cheese pizza and it was incredible. The cheeses and the dough were all so incredibly fresh and it was absolutely delicious. But there was barely anything there, and I was still pretty hungry when I left.

Thankfully, I ended the night at King of Thai Noodle house so I went to bed with a full stomach.
author: Mark A.

description:
My good friend Azure had her 26th birthday party here and I wish she hadn't.

First of all, we made reservation but still had to wait for about 45 minutes. Then when we are finally seated, they place us in a sardine box sized room.

Needless to say getting up to go to the bathroom was quite an ordeal, then when you finally make it to the bathroom there's a wait since there's only one stall.

The food was so so, I was not impressed whatsoever. The plates they served our food on were even a miss, with their awkward and large size it made it hard to fit every ones plates on our already very small table. The portions were very small and much overpriced. The one great thing I did enjoy was their mojitos. They had several different flavors that I'd never combined with a mojito before and they were very good. They are all served with a stick of fresh sugar cane, which is used as a stir stick that tastes yummy too. I enjoyed the raspberry mojito. 

So all an all, I won't be going here for dinner again. But I will enjoy some drinks outside on the patio if I don't have to wait 45mins to get a table.
author: Ericka A.

description:
Great Mojitos.  Unfortunately the namesake Calzone was not great.  They don't have a simple choice one; they all have 2 too many ingredients.  
Great atmosphere, though.
author: Zach T.

description:
I wasn't that impress with the food. I had the Garlic Prawns. We also ordered mussels as an appetizer and the waiter forgot about it so decided not to get it at all. 

Will be trying the other Italian restaurants in the area instead of coming here again.
author: arleen r.

description:
I've actually been here twice.  The first I was on a double date and sat near a window so it was good people watching.  The food is okay, moderately priced.  The atmosphere is pretty fun.  Watching all the tourists walk by in North Beach.  Its loud and fun and a good place for a double date.  Especially in our case.  The other couple didn't know each other that well so it made things more comfortable. 

The second time I came here I was in a large group and we sat upstairs (I know I bet you didn't even know they had an upstairs).  It was fun but we didn't get the atmosphere that you would downstairs or curbside.  However, we were the only people up there for the most part so we could be loud but alsoe have conversations across the table etc.  The food was better than I remembered and it was nice with a big group because you have a chance to try lots of things.  They also have cheap wine and lots of different mojitos...which I don't normally like but they have lots of flabors and they're super strong!  Yay!
author: Angela S.

description:
Calzones - bread, cheese, filling.  Why do people rave about these calzones?  It's like a mediocre pizza folded upon itself.  

Pasta - The first (of hopefully not many) time I was here, I had some pasta dish with asparagus and chicken.  It was HORRIBLE.  Tasted like what a college student who doesn't know how to cook would churn out of an old frying pan - overdone and DRY pasta, rubbery dried sauce, limp asparagus, no flavor, nothing.  It was insulting.

Worst?  They seated us upstairs next to the bussing station.  A large party.  Next to the bussing station.  Compare that to your outdoor seating and you have 2 very different experiences in 1 restaurant.  

I have enough of a negative attitude toward this tourist hole that I never want to go back.  Just can't think of anything redeeming about this place.
author: Sarah W.

description:
I love this place! The decor inside is great with large booths. I prefer to sit outside by the heat lamps watching as tourist and people pass by. The food and drinks were also impressive. 

The food was not too expensive and good portion. My friend ordered a seafood dish for 16, I had lasagna for 13. As for drinks, I had a Russian Mojito, similar to a White Russian, but served with a piece of sugar cane. 

The wait staff was nice, courteous and fast both times we were there. Definitely the place to go while in North Beach.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Awesome mojitos!  It's also a nice place to go and sit on the sidewalk on a sunny day people watching.
author: J D.

description:
Okay, so I want to start off by saying that I met the owner of this restaurant and he is very smart and sweet. He owns many many restaurants in the San Francisco including Aqua (I think). It has been open for more than 20 years too. So with all that going for it then it must be amazing right? Not so much...

There is nothing special about it and the service isn't that great. And I also think that it is weird when you go to restaurants and they serve you food on awkward or over shaped plates, so you are cramped on your table. The calzones are good and I am happy that it is open late and I like the fact that there is outside seating. But I always seem to wish for more when I am there.

Basically, it's a safe bet of a place to go if you are in the area. It is just okay. But like I said before, I expect better of a restaurant that has been open for that long.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
I freakin love a place that has BBQ pizza, mojitos, and potstickers.  That is what I am all about.  Oddly enough, I have never had a calzone so I don't know what ya'll are complaining about.

Perfect for a quick bite before a big night out.  We hit it everytime we are going to Cobbs or Bimbos.  Usually on the bike, so parking is never an issue.

Every time I go, My man spills the huge eiffel tower oil bottle.  It's pretty funny.....
author: Rachel D.

description: We loved this place!  Sat outside at the cute little tables for 2.  Service was great, friendly staff.  Had the crab dip as an appetizer and it was AMAZING!  Then my husband and I shared the mushroom pizza, adding balsamic reduction, and it was so delicious!  I would definitely recommend this place and we will come again next time we visit SF!
author: Kyle H.

description: It was on one of those hot fall nights that I decided to eat at this restaurant with my family.  I figured it would be nice a night to go to North Beach and enjoy a nice family dinner.  Walking down the streets, you could smell the delicious aromas of all the Italian restaurants. We had no idea as to which place to eat at, so we stumbled across this place. Every single restaurant was PACKED TO THE MAX! We got seated very quickly and ordered our food & drinks. I got this pasta with broccolini and I was not satisfied, I am a HUGE fan of pasta and this one was not at all what I expected. BUT I did get a bite of my sister's calzone and I must admit I wish that I had gotten a calzone instead. Hello, the name of the place is calzone duh! Why didn't I get one??? Next time, I come to this place I will settle on a calzone and look for some pasta somewhere else.
author: Jessica H.

description: I went here for my anniversary dinner, and it was really quite nice.  There were just some aspects that made it a little stale.  It was full of tourists which is fine, but there are so many other restaurants in North Beach with so much more personality due to the local atmosphere.  The food was good, but a little bland, and for the food being a little bit bland, it seemed a little pricey.  One of the really nice things about this restaurant was getting to sit outside, and enjoy the happenings of North Beach from your table, also the wait staff was very friendly.  All in all it's a great place for dinner, there are just other places I enjoy a little more.
author: Deanna W.

description: Authentic Italian food. Went here after a great day on Fisherman's wharf. Nice romantic dinner. Great Margaritas! I had the shrimp fettuccine alfredo - to die! yummmmo. Definitely eat there again.  Service was impeccable too!
author: Mirella M.

description:
Not even worth 1 star... that is just the lowest I can go. 

1) bread wasn't fresh.. possibly 1-2 days old. plus it was cold. Asked for another piece, and they gave us microwaved bread... lol...

2) $12 appetizer clams were bad... had about 10-12 small clams... thats $1 a clam! 

3) our entrees were...crap. friends dish was lettuce w/ a small piece of fish. mine was lamb on top of huge lettuce leaves... i was thinking.. wtf is this? food presentation was...wow... a joke... 

bill came to $60+ after the weird tasting latte I ordered... 

I just dont get why this place is always crowded. It must be their bright red sign... humans are like bugs... attracted to and fooled by bright looking things...
author: Joey C.

description: As always Calzones rules! The ambiance is west village NY meets Italy even tho I've never been to the latter. The shellfish pasta or pasta with olives and tomatoes are delicious. My bf loves the 5 hour pork. The Fuji apple salad is tasty. Recently they changed their bread...amazing decision. Much better tasting and no more bag. The waiter Jose is so sweet and remembers us again and again. Eat at this North Beach hot spot now!
author: Colette K.

description:
I was so proud of the boyfriend because he finally picked a place to eat that was out of his element. As I've mentioned before in my other reviews, he likes to stick to chains or stuff that he knows. He lives in SF and I just think his concept about food is all wrong!

Anyhoo, he suggested this North Beach restaurant, and I was so impressed! It was pouring rain. We originally wanted to sit outside but it was a lil bit too cold for that. So we had a sizeable booth. 

We shared bruschetta as an appetizer. It was okay. For my entree, I chose the Gnochetti with the meat sauce, and the BF ordered the chicken mushroom orzo. I liked mine better than his. He was unable to finish his dish. We were debating on who got to take it home, I don't think he was too pleased with his dish but was trying to not let it go to waste.

So...instead of the food going to waste, we gave it to a homeless lady who was sitting bundled up in the rain a few blocks away. I'm sure she enjoyed it.

Anyhoo...I love the atmosphere of the place. The food wasn't spectacular, but I'd definetly come back again to try some more menu items.
author: Stacy S.

description: I had a bf that worked there which is the only reason I even went there and though I have not been in a while, they always made kick ass Calzones and their hot coco was great! Nice big mugs...yumm Staff was always VERY cool and that always helps. I may have to take a trip back and check em out again.
author: Bella B.

description: The food was blan. The drinks were too strong. It was nice to sit on the side walk an watch San Francisco flow by. Cheers
author: Sarah P.

description:
So what if it's geared towards tourists. The service was exceptional, the food was great (especially for tourist fare), and the outdoor seating lining the sidewalk was fun - my girlfriend was even able to take off her coat, because the heaters kept us so warm! At these places, part of what you pay for is the experience, and we had a great experience and filling meal for about $30 -- the flatbread pizza was delicious.

People need to lighten up a little and stop condemning a place just because it wants to make money off tourists. This place does what it sets out to do very well. Sure, there may be much better food in the area, but everyone was having a good time here, and that's all that matters in the end.
author: Keith K.

description: I drive pass this place all the time and theres always people seated outside no matter what day so decided to try it out.  Got the Italian Calzone and the Crab Melt Sandwich.  Both were good and the waiters were friendly and helpful.  Nice place to go if your a tourist or want to have a good cheap date.  The location is nice and IMO that draws in the customers.
author: Neil C.

description:
In a warm Indian summer night me and my friend were thinking: what is the best spot to be sitting outside in San Francisco and have a late dinner and a cold beer? We both agreed that Calzone in North Beach would have done it: and it did! We had a great time because the weather was so wonderful that we felt like we were vacationing somewhere in Europe in summer time.
Unfortunately the service was so bad that next time I'm going to think twice before i'll go there again. 
I understand the servers  have to deal with lots of tourists all day long, and that can be annoying, but a they act like if they works for a Mc Donald in Reno. Very cold! And what is this little computer that feels like is recording everything while we order...I felt like a one of many...just a number.
The food is ok, perfect for that time of the night. But the service needs some attention: we are in San Francisco, not Disneyland.
author: Sergio D.

description: The only reason I ever hear not to go to this place is that it's part of a chain. I'm not sure if these people have tried Calzone's excellent potato gnocchi.
author: Kathleen M.

description: This was my first North Beach restaurant that I ever tried and now my husband and I love going there for a relaxing evening and great comfort food. The best was sitting outside under the heat lamps and people-watching as people pass by. The pizza was good. The pasta was really rich and heavy. The ambience was the best- I felt like I was in Italy!
author: Sheena S.

description: Very cute, attractive restaurant. Had Fettuccine Bolognaise and I absolutely loved it. Home made noodles-yum. Pizza was good too. Reasonable prices, very nice.
author: Carrie M.

description:
Hmmm...

...love the decorations!  all those weird cans tacked to the wall and other "italian-y" decorations were fun, but the restaurant in general made me feel a bit touristy...the food was okay, but calzones all taste the same...i'd come here for a bite but maybe try something non-calzone...but next time I think I'd want to sit outside, even though i went in the dead of winter the heaters were warm and made sitting out on the street look absolutely fun!  the outdoor seating reminded me a bit of outdoor cafes in europe!  very cute :)
author: Linda C.

description:
Okay, yes it's heavy with tourists, but I happen to adore this place for one really good reason: People Watching. See how's it in capitals? That's because it's so sweet: people on dates, out of towners in their SF sweatshirts, drunk foolios with their liquid courage, you name it, you'll see it here. 

My fave dish is the angel hair with tomato, basil and garlic. Simple. Good. Every single time. You might also dig the bruschetta. But don't hate causes it's touristy, it's also open late, and you SFers know that's a good thing in this shut down at 11 town.
author: Charlene L.

description:
food is cheaper than other places, we each had a pizza. the toppings were fresh and tasty and the crust was crispy rather than gross and doughy. i guess it was nice...but the portions weren't that generous and we could really sense the touristy atmosphere...however it was nothing compared to the d*ckhead down the street trying to lure us in by calling out names of dishes in a heavy fake accent..shudder.

yeah. go to calzone's to fill a hole, not to have any kind of dining experience
author: Rachel G.

description:
I enjoy this place a great deal. Of any touristy tourist places I have eaten, this is the one I not only not mind going to, but I actually really really like. I like sitting on the checkered sidewalk and people watching while stuffing pizza in my piehole. 

It makes me feel like a tourist, but in the fun way, when you are the tourist and everyone is nice to you and the city you are visiting is magical and wonderful and makes your skin glow like you just had a really excellent facial. 

Rather than, you know, the kind of tourist whose foot I "accidentally" mow over because they are standing JUST standing in front of Walgreens with 18 of their group completely oblivious to PEOPLE NEEDING TO GO HOME WHO ACTUALLY ARE NOT VISITING AND JUST HAD A STUPID DAY AT WORK GET THE HAMMER OF THOR OUT OF MY WAY.
author: Shannon V.

description:
Calzone's outdoor seating is lovely on a clear San Francisco winter's day, but it's a little painful when it's super sunny and the sun just manages to hit you square in the eye / any exposed chest area.  Nevertheless, we settled in our quaint table facing the street.

The bread is great, it's like a baby baguette served in a little paper bag like it's to-go or something.  I think it might be ACME bread... anyways it is tasty.  And each table has its own supply of olive oil and vinegar so you can make your bread dip however you like!  

The Roasted Chicken Salad is good.  It's served in a really long dish, kinda weird but aesthetically pleasing.  It had "avocado, beets, corn, onions and pancetta in a lemon Dijon vinaigrette".  The portion is perfect, too.

Victoria L. opted for the Norwegian Smoked Salmon sandwich, which she seemed to like.  I think the "wasabi aioli" was the selling point, but she said she couldn't really tell it was in the sandwich.  

Our waiter was quite unresponsive, though our water was filled quite frequently.  

The bathroom is STRANGE.  Not only is it tiny with one giant stall that makes it impossible for people to wait inside the sink area, the lighting is a dim, reddish hue that makes you feel disoriented.  The lady who came in after me remarked that the bathroom must not have been made by a woman.  Right on, sister.  

Anyways the outside seating is pleasant enough and the food is yummy, so I'd like to come back on another sunny day, prepared with a coat of sunscreen.
author: Lydia W.

description:
great spot for people watching and mingle w/ people/friends. Nice food (based on my friend from Italy. He loves food here)

just one little thing minus a 5-star rating - waiting time. (but only nice restaurants get you wait for so long)

m not sure if you can make reservation in advance. Be sure to get there earlier on the weekend.

Rec. food : Pizza n Pasta!
author: Bana W.

description:
I like Calzone's because it's reasonably priced, good portion sizes and generally good food. It's an easy choice with all the options North Beach offers, because it's so centrally located. If the weather permits, sitting outside at a sidewalk table is perfect for people watching and getting some sun.

Inside is nice as well, except I'd rather not be seated upstairs where it's a bit claustrophobic and too far from the windows.

They make a mean mojito too!
author: Sophie D.

description:
Food was OK.  

We only went for the scene, but got seated upstairs.  If you're sitting upstairs, you might as well go to another restaurant... its dull, and uncomfortable.
author: eus l.

description:
I think this is one of the better restaurants on Columbus with the option of sitting outside. Calzone's is incredibly fast and cheap, and the portions are pretty generous. The calzones are huge and the roasted chicken salad is pretty good. Stay away from creamy pastas- I found the sauce to be watery and unappetizing.

Granted, I've had much better in North Beach but whenever I have people in town they always want to be outside in the middle of everything. I'll take a decent, cheap, fast meal any day over some of the insanely overpriced, slow, underportioned plates some of the tourist traps serve.
author: Jessica C.

description: Went here after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon about 2 blocks from the restaurant.  Really great service here (we had a reservation and were immediately seated).  Nice view of the passer-bys on Columbus Ave. so good for people watching.  Table was on the small side, but all the dishes were served in these very narrow plates, including the Cesar Salad, which was whole Romaine leaves and really good dressing.  I had the pepperoni Pizza also served in a narrow dish.  Plenty for one, with really thin crust, almost like  a cracker, but toasted nicely, with good sauce.  Partner had the lasagna, a very large portion.  Really enjoyed it.  Our server was very nice and attentive.  I'd go here again.
author: Steve A.

description: I took my girlfriend on a Friday night it was packed! Luckily, we were seated quickly, waiter was exceptionally nice and orderly. The food tasted great, my girlfriend orderd a chicken alfredo fettucini and I had the crab alfredo fettucini. The atmosphere and setting of the restuarant really helps you feel calm, warm, relaxed, and puts you in a good mood. I recommend this place for couples and friends night out around North Beach.
author: Gregory G.

description: This place is decent and you could do a lot worse in North Beach. The pizza is not bad and the beet salad was quite tasty (although it wasn't what I expected- it literally is just beets, no lettuce or other greens.) Overall, not bad but not a standout by any means.
author: Cathy S.

description: Don't order the italian calzone. For a restaurant named Calzone's in the Italian distric of San Francisco, it sucked. My Italian calzone was supposed to contain prosciutto, salami, and mortadella. Instead all it had inside was ham. $15 for a ham calzone? No way Jose. If they are lying about what is inside their calzone, what other menu items are they false advertising? I've had better calzones at in the sunset for christ's sakes. http://www.yelp.com/biz/taraval-pizza-san-francisco
author: Amy S.

description: The decor and the crowd drew us into the place.  We ordered two calzones and they were very flavorless.  This may be a good place for pizza, or so sit with friends and drink, but the titular dish is not good.
author: Matt Q.

description: That facade. It's atrocious. The neon. The checkerboard BS. North Beach is so great because it's still a neighborhood. Shoe repair shops, Molinari's, City Lights Books. I know I sound bitter but the view from Cafe Puccini is ruined. If you found Calzone's, you're within 300 yards of a dozen places serving amazing Italian food. Find one of them.
author: Brian B.

description: Excellent service.  We had a party of 8 on a busy Saturday night, and they seated us within minutes.  The lasagne calzone I had was a good size.  You could probably share it with someone if you wanted to.  The food came out quickly considering how large our party was and the few who ordered mojitos enjoyed them immensely.  I'd definitely recommend this to people who are looking for a good place to go at the last minute.  The service alone makes this place well worth your money.
author: Amy J.

description:
busy busy busy for such a small place. go for the food as the drinks are sub par. we just had the mojitos, nice touch with the sugar cane though. 

its pretty stuffy in there, small one stall restroom. 

whats with all the restored antique camaros out front?
author: Sara C.

description: Let's see, BAD food & HORRIBLE service. There was nothing positive about the Calzone experience. It took over an hour to get our salad and pasta.  SERGIO was no place to be found.  Even though SF law is very specific about smoking at restaurants Sergio enabled our dinning neighbors to light up next to us.  Go across the street to Stinking Rose for a better all of the above.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Our last day in San Francisco was sunshiny and warm.  The line to get into the SFMOMA was so long we decided our time was better spent wandering one of the wonderful neighborhoods.  So we headed for North Beach.  Calzone's was too tempting, with all the tables lined up on the tiled sidewalk to face the passers-by on the street.  We had a lovely lunch, somewhat decent if somewhat slow service, and a great time.  I ate a grilled artichoke, while D nommed on a huge goat cheese salad. Then we shared homemade fettucine with broccolini and sun dried tomatoes. What I loved about this pasta dish is that there was as many veggies as there was pasta, all tossed in warm olive oil with lots of roasted garlic.  Grated parm would have been nice, but the afternoon and the pinot noir was too perfect to complain.
author: Lizzie S.

description: Came recently on a girl's weekend getaway and we were all pretty happy with this place. Two of us had pizzas, which were very crispy and satisfying, and other two had half sandwiches with soup du jour (cream of spinach--just so so), but the sandwiches were very good thanks to the bread.  I'm not a sandwich or bread person, but I enjoyed it very much. Get the salumi sandwhich! Staff was good, not over-bearing or overly friendly, but tentative enough. Atmosphere was very nice; would be good for a romantic date.
author: Tasanee D.

description:
Had a good dining experience here at one time.I had the salmon pasta with a Blackstone Merlot. It was very good My friends tried the pizza and the egg plant parmisiana. Everything was excelent. 
    The server brought me  a white wine, when I asked for a red. He brought back a red on the house which I apreciated.
     The decor in this place has a good Italian charm to it. I would like to come back here.
author: Steb M.

description: I came here for my Mom's bday.  The atmosphere is great, the table was a little small for 5 people, but the day was nice and the view of columbus street was spectacular.  The food was great, the bruchetta was light and filling.  I had the ravioli, my only complaint was that is was small compared to the rest of the dishes at the table, my girlfriend and sister in-law had pasta dishes as well, but their portions were much bigger.  The beer I had was awesome, some german beer that I can't say right.  The dessert was to die for, chocolate mousse cake=smily-face!!  My only complaint is the waiter really didn't listen well.  My girlfriend ordered a Zinfandel and the waiter put in a cab!! And then, we ordered three desserts and he brought out four.  It was slow at the time, these mistakes shouldn't of been made.  Next time I go, I'll get another dish, hoping it will be a bigger portion.
author: Marciano P.

description:
great restaurant, impeccable service, great ambiance
try to sit outside if you can really makes your experience, sun sets all afternoon and if its cold they have heat lamps
food is average maybe a little better
author: Katherine K.

description: what a fun place. we ate outside and i had the pineapple mojito and the lasagna calzone . great stuff. waiter was great as well. perfect sunday afternoon meal with great atmosphere
author: Mark C.

description: Garlic bread on the appetizer was expensive for four small slices. Lamb was excellent and our kids had the Gnochitti (decent). Excellent service!
author: Carl H.

description:
The calzones are very good, although I'd like to have mixed and matched with the ingredients. The eggplant calzone could have used a little punch, like borrowing the artichoke from Italian calzone. I recommend ordering a side of marinara to dip!

The garlic fries were just OK and they don't have much to offer for children (we have 3). The smoked salmon sandwich was very good. My stepdad ordered it with the soup, and I wished I'd have traded!
author: Tracy B.

description:
I tried this place recently for the first time after walking past it for years.

* The Lasagne Bolognese was surprisingly good (4 stars)
* The mojito was pretty good and pretty strong but I got a bit too much mint
* The scallops were terrible - they tasted like fishsticks
* The artichokes were mediocre
* The fettucini alfredo with gorgonzola was pretty good (4 stars)
* The ambience is nice -- we sat outdoors facing the street

I would come here again, but I'd still like to find a better place in North Beach.
author: Jason H.

description: Salmon pasta was good. There was nothing crazy that stood out from the others that I've tried but it was delicious. Great settings, you can sit outside and eat and watch fire trucks drive by with their loud sirens haha :p
author: Princess N.

description:
Alright, so my girlfriend and I went in here for a calzone. We were starving, okay? It wasn't that memorable, or that great. The calzone was truly unremarkable, though I remember it being satisfying enough. The ingredients were not really seasoned, and there was far more crust/bread than innards. Also, for a calzone place that is NAMED Calzone's Pizza, they sure weren't prepared for everyone to be ordering calzones. It took a really long time to get our food, and even then, it wasn't very hot. 

I'd want to go back to check out the Mojito bar, as another reviewer mentioned it and it sounds good, but for the food, I'll try another of the many Italian joints on this block.
author: Shannon F.

description:
St Pattys Day 2007 was spent me and 6 dudes celebrating a bachelor party (yes - I was the sole female to be invited and no I really can't hang with the guys - they all drank me under the table).  We decided to score some prime northbeach real estate at an outdoor table at calzones, order 5 bottles of wine, a few dozen beers, maybe 5 vodka sodas for me, and some tasty shellfish and pizza. We didn't move for at least 4 hours. I forgot how a huge group of men are. Lazy. 

Anyhow the table next to us was an entertaining bunch. They decided to rate the women that walked by in green - literally yelling out 1, 2, 3, 4, and if you were a rare 5 you got a round of emphatic applause  (and if you were her lucky boyfriend you smiled back proudly). 

So I admit it -  I only got a 4.5. I think I can live with that. 

Bottom line is we loved this place. Great service, and great outdoor seating for nice SF weather. The food isnt fabulous but pretty good, and we were happy with the wine. A little too happy.....
author: Stacy H.

description:
We had a large group and wanted a late dinner on a Friday night (11:30pm), so this spot fit the bill.  

First off, I love the atmosphere in here.....the neon sign outside and all the artwork on the wall is a nice touch.

They were very busy, so they sat us upstairs.

First, I'll start off with what was done well.  The bruschetta appetizer was amazing.....it tasted great with the pesto and garlic.  Also, the chianti was quite tasty.  Also, my girlfriend ordered the borscht with cabbage (soup of the day) and it was good.  In addition, the place was reasonably priced for SF (most entrees $15 and under).

However, the rest of the food wasn't great.  I got the gnocchi with tomato sauce and I found it quite bland.  I was expecting them to come by with some fresh parmesan to add, but they never did.  Some of my friends ordered the pizza and they also found it bland and said they wished it had sauce (it had none).  Finally, the upstairs was very hot and it was uncomfortable to sit here for a long period of time, which sort of put a damper on our dinner.  It wasn't horrible, but not the greatest in the city and there are certainly much better Italian restaurants in North Beach.
author: Aaron M.

description:
So I read through all the negative reviews and I have to think, did these people eat at the same restaurant as we did?~ IMPOSSIBLE! 

Both times I have gone here when we had family in town and both times the food and service was ON-POINT! One thing about SF that drives me up the damn wall, is poor service. I dont care how good the food is, if the service is terrible, we wont go back. But not here. The service was great! The food was great! 

We got there around 6ish and they were SLAMMED! But with in minutes we were seated and they had water and bread at the table as we were being sat. I LOVE THAT! When you have kids with you, every minute with out bread on the table feel like an eternity. You dont mess with hungry toddlers. 

Plus we didnt get the EVIL STARE like we usually get when we enter  a NON-KID-FRIENDLY place. But these guys were smart, they sat us upstairs away from the  busy crowd and next to another family with kids~ BRILLANT!

Our server,(several were serving us at once) was great! They kept the drinks coming(BEST MOJITOS IN TOWN) and food arrived quickly. We tried several dishes and appetizers and they were all very tastey. We LOVED THE SCALOPES IN WASSABI!!! Yum! Yum! My favorite dish by far was the GNOCCHETTI. I think it was the best I have EVER tasted! Plus the kids loved it!

AS of right now, this has been BY FAR THE BEST place we have eaten in the city-SERVICE AND FOOD~perfection! This is a wonderful place to take family/friends visiting from out of town....great "san-franciscian" experience!
author: Jamie K.

description:
Seemingly huge portions, since everything you order comes out on this really long eliptical plate. But their portions aren't really that huge after all - more comfortably sufficient. 

I thought that for a place with "CALZONES" lit in huge neon letters in its name, that their speciality would be calzones. But the calzone we had was a bit too creamy and cheesey, and was lacking in other ingredients that were supposed to be in it. The pizza was really good though. 

I think I've had better pizzas and pizza related foods elsewhere. Not extremely impressed with what we had, but the other dishes at surrounding tables looked worth trying. Next time.
author: Christine K.

description:
The few times I have been to the restaurant, it has always been busy.  That must mean it is good, right?

Well, I have only had the pizza and calzones here.  Oh, and several mojitos!

I prefer the pizza to the calzones.  They were both good, I just thought you got more for your money from the pizza.  All the food was good and fresh.  Nice spicy sausage.  I also liked their little baskets of bread that came in handy, because I was not filled alone on the pizza.  I guess I was just hungry though!

As for the mojitos, yes, I know, it is a Cuban drink, and why would I order it at an Italian place?  I was on a mojito fix that week!  Anyway, I thought they made really good mojitos!
author: John O.

description:
Sometimes its fun to play tourist.

The outside tables are fun and they have space heaters, so even on an overcast day patrons can enjoy people-watching.  The heirloom tomato salad was delicious.  The chicken and asparagus fresh fettuccine ribbons was simple and yummy.
author: Taylor S.

description:
TOURIST TRAP!  Seriously, quite average dining establishment, but the service was good.

I ventured into the Urban Jungle yesterday to meet Michelle for dinner at Calzone's.  GREAT weather in the City + me feeling generous = 1 extra star.  We ordered the fried calamari to start.  It was bland, and the cocktail sauce served with it was probably straight from an industrial restaurant-supply sized jar.  The house salad and the cheese pizza rustica were pretty yummy though.  The salad was simply tossed in oil, but was green and luscious and fluffy.  The crust of the pizza rustica was super thin and crispy -- like a cracker.

Ok place to eat, but you can definitely find much much better in North Beach.
author: Michelle W.

description: I update my rating because they had the courtesy to email me about my dinning experience and apologize. I give them a lot of credit for doing that. It shows that they do care about what people think. They also said they would let the kitchen know of my concerns of the issues with the food. Thank you for your reply Calzone's. Maybe I will give you another try someday.
author: Food C.

description:
Great Mojitos for sure, lots of different flavors.  Certain things on the menu are great!  I loved the gnocchi and calamari.  I tried a pizza and wasn't a big fan of it. 

The outdoor seating with heaters is awesome though and great for people watching.  I really do like the atmosphere, I just think that the food could improve slightly.
author: Courtney M.

description:
Every time I pass by this place, I always think one of these days I'll be sitting at a sidewalk table people watching too! Sure enough...today was my day to do just that. 

My friend and I were quickly seated at a sidewalk table (per our request) and they turned on the heat lamps which kept us nice & toasty!

I ordered the Pork Scalopini which was delicious: served on a bed of well flavored Swiss chard and topped with eggplant and a delicious  cheese that accented the flavor of the dish just right. The pork was well flavored and not overdone. The sauce was tasty.

My friend ordered the Italian sausage sandwich & soup of the day which she thought was decent but not super good. When I return, I'll probably avoid ordering a sandwich and stick with a main entree or try one of the pastas/pizzas/calzones instead.

What makes this restaurant 4 stars is 3 for the food and 1 star for being able to eat outside and watch the city bustle around you.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I think it's better to sit inside as people have a tendency to start smoking at the outside tables - yuck.   That is a phenomenon that occurs at many restaurants in the area.

Today we had the asparagus orzo and the asparagus gnocchetti.  We were guessing that the two dishes would be pretty similar, but the gnocchetti were much more flavorful and creamier.  The orzo needed a lot of cheese and some salt added to it.  

One of my big restaurant pet peeves is small water glasses.  If a place is going to have small glasses, they need to be filling them frequently.  This turned out to be a problem here.  Time to get some bigger glasses!

I also think the prices here are a bit high for the type of restaurant that it is.  The food was good and I would return, but it was a little pricey.
author: Squirrel L.

description:
I've eaten here twice now, both times I ordered the Salmon. It comes with these mashed potatoes that are INCREDIBLE! They put zucchini in them, and I would never have guessed that zucchini in mashed potatoes would be so delicious. I could go here and just order a bunch of sides of those potatoes. 

I've sat inside in a booth once, and outside once. The outside experience was really nice, the heaters kept us very warm, even in the windy evening, and we got to people watch as we ate.
author: Catherine T.

description: Me n my friends had dinner and was out for a walk..saw this pizzeria...eat out spot was very attractive ..Since we had a dinner before, we ordered very basics..one of the finest garlic bread n veggie pizza that i ever had..loved the crust and fresh mozzarella !!! sure 'll go back again
author: Elangovan K.

description:
After walking to North Beach from Union Square in my stiletto boots, we desperately wanted to find somewhere where my boyfriend could get some italian lunch, and i could get a good bloody mary.  Using yelp on my phone, we located this place, and it was much cuter than i'd anticipated given the name!
They had heaters overhead, so all the tables seats faced the street, which at first i disliked, but then being under the heater AND not being trampled on by passer bys proved reason enough to enjoy this seating option...
We were seated right away, although we did arrive around 2, so a little later than most brunch crowds, and the bloody had a slightly bizarre taste to it, but was a decent size and price ($7.35), although I dont think it was on the actual menu...

My boyfriend wanted spaghetti and meatballs which they didnt have, so got the sausage sandwich instead (review below, he was pleased enough, but as usual discards anything that looks green/in the vegetable family).  

Our server was a bit slow (meaning very slow), but since we weren't in a rush it wasnt a huge deal.  The place is actually owned by the same people as Franciscos, The Stinking Rose, Bobo's, etc. which after discovery made me think the prices were actually even more reasonable than i'd initially thought.

If i don't come back it would only be because there are so many other options in the area i've yet to try (the block was literally only restaurants on the other side of the street).  A favorite in the neighborhood so far, and if i didnt love north beach so much that i want to try everywhere, i'd definitely be back!
author: Danielle J.

description:
The food at Calzone's isn't great nor is it bad, I guess you can say that it did the trick since my girlfriend and I were looking for a good italian spot to eat at one night. The calamari here is pretty good and the entree's were decent, the service was quick, and luckily we didn't have to find parking since we were within walking distance to our apartment. 

Tips and Pointers:
-Try the calamari, not too shabby
-Service is fast, wait staff is friendly
-Prices are mid range, nothing too outrageous
-If you need to park, good luck, you pretty much need all the luck you can get

[APPROVED]
author: Eric T.

description: Calzone's is fantastic. We had a full meal here at around 1am after arriving to the city from Newark. The lasagna was fantastic and the sausage and pasta dish was OK. Plus, the interior is very cool.
author: Kevin L.

description: The calzone was decent, definitely deserves more than 1 star, maybe 3.  But the reason I gave one star is because of my pasta dish. Not impressed with what I found in it.  The owner is very nice and has followed up with me regarding this situation.  Besides me having a bad experience the atmosphere in the restaurant is nice, especially the outdoor seating.
author: Darren A.

description: Seems like a touristy place...Very americanized Italian food. They have really nice seating outdoors. We sat inside and it was rather loud. The food was adequate. Ordered the lasagna calzone. It tasted like hamburger meat with some cheese and sauce. Don't regret coming here, but would try other Italian places in the neighborhood next time.
author: Jas G.

description: The ambiance is just great. Food are awesome with reasonable prices. Try their mojitos they got the best! :)
author: Donci B.

description:
Calamari = excellente! 
Cazone = really crispy crust and tasty! 
Crab Fettucini = super oily, but has lots of crab!
Chocolate Truffle Mousse = a better dessert!
Mesclun Salad = very well dressed and light!
Tiramisu = aiiight.
author: Charm N.

description:
Located in North Beach (parking sucks), Calzones is a nice italiano trattoria (um, well except the decidedly hispanic busboys) perfect for a birthday dinner with you and a few friends (okay, like ... 30). You can tell the experience is authentic (ignore the massive neon sign that is straight outta Vegas) when you step inside and spy the cast of the Godfather (III) dining there. Order a drink from the massively well appointed bar downstairs (I recommend the Kamikaze shots - the Japanese were on the Italian side in WW2, after all) and it arrives within... minutes.

Yes, Calzones. They have those also. And they do taste good (like calzones anywhere else, just more expensive).
author: Maxx L.

description:
