I am a semi-picky eater, and for some reason none of the pasta dishes looked all that appealing... I went for the Point Reyes Bleu Cheese Alfredo and Swiss chard, artichokes, pine nuts and chicken  hoping the calorie splurge would be worth it... sadly, it was not what I was hoping for.  Thick congealed with no flavor, I ate the pieces of artichoke and chicken out of it, and left the rest.  My two dining companions each had the margarita pizzas and cleaned their plates so maybe I just had bad luck.  

On the other hand, their wine pour was bigger than expected, outside seating rocked, and their mojito choices looked amazing (if I didn't have to drive back to San Jose after, I totally would've indulged).  And the wait staff was friendly and the food came out quick, so I think 2 stars is fair.
author: Ker T.

description:
Probably the worst dining experience I have had in San Francisco. The clams were not even remotely fresh and made me sick for several days. The crab pizza was terrible. The pizza is a bland, soft crust with a little bit of melted fontina (and I do mean a little), some dry, tough crab meat, stringy shaved onions and brown avocados made up this dish and I could barely choke down one slice.

The so-called bread service consisted of a waiter plunking down a cold mini-baguette *still in the bag* on my table and the bartender was some kid who just turned 21 and didn't have a clue what he was doing.

All of the negatives would have been ok, if the pizza was good and the clams were fresh. That said, I will never eat here again. My stomach rolls at the sight of the sign. I should have known better. I DID know better. Dammit.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Went to this place for lunch. It was on a Thursday afternoon around 4. There was literally no one in there except me and my friend and the ppl who work there. The food was okay, It was kind of weird that you'd have to pay just to get bread...

I got a calzone, which was alright. It was actually really really big. Kind of intimidating...but there was a lot of cheese, which kind of put me off. Basically, prices and everything, I could go to someplace else for cheaper and better food
author: Dustin H.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. 

I recommend going there at night and pushing for a table on their checkered front stoop.  The heat lamps will keep you nice and toasty and you can eat a fine candle lit dinner and watch the people pass you on the streets.  Their wait staff is friendly and the service is fast.  

If you cant seem to get a table outside, the inside is just as nice, you can cozy up in a plush booth and have more than enough to look at, the interior is decorated with Italian dry goods and glass bottles, eccentric and charming. 

Recommend: 

Broiled Whole Artichoke Appetizer
Gnocchi with Tomato Cream Sauce
Fresh Fettucine with Dungeness Crab and Cherry Tomatoes  

Anything coming from the woodfire oven is also fantastic.
author: A S.

description:
having dramatically increased the sample size of calzone's visits, piggy's perceptions have improved!

piggy's picks:
*ROMAINE (add grilled chicken) - whole uncut baby romaine salad, croutons & shaved grana cheese, caesar dressing
*CALAMARI - fried & rolled in seasoned semolina horseradish-ginger cocktail sauce
*COTEGHINO - thinly sliced italian sausage sandwich with fontina & rocket arugula
*FRESH TOMATOES - angel hair with basil, garlic, italian olives, extra virgin olive oil
*BOLOGNESE - fresh fettuccine with five hour pork & beef sugo
*CHICKEN & ASPARAGUS - fresh fettuccine with roasted tomatoes, pine nuts, garlic & basil
author: Vicki Y.

description:
If you haven't been to Calzone's, then you probably haven't been to North Beach for dinner that often.  Calzone's is the one place in North Beach where people flock to because of the obvious, quaint atmosphere and prime location on Columbus (close to Green).  I have eaten here a few times, and have never been wow'd, but never dissatisfied.  The sausage is hearty, the pizza is good, but there is nothing that really stands out to me besides the sitting area on the sidewalk.  Expect Calzone's to always have a crowd, especially for dinnertime and into the late night hours.  

Again, I feel Calzone's is more for atmosphere.  The food is okay, but perhaps I haven't found that "wow" dish.
author: Beth K.

description:
Went here for a late dinner with my boyfriend. Service was good, atmosphere is chill and the food was really good. I love bruschetta and I got it here which was a good choice, very tasty. And my pasta dish was fresh and light like I wanted. My boyfriend got the calzone and said it was really tasty and everything he had expected when he ordered it. 

Would definitely be back here when I'm in the area and want some good Italian food.
author: Stephanie W.

description: The food was OK, a bit bland.  The service was sparse.  The ambiance was stuffy and noisy.   Definitely, overpriced.   Would not go back.
author: Bob S.

description: I don't know how many times I've passed this restaurant in my life.  I never really had an aching desire to try the food here but was willing to give it a shot.  I guess you could say that I will probably never really have an aching desire to ever go back either.  Service was actually pretty good and attentive but it's just too bad it was followed up by food that was not very good.  The crab linguine was decent albeit a small dish, but the seafood pasta had the absolute worst shrimp I had ever tasted in my life.  It tasted like they butterflied the shrimp a year ago, froze it, then defrosted it in the microwave and threw it on the plate.  The romaine lettuce in the caesar salad was also clearly not fresh as there were many pink spots on the midrib of the lettuce.  With the pasta dishes being just south of $20 per plate it's pretty clear the cost of the food is directly related to the location of the restaurant as opposed to the quality of the ingredients in the dishes.
author: Erich D.

description: if u want a bite to eat before or after the clubs, this is the spot to go. its super  cute on the outside and the inside.  Food is pretty good, brushetta,eh. Pizzas are oddly shaped but yummi if you like the thin crust pizzas.  My other friends had stuff that looked really good , like the Alfredo, or the salads. Haven't tried their calzones, although I guess I should, bc thats the name of the place,... Till next time!
author: kim p.

description: This place was amazing but very busy,ordered a pepperoni,mushroom and cheese pizza it was hot and delicious! Ordered some Pasta with meat sauce and that was delicious with some hot bread, had some kind of marinated meat i do beleive marinated pork,beef with with pasta noodles. Very tasty and would recommend. Ann
author: Ann R.

description: I absolutely love this place. Both times I've gone it has been after a night out to have a seat at their outdoor cafe. The ambiance is excellent-- feels more like you're in a Parisian cafe than in SF. We ordered an arugala topped pizza, heirloom tomato salad and the salumi meat platter. Everything came out nearly instantaneously and was delicious. The bottle of red was reasonably priced and tasty. Pretty healthy grub after a few drinks as well.
author: Rob G.

description:
Hey, this place aint bad!

Sit outside and enjoy people watching, or more like drunk tourist watching :) lol

The mussels and chicken/artichoke calzone is good.

The salads on the other hand, were nasty.
author: John S.

description:
Great for pizzas, I ordered the crab pizza as a gamble and it paid off, DELICIOUS!!!  The pastas and drinks are good here nothing stellar though.  

Great place for late night eats and people watchin'.
author: Don I.

description:
My friend and I decided to dine outside. On a cold night, the heat lamps kept us might toasty and compensated for the small wobbley tables. We both started off dinner with a glass of wine she had a Chardonnay and i had a glass of Beringer White Zinfandel. I would have preferred a glass of  Red Cabernet, but their wine list was horrible and needs to be updated. We shared a Caesar salad. Nothing special about it. For my main dish, I ordered the pesto chicken calzone. The portion was huge but not as flavorful as I had hoped. My friend ordered the linguine with tomatoes and seafood but mentioned Pasta Pomodoro's as the better choice for the dish she ordered. 

I doubt I'd go back here again.
author: crystal e.

description:
I had my all-time Worst Meal Ever In San Francisco at this place:

Lasagna topped with (I am not kidding) about a centimeter of OIL.

One small bite of that was more than enough for me and my dining companion to end the meal right there.

How a place like this could possibly have 3 1/2 stars on Yelp is a serious mystery, unless we just happened to catch the place on their worst day ever.

Just walking past and seeing their garish red neon facade is enough to make my stomach turn after that one experience.
author: Boogee Z.

description: great seating outside... had a coffee and talked uninterrupted with a friend for about an hour without feeling like they wanted to rush us out. The table next to us was having calamari fritti, which smelled really good!
author: Alisson X.

description:
We came across this restaurant after going to Beach Blanket Babylon (a very touristy weekend I admit!) 
It wasn't great by any means but what do you expect from those Columbus tourist traps? 
It was a nice sunny day so it was great to sit outside and people watch but the food was just ok- and the coffee was horrible couldn't even drink it! 
I had pizza the crust was thin and it was good but the sauce tasted worse then the can stuff I have at home... 
Oh well it is what it is...
author: Janae L.

description: Four of us dropped in to sample a few items as we walked around North Beach on a Pub and Cuisine Crawl. We all ordered cocktails and decided to share an order of calamari and the house calzone. The calamari was very good and the cocktail sauce served with it was exceptional. The calzone was huge and tasty. Service was outstanding. I almost expected an attitude when four of us only ordered two items, but all the staff were very attentive and professional and they even brought us two loaves of delicious hot bread and very high quality olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Waters were refilled often and they even took time to give detailed directions to our next stop. It is a great place to people watch in a cute ambiance. Cocktails were good. We will be back!
author: P S.

description: I my partner and I spent an hour at our table looking for another restaurant to eat.  My cocktail had 6 limes in it... Talk about overly sour.  Garlic bread with mazzarella cheese was dry and had to drink it down.  Next!
author: Charles H.

description:
The food is great but nothing extra ordinary...Im a bit indifferent about my "italian food" especially the pasta...i make the best lasagna according to my good friends fonzy and carlos...hmmmm

i came here with my good friend eddy...finally a decent place we can go to that is not just serving breakfast food.

the margarhita pizza is superb espcially being cooked in a brick oven and having a thin crispy crust.

service is alright...nothing fancy...

if  you're at north beach this is worth trying...
author: Malou C.

description: Food was really good. Perfect place to people watch on a warm summer night in the city...which, I know is rare, but it happens, damn it!
author: Seanté B.

description: Ordered the clamari, mussels, and clams. I was extremely disappointed at how tiny the mussels were. Seeing that made me verrry happy that I ordered the clams!  They were the biggest clams I've everrrr seen!  The calamari was also delicious and extremely plentiful for its price. I'd come back just for those clams!
author: Jen P.

description:
Food was okay, but not particularly great. A little pricey for the quality. A fairly safe place to go for passable thin-crust pizzas and appetizers. The eggplant and goat cheese crostini was a little too vinegary and not very easy to eat. The basic pizza margherita had a good crust, a little bit undercooked, and was nicely garlicky.

But $30+ for single entree and appetizer in a touristy atmosphere didn't strike me as a particularly good value.
author: Andrew H.

description:
This was my favorite place in North Beach!  Especially late at night when you are craving the crispy calamari or the bbq chicken pizza with your favorite alcoholic beverage!

I know that there are several places to eat in North Beach and definitely try each and every one of them...but one thing I can say about Calzone's....they are consistent!
author: Elaine D.

description:
Great spot in North Beach with good food. Nice booths if you can get one or eat outside for great people watching.

Love the salads, artichokes and pizza. Prices are fair for the area. Service is good on the 5 times we've ben there. Best to go during the week when it's less crowded. Went there one time when they said there would be a 20 minute wait. 30 minutes later, still waiting and they said maybe 10 more minutes. Well, it was almost 20 more minutes later.
author: Jim K.

description:
A friend and I stumbled upon Calzone's during a "Girl's Day Out."  The service was fast and we enjoyed our meal.

On a few repeat trips, the service has been inconsistent (the waiter forgot that we asked a pasta dish to omit the meat because we had a vegetarian in our group.) On other visits, the service can be slow.

I have enjoyed the mussels, artichoke, calamari appetizers as well as the calzones, pizzas, and pasta dishes.  The food is solid and that is why my friends and I go back to this place.  It is always fun to look at all the kitchsy items they have on their walls.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Why only one star you may be wondering...

Wouldn't you give a restaurant that gave you food poisoning only one star zero if I could, but I'm jumping ahead of myself...

First off my friends ordered a cheesy garlic bread, which was puny for the amount they charged, but they said it was good, just wished they had more of it.  Our main orders came out, I had gotten the Orzo with sausage dish, average size, average taste.  The afterkick from this put me out for the rest of the weekend (we came here on a Thurs night).  What I want to know is how somebody can mess up such a simple dish.  My dish had three main ingredients: orzo pasta, sausages and tomatoes.  Can't really be the pasta that made me sick so it's down to sausages or tomatoes; both just point to uncleaniness/sloppiness in the kitchen.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
The curb-side dinning definitely makes this place. Perfect for two, even on a chilly day since they have overhead heaters (really warm). My high rating is primarily due to the EXPERIENCE (environment/service) you get as you dine curb-side. The food is not mind-blowing, but nonetheless tasty and true to Italian cuisine (reasonably priced for SF). Try their rustic pizzas with a glass of wine and maybe a salad, you and one other person will have a fabulous time!! 

Happy DiNNing...
author: Nader A.

description: I just love me some North Beach!  This was our second dinner at Cazone's only this time we went with another couple who loves the food there.  We ordered some drinks, beer and wine which complimented the yummy bread they give you in a small bag and they kept those bags coming!  I always try not to fill up on bread but dipping it in the fresh olive oil & balsamic vinegar was a little too addicting.  We had a nice booth inside, I prefer outside, however, it was Halloween night and the place was packed.  Our friends had the Butter Lettuce Salad and Pancetta Wrapped Scallops to start and we shared a tasty Arugula with Artichoke Salad.  Then for din-din they had Gnocchetti and Lasagna.  My Sweetie & I ordered the Orzo with Sausage and Lasagna.  The server grated generous amounts of fresh parmesan over our dishes and he was very attentive.  I liked the Lasagana but it was a little too aldente and it could have had more sauce.  Same with the Orzo, overcooked and not enough flavor.  We took the rest home and the Orzo tasted better cold the next day.  I got to taste one of the Scallops, yummy good but I didn't care for the wasabi based sauce that was pooled on the bottom of the plate.  It wasn't very strong but it didn't pair well with the tasty Scallops.  Overall, it was a fun evening with good friends, good ambience, and good costumes to look at while Calzone's passed out candy to trick or treaters.
author: Ruthie V.

description: This restaurant appeals because it provides outside seating under heated lamps facing the hustle and bustle of Columbus Avenue. The part that ruins the vibe is the music they play, hip hop! Nothing against hip hop but listening to Italian music would enhance the experience much more. The service was ordinary. I had the gnochetti in a basil pesto sauce and I ate three bits before deciding to quit and wait for dessert down the street. Hubby had pepperoni pizza with caramelized onions. Looked good but no raving on his part. Don't think we'll be returning since there are a few other outside seating restaurants to chose from in the neighborhood. Bon Apetit!
author: Judy B.

description:
A bit expensive, but has a very "european" feel. Do opt for a table outside! The inside is just like any other restaurant, outside you get to watch the people pass by (and they have heaters above the tables, so don't worry about being cold).

The portions are not HUGE (like at Buca on Howard), but very tasty. I especially like their lasagna - it's hearty, but not too heavy - just right :).

Tiramisu is of course a winner, like you would expect at a restaurant of this class in the middle of Little Italy.
author: ivan s.

description: The one experience I had here was with a huge group and not terribly memorable. Food was average and service was pretty good. With that many choices in North Beach, I'm not sure I'd venture back, but i won't dissuade anyone from going. Tourists seem to like it a lot
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
walked by during the north beach festival. went in around 6pm and there was no wait for a party of 5.

food came out VERY VERY fast.

smoked chicken calzone ($12)- the chicken was still a little cold... could have been more flavorful- just added a little chili flakes.

garlic fries (~$5)- piping hot, very crispy, garlicy yum

combo pizza ($12) - lots of toppings

gnocchietti w/ bolognese sauce ($14)- this was very thick and yummy

service was average.
author: Nancy L.

description: I went here some time ago and cannot remember what I ate but I do remember the food here is catered for the tourist and was bleh.  If your in SF and want good food eat somewhere else, especially in that neighborhood.  Now that said, if you are in the neighborhood you should stop here before dinner and order Mojito's.  These are awesome and decently strong but you wouldnt know it.  The best part is the sugarcane stick they put into the mojito, YUMMY!.
author: Adamandcarmelita K.

description: I just love this place.  I've been there for lunch and dinner a number of times over the years and have always enjoyed it.  The food is tasty, flavorful, fresh, and the presentation is nice.  Pasta and sauces are hearty and the menu has a good selection.  Desserts are also excellent!  I've been there for lunch and dinner and even on a really crowded night, the service has been friendly and efficient.  They also made it pleasurable for birthday and other occasions.  Grazi!
author: John C.

description:
Holidays' crowd are always expected at any restaurant.  Went there Xmas Day and the wait was over an hour.  But I was lucky to find curbside parking right in the front.  

Must try the Mojitos!  Garlic Fries and Tiramisu are also delicious.  Had the Prosciutto Calzone, that was good too.  Everything was good perhaps the hungry zone I was in made anything edible tastes good.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
A meal at Calzone's is quintessential North Beach.  The location is dead-on for eating al fresco and people-watching, the atmosphere aromatic and bustling.   Can it get pricey?  Of course it can - the setting is pretty conducive to multiple drinks, and let's face facts - you're in, by choice, a touristy corner of town.  For NB, a typical Calzone's bill is definitely reasonable.

Don't let the name steer you only to the pizza options on the menu - the pastas are excellent, particularly the fettuccine with broccolini, and the gnocchetti have made me a recent convert to gnocchi fandom. In the tomato cream or pesto, they're fantastic.  If you're looking for lighter fare, the heirloom tomato caprese salad and crostini is a win; I was blown away by the semolina-crusted calamari.  Again, the cocktails are another Win - and I'm a former bartender - caipirinhas and mojitos for a regular night out, champagne cocktail for a celebration - also nice to see that they feature Domaine Chandon. Watch your tab inflate with the drinks, however - $9 each makes for happy server and a weeping wallet.
author: Sarah V.

description:
Great location and the pasta was pretty good.  After drinking a few beers, its a good place to grab a bite.  The alcohol is a little expensive, but this is sf

Scrat
author: Fady A.

description:
A bit spendier than I'd like, and sometimes the service is a bit laggy despite the cool wireless system they've got set up for waiters with palmtop devices. The pizzas are sortof flat and tiny.

But this place has the best tiramisu I've ever had. The rum cake, and the mojitos are mighty tasty too. The location is just plain stunning-- fascinating bottles and decorations all over the walls, lovely atmosphere and lighting, warming lamps on the sidewalk.

And maybe best of all? It's open till 2am. Just in case you have a burning need for tiramisu at 2am. I know I do.
author: Leah C.

description:
There is much better food at better prices (or similar prices ... but better b/c the food is at least good) all around this area.  I have no idea why anyone would eat here, but it might be a good place to sit down outside, have a drink and people watch.

I don't quite understand why it's always crowded, except if people eat here purely to enjoy the people watching.  Food was mediocre, service was "eh" ... and it was really noisy, but not in a good way.
author: Kristen H.

description:
Great location in the heart of North Beach!  It's always a bustling crowd and a fun place to eat.  The food is pretty good, not the BEST I've ever had as far as typical Italian food goes. 

I had the asparagus and cheese gnocci that sounded like a good idea on the menu but actually only tasted of broccoli upon arrival.  It wasn't BAD but it wasn't that good either.  There are so many Italian restaurants in such close proximity in this neighborhood, I'm sure there are better places to go to.
author: Candice M.

description:
Positive:
 - Deliciously huge glass of mojito. (a bit sweet for some)
 - cool sidewalk seating with heat lamps
 - veggie pizza, mussels, and organic beets were delicious
 - cream asparagus gnocchetti is worth ordering but too heavy for me

Negative:
 - tables are too small to seat 4/5 people. We ordered lots of small plates to share and did not have room on our table. It was a constant shuffling of plates and casualty of forks falling to the floor. An empty mojito glass almost hit the floor but fortunately my friend have super quick reflexes.
 - pesto chicken calzone was not oozing with cheese and pesto as i imagined it to be
author: Yenly M.

description:
i liked this place a lot went for a saturday night dinner. parking was hell but we scored a pretty decent spot a couple of blocks down. 

the food was really good somewhat small portions but decent for a party of 4. 

bartender made some strong jameson and cokes as well as dirty maritinis. ill definitely consider going back. i love the look and the vibe at night.
author: Matt C.

description: Xmas day -  Busy but not too bad - enjoyed the ambiance and open windows whether you sit outside or inside.  I really wanted to like this place and decided to order the Large Plate Mixed Grill with my husband and split a couple of smaller plates  as well.  I just reread the Mixed Grill on the posted menu just to make sure I wasn't imaging things.  Mixed grill scallops, prawns, salmon, soy ginger glaze/ cauliflower colore 24.95.  Sounds good doesn't it.  Well..... maybe no one had time to go fishing today. There was two small scallops, two small prawns, a tiny piece of salmon and 1/4 of the dish was green salad.  Wait - I think I see a tiny speck of a colored purple cauliflower but we couldn't share it as it wasn't big enough to cut in half.  Yes this is North Beach, San Francisco etc.  But please Calzone do not call this a Large Plate.  A mixed grill should be substantive and this was not.  And to add all that green lettuce - I kept poking around with my fork to see if I was missing something.  Really felt like this was a rip off and left feeling hungry so stopped and bought a sandwich down the street.   Sorry Calzone but Che Cosa Fai??
author: Sami M.

description:
Well.. I would actually give this place a 3.5 stars. 

Atmosphere- (3.5 stars) the atmosphere was pretty nice. I like how it's set up. Even though it is a bit small it makes you feel comfy. There is two stories but i didnt get to upstairs to see how it's like. There are tables set up outside too with heat lamps above you so you can enjoy the outdoor air with out freezing your butt off. There's a bar too.

Food-(3.5 stars) I got to try the Lasagna, Lasagna-style Calzone, GNOCCHETTI w/ cream asparagus sauce, and the Melon Mojito. 
The lasagna was pretty good but thought it could have been bigger for the price you're paying. 
The Lasagna-style calzone wasnt that great. But it was pretty big. The Crust was the best part, it's amazing, but the filling inside (lasagna-style) wasnt that great. It felt like i was eating a cheese calzone. There was more cheese than actual lasagna filling. I wished i tried the other ones instead.
Now the GNOCCHETTI, it was amazing. It was so good, i would go back just to get it again. I think that's my favorite dish of the night. The asparagus sauce and manchego makes just the right flavoring for me.
The Mojito was pretty good. It great for the price. It's served in a pretty large glass. First time tasting Melon flavor, it wasn't bad but I would probably still prefer the original. 

Service- (3.5 stars)
author: Janet C.

description: Cute place, love how it looks at night. Been there once, portions aren't too big and it's a little expensive comparatively.  The food was good, but not phenomenal. If I go again it'll be for the decor and ambiance, there are too many italian restaurants around for me to go back just for the pasta here.
author: Shafaq C.

description: drinks and food...excellant outdoor seating. lovely place to be in North beach. mojito - yum
author: Michelle B.

description: Very bad food and bad service. The pizza crust seemed like it was baked on very thin crackers and was not tasty at all.
author: K. E.

description:
I'm still waiting for Yelp is enable half stars. I'd give Calzone's 2.5 if I could. Not because its really all that bad, but because its not all that exceptional. I like Calzone's on a sunny Summer afternoon, when a fresh bowl of seafood pasta can be split out on the curbside. But as a group dining experience for dinner, I found I'm not all the amused with the place.

The tables inside feel rather cramped for what appears to be a large restaurant. The waiters aren't notably warm or friendly, but that doesn't meant they're inattentive. I just don't feel making a customer connection is a priority here.

Now, for the important part- the reason you dine out- the food: my steak was cooked as I ordered and well portioned (the size of my fist = perfect!), and the zucchini mashed potatoes were fluffy without being doused in much, if any, butter, but they weren't exactly ZINGING! with flavor. Which, for a bit of a foodie, is a disappointment. Even if it isn't the best restaurant in North Beach, or small and family operated, I feel like there are simple things with seasoning that they could do to make it a step above where they're at. I'm also not a huge fan of the bread (which isn't warm and comes in individually wrapped bags), and our starters of salad and eggplant pizza were decent but had the potential to be BURSTING! with flavor. Also, the entrees of my 4 co-diners seemed pretty basic. All got pasta dishes, and none looked particularly appetizing in presentation. As a fairly good cook, I could estimate just at a glance that I could make each dish better and prettier.

I was quite surprised by the somewhat "meh" feeling I had after trying each course- considering the fond memories I have of sipping wine and eating lite, fresh, seafood out in the sun during the summer- but I suppose its just not the type of place that's meant to be a great foodie spot in the city. There has to be restaurants such as these: ones where you can go with a group of five and only pay $35-40 each for two appetizers, your entree, and one bottle of wine. Where the food isn't bad, but you don't feel compelled to make it back anytime soon.

Again, if you want a decent food at a cheap price point, and don't care particularly for the atmosphere of the experience, then Calzone's isn't a bad Italian option in NB. Its just not anything to write home about.
author: Raquel C.

description:
Just here for our 2 Year Anniversary!!!

The waiters are good, food it delicious, bar could use a few more options but besides that I'm a fan. I'd suggest going at night! You can enjoy a candle light dinner outside or go inside to dine. I will admit it is a bit packed and not that roomy but that is just do to the fact that people like it hence the traffic.

My recommendation, try it at least once!
author: Brody D.

description: The pizzas, pastas, and calamari are pretty good. Not awesome but better than average. It's a good place to go before hittin up North Beach or Broadway. Wouldn't go out of my way to eat there but when I'm in the area I always swing by.
author: Beini Q.

description:
Two words: TOURIST TRAP

Awful overpriced mass produced gross food!
author: Natalie T.

description:
Best garlic fries EVER! 
fried in peanut oil and served with a horseradish ketchup.
Oh my god, I just LOVE these fries. I can't get enough.
The only other item I've had at Calzone's is the heirloom tomato salad with avocado and basil- also outstanding. 
I'll prolly never order anything else here because I've found the ultimate mouthwatering combination.
author: .'antigone' ..

description:
Calzone's is open till 1:00 AM daily. It's about time that Yelp lets us search for places that are still open at whatever time we're searching for something. Bleah.

Key phrases: late night; open late
author: John K.

description:
4 hungry tourists out and about looking for a place to satisfy all our tastes for a italian late lunch.
-Nice cafe seating outside.
-Calzones were big, not too heavy, and had unique filling options.
-Salad was fresh.
-Perfect choice!
author: Jen T.

description:
I've been here twice and had two totally different experiences.  The first time the waitress was great and everything went smoothly.  The food is par, but sitting outside to people watch under a heated canopy is worth the visit. 

The second time I was here, I had a chubby waiter that was slower than ever and brought out my girlfriend's soup, an appetizer of calamari, and our pizza all out at once without even giving us bread or our drinks first. He brought us a new pizza and even still the service was so bad I had to struggle to give him a 10% tip.  

So, if you go here make sure you have the cute brunette waitress.  I think her name was Brittany because if you get the chubby guy, you'll be waiting forever.  The couple next to us waitied twenty minutes just for their check.
author: Brian D.

description:
I really like Calzones. For a quick lunch this is your place. They do have wonderful calzones but do not limit yourself because you will be missing out on their other wonderful meal options. They have a full bar with an on-staff bartender so do not hesitate to take advantage of that. 

I love their pizza and gnocchi the best. They also have these garlic fries that smell so good when they serve them. I have never eaten them but they smell incredible. 

They probably have the most abundant seating of all the North Beach restaurants which is good for people like my dad who insists on take his dog everywhere. They also have a decent wine and beer selection, albeit not very big. I would recommend this for a quick lunch or dinner. What is also nice about this restaurant are the portions. They are not massive like other North Beach restaurants so you will not need to unbutton your jeans when you leave.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
This place just caught my eye one time that me and a handful of friends we're walking through, so we went in to eat. The staff is very friendly and knows what they are serving. This place is aways a backup plan for me if nothing else is working for the evening, and I always try something new here and have yet to be disappointed with my selection. 
They really know how to make mojito's here so if you like mojito's you need to have one of the ones they make here, just be warned they tend to be on the strong side. 
Overall the prices on food are reasonable and the service is fast so I would recommend it to anyone walking by because finding parking in the area is never easy.
author: Luis T.

description: Used the other recommendations and ordered Mojitoes and calzones.  The Mojito deserved 6 stars, and the calzone deserved 4-5.  Pesto Chicken was fabulous and the Lasagna Style was moderate to good..
author: Sheri W.

description: I liked their pizza. Atmosphere was nice too and feel like lil time-tripped. I saw other people's food, those also look great, but I feel they tend to order too much... The funny shape plates are cool, I thought...
author: Daisy A.

description: Although this restaurant looks super touristy, my boyfriend and I decided to try it. We sat outside under the heat lamps, which actually made the chilly evening quite comfortable. It was fun to be out on the street. The food was good, but the portions were not as large as I had anticipated for a restaurant like this.
author: Amy K.

description:
When you pass by Calzone's, you are overpowered by the smell of garlic.  For me, this is a good thing, though I realize it wouldn't be for many.  It's brought me in on a couple of occasions wandering around North Beach looking for a good, moderately-priced lunch.

The inside is kitschy, but fun.  I wouldn't characterize it as a romantic place to eat, unless you eat outside, under the (too hot) heat lamps.

For an appetizer, my friend and I had the garlic fries, which were delicious.  They came out hot and had just the right amount of garlic tossed in with them, and the dipping sauce was yummy.

I had the smoked salmon pizza.  Now, this was essentially your average bagel-with-all-the-fixings brunch on a pizza.  It was alright - I'm not sure I'd recommend all those flavors together, on a pizza.  Pizzas in general there are just not as good as other things, so go for something else.

Overall, though, the service was attentive without hovering over us constantly, the appetizers are always good, and I've heard good things about the non-pizza entrees.  Also, I've tasted the mojito when a friend ordered it, and it was FABULOUS.

It's a nice place at North Beach, and less stuffy than many of the "authentic" cafes on Columbus.  Give it a try - particularly if you like garlic.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
It has that "I'm a chain" feel to it-- Overall good, but not great. I like their salads. 

I would only go there if I was dragged into it by someone who was visiting and who was intrigued by the sidewalk!
author: Maddy S.

description:
I'm a fan because every time I come here, there Always Always are couples sitting outside cuddling, or heavily making out. 

It's a casual romantic place to be ! And you don't have to worry about the cold since they have the outside heaters. 

In regards to the food, the menu is quite bland.... 
It's like a fast-food bistro. Filling, but not savory enough to make me want to come back. Still though, I come because it's a good place to pass the time with good company.
author: Nancy Y.

description: whenever the weather is nicein sf, everyone wants to be outside of course.  such was the case this past weekend.  we sat outside.  its a bit weird because the tables are two people each and you both face the street.  we each had a soup which came out super quick and also an artichoke calzone.  the thing was filled with onions, and not that much artichoke.  still good nonetheless
author: claudia y.

description:
Hey, what am I doing in this tourist joint?

Eating HELLA GOOD garlic fries, that's what. Housemade ketchup too.

I'd stick with the salads and pastas, the pizzas aren't my style. Vegans should stick with the angel hair, the fettucine has egg. Vegetarians would be happy with the broccolini dish (butter). The service is wham-bam-thank-u-maam, which is ... actually refreshing.

For a tourist spot, the prices are low and the quality is high. They are used to seeing people from all over the world, so the hosts are professional, efficient, and appear to give even service to all - kudos.
author: Currently A.

description: Went here several weeks back. We are literally still talking about how disgusting the food was. Horrible food and service. The place is a total tourist trap. If you want some good Italian food to over to Original Joes.
author: Trevor H.

description: Great location and ambiance. We had lunch right on the sidewalk which was perfect for people watching and to continue our day of seeing the sights. The Mojito was fantastic and the Calzone that I had was delish! I can not wait for my next trip back! Definite worth the stop if you are in the area.
author: Tony T.

description: I always passed by this place thinking that it was just a big tourist restaurant in North Beach but I can say that this is going to be my go-to restaurant in North Beach (with Panta Rei a close second). I ordered the artichoke and prosciutto pizza with the lasagna. Their lasagna was the best lasagna I've ever had. I can tell that the pasta was fresh and everything else in it was basically fresh. The service was great and dining al fresco always makes the food taste better. This place is great.
author: Rylan C.

description:
Horrible service. Juan (server #101) is the worst possible excuse for someone who is a waiter.

There for five of us. We order 5 bottles of wine at $40.00 and we asked for bread and he made it seem as though we were an inconvience. 

For someting that is supposed to be authentic Italian, the entire staff was not.

I will NOT be returning.
author: Michael D.

description:
Hmmmmm.....What should I say about this awful place...maybe that it's awful?

I'm not going to say it was my worst dinning expirience, becasue it wasn't. But it's deffinetly one on the bottom of my list. 
My mom probably ordered an iced tea about 5 times and they brought it to her in about 20 minutes (even though she asked repeatadly).
Another problem... they don't have any simple pasta dishes. I was in the mood for a very simple sauce (tomato sauce). I was shocked when I read their menu becasue all their sauces were so complex. So, I ordered the most "simple" one they could make; Asparagus, sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, in a white sauce. Not only did my pasta taste like super mushy oatmeal...it was hella expensive too!!

And one last thing...Our table wouldn't stop wobbling!! SO ANNOYING!!!!!
author: Pasta G.

description:
Great for a midnight meal.  The food isn't perfect, but perfectly fine, especially after a few cocktails.  Perhaps a teeny bit pricey for what you get, but hey, the location is great,!  Especially for watching tipsy tourists walking by.
The staff is generally pretty nice, and the space is very welcoming.  Just quiet enough for a good conversation, and just loud enough to have a totally inappropriate conversation.
author: Mollie T.

description: Wonderful dinner here with three adults and a one year old.  Just noisy and busy enough to keep baby entertained while we enjoyed our cocktails and people watched.  We shared an Arugula salad, prosciutto pizza and crab pizza...all very yummy!  The bill was so inexpensive I checked it for errors!  Great place!
author: Lori M.

description:
Me and my Boy went here. We wanted to try a new Italian place and he wanted to do it in the city. 
So we walked up and down the little italy. We got to the city around 1145ish. Parked on green and walked. Calzone's is def a eye catcher. I really wanted fryed cheese. That what I was looking for on all the menus we past. But the diffrent resturants where either empty ( IE not good)n or the wait was too long
When we walked past Calzone's they didn't have Fryed cheese but they did have something else I was willing to try. 
Italian pot stickers. 
We were seated very fast. We ordered the italian pot stickers, the chicken calzone and the mixed sea food plate
Pot sticker where good but I think if they would have had some type of cheese they would have kicked it up d notches
The chicken Calzone's was hecka long. It was good, well ok. I needed more souce and more cheese inside. I'm a soucy kind of girl. I asked for ranch cause the chicken was dry. They said they didn't have ranch so I had to get more red souce. I had to make it work
The mixed sea food plate my boyfriend orders... Looked hella small exspecialy for my guy he is a big guy and when the plate came it was like some type of fish on top of some shrimpwith mashed patatoes
I tasted the shrip, dry, I tased the patatoes, they where the only thing good... LOL
He was in my plate the whole night. 
The only thing we had good this night.... Was the pot stickers that needed some cheese and our seats out side. People in SF are too Funny:)
author: Whitney C.

description: The food here while not amazing is well made.  They have good pasta dishes, as well as salads and calamari. They have outdoor seating that is heated, which rocks on a cold SF day.  It's a mecca for tourists, you probably won't catch too many locales here (some but not many).  It's a bit pricey, i think for what it is but seems to always be busy.
author: Ka C.

description: I really love the European atmosphere at this place where you could sit outside, get good food and enjoy the company with your friends. It was even better in the past when you could light one up after dinner while waiting for desert to arrive. The staff is very attentive and food is delivered fast. My favorite is the thin crust pizza.
author: Andrew B.

description: Our cab driver suggested this place on our vacay in SF! I should've tipped him better because this place is AWESOME!  The Calzones of course were great, the ambiance is cool...Fast service and this place seems to be crowded all the time. Will come back again for sure!
author: Ai C.

description: I love Italian food and when it comes to Italian food - i call it Calzone's ... their food is awesome and cocktails are the best. I like their vegetarian pizza .. being a vegan, the chef made it so delicious with all the veggie toppings. the pizza is thin and the dough is well prepared! the lasagna is also good. i go to this place whenever i visit SFO. the sitting area and lounge is nicely done.
author: Sarah S.

description: Fun for a first date; very crowded and touristy though; average food; great for people watching.
author: Ashley E.

description:
I haven't been here for quite sometime, I usually come here for dinner.  but today I decided to go for lunch bc it was nice out which is not a regular thing in SF. 
I had the burger, it was real good; I even couldn't finish it ( and I am the guy who finishes his drink and belongs to the empty plate club). My girlfriend had a chicken salad with yellow and red beet, I almost finished it my self and I don't eat salad or greens myself.
I was very pleased with the whole combination, plus the weather was nice and the waiter knew us.
author: Fabio.lous f.

description:
Wow!  What a great place for an italian meal.  Yes it is a touristy place to eat, but at the same time the ambiance and taste are exceptional.  I had the Ravioli filled with roasted chicken and mascarpone with crispy fried sage and I was extremely impressed.  It was by far the best ravioli dish I have had in San Francisco - anywhere in the US for that matter.  My friend's eggplan calzone was also fantastic - cooked exceptionally well and deliciously moist.

-1 for portions.  Too few raviolis for my raging appetite :(
author: Steve G.

description: awesome calzones here.  the bread is thin and not thick and bready.  besides having great calzones, it's also pet friendly.  dine with your pup at one of the outdoor tables!
author: Rosalyn M.

description: So I went here for lunch on my bday.  It was drizzling out, but we still sat outside.  Thanks to the overhead heaters for keeping us nice and toasty!  Lunch was delicious!  Everyone that walked by on the street had their eyes fixed on our food as we chowed everything down.  Everything was good, until a big food truck double-parked right in front of us to deliver food inside Calzone's.  And I mean it literally stopped dead smack in front of our table.  So we spent a good portion of our lunch taking in the view of this white panel truck.  All in all though, I had a good experience.  Service was fast and friendly too!
author: Stacey L.

description: Calzones is my one of my most favorite places in North Beach.  It is very tourist-y I know, and as someone that lives in San Francisco it gets a little annoying.  But Their Crab Salad in their Red Sauce with Cherry Tomatoes... absolutely to die for.  I've always sat outside and the service is alright, hit or miss sometimes but the water guy is always great.  I've actually tipped him more than the waiter because he really busts his ass!
author: Wenter S.

description: I was craving Italian, and was disappointed with my choice this evening...  House salad was decent, but the lasagna calzone (recommended by the waiter) was bland.  Glass of CA Cab was $9.  Some like the outdoor seating for people watching, but as I sat inside watching through the window I noticed some of the city's homeless took opportunity to interrupt customer's meals to ask for alms.  (I'm generous, but they come back every 15 minutes taking advantage).   Service was acceptable.  I will be trying a different place next time I have Italian cravings.
author: Tracy W.

description:
it was really nice sitting outside in the cold because the heaters above us kept us kind of warm.

i didn't particularly enjoy my meal (ate some lasagna), but i did enjoy my hot chocolate.
author: Jamie C.

description:
love the great outdoor seating on a hot sunny day or a warm evening right on columbus street in north beach, great for people watching.   

my hub & i especially love their crab fresh fettuccine w/garlic scallop sauce.........AMAZING especially if you LOVE garlic & crab.......its ALL GARLIC & CRAB LUMP MEAT!!!!

got other things that we don't care for & won't ever order again.....

- smoked chicken calzone -- dry & lacked flavor
- gnoccheti -- the one i got i believe had pt. reyes blue cheese -- too rich & overpowered by the cheese & cream.

so the stars are for the outdoor seating & the crab fettuccine dish!
author: Cindi N.

description: Pricy for the quantities, particularly at lunchtime. My calzone was excellent, and it was a very nice place to sit outside on a sunny day. Service was lacking...I waited longer for my bill than I did to order, get my meal, and eat it combined. I'd recommend getting salads and splitting a calzone with a friend.
author: Monika M.

description: What a mistake coming to this place. I recently moved to North Beach and while walking around the neighborhood I saw this place and thought it looked nice.. had nice outdoor seating, and I was craving a hearty Italian meal. I walked in with a friend and almost walked back out. I now regret not doing that.  It was a very unfriendly atmosphere.  After we were seated it took about 10 minutes for a waiter to stop at our table, he never introduced himself. I ordered a heirloom tomato salad, a chicken and something calzone and a glass of the house red wine. it's been a really long time since i've had a "bad" glass of wine and this one was just that. It had an unsettling smell to it. The salad was mediocre and when our entree's showed up, my calzone was nearly cold. My friends prawn and pasta dish wasn't very good either. She said the prawns were over cooked and the pasta it came with which was supposed to be fettucini was some totally different type of pasta that was also overcooked. I would never go back to this place again. Unfriendly service and terrible food is how you can sum it up.
author: Jamie G.

description: Was kinda torn between 2-3 stars.  We went there at Midnight on a Saturday so it was good to still be able to get some food.  We ordered drinks and some pizza.  They brought us some cold bread in a paper bag that was so-so and then the pizza came and I love all pizza but this combo was just so-so as well.  I doubt I will ever go back there, more for tourists than city dwellers.
author: Mark M.

description: Went there about 4 times, food is good,but overpriced, the bill can be expensive if wine/beer ordered. Last visit, the menu looked so americanized-italian(to cater to the tourists?).  I prefer old school,keep it italian without being americanized.
author: Jer W.

description: The service is super quick in terms of "good service" which I prefer.  Water always filled, empties cleared and attentive, just not a great deal of table side personality.  The heaters outside are cooking and perfect for a cold night of people watching.  The butter lettuce salad was awesome, fresh lettuce and light flavorful blue cheese vinaigrette dressing.  The pizza however was BLAND, the veggies were raw, the crust dry and bland.  I had to add olive oil for flavor and moisture before I had to resort to marinara.  The server came up and before I ordered he predicatively asked, "marinara?"  I'm definitely not the first person to ask!
author: Todd O.

description: Pizzas were like flatbread.  Tasty, but not really pizza like Italy.  Salmon orzo pasta, both salmon and pasta were very over-cooked and then saturated with olive oil.  The complimentary bread, service, and decor were very good though.
author: Yan X.

description: I've been to Calzone's about half a dozen times and have always had a great dining experience; Calzone's is now one of my new favorites in the North Beach neighborhood.  The food is outstanding!  I absolutely love the pizza, there's something about the crust that just makes the pizza (very light, flaky crust - so good!).   And the Moscow Mojito's are the best!
author: Brandy A.

description:
While this place is accommodating for larger groups with children, the food is tasteless at best. Kids will eat anything and they had no complaints. Yet, all five of the adults in our group ordered different entrees and we were all disappointed. We each wound up with a bland dish and the portions were tiny.  I would never recommend this for dinner.

What it is good for is having a glass of wine at one of the outdoor tables and perhaps and over priced order of garlic bread.
author: Karen H.

description: Was in SF on business with a colleague.  I am from The City so was providing a "tour" and we ended up in North Beach and hungry.  Decided to stay on Columbus and picked Calzone's.  Most North Beach restaurants (especially those right on Columbus) tend to cater to the non-locals so I was a little skeptical.  Restaurant was busy but not crowded so I was a bit shocked when we were diverted to a table upstairs.  Quickly rectified that one by pointing to a table by the windows and moving to same.  No push back or argument from the wait staff.  Good I thought..  Appetizer of french bread, garlic and mozzarella melted.  A little institutional but plenty of garlic.  My main was lasagne and I must admit it was pretty good.  The pasta was not over cooked; the sauce was bright and there was plenty of meat.  Not overpowering on the cheese either..  Mostly mozzarella and would have like a little ricotta to go with but, still, not bad..  Colleague had the Margaretta pizza..  Not round but elongated.  Fresh tomatoes and mozzarella and basil..  Great crust..  Toppings, well, the tomatoes tasted canned and the cheese institutional.  Still it was not a bad pizza.  Skipped desert..  Full bar and quite a few wines by the glass in the $8 - $12 range.  So the verdict is Calzone's is not bad.. It's a great place to watch people and the food, while not up the standards of some of North Beach's better Italian establishments is serviceable.
author: Jerry G.

description: Food wasn't too great but the ambience was. Chicken ravioli was bland. Bruschetta was okay. Clams is garlic wine sauce didn't taste so fresh. You pay for the outside people watching.
author: Helen V.

description: 3.5 stars. My wife and I arrived into SF late and found ourselves walking around town looking for a dinner place. Naturally, most restaurants are already closing up their kitchens when the clock strikes 10, we were thrilled to find this place still bustling and fill of patrons. Clearly we were among many others tourist, but my stomach was quite happy with the find. I ordered their prosciutto pizza and my wife tried their gnocchi wiht tomato cream sauce - both were fair to good and served their purpose. We probably enjoyed the people watching more than the food, overall a decent restaurant.
author: Jesse W.

description:
Showed up on a crowded, warm Saturday evening in North Beach on Nov. 13 with out of town guest.  Informed wait may be 20-30 minutes; only waited 5 minutes for indoor table.  Pleasantly surprised: treated like a star; surprisingly good food/price value; standard NB service; great table, never rushed; lounged; great SF evening.  
Regarding service issues: it's "pizza cucina" for gosh sakes at fairly reasonable prices.  Lighten up, sip your vino/cocktail; relax, lounge and enjoy.  It beats places that push you out the door to fit in another group.
author: Robert P.

description: Very nice upscale place, that is also biker friendly. We have been there a few times. The wait staff has always been friendly and service very good. We usually sit out-side on the sidewalk tables. They have heaters above the tables for cold San Francisco evenings. A little pricy, and touristy but that is all part of San Fransico. The place is always crowded and busy.
author: Eric M.

description: I'm a fan of Calzone's - it's touristy because of it's Colombus Street location in NB, although the food (the pasta) is very good and satisfying.
author: Whitney P.

description: Nice place. We were there with a party of 3 and sat outside under warm, heated lamps. The wine list was average but complimented the food on the menu well. The garlic bread with cheese was very tasty as an appetizer. We ordered the two vegetarian pizzas on the menu--the bianco was not good, however, the margherrita was excellent. The tiramisu was standard. Overall, good place for the situation.
author: Premal S.

description: Don't let the outside fool you. Its like a big bright red light attracting a bug and I was one unlucky bug that fell into its trap. I've eatin everywhere in the north beach area and I always pass by this one for some reason since I was a kid. So finally my girl and I decided to give it a try. I ordered the margerita pizza and she ordered the blue cheese fettecinni alfredo. Plain and simple didnt taste good. I would never come back here again unless I was drunk and was with a group of friends. This place is a tourest trap. Don't get me wrong its a nice venue but the food here dosent meet up to its standard.  I give this place 1 star for the food and 1 star for its nice venue.
author: Jay S.

description: let's just go w/ terrible shall we. What italian restaurant doesnt know how to make good pizza- your sauce was terrible . . the cheese overbaked...the crust- was more like flatbread than pizza crust- and you serve FRIES? Seriously-its a huge tourist trap which obviously we should have picked up on...judging by the tacky decor- but you yelpers said it was pretty good...and due to that fact i will no longer use yelp b/c seriously this place was just bad- nowhere near 3 1/2 stars. Shame on you yelpers
author: Allison W.

description:
the food was great!

the service was fast considering i went there on a crazy friday night!

the mojitos were delicious..

my only dislike...is that crazy 3x3 room they call a restroom, its not even clean..slippery floors and since its so small your waiting in line, all up in somones face!!  not mention the unbalanced tile floor that i almooooost slipped on.. its a little crampy in there so it gets hot..
author: Bernie P.

description: Went Last Night as we always go when SFO. Never been treated so bad at a Restraunt , spoke to the manager Andre who looked like he had been drinking and was on something I  am surprised he could see us when he was speaking while being absolutely no help. Why would they put someone in charge that is so incompetent. This was supposed to be a great experience and it was a birthday celebration, needless to say we left without eating a thing and would never recommend this place again. I guess they think they are so good they don't need any new customers or any more money.
author: Graham E.

description: A little touristy, but good food at a good price. Definitely worth the wait for outside seating. Call ahead or grab a drink at the bar if there's a wait. Best for a date, a small group of friends, or with the parents.
author: Matt M.

description: The food isn't bad, but being a vegetarian my choices are very limited. This is one of those restaurants that it's really more about the great location than anything else. Make sure you get a seat outside on the sidewalk under a heat lamp. This is a fun place to have a drink or 10 with a date. Some of the best people watching in the city. There is an interesting mix of people on dates, sleazy guys sneaking into the Broadway strip clubs, tourists, and young locals that walk by these heated sidewalk seats. It's super easy to get a cab from here too.
author: Brian A.

description: We were lost in little Italy.  There were so many choices everywhere we turned.  If there are so many places to eat, why the hell do so few places have parking?  San Fran sucks in this respect because in LA there would be valet.  We stumbled upon Calzone's by tripping over all of the sidewalk patrons.  They have small and tight outdoor tables perfect for people watching.  My lasagna was full of meat and cheesy and generous with the sauce.  The orzo was chocked full of seafood.  It was almost overwhelmingly swimming in seafood.  Overall the food is good, but their bread sucked.  What kind of Italian place can't do good bread?  Service was nothing special.
author: Mimi D.

description:
anybody who knows me knows i am not a huge fan of italian food, but i love this place. this is my go-to place in north beach, and i couldn't count the number of times i've been here on my fingers and toes - after beach blanket babylon, before going out, with friends, with dates, with family... i have a lot of fond memories here.

that said:
+ excellent, thin-crust pizza
+ friendly service
+ great seating

- it gets super busy on nice weekends, hard to get an outside seat
- parking is difficult, but this is san francisco, get over it or get out

i have gone back, and will continue to. i have been urged for years to try steps of rome, the other north beach fixture, but honestly, why gamble when i know calzone's is a sure bet?
author: Ahu S.

description: i wanted The Stinking Rose.. you know everything made with garlic.. its one of my favorite places to eat.  But it is my BFF's birthday so i have to give it to her for choosing any place to eat.  she choose a great place.. i want to say YUMMY to my sandwich and soup.  well the soup was good intill they started talking about chicken gizzards then i was turned off completely towards that soup (still trying out chicken i still don't like it.)  but my prosciutto and salami sandwich was so great. to go with this yummy meal i had an anchor steam beer.. a little too pricey for the food but still good!
author: Lety M.

description: Bleh. Not nearly as good of food as many of the other Italian restaurants around. The only saving grace is their amazing patio in the heart of North Beach.
author: Niki N.

description:
I like to wander, usually aimlessly.

My sister and I had lunch & ended up at Calzone's.
When we walked in, the host looked at us and ASKED "Hi?"
So instead of really speaking to him, I threw up two fingers to indicate that there were two of us...Furthering the obvious fact that we were there to eat...food...

He told us to sit wherever we wanted so I picked the last table next to the windows. Our host, although initially a bit pretensious, offerred to open the window up for us - this was great, as it was really warm and the breeze was cool and refreshing.

I ordered calamari and the heirloom tomato salad. My sister, the picky eater, ordered garlic fries.

The food was decent. The calamari: crunchy, clean taste..a LITTLE on the rubbery side.
The Salad: the tomatoes were wonderful, the rest of the salad - so so.
Sisters garlic fries (I stole many of them) were good as well...a little light on the garlic.

There was a very irritating man sitting on the other side of the window...right next to me, breathing up all my fresh air and making rude comments about the people walking by...but that's not the fault of the restaurant, so I deduct no stars for that.
I thought the menu was a bit pricey...$12 for an appetizer seems a bit much to me.  Maybe I'm just a cheapo. 

All in all...I was pleased with the place...I felt the food was a little hit or miss...the service was decent...the location was neat...so..
Tutti a tabella e mangiamo!
author: Sonia P.

description: Calzone's isn't the top of the line Italian restaurant, so don't go there if you want something upscale.  However, it is great for mainline food in a heavily populated tourtist location.  Try to get a table outside with the heat lamps....great for people watching!   We went last night and the service and house Chianti were great!!
author: Stacy L.

description:
A disappointed Coach K dropping by:

Where to begin - I went to this tourist trap with a group of six people. Upon arriving I saw my co-worker and his girlfriend (I just can't seem to get away from the guy). His gf is great though so it is always a welcome encounter. Here is the run down.

* We are smashed into a four person round table (minus 1)
* The bread plates are long and narrow and take up the entire diameter of the table. The bread comes out in to-go bags and is basically thrown onto the table. Three bags for six people. (minus 1)
* My knife had dried up lettuce embedded into the cutting surface (minus 1)
* I ordered the "lasagna style" calzone and my friend ordered the pesto chicken calzone (we decided to share calzones, I know it is a little gay but what the hell). Both calzones actually tasted like nothing... I am not kidding there was no taste to them. I was truly impressed that food could be prepared in this manner so I won't give them a minus here.
* There was a giant mirror on the wall in front of me so I could constantly scan the entire restaurant and make sure my hair looked good (plus one).
* We ordered our second bottle of wine mid-way through the meal and it hadn't arrived by the time everyone was done so we canceled (minus one).

This place defines tourist trap. Two stars might be generous, but I am sure there are plenty of places worse that deserve less stars. If this is the only thing anyone ever listens to me about on Yelp I would be satisfied. Please, I beg of you, do not eat at this second class, good for nothing, tasteless food restaurant. I hate anyone who feels different. 

Out,
author: Coach K.

description: I've been eating here for years when in SF and looking for a quick, reasonably prices meal in Little Italy.  Plus I love their outside seating with warm heaters so you don't freeze.  So fun to watch what's going on in the neighborhood.  Usually get one of the pasta dishes with the fresh vegetable that is in season like asparagus, and I have always enjoyed every bite.   I think the last one I had asparagus and dried tomatoes and maybe something else on it - delicious!  The dishes are usually simple but tasty.  No heavy sauces here.  The calzones are wonderful also as are the pizzas.  For the price, usually under $15 you can't beat it.  If you want heavy sauced Italian food go elsewhere but if you want a lighter meal try this great place.
author: debbie l.

description:
wow, first time i went to northbeach after sunset and didnt leave blasted drunk.

so my friends and i decided to go on an impromtu dinner in north beach, and most places were an hour wait, but calzones said it'd be 15. so we put our names on the list. 

we waited at the bar where i ordered their bv cabernet ($9). I was surprised how much they gave me because they poured past the "appropriate" line to pour wine, but hey, im not complaining! my friend ordered their plain  mojito, and it was the best mojito i have ever had. by best, i mean it wasnt too minty, or too sugary, or too limey like most other places are prone to do. it tasted like an authentic mojito.

so we get seated at the table and ordered the following:

- heirloom tomatoe salad: oh my god. ok, i know this sounds weird but as a child i had a semi-phobia of tomatoes. i think its because of that show i used to watch called "ATTACK OF THE KILLER TOMATOES". anyways, i usually get seriously nauseated when i see people eating tomatoes whole (i wanted to stone people who ate tomatoes with sugar on it... omg ew) but i can tolerate, even enjoy, tomatoes chopped up and processed. anyways, their tomatoe salad was AWESOME. their vinaigrette was not too vinegary (omg there's a swear word hidden in that word)  and i didnt know green tomatoes could taste so good! it had crostini and avocados in it too. it was so refreshing.

- italian potstickers: YUM! it came on a bed of arugula which i might have enjoyed more than the potstickers bc my friends ate most of the potstickers but wow these were pretty good. granted they tasted almost like regular chinese potstickers, they were still good. italian sausage and portabello mushrooms... mmm mmm...

- sausage/peperoni pizza: ok i was expecting a salty ass oily ass thick crusted ass pizza, but no. somehow they managed to make a PEPERONI pizza light. how, i dont know. but i love love love love love thin crust. and though i dont remember too much of the pizza (bc i was scarfing the salad) i do remember that it was satisfactory.

- garlic bread: i was least impressed by this one, it was really cheesey which is good but not really expected of garlic bread, but hey if you garlic bread is your thing you'd probably have a lot more to write about this one.

- pesto calzone:  WOWOWOWOWOW im so glad someone ordered this. ok before this place i thought a calzone was this loaf of chewy ass bread stuffed with oily ass cheese and chewy ass meat.... but i think this is what a calzone is. it's crust was so thin and light, crispy yet malleable, and it encased a gooey but NOT oily filling of fluffy ricotta and light (not too garlicky) pesto swirled with oozing mozzerella and tender flakey white chicken. i've only seen the likes of this on food network. 

service was satisfactory. the place was ridiculously crowded but kudos for finding us a seat on a night where everything else was jampacked. 

this was the first time i had "authentic" italian food, so i may be wrong, but i'm just saying i had a great time and enjoyed the food. i have yet to have a better italian meal.
author: Lillian P.

description: The hostess Kelsey is the best, very friendly and welcoming.  The drinks are great also, the mojitos are amazing!
author: R K.

description: I wouldn't really recommend eating anything here, but the mojitos are crazy delicious. Is that a stalk of sugar cane?? Fuck me!! Two or three of those will take you down the sweet, delicious highway to wasted town.
author: Megan W.

description: Great food! Great service!  My husband, brother and I had a late lunch (around 3:30 pm) last Thursday at Calzone's.  The entire experience was absolutely fantastic.  The  staff was welcoming and courteous and our server, Duy, did a perfect job with our order.  Our food was up in literally 5 minutes from the time we ordered, and it was hot, fresh and amazingly delicious!   I have no idea how they can make such amazing, made to order food that quickly but WOW!  Our salads were perfect, and my brother's pizza was hot, fresh baked and really unique in taste and presentation.  Our server, Duy, really made our afternoon with his smile and warmth.  Note that many restaurants in the area are closed in the late afternoon while Calzone's is open and inviting.  I had not seen my brother in about 3 years so the lovely afternoon at Calzone's will be a great memory of special time spent with my brother and hubby.  Thanks Calzone's :o)
author: Annabelle C.

description:
With nowhere else to go , after a fashion show, my friends and I ended up here on Val's day  . We sat outside , and it was comfy owing to the heated porch. The food and the conversation definitely were distractions enough from all the  couples walking around, doing what is supposed to be done on Val's day. 
I thought the floral  tables were pretty. The food was nothing to write home about , but I guess it was  just fine, nice and subtle flavors, that you cannot jump to conclusions about. The service was pleasant .I would definitely go back to  explore the menu.
author: M p.

description: Don't get me wrong, the food wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great either.  I got the "5 hour Sugo".  It literally tasted like chef boyardee.  My husband got the dungeoness pasta is scallop sauce and it was a little on the fishy side.  We ended up going here because of the crowds.  There are tons of people here all the time, and perhaps we should have eaten pizza or calzones like everyone else around us.  I suggest you really look around the neighborhood before deciding which of the numerous restaurants to eat at.  There are a ton of them, and most are better than Calzones.
author: Dru C.

description: After walking all the way from Union Square to North Beach in the cold wind and passing through busy Chinatown (it was actually pretty fun!) we became a little hungry. We first came to Figoro, which is right next door to Calzone's, but after the disappointing service before we even ordered anything, we came here and I'm so glad we did! Our waiter was just wonderful! What a cool and down to Earth guy! Also, the food was good and the atmosphere was very welcoming and casual. Trust me, you don't need a long review to convince you to come to this place for a quick bite to eat. Bottom line, I've been here twice and I have yet to be disappointed. :)
author: Narina A.

description: I've always been wary of going here as it has been consistently referred to as a "tourist trap" on various websites, but I was in the North Beath area, hungry, and not interested in browsing too many menus.  Calzones it was.  The inside decor was fun -- kind of like a being on the inside of a festively stocked pantry.  I ordered a simple pepperoni pizza and is was really good.  It was thin-crust and crispy which is right up my alley.  The portion was relatively big, although i was able to finish it all.  I browsed other patron's plates and the calzones looked yummy and salads looked tasty.  If my allergies weren't bothering me, I would have ventured outside for one of the many patio tables.  The waiters were friendly, the service was quick, and all in all a good experience.  I look forward to trying the calzones or alfredo (that someone else mentioned) on the next visit.
author: LaSha G.

description: Just had Valentine's Day brunch here and it was wonderful. Fresh and flavorful! Had the arugula salad and salmon panini and the fries!! Good honest food, attentive service. Try it - you won't be disappointed!
author: T F.

description: My favorite late night SF dining.   Sit out side under the gas heaters and people watch.  The food is good, the servers are friendly.  If you are lucky a street musician will come by and sing you a song.  Bathrooms are clean.
author: Tony K.

description:
We had a friend in town from AZ for the weekend and they wanted to get out and "experience the culture of the city".  So instead of dropping of the cute piece of man meat into the Castro to make us some money, we decided to play it safe and head to the oh-so-cultured North Beach for dinner on Thursday.  Hey, North Beach does not have millions of cacti and/or small desert mammals, so it was more culture than out-of-towner had ever seen.  We decided on the touristy Calzone's for it's location and price.  OK, let's be real.  We came here for the full, cheap bar.  

I had a hard time deciding what to eat since there was just so much on the menu, but settled on brocollini and linguine in a red pepper oil.  The bf had the chicken calzone and the Arizonian had the ravioli and his gf had the pepperoni pizza.  To start we ordered the bruschetta and the italian potstickers.  The bruschetta was delish and I'm sure I smelled like I had just eaten at the Stinking Rose since it was piled high with whole garlic cloves.  The italian potstickers were just what I imagined.  Gross.  I mean, Italian + Potstickers cannot = good.  It was basically some marinara and chicken and cheese in a potsticker shell smothered with soy sauce.  Just as unappetizing as it sounds.  My linguine came and the taste was there, but the preparation wasn't.  The linguine was a giant clump of noodles that looked like it had been sitting there all day and reheated.  The brocollini was luke warm. Had it been prepared correctly, I'm sure it would have been killer.    The ravioli didn't even come with sauce!  I don't know if I've ever known a down-home ravioli to come without some sort of sauce.  Weird.  He ordered some on the side, but it's just not the same.  The pepperoni pizza looked pretty standard, although I didn't try any.  If you're going to eat here, just come for the namesake.  The calzone was delicious and HUGE.  Warm, gooey cheese and filling and a perfectly cooked crust made it fantastic.

Other than that, it's a pretty good location and afterwards you can always walk a block in any direction to get a few drinks.  Because, let's be honest, that's the main reason to come to North Beach anyway!
author: Kathleen B.

description: The portions are tiny, the food is bland and the prices are high. Sound like a winner to me! Or maybe not. This has to be one of my least favorite places in North Beach, and it is the ultimate tourist trap. It's usually packed, though, for the life of me I can't figure out why. It's just not that good. I guess misery loves company!
author: Lance J.

description: i remember being brought here when i was around 12 and never forgot about it since. The garlic french fries are delicious. me and my boyfriend get full from just that and a calzone. it might be a bit overpriced to some people, but i think its really worth a trip once in a while.
author: Jenn W.

description: I actually thought this place was pretty good, plus they are open late night!  I ordered the lasagna calzone.  BOY was that thing huge! haha I ended up eating about a 1/3rd of it and tried to force my friend to finish the rest =) i took off one star because we sat outside in the heated area and the heat lamp was so hot!  I had to ask the waiter to turn it down because i seriously felt like i was being baked.. I think there was something wrong with the lamp because he couldnt turn it down.. and just ended up turning it off.. good thing the heat from the next table's lamp blew over to our side
author: JUDY L.

description: I am surprised to read a number of positive reviews for Calzone's.  My experience echos of the "tourist trap" sentiment that some others shared.  The bruchetta we had, a very simple dish to prepare, had no taste until i added some balsamic and oil.  My meal, a cream based crab fettuccine, was riddled with bits of crab shell and again covered in an oily flavorless mess.  House wine was also remarkably bad - if you have the house wine at any real italian place they won't stear you wrong.  I will disclose, i did not try the calzones or the pizza.  Either way, i would avoid this place if i was looking for good food.
author: rahmin s.

description: The best part of this restaurant is its looks. A Italian restaurant offering microwaved lasagna is something that completely invalidates it. Pizza was okay but not as special as to return because of it.
author: Jose M.

description: Calzone's calzones may actually be the overall best choice of food for San Francisco after 11pm. They stay open 'til 1 or 2am, have heated seating outside on the Columbus sidewalk, and serve up very passable Italian. An unsolved mystery: literally dozens of Russians congregate there after 10pm or so nightly. Why?
author: Max L.

description: Personally, I had a  pretty good experience at Calzone's for the most part.  A few weekends ago (the weekend with that crazy hot spell!) a few of my friends and I headed to North Beach after a Giant's game to grab some food. Our whole party hadn't arrived, we were waiting on just one more person, so we just went to the bar and ordered a bottle of wine and appetizers.  We sat by the open window and enjoyed the warm night. We ordered steamed clams (a little sandy), bruschetta, popcorn calamari, and eventually after deciding on not getting the table, we ordered a lasagna styled calzone. That was enough food for two guys and myself to feel full. I thought the food was tasty overall and the food came out surprisingly fast considering the busy crowd. Our bartender never forgot about our food and drinks and just kept it coming! I'd definitely go back!
author: Eimi W.

description:
get the dugeness crab crostini appetizer.  crab, smoked salmon, avocado and extra virgin olive oil on crostini. light and delightful. 

on a warm night it's a great place to eat outside and people watch.
author: Regina C.

description:
I try and eat at Calzone's every time I make a trip out to SF.  There are only 2 things I find less favorable about this place... 1. though we always make reservations, we still end up having to wait at least 10 minutes and see walk-ins being sat before us. 2. the place is pretty small so if we are not sitting in a booth, we are getting nice and cozy with strangers.

Other than that, I love Calzone's.  The staff is very helpful and friendly.  The Italian Pot Stickers appetizer is delicious, though you only get four :( The gnocchi is probably one of the best gnocchis I've ever had (try Metro Bar and Restaurant in Lafayette for another great gnocchi dish), as they are large dumplings and practically melt in your mouth.
