Try the gnocchi with the asparagus manchego cream sauce...delicious!  The tiramisu is not bad, and is made with pound cake rather than lady fingers, like some restaurants tend to do to save money.

I get the same waiter everytime and he is very nice and attentive.  The other staff is also very attentive, quickly clearing away dirty dishes and doggy-bagging your food, filling water, and bringing more bread.  I will continue coming back here every time I go to SF!
author: Nicole S.

description: Locals I've mentioned this place to seem to have the impression this place is a cheesy tourist place. I beg to differ. I've been coming here for 7 years and the hand made pasta, pizzas and delicious salads have a 90% success rate. I'm partial to the gorgonzola alfredo and the pizzas. For dessert maybe head across the street to Cafe Greco.
author: Eric M.

description:
You know, I really wanted to like Calzone's... such a charming location with nice outdoor seating, great for peoplewatching.  I'd been here a couple of times for dessert and peoplewatching only, and their desserts are actually OK... had a full dinner here for the first time last night and we were sorrofully disappointed.
I've tried two of this chain's other restaurants... I thought The Stinking Rose was overpriced and average and thought The Franciscan was excellent, so we guessed that Calzones had a 50% chance of being good.  Unfortunately, we were wrong.  I got the salmon sandwich, which was average, the Fella got the crab fettuccini, which was rancid and the fella's brother got the Italian sausage pizza which turned out to be salami.  
I would have been a little more forgiving except that the service really was very unfriendly.  Our waiter tossed a couple of rolls wrapped in paper bags on the table as he was rushing by (kinda perplexing... and maybe a little unhygenic).  When we got our food, we all noticed the weird, rancid smell coming from the Fella's plate of pasta, but our waiter just disappeared.  Fella shared his brother's pizza because he couldn't really eat the rancid crab.  What totally soured my experience was that, when the waiter finally did come back to clear the plates, he asked how the food was as he was grabbing plates.  Fella said quite clearly "there was something wrong with mine... I couldn't eat that", but the waiter toally ignored it and said something like "thanks for eating here, hope to see you soon"... he obviously didn't notice that Fella's food was untouched, or hear that he couldn't eat it.  I live down the street and eat out a lot, but I won't be eating here again.
Incidentally, Fella and I had eaten dinner at the Olive Garden in San Jose (San Jose!) just the day before and the service was incomparably friendlier and the food actually much, much more flavorful and tasty.  My thoughts... skip Calzone's and take the M out to Olive Garden at Stonestown.
author: Kri B.

description: Pretty good food, I enjoyed the Dungeoness Crab pizza - it was the perfect size for one person, and hit the spot.  The service was FAST.
author: Jeff W.

description: Service was decent. Food was pretty good despite the free bread appetizer they serve. Interesting and diverse mix of people.
author: zach w.

description: I went on an "Urban Hike" in SF with my hiking group. Around 3pm we decided to eat, so all 35 of us walked into Calzones with no reservation. The room upstairs was the perfect size for our group. I could not believe how fast and friendly the service was. We were all seated with menus and water within 5 minutes. They even brought us lemon wedges for our waters without being asked. Five minutes later we all had bread, drinks, and our orders taken. My friend and I shared the margherita pizza, which was garlicky and delicious. Everyone in our group polished off their food, so either it was delicious or we were all starving after hiking for 6 miles. Our water glasses were kept filled, more bread was offered, and the waiter didn't seem to mind the multiple checks. It was a great place for a large group, but I also hope to go back with my boyfriend soon and sit out on the sidewalk and people watch.
author: Melanie I.

description:
yet another italian restaurant in north beach for me to check off my list.  i feel like the caliber of these restaurants really hinges on the luck of the order b/c the chances of coming back to any of these is slim considering it's a dime a dozen in this area.

but for my lunch here, we managed to order 3 delicious items, so I can't really fault this restaurant, even if some of the other menu items may be lacking.  we ordered a soup and chicken sandwich, which were quite good, though not fantastic, so maybe they get 3 stars.  

but then we ordered the shrimp scampi fettuccine and the ravioli which were both so good because of the pasta.  I'm assuming they make it fresh here, and if not, then maybe i'm even more impressed.  the fettuccine was wide, but thin, and the flavors with the shrimp made it a really good scampi (often it tastes like watered down garlic sauce, but not here).  My ravioli was my favorite because of the filling.  It was a chicken and cheese filling, but it wasn't dry (as i have often found with chicken raviolis), and the fried sage was a nice touch.  

plus the decor is pretty eyecatching.  again, i doubt i'll be back before I try all the other italian places, but it was a really pleasant lunch.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
Maybe 2.5 stars.

I'm not sure I'm ever going to come back to this place. Not to say that the food here is actually that bad, but in SF and in North Beach especially, there are so many BETTER Italian restaurants to eat at. Nevertheless for some reason, this place always appears to be packed. We went and tried this place on a Mon night because my sister says every time she drives by it, there's a massive amount of people eating at it or waiting to do so. Even so, we got seated really quickly. The three of us ordered the following:
1. Calamari. You just have to try calamari when going to a new Italian restaurant! That being said.. this calamari was just mediocre and the cocktail sauce was HORRID!! It was so sweet, I was tempted to spit it out.
2. Garlic bread with mozarella. Extremely greasy and not good. How can you mess up garlic bread with mozarella!!
3. Orzo with chicken, asparagus, and mushrooms. YUMMM!! *Sigh* The saving grace for this restaurant was its ability to introduce me to orzo.. that yummy, funny pasta shaped like rice. I could have just eaten it plain and still been happy with it.
4. 5 hour pork and beef sugo. This seemed extremely promising but wasn't anything special. Just your average extremely meaty bolognese sauce.
5. Lasagna. Now if you don't like ricotta cheese in your lasagna and if you love meaty lasagna, you'll probably like this lasagna. It was just about right and one of the best dishes we had that night.

So with three of us sharing this meal and with each of our own glasses of wine, the bill came out to $35 each including tip and tax. That's just more than I want to pay for a place like this.
author: Lauren C.

description: I loved my crab crostini accompanied by a satiating weissbier and topped off with a delicious chocolate mousse cake for dessert. Did I want to be so bluntly ripped off for it? Not so much. But it's the North Beach standard, so I'm willing to deal, especially for such a fulfilling meal. We sat outside on the row of tables lining the street-front, which translates into front-row seats for prime people-watching... a dignified local pastime. The only caveat was that it was FREEZING, but I'll gladly be lured back on a warm sunny day when I can ogle at tourists without catching pneumonia. I can't attest to the inside of the restaurant, but the service was cordial and the other menu options seemed equally enticing, so I plan to return for seconds!
author: G. J.

description: I went here with 3 other friends.  We wanted to sit outside facing the sidewalk, and though most people sitting outside were parties of 2, they let us sit outside anyway.  Well, at first they made us sit in the corner, where it was cold, but after we asked if we could move, they kindly showed us to a warmer (almost hot) table.  I got the tiramisu and a cup of coffee which was O SO AMAZING.  Coffee was coffee, but it was nice because they gave free refills, and the tiramisu was one of the fluffiest tiramisu's i've ever tasted.  One of my friends had a margherita pizza and the crust was really crispy and the tomatoes on it were really fresh.  The french fries on another plate were also REALLY good.  Food was good, ambiance was good, service was good.  What more could you ask for?
author: Traci C.

description: Excellent Italian cuisine (especially the gnocchi),and great curbside dining atmosphere in beautiful North Beach.
author: Bryan Y.

description:
Bonjour Calzones! 

Let your imagination go wild in the streets of Paris...well not Paris but San Francisco. Unlike the ordinary restaurants where you are face to face with the loved ones you're dining with...I figured that it was due time to watch something else (lol)....and what's more fun than to experience the joy of people watching in North Beach of San Francisco? I enjoyed Calzone's for its conveniently laid out tables in front of their restaurant.  The way they positioned the table so that you can watch dozens of people fly right by you while you're enjoying the food is fun & it's a great way to practice your eye winks at the hotties who stroll by. They've also placed heat lamps per table which call for a cozy evening & prevent you from facing the San Francisco wind chill. One of the choice places for a fun date night or to hang out with friends...not for an intimate dining experience like Bocce Cafe. I had the eggplant rustica pizza with olives & goat cheese on top...it was gone in 20 mins...yummers! Also, great service
author: Charmian D.

description: Ok those who come here either really like it or are the tourists- but I think they're pretty reliable with their  menu...but my review is for the calamari frittis- which is called popcorn calamari... its more crunchy and thicker batter but still good it comes with a horseradish marinara sauce :-)
author: Arissa C.

description: It looks so cute from the street, BUT . . . decor is bright and kitschy, the pizza boring, the bread cold and the pasta a congealed tasteless mess. I did not enjoy one thing. This is the kind of north beach restaurant that thrives on tourists and street traffic. I was upset to have spent money there.
author: t m.

description: I wanna kiss the bartender at this joint... the mojitos are banging!!!  The smoked chicken calzone is my absolute favorite.  Whenever I give a bay area tour, and North Beach is on the agenda, Calzone is a must for lunch!  (If for no other reason to endulge and throw a mojito (or 2 or 3...) back...), Why anyone would dine here and NOT have a calzone is beyond me!?!?!? I heart calzones!
author: Mijiza M. S.

description: Eh, Calzone's seems more of the see and be seen place (especially the outdoor seating) than actually having the stellar rep on the food. I've ate here a couple of times, having tasted three of the pizza's and two of the calzone's...seemed more dough than fillings and the lasagna calzone was crammed with mushrooms but not much else. This is an ok place, the wait staff is attentive and I guess has a fun atmosphere if your sitting outside, but the food is nothing special considering all the great eateries in North Beach.  I did quite enjoy the BBQ Chicken pizza tho
author: C R.

description: Yuck. What a waste of time and money. And that pizza is a sorry excuse. The pasta was soaked in olive oil. The table was bereft of olive oil and balsamic vinegar, which were absolutely needed to salvage the uninteresting bread roll. And the decor is overly contrived. I will not be returning.
author: Faye P.

description: On a nice day, Calzones is prime for mojitos and people watching on their outdoor patio.
author: Jen D.

description: i give it an extra star because i love the cutesy plate they use for their dishes.  the food here is not bad, kind of pricey...came here for a birthday.  Parking is hard to find of course....and its really dark and gloomy inside.  Forgot what i had but it was quite all right.
author: Shirley H.

description: Calzone's sucks. Their pizzas are OK, but ridiculously overpriced. Crust was soggy and rest of it was bland. Garlic fries were OK, but we left feeling ripped off and unsatisfied.
author: Aaron R.

description: This place is just ok.  Wouldn't go out of my way to go there again.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Checked this place out for lunch... not too bad. The wait staff was super attentive and the food was pretty good. their sandwich/soup deal is the best. If you don't like those all-bread sando's then beware yelpers.. this isn't the place for you. but if ya want a little taste of north beach with cool staff the come-on-in!
author: Lindonesia S.

description: Can I say that this restaurant has the best mojito in San Francisco. Try the Italian Pot Stickers and the Tiramisu. Open 'til  2a.m.
author: Loren T.

description:
considering their name one would expect a tasty calzone, no? 

no. [1st  visit - strike 1]

apparently "medium rare" = "burnt to a crisp". [2nd visit - strike 2]

service? can we get some? [3rd visit - strike 3]

seriously, if they didn't have outdoor seating to chill and people-watch i wouldn't give them any stars at all. but do yourselves a big favor and save your appetite (and cash) for a place with better food & better service...
author: mike l.

description: We got our food so incredibly fast, it makes me wonder if things are actually cooked to order or simply zapped in the micro. The pastas were somewhat forgettable, but the four cheese pizza was actually pretty heavenly - a white pie with goat, fontina, mozzarella and blue cheese, plus candied walnuts. Surprisingly good and made with what seemed to be high quality cheese.
author: Beth T.

description: So it's late, Shannon and I just drove up from Los Angeles and we are STARVING. We see Calzones we figure sure why not. We go in and it's crazy cramped and crowded and overwhelming as there is shit all over the walls. So bleary eyed and starving we decide to get 2 Calzones a Balsamic Marinated Eggplant and a Smoked Chicken (the only reason I know this is cos I went to their site and looked it up..). After waiting FOREVER to get our food it arrived  room temperature, under seasoned, with way too much cheese. We left full...full of disappointment. Shame on you Calzones. It's your namesake for crying out loud.
author: Natalie G.

description: Decent food and great people watching spot.  Try to get a sidewalk table if you can.  Generally would expect a better wine list at an Italian inspired sidewalk cafe.  Give one of the Pizza Rusticas a try...
author: Dennis H.

description: Calzones is a fun and boistrous atmosphere which really lends itself to a fun Friday or Saturday night out.  I really enjoy sitting outside at the little tables in front.  The wine is reasonably priced and the food is tasty.  I wouldn't say this is one of the best places in North Beach, by far.  However, it's a good stop and the lasagna is reliable.
author: Angela W.

description: I took a friend who was visiting here and loves Italian food. We sat outside under the heated awning where it was broiling. No worries, however, because our waiter came right over and shut off the heater for us. We started with amazing bruschetta and ordered the bbq chicken pizza and the crab melt(someone had to try it). The pizza was delicious. The crab melt was interesting, but I would skip the avocado. The best part of the meal was the palm soup that came with the crab melt. Delicious. Good environment. Good service. I'll be back.
author: Amanda R.

description: As much as the interior of this place is decorated with Italian artifacts, this place totally reminds me of a restaurant chain in Paris. I've always been a fan of the North Beach flare and I love hanging out here. Sitting outside at Calzones for an early dinner in the sun was a great way to end a workday. The food was good, the mojitos came with sugar cane, which is always a plus, the service was prompt (they even brought us an ashtray at the sight of a lighter coming out)... great stuff.
author: Rada I.

description: I went there yesterday after a bike ride through the city and into sausalito over the bridge.  We were attracted to the signage lame reason to go to a place but whatever.  They have pretty solid outside seating so that we could oversee our bikes as we dined.  The initial impression I got from the waiter/host was a turn off.  No eye contact or care in the world that we came to the place.  We sat next to a pair of older gentleman and we noticed that they were getting more attention than we were until we ordered a larger meal and were more polite to boot!  Anyway the food was tasty, the seating phenomenal and I really enjoyed myself.  One thing I didn't like was that my drink was never refilled, important after a long ride, and it cost $3 even though drinks were not listed on the menu.  Service is fast and your in and out pretty quickly.
author: Omid S.

description: Drinks - continually are meh. DO NOT ORDER A WHISKEY SOUR. Dessert is nice though light and traditional. Italian potstickers were good. **Gnochetti w/ asparagus sauce - yummmmmmmm!** Service is slow, but food is yum. Calzone has a nice crust but veryyyyyyyyyy cheesey. Acme bread, and keep it coming.
author: Angela H.

description: Good italian that's open late night.  Heated sidewalk seating.
author: Russel S.

description: Okay, time to defend this place.  Here you'll find the best price-to-authenticity ratio North Beach has to offer. And everything I've had is delicious. Sure, you'll find tourists here, but so what?
author: Rego S.

description: Warning: Tourist Trap. Calzone's is the ultimate mecca for those visitors that left their Zagats on BART and wandered into the Italian Quarter aimlessly. If you're into city sidewalk dining, heat lamps, and mediocre Italian food - this is the best place on Columbus to do it. The food isn't anything to jump up and down about (though the crab pizza is mighty tasty!) - but the atmo is ideal for listening to snippets of conversations from the pseudo intellectuals that roam North Beach like beatnik vampires and drinking your cheap wine. They even give you your own personal baguette. (Because that's the how the Italians do it?) 3 stars for the food, 4 stars for the black and white tiled sidewalk.
author: Katelin H.

description: I absolutely love this restaurant!  My boyfriend & I decided to try this place out after a long day in the hustle and bustle of the city.  The cheese calzones are amazing and so are the cocktails :)  And we all know the cocktails are what really scores the big points with me!! The atmosphere is so incredible and fun. I love the walls and walls of food cans as well I feel like i'm walking into a pantry whenever I go in and somehow it's comforting.  I would definitely give this place a go if you're in the area.
author: Lindsay S.

description: I ate here the night of the Velvet fiasco, so the memories are forever tainted for me.  I remember a sour bruschetta but lots of outside seating.
author: Kevin S.

description: I think this place is a bit on the overpriced side, but I admit to being very impressed by the incredibly good Alfredo dish that had edamame in it.  Sounds weird, tasted great!
author: Jude F.

description: Not the best Italian food in NB by any means, but they're open damn late, and the portions are huge. Actually, the open late bit is the only real reason they get a positive, just because there's so much better Italian food around there. It's also a tourist mecca.
author: Don H.

description: Nothing special.  It's another cookie cutter columbus ave restaurant.  The food was not bad, but it wasn't great.
author: Debbie Y.

description: OMG!!! This is my favorite place to go when I'm in the city. The Calamari is always crispy, the pasta is always aldente, and the service is good. Parking is sometimes a hassle but it is well worth the search. Calzone's is the perfect end to any day or night because they are open late.
author: Kameelah R.

description: I had a great time catching up with friends here over some tasty concoctions and scrumptious appetizers. We sat right outside along the main drag of Columbus Ave in the heart of North Beach. A perfect place for watching the city life go by. If you come on a cool night and choose to sit outside, there are heated lamps to warm you up. What a casual, colorful and fun place!
author: Anne E.

description: limited options late at night in that area so i stopped here. service was ok. food was bland. i got the roasted chicken (not pasta or pizza) so maybe that was my fault for not getting a traditional italian dish. anyways, the name of the place is called calzones, so i should have gotten that. the chicken was not good.
author: Food C.

description: garlic fries and mojitos were good. I had the pesto chicken calzone and was not impressed. The service was good though. Best place for small groups and dates. Good place to eat a smaller meal before hitting up the bars around the area.
author: Ronald M.

description: If you want an Italian meal in North Beach, this is jostling with Pante Rei for first place, in my book. If you do eat here, I'd recommend their namesake and get a calzone. You may want to share it though - enormous!
author: Bob G.

description:
not anything spectacular... the sandwich i had was good - fresh... the interior... well all those canned food, dry pasta packaging all over the walls seem sorta tacky...
black tiles are pretty cool though...
author: charlotte s.

description: I don't care if it's touristy -- the eggplant calzone is excellent!
author: shoba d.

description: The food here is pretty good - there's a wide selection of typical "Italian" dishes but my favorite thing about this resto is by far the awesome people watching. I love sitting outside, under the cozy heat lamps watching people peruse the streets of northbeach. Wait staff is pretty quick and helpful too.
author: Sadia J.

description: I thought this place was pretty good. Really delicious calzones. Quick service and neat styled place. Definitely worth checking out when you are at North Beach.
author: John Z.

description: An awesome choice, especially if you choose to eat on the sidewalk under the powerful heaters. Obviously a great place for people watching, but the food is to not be ignored. The Calzones are wonderful, and a very good size. One thing we always do for the best value is have one person get the prix-fixe, and the other person will just get an entree. You basically get your dessert for free when doing this.
author: Jon N.

description: So yummy!  The lasagna is full of artery-clogging cheese and not too much noodle.  The pizza is thin and so flavorful.  The pastas are dripping in thick, creamy sause.  The calamari is crispy and not soggy.  All of the fattening food we ordered was delicous.  One waiter looked like he was about to role over and have a heart attack any minute.  I bet he knows what good food is.
author: Julie R.

description: I've been quiet a few times and I enjoyed all of them.  They have great chicken sandwiches and the Maui onion salad with crostini is SO GOOD!  Plus they have really good garlic fries and ketchup, the ketchup tastes different there.  I think they said they make it or something...either way it's good.  The service is really good, the food is good, and on warm nights ask to sit outside so that you can watch all of the people walking by.  Late nights seem to provide for the most entertainment though.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Okay okay.  Totally lame tourist area.  However, the calzones and homeade bread is amazin! the peach tea is always good as well.
author: Rachel P.

description: Overpriced for a soup and salad ($10).  Though minute and tasty, I've had better, authentic, and more creative gastronomic fares for less.  This restaurant's hook and attraction is that it is open late for those, who for instance finish work late like after 9.  And the warmth of the sidewalk tables and heavy traditional furniture is hard to resist as an advertisement.  It's more about the setting than the food.
author: Jeff L.

description: Nothing beats a long cocktail-fused lunch outdoors on a nice day. This is also the perfect spot for people watching if you can score one of the highly desirable sidewalk tables. Great food, great service, good wine and a mighty fine chicken caesar salad.  If you're doing dinner, I'd recommend the calamari and the filet mignon ... yum-licious.  I've tried this spot in all scenarios - business party dinner, first date, friend reunion, pre-bar meal, in-town relatives ... its a no-fail zone!  Again - get a sidewalk table .... call ahead, just get one.
author: Sarah K.

description: I don't really care for the food here, but it's a great place to go for late night eating...only if you sit outside. (not many decent, meaning non-asian or diner, places open past midnight.  You can watch all the drunk people walk by and make snide comments.....love it!
author: Neety P.

description: I'm a bit surprised at the mixed reviews!!!  Calzone's is Definitely in the touristy section of North Beach.  I usually tend to stay away from places like this, but something about it drew me inside.  Maybe it was the big "Fresh Mojitos!!" sign outside?  Weird, for an Italian place, right?  We felt like sitting at  the bar that night, and were greeted by a very nice bartender, who also was a big ball of personality. He made the best mojitos!!!  We ordered the gnocchi and the prosciutto pizza..  The gnocchi was more of a gnocchitini, tiny tiny dumplings, but were very good!!!  The pizza was outstanding.  Long, thin, no tomato sauce, very light.  We were there for hours that night,..  we met a lot of great people, had great conversations, were entertained by our bartender, yummy food, non-stop cocktails...  my kind of place.
author: Eliz G.

description: Food here is good.  Outside of the Italian potstickers, which were delightful, the food tasted like generic Italian food... I had the smoked chicken calzone.  I was unhappy with it.  And I'll eat anything.  But the calzone lacked flavor in a serious way.  It was edible, but soo boring!  I probably won't make a special trip to eat here again... Also, the service wasn't that great either... But it wasn't a terrible meal, just unimpressive for $92 (before tip) for 4.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
3.5 stars... not quite average, but not quite not-average either.

after becoming a driving patron of the city (how did i ever survive before?)i drive almost everywhere around the city and as i was driving along powell in CT/north beach neighborhood i found a parking spot. i wasnt really looking but parking is so rare nowadays that i parked it and decided to stroll around the neighborhood for a good place for dinner.

dare i admit on yelp that i hate italian food?  pizzas i adore... pasta? not so much! why i decided to dine at calzones puzzled me as well.  anyway, i ordered a dish with orzo (which is like my favorite pasta because it looks like rice) with salmon and it tasted really good.  i was surprised.  but of course the place is called calzones so a meal w/o a calzone just isnt complete.  to my dismay, only 5 calzones are on the menu (really? that's it?) but the calzone was really good... the dough wasnt all thick, it was nice and thin and crunchy.

the outdoor seating is perfect for watching the city nightlife go by...
author: Tina L.

description: I went there with some friends on New Year's Eve and had a calzone.  You would think it would be amazing since it's the namesake of the place, but I think I've made better at home.  Too bland cheesy.  Plus, there were not nearly enough restrooms that night, but with the number of drunk women around on New Year's Eve, that's not surprising, probably not normally a problem.
author: Cara J.

description: Yuck.  I only had a pizza, but for a restaurant with "pizza" in its name, it sure was a let-down...  It just didn't taste good.  And it's excruciatingly expensive.  I wouldn't go there again.
author: Lisha L.

description: Very touristy but a great place to grab a late dinner and people watch (esp. during the weekends). The food is good and so is the service. The atmosphere is also warm and cozy esp. during cold foggy SF nights.
author: Kat F.

description: They used to have a dinner special which was like 15 dollars for an appetizer, a main dish, and dessert.  It was amazing, its since been cancelled.  Its nice to eat outside there but it can be pretty cold.  Definitely choose a table next to one of the heaters if you sit outside.  Good for a relatively cheap dinner before heading out to the North Beach bars.
author: Marc M.

description: The roasted chicken is delicious.  Their Gnocchetti with the pesto sauce is also a hit.  I'm a calamari fan, and their popcorn calamari held me down before the entrees arrived.  They also automatically serve their special bread which is, well, lackluster, so don't forget to ask for some balsamic vinegar and olive oil for dipping.
author: Michael B.

description:
this has the total north beach/touristy feel....let me kno of another calzone spot in the city~that serves mohitos~has seating outdoor in the heart of frisco...on a nice sunny day in the city this place never fails~the appetizers/quality of food with their selection of mohitos...(notice i said mohitos again) is a good combo....feeling kinda chilly at nite with a city breeze...spot has outdoor heaters...service is on time/precise~no complaints here

elmo
author: elmer d.

description: I've only been here for lunch but it's a nice place to sit outside and enjoy your food, even if a bit cramped. The calzones are excellent and the seafood pasta is nothing to sneeze at either. Downside is that this makes for a rather expensive lunch, especially when you get a mojito or two...
author: Jan Michael K.

description: This tourist trap features the bad food, high prices, and klutzy decorating ripe for disaster.  I'm surprised they're still alive and kicking.  You'll pay too much for less than mediocre food.  Others rave that this place is open late.  If you only come here because of the late hours, I really recommend going somewhere where the food is at least halfway decent, or at least less expensive.  The food wasn't noxious and the service was fine, so it gets two starts out of five (rather than the one I was contemplating earlier).
author: Margee B.

description: The Mojitos are excellent (I recommend getting two) and in their flat crust pizza, they've managed to make a something that is totally unlike anything you'll find anywhere else.
author: James K.

description: I love this place, it's in a perfect location and it's open late. They have really good calzones and the fries are really good with whatever sauce it is. Something so simple but done right all the time. I enjoy sitting outside and watching everyone walk by. Really cool place to chill and hang out.
author: alfred k.

description: The good thing about this place is it has heaters outside above every table. And, there are tons of tables so getting one didnt seem to be a big problem. The prices didnt seem to be that terrible and the food was pretty good, although they didnt have spaghetti with meatballs which I wanted. I figured every italian place had ot have that. I ended up getting the sausage sandwich and wasnt let down.
author: Jared M.

description: I love this place . . . I think I just like sitting outside on a beautiful day.  Eating great food and drinking some bubbly.  I usually start talking to the tourists sitting next to me because I see them pulling out a map or talking about what to do next.  I'm always happy if I end up there.
author: Jesse O.

description:
This is the standard fare you get in the touristy part of North Beach - overpriced, somewhat-Americanized Italian food.  I have been there twice and enjoyed my food both times, but I definitely wasn't wowed by it.  I also like the outdoor seating for great people watching, and because it gets me out of the kitchy atmosphere of the restaurant (just because your decor is dark, doesn't mean your place can't still look a little cheesy).

All in all, unless you feel like tourist watching, I would just go a little further up Columbus and sit outside at one of the smaller, better priced cafes near the park.
author: sara b.

description: Late night casual dining in North Beach.  Their thin crust pizzas are great and so are the cockatils.  I would skip the dessert there and go to Greco across the street though.
author: Nellie L.

description: Err, what's so great about this place? Hard to get to via car, no drink refills on soda, the portions are tiny and over priced and the food is okay.
author: Alden C.

description: This is my fave place in North Beach. I have never had a bad meal here. plus the  outside tables are the best for people watching! My fave: wine (of course) with the spinach and goat cheese salad- it is HUGE and delicsh!!!
author: Jess W.

description: One of the key aspects of Calzone's: they are open late. They also have a great artichoke appetizer. Combined with being open late and artichoke, it's a destination for me post-whatever in North Beach. The bartenders are very nice, when I show up late and order an artichoke. It's one of the reasons touristy places are great- they're amenable to locals who require late night artichoke fixes.
author: Anna B.

description: For sure one of the three best places in the city to be eating after midnight. Open until 2AM. Not 1:30 or quarter till, they serve full-on food until 2. But it's charming in the daylight as well. I live in NB and Calzone's not as cheesy as it first appears. Sit out on Columbus and have a bottle... the wine list is better than you'd think with some decent bottles from Napa and Sonoma and priced right. The pizza and salads are as good as the latest Mission flavs of the month. Don't sit inside, it is cheesy. And other than the pizza, salad, wine and tiramisu, I don't have anything else to recommend. Now if it's Saturday night and the  effers are stumbling by, well that's not Calzone's fault. Come on a weekday, the best days in North Beach anyway.
author: Brandon R.

description: You can get a late night dinner or snack here when all the other places have closed. I like their Orzo with smoked salmon and asparagus and the Angel hair pastas. The plus is being able to sit outside on a warm evening...great for people watching!
author: Arlene C.

description: The atmosphere is decent and the food is so-so, but its more popular than its deserves to be. I thought that with a wait like this, this place must be awesome. Well I was a little disappointed in the end. The food is definitely nothing to write home about. The mojito was pretty good though. I doubt I'd come here again. Prices+waiting+atrocious parking+lackluster food = done with this place.
author: Rocky K.

description: One of those places "to be seen at," but regardless of that, the food is good, but not worth the high prices that you can get better quality elsewhere and cheaper.  Portions are kind of small, but it might be worth it for those that want to sit outside with a view of Columbus St, while the outdoor heater is keep them warm.
author: Richie W.

description: Food was good, service was a little slow. Appetizer servings were large compared to the small pasta main courses. Would try the Calzone's next time.
author: Karin C.

description: This place is pretty good. I gave it five stars because of the mojitos. The mojitos are friggin GREAT. They have pineapple and strawberry and if you ask them to mix the two together, you won't be sorry.  The food...is ok. The calzones are huge. They have some pretty good orzo although it is swimming in butter. Usually by the time the food comes I have had so many mojitos I'll pretty much eat anything.
author: Katie W.

description: For a restaurant that would seem to make exceptional calzones, Calzone's unfortunately falls way short of that mark. The calzones are barely cooked and come out of the oven doughy rather than brown, warm, but not piping hot. I don't think its asking too much to cook your signature dish properly, and there has to be something wrong with your establishment, or your oven.
author: Stevi C.

description: The frozen "hot pockets" taste better than the calzones here.  I think it's way overhyped.
author: Jessica N.

description: We ate here dinner a few nights ago. They have seating outside and inside. Sitting outside you get a heater over your head and a nice view of the cars, and people walking by. It is in the Italian side of the town. We choose to sit inside, and were given a table by the window. The decoration inside is very busy but nice. They take your order and enter it electronically on their hand held computer. Another person brought us water in clean cups, and you felt that the place was clean, well run and managed. Our food arrived shortly thereafter. Prices were reasonable. Portions were smaller than we are used to, but everything tasted great and we walked out satisfied and happy.
author: Linda M.

description: Me and the fam stopped off only because we were tired from walking around in chinatown and needed to use the bathroom. we decided to order something light...a flatbread pizza...it was real damn good. the ingredients were so fresh and delicious...the flavour was incredible. i'm surprised at the other reviews here. the place itself is ok, and the waiters were very friendly and efficient. food came out really quick too...
author: Nash M.

description:
This place was packed at almost 2pm on Saturday afternoon so I had pretty high expectations.  We ordered the garlic fries and I thought they were pretty good - they had a slight ginger flavor.  I still can't figure out if that was intentional.  

I had the roasted chicken salad.  Perhaps that was a mistake ordering that a place called Calzones.  The salad was good, but nothing really special about it.   The chicken was just ok.  However, one of my friends ordered the lamb with arugula and that was really good.  I checked out the Calzone's on some of the other diners there and they looked very good and cheesy.  I think this is a fine place to eat, but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come out to North Beach.
author: Julie G.

description: What can I say, the calzones were delicious here!  You MUST sit outside and people watch while eating... and indulge in some house wine, not bad at all!  Gotta love North Beach :)
author: Stephanie P.

description:
the place is the perfect hangout for people watchers of every kind.  the romantic couple.  the sketchy lone-guy.  the not-so-undercover tourists.  the food is good enough to hold its own but not anything to die for.  and not anything i'd go back to until after i've tried every restaurant in the city.  that said, it's a place that makes for easy convo (because there's always a passersby or two to diss)...so it's a fun place to bring a date.  and by 'date', i mean 'you've already impressed her so you don't need to impress her anymore but want to have a comfortable time' kind of 'date'.

we waited a while for an outdoor table because otherwise and really,  what's the point of eating here.  without the staredowns at my plate and worries about the exhaust fumes tickling my nose while i ate, it would have been a dull, everyday 2-star experience.  ciao!
author: Adela K.

description: We went here after a long day in the city. A GREAT place to sit outside and people watch. The food is excellent, a slightly smaller portion of pasta than I expected but delicious. The service was not up to par with the food however. The waitress took our order, and we pretty much never saw her again. The busboys are the hardest working people at Calzone's. They refilled our drink, brought out Parmesan cheese, cleared our plates, they really did everything. My suggestion: Try Calzone's. The food and ambiance are worth it...just hand your tip directly to the busboy.
author: Greggory O.

description:
I have to admit, I strongly dislike the number of tourists that flock to North Beach...pretty much all year round.  That being said, I LOVE this restaurant and will sit outside on the coldest or hottest day of the year and not even notice the millions of I "heart" San Francisco! t-shirts that go by.
I first came here with law school friends around 10pm on a Friday night.  We ordered wine...the shots...the espresso, as the heat lamps and early start to the drinking that day were going to stop us from keeping the party going.
Then I came back with my boyfriend, for a late night bottle of wine.  The server was incredibly nice and let us have an outside table for...maybe hours? all to ourselves without being pushy.
Then I came back for dinner...the pizzas are SO flavorful (highly recommend the prosciutto and arugula one!) and the portions of calamari and entrees are VERY generous.
Came back twice more in the middle of the afternoon on the weekends, and while they can be incredibly busy, the waiters always find you a table outside, just where you want it, and your food will be hot and drinks will come quickly.
The only thing that keeps me from giving four stars is that they still don't remember us...or at least don't seem to!  Won't keep me from going, though!
author: Emma H.

description: I ate here a while ago and seriously can't remember anything other than it's open really fucking late during the week (we dined around midnight). The ambiane is nice and I do remember the wait staff being very cordial. Now when I walk by it going to my internship, I see lots of people waiting to get in, so it must be popular!
author: Jenz y.

description: I came in here after smoking a little la-la-la; and so anything pretty much would have tasted good.  I ordered pasta with olive oil, asparagus, and chicken.  It was a bit oily but I ended up eating the whole thing.  I do like the outdoor seating area of Calzone's.  I think it's nice to sit outside and people watch.  I am not sure I'd come back here on purpose, however I am glad I tried it out.
author: Sarah F.

description: The problem with a lot of restaurants in NB is that there's so much tourist (non-repeat) business that they don't have to be good. We split a salad that wasn't very good--the only thing we could come up with for the dressing was that it was weird, and a pizza that was fine/average/not all that interesting. Overall, a disappointing dining experience.
author: Jen S.

description: Calzones is pretty good, but the price is kinda shitty. The wasabi salad with lamb is pretty crazy good, but for the price, i can get a whole pizza and actually get full. Decorated nicely, but not enough bang for your buck.
author: Paul Q.

description: Man man man!!! I cant even start to tell you how much i love this place. its open till 1am so its great late nite place but it gets better. the food is killer. me and my sisters come here all the time and get the same thing. bolangse pizzza yum. brushetta 2 yums and clams and pasta 3yums overall great place nothing bad to say. and plus if u sit outside its a heated patio but after a couple of purple haze you might opt out for it
author: joselyn b.

description: Great place to people watch as long as u have dinner outside. Food was okay but the atmosphere of "Little Italy" definitely makes an evening @ Calzone's worth it.  They also make yummy mojitos.
author: Nicole C.

description: This place has it made because of the sidewalk seating. If it wasn't for that I don't know how busy it would be. We were walking around and just wanted something quick while we were in the area. Saw the lovely outdoor seating and decided to share a pizza and grab a couple glasses of wine. I loved how the tables allowed you to sit side by side so you had a clear view of the street and nobody had their back to one another. Sitting there made me feel like we were back in room because you really did have a nice view...sigh. The 4 cheese pizza was ok. A little strong on the blue cheese, but I liked the thinness of the crust. I don't think I would eat dinner here, but would come back just to sit and relax and enjoy the scenery.
author: Glenn M.

description: Been here twice and both occasions were very pleasant. Had the lasagna both times, and being a lasagna nazi, I have quite strict standards. This place is totally up to snuff though. My snuff at least. Very cool atmosphere and great for watching tourists through the huge windows they usually leave open. Nice heaters outside too when the breeze comes up. I'd say its definitely worth seeking out.
author: Jeremy B.

description: This place has decent food, but their service SUCKS! that's y i don't eat here, i just order to go and bring it home to eat. One thing good about this place is, its open late, so if you have a craving for some Italian food at 11 or 12, this is a good choice.
author: Q W.

description: Try the Italian pot stickers and the house red. They're great !
author: Seth F.

description: after a day of roaming around the city... my friend and I ended up at Calzones.  I thought the atmosphere was quite nice.  they had large open windows so that you would almost feel like you are sitting on the street even though you are inside the restaurant.  The food was not too bad.  I had a five hour pork with beef sugo fetticine dish.  The noodles were fresh and homemade!!! I enjoyed that aspect very much.  My friend had a chicken & artichoke calzone.  the calzone was huge!!!! and the rum cake....  is to die for!  esp with a latte in hand.  If you get a chance, try the rum cake.  Definitely sealed the deal for me!
author: Nicole J.

description:
My husband brought me to this restaurant recently, since it's his favorite restaurant in the city. 

Their waiters were really nice, but it took time before they were able to get back to us. They were so busy and inattentive. I love their outdoor seating though! You can sit outside without worrying about the cold air, because of their great heating system. My husband didn't even know that it was artificial heating! He just found out after I noticed it. I would love to hang out outside their restaurant all throughout the year!!! 

Their foods were fantastic! I can't ask for more. My favorite is their Tiramisu. It's the best Tiramisu in the whole world!!!! Now that I am thinking about it, I can't wait to go back to the city and eat their yummy Tiramisu (drooling).
author: Brownlab S.

description:
After having a great meal at The Franciscan Crab House in April 2008 I was looking forward to dining at its sister property, Calzone's Pizza Cucina. We (me, wife, 8-year-old daughter) dined there on Saturday, May 23. We made reservations about a week in advance for a sidewalk table and were promptly seated when we arrived. It was very cold and windy so the heater was a must.

Sitting on the sidewalk has its plusses and minuses. On the plus side, dining al fresco is usually fun, especially with the people watching in North Beach. The minus is that behavior that would never be tolerated inside the restuarant isn't given a second thought on the sidewalk. I'm talking about the woman from Italy two tables over who spent 90% (I am not exaggerating) of our meal speaking loudly on her cell phone while chain smoking cigarettes. Of course, you have San Francisco's local color to fend off during your meal, too. Be prepared for panhandlers looking for money or food, and be quick to fend them off lest they break out in song hoping for some money.

The service was efficient although I would have to guess that every waiter in the restuarant is from Mexico or Central America (none from Italy?). Except for one of the bartenders I didn't see a single female employee all evening. This place turns the tables over quickly - if you don't want to be rushed through your meal you'll need to let your server know that you are not in a hurry.

The garlic bread appetizer was yummy although it was far too small. My wife ordered some kind of pasta dish (I don't remember which one) and she said it was good but a bit small of a portion. My daughter and I split a pepperoni pizza, which was very good but far too small for the money. The bottle of wine we ordered wasn't bad and seemed a decent value (although I know virutally nothing about wine).

All in all the meal was decent - I wouldn't go back because there are so many restaurants to try in North Beach.
author: David J.

description:
My girlfriend and I gave it a try today because it looked pretty cool with the outside seating.  I will say that the atmosphere was pretty cool, as we've both never ate at a restaurant with outside seating on the sidewalk (we're new San Franciscans).  

The food on the other hand...I don't know how you can even call their calzones food.  I would say 75% of my smoked chicken calzone was uncooked and mostly doughy.  I still ate it regardless, but I normally expect cooked dough when I eat pizza or calzones.  As for the calzone as a whole, it was OK.  I wouldn't say the chicken was smoked and the sun dried tomatoes in it were crap, but overall it was alright.  I would not order it again though, and I will probably not go back to this place.

And as for the service, it was pretty slow - it took us about 20 minutes to get someone to get us our check after we were finished with our beverages and food.  The place wasn't even very busy, and our side of the outside seating was just being entirely neglected.  I hope to see better service and food from some of the other outside seatting restaurants in North Beach in the future.
author: Mark R.

description: The food, prices, and service were decent. This place was just awesome for being open after 10-11pm when there's not many restaurants open after 10-11pm. An A-OK restaurant. However, I did find it disappointing that an Italian restaurant did not serve Italian soda!
author: Pudgy G.

description: Cool ambiance. Very good calamari and bbq chicken pizza. Excellent mojitos. Also, it's nice that they're open late.
author: Ryan P.

description: A likely tourist-y feel with somewhat less than memorable (but not bad) food and table service that could have been better.  Maybe better for a quick meal (if tables are free) but not for a dining experience, and certainly not worth a wait.  Plenty of better Italian choices nearby.
author: H H.

description: The only redeeming quality of this place is that it's open late. The food is astoundingly average and ultimately underwhelming.
author: Dan B.

description:
This place is, like, the TGI Friday's of Italian restaurants.  And just to clarify, that's not a compliment.  In fact, I thought it was so lousy that I actually got off my ass, joined Yelp and am now writing my very first review.  How's that for ambition??!!!

Seriously, how could this place get such consistently good reviews on this site?  Here's what you get -- a cheesy, flaming neon sign.  A fairly massive interior that seats hundreds.  An assemblyline-type feel to the wait staff.  Cheap patio furniture (if you elect to sit out there).  A menu that's neither extensive nor creative.  Sub-par fare on even the basic, difficult-to-screw-up menu items.  (How can you screw up a pizza margherita?  Honestly?  Somehow, they've managed.)  A wine list that's adequate at best.  And all of it priced just north of what I'd expect to pay for a really average Italian food experience.

And with so many other offerings available in North Beach ... why would you?
author: Ted C.

description: I really like coming here for their Dungeness Crab Pasta, Pizza, and House Wine.  The setting and service is decent but nothing to call home about.  Trying to find parking around the area is definitely a pain.
author: Mike C.

description:
I love this place!
I love the outside seating, totally feels like Europe. 
The mojitos are really good and I've had a few of their specialty drinks and those were yummy too. 

The best is the food, the chicken salad with beets, corn, avocado and all the other goodness is outta this world!! Seriously my favorite salad anywhere, I could live off it. The pizza is really original, I love the proscuitto and arugula one. Delicious. I've had a few of the pastas, they were tasty. The crab/smoked salmon crostini appetizer is bomb and so are the scallops. Artichoke is delish. Pretty much, you can't go wrong. Everything is good. 

Service is 4 stars, the food runners are supper fast and the food comes out really quickly. But some of the waiters can be a little bleh. Not rude, just nothing special. I wanna be like, umm it's ok to smile once in a while. But other than that I love this place.
author: Alison W.

description:
This place is ok.  I think it looks really cool inside and I always walk past it.  I've been here a couple times.  They serve you bread in a paper bag, which is a little weird to me.  It made me feel like I was at McDonalds or some fast food Italian restaurant.

But the main dishes were good.  Service is so so...
author: Richard C.

description: A favorite late night spot of mine, I believe they serve until 1am or 2am!  Great food, a bit pricey though.  I usually get a pasta, but even if you go off menu for plain old linguine & clams they do it fantastic.  & the service is super fast.  The only thing keeping me from 5 stars is price!
author: Chris C.

description:
Reasons to go to Calzone's:

1) It's casual
2) It's open late
3) The food is tasty
4) You can sit outside or inside...and the outside is heated!
5) Lively atmosphere (most of the time)
6) Friendly staff
7) Good people watching (as most places are in North Beach)
8) The MOJITO BAR...it's excellent.

The only thing that keeps Calzone's from being a 5-star in my book is that their prices could be a bit lower for what they deliver. The food is good, but not good enough for $12-15 for pizza.
author: Nicole R.

description: Secret beverage option:  Raspberry lemonade!  I think it's raspberry, anyway.  It's dark pink and tasty.  (They don't have regular lemonade.)
author: David G.

description:
One star is over rating this place for sure!  I just returned from what I can only describe as an horrific dining experience.  Calzone's was the worst for food, service and ambiance that I have ever experienced in my 12 years living in San Francisco.  

My friend and I were served two appetizers and split a calzone for  dinner.  The calamari tasted freezer burned, the cocktail sauce tasted like catsup-which, incidentally when we finally spoke to the manager and told him of this atrocity, he seemed relatively proud of that accomplishment (Whaa?!), the mussels were tiny, over cooked and tasteless and the calzone was mediocre at best.  

But what finally did me in was their overt disregard for and clear ignorance of CA state law.  When I complained that the smoke from a woman's cigarette out front was bothering me, I was told that 'it was ok, people can smoke at the tables on the sidewalk',  wtf???  I said no, in fact its against the law in the state of CA to smoke within 20 feet or less from a door or window of a restaurant.  And as a manager he should know that he's putting his employees health at risk each time they are forced to serve a smoker.  The manager argued the point with my friend and I for about 10 minutes and even said that our fair city of San Francisco had issued them a 'special permit' that allows smoking on the sidewalk in front of their establishment.  He said it was posted outside (by the way....the 'permit' to which he referred was actually a warning sign that smoking is hazardous to your health and not issued by any city agency).  He must think everyone is as stupid as he.  Then he continued to argue with me that not only was this rude and inconsiderate woman free to smoke but that Calzone's encouraged smoking.  I thought he was unprofessional and dismissive.  He was more comfortable creating a scene with me in front of other diners than he was approaching a woman and simply requesting her to obey state law.  When I asked if this is how he typically responds to customer complaints he said 'well what do you want me to do?'  At that point I accepted the fact that this 'manager' did not posess the skill or intellect to resolve the color of his hair much less the ability to run a restaurant. 

So if you enjoy crap food, a dining room full of cigarette smoke, worse customer service than DPT and argumentative, defensive wait staff...Calzone's is your place, enjoy!
author: Linda R.

description: Enjoy the parade of people.  The food is better than the olive garden, the staff is generally nice, but this is not a destination for food, the pizze are fine, and the salads work, but it is not the place to go for a fine meal.  Calzone's is for people watching, best seat in North Beach to watch the parade of tourists, homeless, hookers, hipsters, high heeled girls in black tops wearing jeans, loners, scammers, frat dorks, asian slicks, and whatever else seems to be walking down Columbus Ave.  The 4 stars are for the location, the food barely gets 3.
author: Mickey D.

description: It pains me to put forth this much effort to review this tourist trap. Please, do yourself a favor and save some money by heating up some Stouffer's.
author: Alexander M.

description: I've visited this restaurant five times over the last three years, weekends and weeknights. It's all about location. Sit outside, have a quick bite or a glass of wine, and enjoy the people watching. Fine. But don't be surprised if you only see your server twice, to take your order and give you the check. This is not fine dining. This is expensive fast food.
author: Annie B.

description: It's okay.  It's more American- Italian than traditional Italian.  Which isn't bad, but nothing to crave for.  They live up to their pizzeria name, but their minestrone and pasta is Whole Foods level.  They're open all day, and is located in the main strip of North Beach, so it would be a good place to soak in the bustle of this neighborhood.
author: Passdatanqueray M.

description:
I want to start this off by saying I'm not reviewing the food here. I might when I actually eat something here. I've only come here for drinks. 

I like coming here when Ive been drinking somewhere else and I'm stumbling across this place with warming lamps and the decor seems cool. I like to drink here and then try to check off all of the different kinds of drinks I've had before on the walls of the bar. Which seems like a alcohol heaven for someone who just started AA. 

The Mojitos are pretty good here. Kinda confusing on why a Cuban drink is made in an italian restaurant in San Francsico is the specialty drink...

The bar tenders are always cool here and if you tip well the first time they'll take care of you later. Maybe I'll give this place 5 stars when I actually consume something sometime.
author: mark h.

description: The two stars are both for the amazing mojito. The service was very mediocre and pretty dang slow, decent food but not incredible. Definately worth going for the mojitos, outside seating and people watching. The bright colors and lights can't make up for the so-so meal unfortunately.
author: Liz P.

description:
As a Bay Area local I decided I need to experience EVERY restaurant in North Beach, but during this mission...I was pretty disappointed in Calzones. 

The atmosphere is nice, heating lamps outside, custom made sugar packets, nice booths downstairs, quaint upstairs...but the food fell short. We had a calzone and lasagne. The clazone was very bland...no spices or zest. The lasagne was luke warm and a very small portion for $15 abuot the size of my fist.

*Changing my one start rating to a two because it does have nice ambiance!! Just don't order food...chill with drinks! :)
author: J B.

description: This can hardly be considered a place for "locals" with its cheesy lighting and somewhat "in yo face" outdoor sitting, but I like it. Reasonable prices, good and quick service, consistent food that won't disappoint, and it's always busy and fun.
author: Eric A.

description: I went to this restaurant with my parents. I got a chicken calzone that was so reheated it tasted like there was fish in it. My mother got a slice of lasagna that was incredibly cold, and lasagna stays warm for hours after it is prepared. My father got an incredibly overcooked chicken. This place has horrible food.
author: k b.

description: Don't ever eat here, in fact, I'm starting to think you can't eat out anywhere but I digress.  So friggin weak, the sandwhiches they offer are just the same bread role they give you to start the meal with, but they add a few shreds of meat or cheese to make their "sandwhich", I got the soup to go with it which was ice cold when it came out and luke warm after I sent it back to be reheated.  My son (9 years old and not a big eater) ordered the personal size pepperoni pizza and he proceeeded to plow through the four small slices in about 2 minutes, his pizza alone was 15 bucks.  Another person at our table got a pasta dish, so ridiculously pinner of a portion also for 15 bucks, he didn't even get a salad with it.  The idiots leave the front door open too so you get all the nice cigarrette smoke from the wannabe eurotrash sitting outside so that is also an added benefit.  Eat here if you want overpriced small portions of lousy food in a crappy setting surrounded by losers. This restaurant experience has once again reinforced to me that the more I decide to eat at home the better off I am.
author: Ryan B.

description:
I have been craving a GOOD calzone for months now. 
I still am. 
My gf and I are sitting at cafe Greco the night prior enjoying a cappuccino, I see this places called Calzone's, "shit we have to go there tomorrow night, I need a good Calzone". 
We sat outside, never went inside so I cant comment on the interior, the table was oddly shaped and uncomfortable to sit at. The sun was blinding me. The olive oil they put on the table for you to dip your bread in was rancid, revolting. We both ordered a beer which was reasonably priced $4ish/pint and arrived promptly. I got a calzone that was suppose to be sausage and shrooms and whatever else is in your typical calzone. She got a smoked chicken or something calzone. My calzone did not have sausage in it as the menu said, it had salami, it was dry and left much to be desired. Shannon's was better I thought, but she liked mine better. On the positive side they were big, Shannon could only eat half of hers, she forgot the leftovers.
I probably wont go back, better choices in this neighborhood.
author: Matt L.

description: Love this place.  I recommend the balsamic garlic eggplant..i added sausage but without is just as good.  The strawberry mojito is my drink there.  The service is awesome and pretty fast.
author: j l.

description:
hands down this is the best restaurant in north beach, I am in love with everything on the menu. 

I don't usually like mojitos, but they are great here!
author: april d.

description: I keep coming back for only 2 of their dishes: 1.  garlic fries 2.  smoked salmon pizza.  I admit, the first time I came here, this place was another overpriced, mediocre Italian restaurant, but after I gave it a second chance, I've grown into a lifelong fan.  The service may be crappy and finding parking in the area is impossible, but the lively ambiance of the neighborhood makes up for it.  I always try a third dish when I come here, something different each time, including the calzone, the proscuitto pizza, clams, angel hair pasta, and bruschetta.  All were average (you can probably get better elsewhere) but seriously, the garlic fries and smoked salmon pizza are so incredibly good and I haven't had better elsewhere!
author: Samantha B.

description:
I have been to Calzone's 4 times in my life.  My experience with this place has never been exceptional, but the reason I continue to go back is because of the food.  This Saturday night, I had by far the worst restaurant experience that I have ever had in my entire life.  I will NEVER go back to CALZONES ever again! Let me tell you why:

It all started when I called to make reservations for my bachelorette party.  A group of 10.  I made them over 2 months ago.  Everything was fine. I called to confirm Saturday morning (the day of my bachelorette party) and the girl on the other end of the line said that they dont take reservations and that no one ever told me I had a reservation.  I told her that I have thrown 2 parties and have hosted them at Calzones and had made a reservation each time.  She said, Mam, please stop lying.  I was apalled!  I thought to myself, I dont want to give them my business, but my invitation has Calzones printed on it and it will be too hard to get in contact with everyone to change it.  
7PM 7/19/08 we arrive at Calzones.  She tells us it will be a 20 minute wait...we have no problem waiting.  The hostess walks up to my friend and tells her to move and that she is in her way.  My friend says "Excuse me?"  The hostess said, "You heard me!"  
Finally, 45 minutes later we are all seated.  One seat was unoccupied at the table.  The hostess comes upstairs and starts counting the number of seats.  I knew she couldnt see very well since our group was behind a wall, so I said there are 9 of us.  She replies with "No shit, I can count!!!" I went crazy and told her to send her manager upstairs.  30 seconds later the manager comes over and I tell him what has occured.  Please be reminded that I was at a table with 8 others.  He flat out says that I am a liar and that there is no way his hostess would ever say that.  I told him that I worked in a restaurant for over 4 years and that never in my life have I ever seen a manager take the side of an employee over a guest.  I told him that no matter if he didnt believe us, he should have apologized for the behavior of his employee.  He noticed I was wearing a bride to be shirt since it was my bahelorette party...in the middle of me speaking he turned around and began walking away....he got a few steps away and then said, yeah congratulations your marriage will never last!!! I was appalled...we got up and left.  I called this morning to speak to a manager and when I gave my name and what is was regarding, the guy on the other end of the line said "Oh this must be the drunk bitch from Saturday night who tried to get my fired!!!"  It was the same rude manager!!!!!!! I could not believe it!!!  It seems that the hostess and the manager must have been having sexual relations and it was quite pathetic that we recieved the service we did.  I tried to get into contact with someone higher up than them but it seems impossible.  They truly ruined my party and I hope people never go there!
author: Brittany D.

description: calzones is not as bad as you think it would be, but its not fabulous either. yes, a lot of tourists but i do love sitting in front on their sidewalk patio with a bottle of wine. they have this great 'create your own' salad which is usually very good. pastas are ok, and i've been here with someone who said their calzone was great.(didn't try it myself though) one night a few years ago when we were eating here a huge motorcade stopped in front. (police cars and everything) turned out to be president clinton getting take-out on his way to a party with the Gavin. i thought that was funny he stopped here of all places for take-out. then on another night while eating here i met a guy who was walking his cat on leash. craziest thing you ever saw.
author: Michelle I.

description: crowds attract crowds...that's why we stopped here. outdoor seating along the street was quite full and there was no clear sign as to how to be seated so we went inside to ask. the bartender/manager? was quite rude. we asked and he kept talking to the other bartender. after ignoring us the first couple of times, he told us to sit anywhere and he'd be right there. well be right there was not be right there...i went and got my own menu. however, after that, our waiter was very pleasant and we had a good time. if it's named calzone's, their calzones have to be good right? one smoked chicken calzone later...i was not convinced. while the sauce and the dough was very good, the chicken was quite bland. we also had a crab melt w/ italian sausage and rice soup. crab melt was filled with a good amount of fresh crab meat but it was a little light in flavor. the italian sausage and rice soup was delicious! overall, this place was somewhat overpriced. i wouldn't have paid more than $10 for either dish. total meal was about $40. i'm going to have to think twice when i see a crowded restaurant.
author: Minda w.

description:
sometimes i get these silly cravings and start going on an asian binge, then one week, i get into cupcake cravings ... and i will drive as far as it gets just to get what i want to satisfy my poor tummy.

i guess THIS TIME, it was calling out for some italiano cuisine ... 

everytime i pass through north beach (columbus), i've ALWAYS seen this place super packed, and i told myself, calzone is always good -- so here i was, pigging aways...

came here for lunch and must say it was actually darn good ...  the calzone that is ... i mean, c'mon, let alone, the place is CALLED CALZONE so their calzone SHOULD BE GOOD, don't cha think? this place is a trip and a half though ... filled with tourists galore ... 

it was humongo ... shoot, for $13, should be ... their proscuitto calzoni .. mm mm ... i was happy ... =D but my $9 arugula salad wasn't all that ...  oh wells, not a place i'd totally recommend ppl in coming, but if you wanna satisfy your calzone fix, you can always come here.

the server was super cute, but unfortuantely, he's just a kid ... lol ...
author: Jennifer S.

description: Part of a small chain of lively local tourist restaurants, Calzone's is a surprisingly good, underestimated (among foodies) joint. They also own the notorious Stinking Rose across the street.  They pay attention to basics; half the menu items are signature.  The bruschetta, a bellwether opener, is perfect -- sweet tomatoes sliced too thick, fresh herbs, atop utterly indulgent fattening crusty garlic bread.  It gets even better from there. . . but if you do the Calzones ask for sauce on the side or it will be dry.  The highpoint is an ultra-larder of fascinating Italian pantry items on overhead shelves througout restrained, unconvincingly, by thin wires against the eventual earthquake.  The upkeep / care can be sordid.  Very cool Villeroy & Boch "new wave" share plates were crusted with debris, and the replacements were greasy but not custed.  But something about Calzone's is just, well, very happy, cool, real.  You leave with a smile.  Everyone does.  Conversations here are intense and personal.  It brings out the best.  Great location, sunny outdoor seating.  Well-intentioned waitstaff.  Food better than normal for the moderate price (think a livelier, fresher version of Pasta Pomodoro).
author: Gil S.

description: came here with a group of 7 and it was a fat huge disappointment. the exterior and interior looks pretty nice, but that's just to attract attention to tourist or whatever. anyways, came here with a group of 7. the food portion was just way too little, i was still hungry after all the food. in my book, it's not worth coming here. also parking hella F-ing sucks too. they also charge service fee too, like what the hell is that..? what service? we didn't get anyone to play the violin. there isn't any service. i won't be back.
author: Valerie N.

description: The Italian potstickers are one of best plates they offer and to sit outside watching the busling traffic of Columbus and a glass of red vino is the icing on the cake of a true northbeach experience.
author: Ralph H.

description: Perfect place to sit on the patio on a weekend afternoon for some food/drinks, chilling and people watching. Patio faces west and the afternoon sun + heaters actually keep it pretty warm on even a typical cold SF day. Service and food was good.
author: Nithin R.

description: This is a pretty average joint. I didn't order any of their pizza or calzone specialties, so I may have missed out, but  I did order a crab fettucini and just felt a little ripped off. For $16, it was like a ton of pasta, but not a lot of crab, and about two cherry tomatoes. The bread wasn't warm, and overall... I just had expected more than what I received. I probably wouldn't go back, but it wasn't terrible... just kinda erm... bleh.
author: Jovi C.

description: Ended up on Columbus because originally I was looking for a Fondue place called Melt but because we were in Little Italy I assumed the most obvious choice was to try Italian.  Walked by many restaurants on Columbus but Calzones caught my eye and the wait was not too bad.  I ordered the combo pizza and my friend ordered the crab pizza.  Loved them both.  Tasted very fresh and the service was quick and precise.  The price is not bad considering we are in SF so overall the experience was a good one.
author: m c.

description: the pasta is pretty decent, the ambiance is great.. but the calzones.. did they take it out of a box and serve it to me? hmm.......... very confused of why the name is calzones... it should be called italian red robin.. because the menu is a little too big for me.. i like a smaller menu versus a big menu where you can get a cheeseburger... we're in little italy.. let's make it seem like it...
author: Nina M.

description: they open late. 1am week nights 2am weekends. thank god! nice to have a good out door sit down restaurant past 10 pm in the city.  they serve great pizzas (bbq chicken) drinks ( pineapple mojito) and sides (garlic fries). great place to take a date or eat out when you're hungry late in the night.
author: Charlie L.

description: i was with a couple friends from out of town and playing tourist, and we were hungry and picked this place solely because they had a free outdoor table, so i had no expectations.  however, i was pleasantly surprised -- we managed to squeeze three of us around the tiny table, and the crust on the pizza and calzone was delicately thin yet crispy and delicious!  i normally hate crust and don't eat it, but i'd definitely come back to this place!  the service was great and friendly, and it was wonderful to sit in the sunshine on a january day.
author: Caroline P.

description: 3.5 stars, wasn't blown away but the crab pizza was light and perfectly portioned.  i go under because they did not warn that their olives (for a dirty martini) had jalepenos in them.  i would not have minded had they mentioned it, little overpriced
author: kiki b.

description: I've driven or walked by this place hundreds of times and finally tried it last night. Wait was about 30 min for two of use but they have a small bar inside. Place is a little cramped but they have seating outside with heaters. I had the lasagna calzone ($13.95), which was REALLY good, and we have mussels as appetizers...Service was adequate; place was packed mostly with out of towners. Parking is...well it's North Beach, the parking Gods are with you or not! (free street parking or get ready to chuck $15 minimum)..
author: Steve K.

description: The pizza was good, the seafood crab fettucini was OK.
author: RO Z.

description: Dissapointing.  The people sitting out on the sidewalk under the heat lamps always looks so content that I was surprised by how bland the food was.
author: Jessie H.

description: the service was decent. quick and efficient. our waitress didn't smile. the food was bland. great atmosphere. don't think i'll go back.
author: Wednesday M.

description: Would be a great place to go on a warm night, warm afternoon or an unwindy day, but since we've had none of those lately, i was reduced to sitting inside. I felt much better than those who waited extra long to sit outside because I was out of the wind but it is still cute to sit outside if it's a nice day/night. I ordered the chicken and asparagus fettucine and my bf a salad. His salas looked great, and the pizza's we passed on our way in looked delicious. My pasta was a little over oiled which caused problems towards the end, and there were few noodles and a ton of chicken! but it was still overall delicious. Atmosphere mixed with taste of food and i would definetely come back to this place.
author: Sarah I.

description: This place is a quick eat, not a restaurant to kick back and chill out at. It's San Francisco, come on, you get what you pay for. It's reasonably priced, it's delicious it will not blow your mind away, but this is a place to know if you are in the city with hungry friends. You can always say you know of this small place which is good for couples and friends, but not for anniversary's or special occasions. I wish the south bay had more places like this.
author: Abel V.

description: Pretty good calzones.  I still don't know why my friend and i took 30 minutes in deciding what to get at a place called calzone! I glanced over at the table next to us and the pizza looked just so so but maybe it tasted better than it looked!  My friend also really liked the mojito he got here...and we sat outside which was fun for people watching!
author: Michele Y.

description: Great place to have tasty Italian food and eat outside.  They have heaters over the tables so it's nice to eat outside even on a chilly day.  I had the ravioli (delicious) and my fiance had a calzone (also delicious)!   Also, we   had our dog along (a pit mix, we'd spent the day at Ocean beach) and they said she'd be more than welcome to sit outside with us - they even brought her a bowl of water when they brought us our drinks.  The waiters were friendly and we just really appreciated it, the service was excellent.  I would definitely recommend this place to others, especially if they're looking for an outdoor place to dine with their dog :)
author: B H.

description: We figured how can any restaurant in Northbeach mess up a pizza and calzone.  Guess what, they premake and prebake their pizza and warm it up when you order it.  When our order came our pizza and calzone was cold.  I asked them to warm it up.  I was told that they cannot, it will burn and I had to eat it cold.  We refused and ended up eating the rest of our appetizer and salad and leaving.  They even brought us a bill for this.  3 drinks, 1 salad and appetize came to 70.00 and we were starving.  No apology as well.  DON'T GO TO THIS LOUSY PLACE - SAVE YOUR MONEY.
author: A. K.

description: me and my boyfriend was looking for out door seating because it was a nice day. My boyfriend told me here has been here before and the food was OK. So we sat down and ordered Bloody Marys which was good. We ordered the Garlic Fries which was really good. Also ordered Bruschetta which was not that good at all. Would not order it again. The presentation was good and it looked like it would taste good but once you bite into in the bread was hard and the taste was average. I have had better. I also ordered the Norwegian Smoked Salmon which would have been very good if they did not over power the Wasabi Aioli. It was so much on there in certain spots that when i took I bite I would almost cry and it would hurt my brain.  Wasibi is strong you have to really spread it lightly on the bread.
