I had to take off the bread after a couple of bites. The side salad was lite and good. I ate all of that. The person sitting next to me got the same sandwich I did and I notice that she also took off the bread where the spread was on. Just shows that it was not only me. I don't know if I would go back there again because there are allot of other restaurants with outdoor sitting. if I do go back there I might just get there garlic fries and bloodymarys, maybe try there calzones. The staff was nice and fast and the food price was OK.
author: Ge I.

description: Strolling by the outdoor, romantic candlelight tables for two is very enticing. However, it is quite the tourist trap. The service was very disappointing: unfriendly waiter and several bus boys with different tasks who apparently didn't understand requests for more water or bread. And the most pathetic wine list for an Italian restaurant. The food comes out incredibly fast, almost unnaturally. But it is quite good. The gnocchetti is fantastic and the calzones are unique on their foot-and-a-half long plate. Also calzone's is open until 2 am so after heavy drinking some quick, rich italian food hits the spot. Also tried a mojito which was delicious but seemed out of place at an Italian restaurant. I would probably go back for a late night bite if nothing else was available.
author: Kate M.

description: We love this place.  We had a salad and the calzone.  Very good.  I'm really surprised this place only has 3 stars as it's not only good food but located in a fun part of town.
author: Dan W.

description: Food is ok- nothing special.  Service SUCKS.... I can't even go there b/c they are so slow and get things wrong.  There are lots of other places to go.  Good spot for tourists
author: katie c.

description:
Just after finishing a long Thursday night at work, a couple of friends and I decided to take a detour on  the way home and stop by one of the few late night restaurants open for a little snack and some cocktails.  Needless to say next time we will skip Calzone's and continue on to a place more like, say NOPA.  Upon  arival we were practicaly bludgened to death by the so called greeting we received from our waiter Randy.  The first thing he asked was "Can I get you anything?" Well certainly. "A kettle one gimlet straigt up, a glass of wine, and  GG Martini." After the second glass of water of was finished, Randy decided to take our food order. We ordered and Randy discouraged me from ordering the cheese on my salad, telling me that the goat cheese would be better.  Aftger 14 years of waiting tables, I think I am familiar with the cheese I prefer.  The cocktails came.  The Gimlet straigt up was on the rocks and I pointed it out.  Randy pointed out to me that it was, in fact, a gimlet.  I pointed out to Randy it was indeed a Gimlet, but I wanted a Gimlet straight up.  I understand.  Long day. End of shift. Ready to go.  But.....if this the   aattitude you have waiting tables, maybe breakfast would be more appropriate for Randy to be serving.

So if you're reading this, Randy, now and you and the rest of the world understand the difference between 15 and 20 percent. I could go on and on until the rest of the dinner was complete, but I feel I've said enough.

On a happier note, the food was nice, and I made it to Safeway before 2:00am!
author: spacestarkid P.

description: not bad - especially for a tourist place. straight ahead italian that's lively and a cool place to hang out. also prices not bad, if i remember correctly...
author: hugh k.

description: This place is my favortie to go to while I'm in SF for Italian food. Its sister company is the famous "Stinking Rose" which is usually always busy and a long wait. But Calzones food is just as good with a fun atmosphere. The walls have hundreds of different Italian foods stored on shelves with hanging fake meats and such. It keeps your eyes busy while your waiting for the delicious food. You cant go wrong with any of their pizzas! great place for dinner
author: Tiffany S.

description:
italian potsickers..........OMFG   they are soooooooooooooooo good
the service is great but the only downside is that for 2 people the check was $70.
author: Pavlos P.

description: really awful.  we didn't realize it was touristy because we didn't have a computer with us on this trip to get the local yelpers' take on it.  i'm sorry we didn't have all of your opinions.  we were starving and ducked in because it was busy and, like another reviewer on here, we thought all these people can't be wrong.  it was awful.  the only seasoning was salt.  my friend had the gnocchitto with pesto and i had pasta with asparagus, chicken, pine nuts, and tomato.  hers was a completely one dimensional flavor that bored her after a while and mine was dry as a bone.  it was just salted.  that's it, the only flavor i tasted.  it was just terrible.  we'd ordered the bread with cheese too and it was cold and relatively flavorless, though somehow more satisfying than the main courses.  seriously.  don't waste your money.
author: h d.

description: Always busy, but worth the wait. I can bring my dog Ted and we sit outside nice and warm under heat lamps.  Servers are very busy but alway get what I want when I ask for everthing from a extra parm to more bread.  They are very nice if you want a different veggie or somethig special. If you like Lamb believe me I have tasted the best and this is right up there.  It's so good I have to admit I just have to order it every time medium rare. Perfect.! Tender juicy, never over cooked and tough,  The lamb is boneless and comes with a pile of arugula tossed with a light wasibi dressing. Talk about healthy low carb and tasty.  Your really eating right in a restraunt called Calzones, The lamb has a demi glaze that is just a perfect counter point for the flavor of the meat.  Just a warning to the carb counter.  They bring thease litle loves of Italian bread in a mini black and red bags, then you can fill your sauser with good olive oil and the sweetest balsamic viniger,  But wait,  If your like me you ask for some parm,  No pre grated dry chease here. The bring a block to the table and start grating till you say stop or the plate spills over.  The price? $17.  North Beaches biggest bargen and there really nice too.
author: richard p.
